content.description:
I am your humble reporter.  

Scuttling the 'verse in search of interesting things to report to you every Monday.

content.text:
![butt_summaries_image.jpg](&cIBYD4wh/L/Ivqb1Zyqc3uwFQJOB6Sgnlv3lITD/urY=.sha256)

# This week in Scuttlebutt
(butt-summaries #8: Feb 26-Mar 4 part 1)

## Followup / Missed Items
## Totally Random

[Attempts were made](%HBjjiyYvRL2uSO9TxRxOm/MuA28180w5vmkwLzP6YCc=.sha256) to capture the essence of Hermes in ASCII art.

----

[@nanomonkey](@+D0ku/LReK6kqd3PSrcVCfbLYbDtTmS4Bd21rqhpYNA=.ed25519) wrote about the [Psychogeography Ritual of the Fl√¢neur Three](%VhYDcFfcoX1rVLAtvQQ9V9ub8GlDgzTCHdkCxSHgyqU=.sha256) which I shall not expand upon except to say that if you have  dogs you will likely enjoy it.

----

(#)birds saw a blurry photo of [an African Harrier Hawk](%mXVFUYXl303JwIKwEZKzKu0xVHlLpmvqQgmY+yHI7OI=.sha256) I wonder if they're like Bigfoot. 

[Saga climbed into a bag](%RS2rjRiGoKB05S8y5ijdb5pvvtSRY6Q0vGDsoLPr4QA=.sha256)  for (#)cats 

![saga in a gift bag](&xLIrGQhoKQPaDdWBkWq1K7G+WBVl3rpIPDy7LvatTCU=.sha256)


[@Eight'n Half Fingers](@leH93dnjA0vld24vBMAJkRZ6om7CxaOE+46FC1MijZI=.ed25519) [requested dog pics](%Ercfu600dVDdlfbBH9JsXj9ohWp8bf2lNs09iq8SidM=.sha256) and the community delivered many in response.

![dramatic dog pic](&YUNaIVBK8C1s/3ccj0+0Ht+f6li9QRVQt/NnScWZUT8=.sha256)

(#)Dogs win.

----

[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) updated their [Bitcoin Beginner Guide v2](%t+PhrNxxXkw/jMo6mnwUWfFjJapoPWxzsQoe0Np+nYw=.sha256) 

---

[@Sam Smith](@w87xXIicF6SVqG0VIBqbKfHJ/QuXdBOBhtMUweZxE4k=.ed25519) has been working on "[an interactive resource accounting system for ecological circuit diagramming](%lUYB7evVWHovywNTv4Uy/qNJnqBM3jJIT0NTDo9yXbo=.sha256)" with [@mijkl](@70mCOxEUBDup8sP1ec7XjCQqJmN6/XQDVf7wRKyjEvQ=.ed25519)

![ecological circuit diagramming](&T8X0HSLMycdc+WBz5SR3G5zARtTroa2fOk2H1or9GjA=.sha256)


## Community

[@haileycoop](@QdKPBH4vZne0DqD+v1mVJgeeOg8y3RxWuomT7pvIfEA=.ed25519) shared [a bit about the Newkind Festival](%1rRLnJzVllicOJwDkXuCj58Cp29mVm88DdH/GUi18cI=.sha256) which is solar powered and coming up again March 21-25th. 
 
## Community Geeky Intersection

[@dinosaur](@6ilZq3kN0F+dXFHAPjAwMm87JEb/VdB+LC9eIMW3sa0=.ed25519) [proposed implementing](%VY4RezKK4eKOFHcrNo/LOpFzjtaZKA6fC15qu0jwYyk=.sha256) "eat poop you cat" or "eat cat you butt" as the 'butt version could be named as a new SSB game. There are examples in the thread if you're not familiar with it.

----

content.text:
[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) put forth the [idea of having likes reinforce casual order](%zrIKdNxzueywWr4QbFhnVLn2lntu/IIOnv17tU6SSek=.sha256), which also covered the topic / problem of branching conversations within a thread, and received some support for the idea.

----

[@masukomi](@LzTjF5eAVC6xprPMGeNzqEP/EEBIGpM6hDaaY10hrz8=.ed25519) (me) raised [the prospect of adding templates to the user profile](%Gxb0UMgjaouyuU9Z9DuasswTn84bMyEwWzCOuSxgTEQ=.sha256) to encourage new folks to tell us a little about themselves.


----

[@inoas](@vmpbPT6vLrwfg/ku77zHUAies5tgznTvEkTW1P0SX/U=.ed25519) asked: 

> Can you see anything technology related that would create/enforce filter-bubble effects on scuttlebutt?

[and folks responded](%GGkn+NxF3Vjj0CiBVXeV3r6cQk0AFBJ4ZnjpwfQCwc8=.sha256). If nothing else it's something us geeks should keep in mind as we add features to help people deal with the torrent of information that eventually happens in every social network.


----

[@paidforby_____](@Bvky2OovLHyGwP25NO3hiHIWgruRU3Zi6szqUHL+qus=.ed25519) made a [March SSB Grant Proposal: disaster.radio](%ec/AP307+rKLhlMH6oF+9bXpAP16LH2qssGE20x7nsk=.sha256)


----

[@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) posted about "[automated vows](%lvyOzx/PjChZh5H1PtkU+B4FHIJeB6BcrX7DAjfGz4A=.sha256)". Things like clients agreeing to replicate the posts of each other, (future) soft deletes, and more.

----

[@Richard D. Bartlett](@3r4+IyB5NVl2in6QOZHIu9oSrZud+NuVgl2GX3x2WG8=.ed25519) suggested [An Alternate Grants Process](%ElWdxjhPRYAD99gN4EC45qACnUKFR/yvO7ANNtb2sQs=.sha256) and [@Dominic](@EMovhfIrFk4NihAKnRNhrfRaqIhBv1Wj8pTxJNgvCCY=.ed25519) made a "[proposed clarification to the grants-process](%FD7B3JBsxUGUMTKUASVHhAO7rntC3ri/1y6ilkoLluI=.sha256)" which is topically related although not at all competing to Richard's. Distantly related is Dominic's [post about a book section](%+96B+p8kcxyApMs8JqVB/LNPPuJ2m77f37/K5jEenWs=.sha256) that reminded them of the grants process.

----

[@Dominic](@EMovhfIrFk4NihAKnRNhrfRaqIhBv1Wj8pTxJNgvCCY=.ed25519) made a [grant proposal for user invites](%TMtnvFldviDUZROq68YWjryr44hJqRgEsz39LBXXcRA=.sha256)

----

post 2 of 3

content.text:
## Geeky 

[@MattMcKegg](@FbGoHeEcePDG3Evemrc+hm+S77cXKf8BRQgkYinJggg=.ed25519)'s last attempt to implement `sameAs` was derailed by time spent on bugs in Patchwork and is [asking for more funds to finish what they started.](%AfNTpc11XqGt1/iSQMwzpHkgK3BhiAxSU3tTVOPcTbA=.sha256) The thread has a notable discussion about the possibility of implementing `sameAs` via a shared "super key" and the associated pros and cons. 

----

[@cameralibre](@UhORGzAhEE3gqy/pH5vK+EgbpZfnyYvdI46TVBJH6Mw=.ed25519) made [a grant proposal](%g2G7fqvrsU+kPpYM9W8Ro7Xs/4J9607i8HKfUwqPY24=.sha256) for 

>  ...a series of short, simple animations which can be used to illustrate the various complex aspects of ssb that may be difficult to communicate using text or spoken language alone.

----

[@angel](@dnr1swLSAgf36g+FzGjNLgmytj2IIyDaYeKZ7F5GdzY=.ed25519) made [a grant proposal](%6J6nl24wOkD7HGABrCPqC7TdSEEDeqb7fAKBDVDPuKQ=.sha256) for a flume-view index.

----

[@Angelica](@eANNuLfzX/9rlGODXHYV8WJb+zw2h+d7YsT4vpYPvD0=.ed25519) made [a grand-proposal](%w1wPSI8UiOtadwp/e+t7+aXoumNOjzBo8PxOF3walWE=.sha256) for "SSB Emoji Sets, with additional solarpunk/scuttlebutt images."

> I would like to draw art inspired by and for SSB/Scuttleville, to act as shared cultural assets for our community. The main goal is to create a set of emoji that can be used across all of SSB, but through the process of making these I will build up a side collection of solarpunk illustrations and gifs.

----

[@Fenwick](@Q4rYvVUlbC0wdOhl0tmisTeJhTR/Y3PIu8yfXiMYXxY=.ed25519) has created " a single-user, self-hosted web client, meant to be used from a browser instead of a local application." It's still pretty limited (no PMs, no uploading of images) at this point, but it's an interesting start on a new client. More details [in the thread](%zU6NLv1IMQdtGNy7LGz/c7cQfMzSOlnHuPVB5JVdUJA=.sha256).

----

[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) gave at talk about [Interoperability not APIs](%UpEtUPYKd1dbfASQ3Ng5psJ83oIHjNCWFxPggK8WTSE=.sha256) at the Department of Internal Affairs and linked to the YouTube video of it.

They also [have been collecting ideas for scuttle-post](%bC4h6kdzl+kyq0R4N3lLUwI/TJQuRYJhS6d+hsOfkJQ=.sha256) "It's a family member which collects all the commonly wanted actions around post messages." and might be similar to Dominic's ssb-threads. 

They also made a post about [URI encoded compatible links](%jeM0nHIH9wzyHwQTlkix2ybPFNflVZRuOM7y8rgTJnE=.sha256) and made a patch which fixed a problem I didn't realize we had. 

----

[@corlock](@sHFNLAao6phQ5AN17ecYNUbszDa4Qf6DhyQsjtQfdmY=.ed25519) made [a March SSB Grant Proposal: Annotating the (p2p) Web](%7url/UA2QAXnoef0oHKubxFPa9a7adE/LVB2jJZVpMQ=.sha256)

----

[@bentflower](@l+0CONWqxChPs9swKv+tb2ahh80CZqN+1p46KncJnbc=.ed25519) made a [March SSBC-Grants proposal: Accessibility improvements](%TLBgbKhJNSGliMrGUSV+zhNSAgaASQj0JgGNb8TzWBI=.sha256).


## New People

[@Sam Gwilym](@PEqxT8YRvrkf2fyjAgTl8pmdo8aR4KVsKLyh0b5JyOE=.ed25519) stumbled across us and has "...been amazed to find a region of the internet that feels like it did back when I first logged on in 1999." 

----

[@wowcrab](@PnZpCW0+YVk3/sb/BJ362PMDWi23LO9v1l++TmQsgXI=.ed25519) indicated that they were a "[new person here](%ZghrRG7a+akO6NyWftlHJlAdhc8v/dNHCkioZTTlhC0=.sha256)".

----

[@Giles](@oSje99Qtr57FnA4wHDlCsTcqQXjpZ7MgssG8HCKIONQ=.ed25519) is a UK based scientist working on machine learning. In addition to noting interests that overlap with many folks here, they provided a bunch of initial reactions from a new user perspective. 


----

If you're a new person who said hello in (#)new-people but don't see yourself here, it's just human oversight on the author's part. 

----

post 3 of 3

# This week in Scuttlebutt
(butt-summaries #8: Feb 26-Mar 4 part 1)

A sample of life in the Scuttleverse.

## Totally Random

Last week  (#)cats encountered this fellow via [@Frank Pfeift](@A4h/VUlTITbUuO5+4480BIkTXEJjgfZgbBSt3IPhans=.ed25519) 

![annoyed cat](&kfMIrjwZ6/IPRolmQHC7MQMtaSC8j/99/n+PD7sbWzM=.sha256) 

and an [orange tabby](%svx2wSFBAXL3gtWm2zXXgB5+a7XOdsSRnULPo8goE50=.sha256) from [@Ricardo Andrade](@8IpOYivYUnNCEJJP7hIHuXQO7O93+6ODzcQE4apdNJo=.ed25519) 

and [@Angelica](@eANNuLfzX/9rlGODXHYV8WJb+zw2h+d7YsT4vpYPvD0=.ed25519) [posted about a short performance about dogs in space](%SNQIRZ8NU9ujOcr9iXJvlJP0qjdv99J/g4/JMuWYjK0=.sha256) that they worked on with [@Zach!](@ZqH7Mctu/7DNInxuwl12ECjfrAKUX2tBLq1rOldNhg0=.ed25519).

![gardening dog](&p1XPj8v0aZ1OiobejHY2hn2Hq5yt7jA6JIKKOqhmQhk=.sha256)

---

[@Rivet](@MD3RNVfbta1lIVyNWVzHyIazPgFb+1ZAWQ7qzQeU0y4=.ed25519) has CNC'd [a really amazing desk](%wXpu2xC+b4QAm/o+6WVD2iXvNrmzWmU630O8rn9O6AQ=.sha256).

![Rivet's desk](&CFiFnuSzvjVY4ffU5zJgqLFFjyrywuEvvNNVthkMy6c=.sha256)



## Community

[@Jade](@A/xB8zlbjFZAzkHf4e7mDowGt81EWaohCfFmmtRBFiM=.ed25519) "...[went to Purpose conf](%8CNuj3JJF4vBrxAkUfDdMwICyisuDFYgwa7OjYTEbGs=.sha256) last week in Sydney. Lots of interesting themes, particularly around the ethics of big tech platforms. Many of the keynote speakers spoke out against facebook in particular."

----

[@elavoie](@IgYpd+tCtXnlE2tYX/8rR2AGt+P8svC98WH3MdYAa8Y=.ed25519) started what became [a long thread](%oSISvoBB/jMM85hnL75nsSucl/c1rMJD32qWz0LzhrQ=.sha256) exploring people's thoughts on the idea of pub servers that asked for money (and having some of that go back to ssb for donations).

>  I am focusing on a slightly more general goal: I want to make it easier for new and existing users to contribute money towards the growth of the SSB ecosystem.

----

[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) shared [a story about conflict and friendship](%DD7tib0YOCRVxmuhVgkPr8zGBnBD/ETt/DE/sv1lCuA=.sha256) which I think many of us could learn from, especially those of us who work with geeks and find ourselves in surprise conflict, or "violent agreements". 

![friends](&xMi0XPGFWNJraPFq1UG+Z9f/lDWrtr+2LOvzLotXBjM=.sha256)



## Community Geeky Intersection

[@SoapDog](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519) has been [continuing to work on getting SSB stuff into Firefox](%+eZev33L9chnBmpigVpqo4rqsHhGgnuMmaAxf3jjCdI=.sha256)

> The add-on needs to go through a tortuous path of attempting communication with a local sbot or trying to find if there is a local sbot, or even trying to start one if nothing is running.

![Patchfox sbot discovery](&jHKM3FkSITRTeZPJOBuQZtBv+J3U9fAccmry05OHu0U=.sha256)


----

[@gmarcos87](@RmClT86x/o66QdW1dqAfj5Jek4qxUf8rtmvAlhZeZFg=.ed25519) made [a patch to Patchwork](https://github.com/ssbc/patchwork/pull/747) to let you specify your external viewer url. Useful if you want to use a different one or the default one isn't up. [details here](%PDAN0FdY0258iPKYOlW07NkP81fIDweUjR5Un1S7HcM=.sha256)



## Geeky

[@Aljoscha](@zurF8X68ArfRM71dF3mKh36W0xDM8QmOnAS5bYOq8hA=.ed25519) has finished up the work on their Rust grant. It doesn't look like much if you only look at the [ssb-client-rs repo](https://github.com/ssbc/ssb-client-rs) but that's because the majority of the work went into the many supporting libraries which provide the structural underpinnings and are discussed in the [wrapping up post](%T5h5TKyiN8a4YsbWlAsYfkvc91vL36stV6fs+1YhPsY=.sha256). 

There's also a post [trying to find a timeslot to spread the knowledge](%4duCfFNxut1s8yQJfypnDTaPPUGba8p8vX6z4BxYlqM=.sha256).


----

[@Dominic](@EMovhfIrFk4NihAKnRNhrfRaqIhBv1Wj8pTxJNgvCCY=.ed25519) [was thinking aloud](%WDEEoMQn66kKdZrzjFOXZvNTbyDz9ffZkzcZwW8Tvuo=.sha256) about indexing, and generally working with encrypted content in SSB.

----

content.text:
[@glyph](@HEqy940T6uB+T+d9Jaa58aNfRzLx9eRWqkZljBmnkmk=.ed25519) has been working with the jsPlumb graphing library and [shared some of their examples and thoughts](%hpuXlkaoUA8aRx3FrqCX4XH01FO6GdRlQGuGTmcBAcc=.sha256)

 

## New People

[@sdellis](@HMWWxBNlYMI67E2Sx1bAyWDSuE2LnPahjCX5iucGxH4=.ed25519) has been doing web-dev since the early days and is [just starting to get into the decentralized stuff](%58aDd/8St+oCG/8z8v51Gs0r0A13xYmsxORhRZ/ZJ00=.sha256).

----

[@edsilv](@NfBWLiKSDf1ZphiTscvzcYU7fVkBwQ9ZFLnmqxEYK94=.ed25519) has been in web dev as long as sdellis and [is working on IIIF-related projects for libraries](%afMHzDnHMZRgYyiRM/RblTNbzibTC/4tz/CqAJGosIA=.sha256). IIIF is International Image Interoperability Framework‚Ñ¢. 

----

[@hansfast](%EMdnKMw9msEe9TPsW/klJQkJsMSM6I4yfehq1cDEoIc=.sha256) has been [observing from the sidelines for a while](%EMdnKMw9msEe9TPsW/klJQkJsMSM6I4yfehq1cDEoIc=.sha256). 

----

[@captjack](@HZd35JWsRlgKrid2sgOOS2dRgDPQBfeFcLuxq3Vo7f8=.ed25519) is [a web entrepreneur joining us from California USA](%1KsT1MjFqfGP/Lz7xl9hNTWIXm9fo7K5bx3AbNVigds=.sha256).

----

[@minikomi](%wNyXnlErEFUPRdmhpBc9WYwl1aO+e2spmtSTBfNEaNQ=.sha256)„ÄÄis a Tokyo Japan based geek who likes [coffee, clojure, and cycling](%wNyXnlErEFUPRdmhpBc9WYwl1aO+e2spmtSTBfNEaNQ=.sha256).


----

[@Archagon](%B7Z0SilPx0bHtWyW3CRFS43+tFuNfnWr2Qbtrdac88Q=.sha256) [joined us](%B7Z0SilPx0bHtWyW3CRFS43+tFuNfnWr2Qbtrdac88Q=.sha256) after [someone mentioned us in a Hacker News thread](https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=16423643).

----
[@indigo](@I2yDuhAB2DlA2EIbPdEsSwx4oTNQMSVR/ADRqCL1cUI=.ed25519) [joined us](%6tEsH7p2/fC5Jp7ISWbQv0OSGmZu/QAtMg6cHGPvdHY=.sha256) and is "...interested in following people who post about literature/philosophy, and looking to practice my French...and backpacking"

![butt_summaries_image.jpg](&cIBYD4wh/L/Ivqb1Zyqc3uwFQJOB6Sgnlv3lITD/urY=.sha256)

# This week in Scuttlebutt
(butt-summaries #9: Mar 12-18 part 1)

A sample of life in the Scuttleverse.

## Totally Random

(#)cats saw [a couple cellmates](%aoEwTx92hACdl7zPy3Q1/wBBndN7rX4c/71RBAjs3wQ=.sha256) looking for homes

![cats need homes](&73FzYBJdBiBUpNjiYgrXDaRkvXVnEGMogd7PPODJGJY=.sha256)

and this [stylish eurocat](%/IOGa1S8IieouLWQDIGwFFaJdLMgDqPzdY7pPkDEmRs=.sha256)

![stylish eurocat](&KISolD7M7cAKhUA2yLROdQJLrPuaonSwrPs64yhWSUA=.sha256)

(#)birds saw [a gymnogene (Polyboroides typus)](%ZTVJfTqXFJrGZD2wErFOQaIG2s3NoksL152BTI1uFTU=.sha256) and [Guinea Fowl with chicks](%/MNXg4+jBAFGZrgGqOZSuTmfhkuDi9rgkHbBkKFOiAE=.sha256)

![gynmogene](&3tvJKcFV1MVkW3Uk57W04/ehlQk4gEF//AR9iEIjgKo=.sha256)

and [a couple of White-fronted geese](%cRoq61Guwl4p8JtT2dS9Y9Is/cQWOcb7Uv43hIA3YT0=.sha256)

Despite a the incredibly stylish euro-cat, birds wins this week. 

----

[@kas](&DvudcIQJSQEl2dO996PVJU+AqxVna6BLISTua8oKJW8=.sha256) took us on [a walk to the next bend](%pAfFI3loNW+HJiujZsynCmQX+ikQS3pFQ+Wmqwlyplc=.sha256)

![kas's beach](&DvudcIQJSQEl2dO996PVJU+AqxVna6BLISTua8oKJW8=.sha256)

----


[@CallumThe Robertson](@m78GWJOePV1uwy7HUW+U2bWYAKyVoYKRVKfcV7WuySw=.ed25519) learned why [you should never answer your door in a lab coat](%5V5cq3Ah63TArnM/M6teAW0xMN1AQRf4DyHVrWE/jTc=.sha256).

and later shared with us some of [the results of the lab coated work](&qEAvTtiUBnYVam0oglcuBECwPrc6OKbULe1/ZmOu63o=.sha256).

![bob](&qEAvTtiUBnYVam0oglcuBECwPrc6OKbULe1/ZmOu63o=.sha256)

----

[@Simeau](@L0fgU39MfFsU6mkOTl8APCpou+9NdLevknOszIv1D2A=.ed25519) gave us [a glimpse at the Wien's National History Museum's #mineral exhibitions](%aev0tP/snMwA9idoryXs5OTvlbWg3CgiioAgVGN/vjw=.sha256).

----

[@mozz](@XYxouiFbU8kOj7dRKjpVBP7yCO/Tss34E2/ajUpndho=.ed25519) shared some [Japanese minimalist musicians and composers](%wcmV79mhG6gfDyN+C8FcFOfYMTvUpuSmzViwVCFIZqE=.sha256) with us, and [@Emile](@2YVYXQclEJHVzCON5dsLRwf65b2S6HnvxpGS8/LwjwY=.ed25519) shared what sounds like [french folk music](%EGgp8c4rUI/Bb8t+0yF9gJtTQ/FdZxTJLq00v70WTsI=.sha256) to me (along with a bad joke).

----

[@Joey Hess](@BCM6DHYJvWzwWi1lFl2tjDXjaqyZAEmJH5ZONSpXhtc=.ed25519) [shared their thoughts](%5lmvV9iwS+qeUYy8QsFHyeBIxldFAkGvP6AEU3d0yig=.sha256) on an interesting web comic that got them thinking about disability and tech.

----

[@Luandro](@2RNGJafZtMHzd76gyvqH6EJiK7kBnXeak5mBWzoO/iU=.ed25519) shared a [Short Guide to Building a Feces Treatment System](%b+eAYzPT+ul4LHCKmLH7TWTafR60xAu/UweY9MqO9i0=.sha256) which seems useful for those off-grid scuttlers. 


## Community

[@Emile](@2YVYXQclEJHVzCON5dsLRwf65b2S6HnvxpGS8/LwjwY=.ed25519) asked "[What's the plan](%+HPpkAwD/qGTTScVc6LDFJXvg8ctbQnI4tPNcIxi3Js=.sha256) if we get raided by 4chan et al"

----

[@cameralibre](@UhORGzAhEE3gqy/pH5vK+EgbpZfnyYvdI46TVBJH6Mw=.ed25519) has [started working](%7RNBsGnmlYfgnAzfYCuHbgyVQzupt0xe5hF/y156FaA=.sha256) on Animations of Scuttlebuttian Concepts and _needs your input_ to help determine what concepts to work on.

(butt-summaries #9: Mar 12-18 part 2)
## Community Geeky Intersection

[@Josiah](@HjH7assXYIZ5ATQkh1CKtnt6lpVVDY24/NB29okNido=.ed25519) has made good progress [getting tags working](%i3leMjJ/8Ssxf4KlEvyqNrhoFwDPE+giEH8W5hLvmGI=.sha256). 


## Geeky

> I am working on something called ScuttleKit. ScuttleKit allows running untrusted applications on the SSB network - which I think is essential for the network to prosper. For instance, I don't want to install a task management app that has permissions to see my entire log and messages.[@jeswin](@d2vneic0a0Y7OoRYvhXf+nCOBIV/lFQXHmOcHNr/3/I=.ed25519) 

Details [in the post here](%sKJDWf8MNvFGexGkuQbjeF1acI6WpDwGFZyY+MUFNDk=.sha256), but the project is _just beginning_ and doesn't have any working code yet.

----

[@keks](@YXkE3TikkY4GFMX3lzXUllRkNTbj5E+604AkaO1xbz8=.ed25519) started [their dev diary](%WS8k0+hN1fvu3pLfAMJdj5k6X9ySrFtvRWAZYctg0bY=.sha256) on their work on SSB in Go.

----

[@moid](@Sur8RwcDh6kBjub8pLZpHNWDfuuRpYVyCHrVo+TdA/4=.ed25519) is working on getting [a minimal scuttlebot running as an Erlang node](%d5gv/qcOJiI2ow7VWpZ20LJASksEOtP4asjW28nMyvw=.sha256)

----

[@Joey Hess](@BCM6DHYJvWzwWi1lFl2tjDXjaqyZAEmJH5ZONSpXhtc=.ed25519) [got geeky](%lPj7KktYPERL4N3WpF64UXFjcj19mDpt5F1YVblYi2k=.sha256) with their pure sine wave inverters and graphed their efficiency when used for running a satellite modem.


## New People

[@Dazinism](@wpp9V1gs3lLj7aRQQsGIieiSO1W9A0tgatleAZVDZQ4=.ed25519) joined us from the UK and [shared some details](%4yySJzuTTAO1bD/kF6KzDK6UMCU5Z/X8mtycuMUr24Y=.sha256) on their interests in "tech, food, plants, land and people collaborating to manage them."

----

[@Growbot](@29bBCM8OkOI5nJx2iFYySeh1X2GVuQShYFFEOhnzabc=.ed25519) joined us from Michigan, USA and [amongst other things](%BauqJAppWf9zwjRZ/nZHDtDrcscw3T/hLaNbUJPsnTY=.sha256) loves "anything about agriculture tech that will bring everyone to the future". 

For our mycelium geeks they shared [some info about Mycoworks](%5jYF3NlmQiVsCPM8YyPYNmXR7W90rxZtpYDP1SbonAQ=.sha256)

----

[@flash](@YzLvHTzdhqGSS/LYW9ZnHST4x0D8ZELJnUKS/n++d9Y=.ed25519) rode a sheep in and offered up a "dad joke" and [amongst other interesting past-times makes and sells craft liqueurs](%h3z6OZmxWDfkrP9Y7Y6dMZPbE1gXrlzdcqbdpyRTBko=.sha256). 

----

[@microwave](@jIONMw9gxYCqpHM/uNbqW3fcRyhVELqyM/9jp9eZrqQ=.ed25519) is an ex front-end engineer who joined us because she wants [to be on the edge of new tech that pushes humanity forward](%dSxsSP8SN7WKzHjVol4FCZ0OCG6GXrzF6+EAJxvERHU=.sha256).

![butt_summaries_image.jpg](&cIBYD4wh/L/Ivqb1Zyqc3uwFQJOB6Sgnlv3lITD/urY=.sha256)

# This week in Scuttlebutt
(butt-summaries #10: Mar 19-25 part 1)

A sample of life in the Scuttleverse.

## Totally Random

[@alanna](@6OxffMLNyxkboLjCqv29WnMPhH8O3qFrcXCR6KrKcPI=.ed25519)'s representative from (#)cats (Nala) found themselves [thouroughly unimpressed with a human](%RVKWhchz8MEb9k/0fuwP8Om6ig+DOOl8SAnvtnE5QnE=.sha256) infant

![cat is unimpressed with human infant](&WMLdmAyrBZpr8QtBi5hvu0yLZWgld3rttf7lhoWI+2s=.sha256)

Also [Querty got some more beauty shots](%kK0cLBUxgPM60G+K5X2kcytgTrppBPHqfKsDSTgC85s=.sha256)

[@Henk@Mini](@KC3U+gkJ9y36spVeyd51S3e/98hjps64HXUS046Wz9I=.ed25519) [shared](%VWpPD9/9aAfi2RNthqF3C7335iFdtqM7FV/A5wqYp3E=.sha256) "A couple of Canada Geese, madly in love", but far from Canada.

Cats win this week. 

## Community

[@Emile](@2YVYXQclEJHVzCON5dsLRwf65b2S6HnvxpGS8/LwjwY=.ed25519) question last week "[What's the plan](%+HPpkAwD/qGTTScVc6LDFJXvg8ctbQnI4tPNcIxi3Js=.sha256) if we get raided by 4chan et al" lead to quite a bit of discussion, and a little bit of drama. 

Out of that emerged [@substack](@9nTgtYmvW4HID6ayt6Icwc8WZxdifx5SlSKKIX/X/1g=.ed25519)'s [thread about "the rando problem"](%OkgDsogCxesWEWn77Znu2alWlqNTpZVgRI4AWxcckBc=.sha256) and out of _that_ emerged [@Teq](@CxnSXWYjPT160y7QbmTFtWaWT09080azgErYPt1ZeZc=.ed25519)'s [thread summarizing and collating a lot of the new and old thinking](%siiIWzqetxMiwMOcfb3DLOVX2cFmfXcwpJqL5Xun6Es=.sha256).

> So this is one of a few threads recently that, while I feel I have nothing of value to add directly, seem to connect to each other around questions about designing moderation tools that ensure [freedom of listening](https://www.scuttlebutt.nz/concepts/gossip.html).
> 
> I‚Äôm going to explore these connections in a three part post. In the first comment, I‚Äôm going explore some of the context around the problem of trolls.
> 
> In the second comment, I‚Äôm going to roughly categorise some different preferences people have expressed for how they interact with strangers on scuttlebutt (including my own).
> 
> In the third comment, I want to link these discussions around moderation options in #scuttlebutt with those that relate these questions to those of building intentional communities.


I recommend you read Teq's thread, and if you haven't done so already, chime in on one of these threads with your thoughts on how we can improve the quality of life here on the 'butts.

Substack's [thread](%OkgDsogCxesWEWn77Znu2alWlqNTpZVgRI4AWxcckBc=.sha256) starts by discussing the problem of SSB starting from a default of "see everything"  instead of "just see stuff from people you follow" which is then thoroughly debated if it is actually a problem or if the problem lies elsewhere. It's a nicely drama free discussion (well, the bits i can see are). 



## Community Geeky Intersection

[@mix]() discussed [an experimental rework of the patchbay UI](%RebY3A4SHIWUCFVXxm3CVWyQNJhO3q5XdIaCGhfNc/w=.sha256)  with the following changes: 

* make the default tabs the app starts with #mmt, /inbox, /notifications (no noisy public feed loaded initially)
* change channel pages to be better overview pages:
	* only show "root" messages (the first message of each thread)
	* only show the first ~240 chars of a message as a preview
	* if you click on the message, open the thread

They also "... added some of this functionality to the master branch of Patchbay - specifically you can toggle the settings to show only root messages on any page (this setting is then persisted across the app)"

----

[@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) [noted their intent](%6ydEUwOTB7X2JLxj9irwGPg7kJhAbP9rioOYXalvIq4=.sha256) to "... give a short pause on mmmmm development in order to give a help on some #onboarding aspects, because it doesn't matter if there is a nice Android client if you can't onboard easily"

post 1 of 2

content.text:
## Geeky

[@Dominic](@EMovhfIrFk4NihAKnRNhrfRaqIhBv1Wj8pTxJNgvCCY=.ed25519) has been pondering [rethinking pubs as a second device](%Gwqklkj0b2CBT5tPiz5170NWsPp3xiuLbOImEaG/e+4=.sha256).

> A pub should be interpreted as another device that a uxer controls. It could be considered like a "sameAs" device. (but don't send private messages to it! because we shouldn't consider computers in the cloud to be as private as the devices you physically possess)
> ...
> pubs are still just sbots, first difference: now they are more strongly associated with their owners...second difference: an invite code isn't "to" a pub. it's to a person.

Many more details and discussion in the thread.

----

[@Dominic](@EMovhfIrFk4NihAKnRNhrfRaqIhBv1Wj8pTxJNgvCCY=.ed25519) has also been [digging into WebAssembly](%G59Uz1dNq255QJSr+q9xx96liTVBCUUPkKwNKVcGfFE=.sha256) and sharing what they learned.


## New People

[@Visobida](@wr9wdGBSd+5xep9qWmWjD5pkB44k3eX1awRQJsyEPvc=.ed25519) [is interested in the distributed web](%xnZdQRmmWXNa//+5hNGpqgnwnrXUt60d2JLskE7Yves=.sha256) and found us on Hacker News.

----

[@dirkomatik](@t8v56YBNu7BIhZTFGDx0RewsVcA64wL5uRbLbVGjXkI=.ed25519) [joined us from Germany](%KTIPv5FqiYsNbj1Ja8UhJ3ohQr5HmB3q+1yVtFXMg2M=.sha256). They may only speak German.

----

[@Pheobe Hynes](@xdcay4ZKfe8+opQpvkscZskQIT1uQTx+E2qhUMkbGn0=.ed25519) is a newborn [with an amazing grasp of the English language](%R0jKTHX1e6a4K/Al66nLDLn3pazEKKoG4t9sj+C5ZDQ=.sha256). They are "...into sustainable food systems, conservation, queer anything, activism, art of all kinds, communism and floral prints."

----

[@xxxiiinnn](@xTi9vKfS3Sb1KTLCFRjetH4pM1ZnD7687QsKyvll9ZM=.ed25519) is [exploring the intersection of art and distributed systems](%O7cnLGedUIgsY3HGBVCHg0diDWZ1S/fXr3NtL3FRxXY=.sha256)).

----

[@Tim Shumacher](@lR0amhwnd7RXot8sZTr7tiCWWefeGLVgQBqfMgrfmq4=.ed25519) is a geek who is  "...crazy about otters, I am baking my own bread and love cooking" and has set up a new pub for us. [Details in their hello post](%ATQpaG4Hsb8DvhI3LLWt+qDckcxF2Z3ufglJxTxUY+E=.sha256).

----

[@√âdouard](@XWzAllYs8skhI2RPNysrjAzXGryiPfCU01Ebd8yiV90=.ed25519) is "...[a wandering designer](%nCP6d3wyzg1iesiAUC+4zVpkM1pKtmT4UkX2YBE0fMY=.sha256) attaching myself
and associating with various projects in "this space"
that i feel are deeply futuristic"

----

[@malteof](%iH2KABTqPemQB+S1MKVokYkf9eh3Z5OTCth2yFcM2A8=.sha256) joined us from Switzerland and is "[Very much into decentralization, cryptography and privacy - but at the same time trying to find a practical balance where I can involve most of my closer friends and family.](%iH2KABTqPemQB+S1MKVokYkf9eh3Z5OTCth2yFcM2A8=.sha256)" They're also into Go (the game), Photography, and more.

Bonus Post:

![butt_summaries_image.jpg](&cIBYD4wh/L/Ivqb1Zyqc3uwFQJOB6Sgnlv3lITD/urY=.sha256)

# This week in Scuttlebutt
(butt-summaries #11: Mar 26-April 2 part 1)

A sample of life in the Scuttleverse.

## Totally Random

[@JimCron](@qeZN+ZmiJbIMVeDp59Iid/bn8AV6Ve/YN0DV7U+qvPk=.ed25519) is running an experiment. They've [posted a nice landscape image](%CyLw6EMH54VV6CuYgYYWK0DXSotYg8abXmFCYXOKj1w=.sha256) which is won't put here, because they would like to know just how far (geographically) it spreads. So, go take a look, leave your note, and get a view of just how broad our Scuttleverse is. 

----

Meanwhile [@SoapDog](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519) [showed us some of the beauty of Rio](%afDCPyrvcALrSph+9SscZznkYcLlEW8c/Srgu8J76ZI=.sha256).

![Copacabana fort](&bl+hn9rd4+AZUfCH2Z+dxWGbolHzujnm0B4W7gh7hQk=.sha256)

----

It turns out I was completely wrong and (#)dogs won last week thanks to the efforts of [@Brian √ì](@H/haHTZKPFRfyuC5FghQHt2U3f95zahRcLmUh5V0/uo=.ed25519)  including, but not limited to this masterpiece: 

![bulldog in mustang](&KzIrsgxqTYIhN+NK/0U5dVJz6X24FhXUeFVbCBYjmKk=.sha256)

[@Henk@Mini](@KC3U+gkJ9y36spVeyd51S3e/98hjps64HXUS046Wz9I=.ed25519) shared a Common Coon nesting in (#)birds and [multiple other birds](%7fJTPXcK+sKsmjn6AF/t/Ap4W7wklLIxeSqraZcF2QY=.sha256) doing their thing.

![common coon nest](&uCQXKcRyUbt7yC7nXF1pVNEL+LHdp7Yri6UwlRMVbwM=.sha256)

and [@Joey Hess](@BCM6DHYJvWzwWi1lFl2tjDXjaqyZAEmJH5ZONSpXhtc=.ed25519)'s cat decided to [play with a snake](%kRqMiX603kCNt7/01FOi+3avqN21yGWNl8Ko243Ak+U=.sha256).


I think (#)birds wins this week. 

----

[@nanomonkey](@+D0ku/LReK6kqd3PSrcVCfbLYbDtTmS4Bd21rqhpYNA=.ed25519) dreamed aloud [of a steampunk submarine escape plan](%wEURxmtOox7Y71VCX9J9LJ8s3UXcnpvL2KfVuCX0ozg=.sha256)  "...where I could join others on a sun filled trip around the globe". [@juul](@22YV3HX/BGClXH49ZebkcepqRpj7a9f5s0ddwhDSfxk=.ed25519) shared that they were working on an actual submarine in the US for community dives and crowdsourcing its improvement.

## Community

[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) and [@Zach](@ZqH7Mctu/7DNInxuwl12ECjfrAKUX2tBLq1rOldNhg0=.ed25519) [went for a walk and discussed](%VzxV0Je3iaLmWEVCG2KqyvIZzFRwwfFTqXZLeD5at5g=.sha256) the difference between :sunny: and :waxing_crescent_moon: moon thinking and how the design of our apps can be thought of in these terms, and what that means for Scuttlebutt clients.

> If we built more  :waning_crescent_moon: type apps, this will enable different ways of relating, and exploring. This will empower different people, and help us have richer interactions. 

----

[@dominic](@EMovhfIrFk4NihAKnRNhrfRaqIhBv1Wj8pTxJNgvCCY=.ed25519) started looking into the possibility of creating some form of non-profit organization to manage scuttlebutt, [the thread](%sW74DNIYIUJy4IQ8RrXEWURPMVA+oCS4ZwBHjeBdUB4=.sha256) quickly went from "maybe we could" to "hell yes now!" (paraphrased).

----

The Pub server info page has been updated. We now have only 2 pubs listed under "public pubs" most of the rest have been moved to "Spotty Pubs". We also have a bunch of private pubs listed.


----

[@Wayne](@gD8rM3MFLGszA9XxWvD/v3qhu4xhveSWkzB+ATvdasw=.ed25519) [asked if there was an IRC channel](%fxrmzyMXSPc7yschTy/UNXzC+bKElMoPeq3638IVQIM=.sha256). [@Ionas](@vmpbPT6vLrwfg/ku77zHUAies5tgznTvEkTW1P0SX/U=.ed25519) replied that 

> There is `#scuttlebutt` on chat.freenode.net:6697 - https://freenode.net/

And [@happy0](@RJ09Kfs3neEZPrbpbWVDxkN92x9moe3aPusOMOc4S2I=.ed25519) comment that they hung out there and that 

> I feel the scuttleverse (and other social media things) and IRC are different mediums for different things.

There was some debate about the value of having one for the SSB community. If you're looking for real-time chat, or think it's a bad idea, you should let folks know your thoughts.


----

content.text:
[@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) posted about "[Refactoring Our Principles](%b1pH4LZQ4hp2acS036eSBeKJbsSgDAkpovN2JRhv8fI=.sha256)"

> Scuttlebutt is a principles-driven technology...
> we have been gathering quotes from various people who had insights on what defines the ethos of Scuttlebutt. As a result, now we have an assorted list of scattered properties that we consider important...So I invite you to use your thought tools to help us define What does Scuttlebutt exist for? 

You should chime in. 



## Community Geeky Intersection

[@andresaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) started the "[Mobile SSB Quests](%F6PqSrS7m1xlX2wGCbWsRs6oNjZjkKYsOM0ovKfu3gQ=.sha256)"

> Unlike the grant proposals for (#)ssbc-grants, in this process there is a predetermined pool of 3‚Äì4 tasks ("quests") that I've scoped out. People can apply for a quest, by picking one of them, and writing an open application as a public message on Scuttlebutt tagged with (#)mobile-ssb-quests.

If you're a geek who wants to help get SSB running on mobile devices. You should check out that thread. Questions about the process have been [forked into this thread](%g73JKJKgMUHtRG+NPPziTpiYp2Dnf+kiCKtMUINAXvg=.sha256).

----

[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) started talking about [pulling together the important information we have](%QIaDmLHVlmb/Pd8Q4XUSXSAVVfj/ovSmIQTDbnAwA3Y=.sha256) spread out across many systems.

----
[@Dan Hassan](@NeB4q4Hy9IiMxs5L08oevEhivxW+/aDu/s/0SkNayi0=.ed25519) left some General Reflections on the electrum multisig Wallet they've been working with for funding some SSB work.

----

[@corlock](@sHFNLAao6phQ5AN17ecYNUbszDa4Qf6DhyQsjtQfdmY=.ed25519) posted about [the April SSBC Grants](%+zJLWIHY/NIPyiTWdDmLjUMuO3/FnPmW8yo2Gum2VXk=.sha256).



## Geeky

[@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) released [multiserver-dht](%wnLvY+R+ftVaCroq/myN8dXukPJKJQ2664Rj4gkWKr4=.sha256) which came out of their ongoing [thread about improving onboarding](%6ydEUwOTB7X2JLxj9irwGPg7kJhAbP9rioOYXalvIq4=.sha256).

> This module is a multiserver plugin that joins a Distributed Hash Table (DHT) and uses channel keys as "addresses" where peers communicate as clients and as servers.

([GitHub link](https://github.com/staltz/multiserver-dht))

----

[@cel](@f/6sQ6d2CMxRUhLpspgGIulDxDCwYD7DzFzPNr7u5AU=.ed25519) provided [a status report](%yCBIJ1QxcCst+zaE2/09VPqOO/JMo8veBK6R4u1/aYE=.sha256) on their git-ssb work.


## New People

(some of these from last week)

[@Casey Marshall](%P+TB3qDUafpazqQq+a6UYBFSVgCZuR9tq4CKcb6x7sY=.sha256)  is "...located in central Texas and enjoy[s] BBQ'ing, exploring nature, staying active and travelling" They're also [a programmer and more](%P+TB3qDUafpazqQq+a6UYBFSVgCZuR9tq4CKcb6x7sY=.sha256). 

----

[@Nobe](%vjbJUrXYG1Q+bRumbIJney3sR/IH+s3CqIn+dJRU8/s=.sha256) is [a part-time drone pilot](%vjbJUrXYG1Q+bRumbIJney3sR/IH+s3CqIn+dJRU8/s=.sha256) spreading their wings and overcoming fears. 

----

[@plomlompom](%rC9PYXnqp/ah6pj8UScCsRlhYWfYgxr1PPOu9tZdut0=.sha256) [joins us from Berlin Germany](%rC9PYXnqp/ah6pj8UScCsRlhYWfYgxr1PPOu9tZdut0=.sha256), and "...enjoy[s] curating film-historical movie nights, economizing and bookkeeping and budgeting, tripsitting, coding IRC bots and terminal roguelikes, and exploring the historical linguistics of the Indo-European language family."  and [so very much more](%rC9PYXnqp/ah6pj8UScCsRlhYWfYgxr1PPOu9tZdut0=.sha256) that an interesting thread emerged. 

----

[@WriterLionel](@iIVt4qJzctFKZEbxOTErm9IDb2BqagCzkp4gdHMnbz8=.ed25519) joined us thanks to a recent slashdot post asking for [a good alternative to facebook](https://tech.slashdot.org/story/18/03/25/0039218/ask-slashdot-is-there-a-good-alternative-to-facebook). They're [a musician by fun and "content marketer" by trade](%GeKla7rYwgdHnBkvkXs8SiT1cTKEm7XJ28BL8V+ThTI=.sha256).

# This week in Scuttlebutt
(butt-summaries #12: April 3rd-9th part 1)

A sample of life in the Scuttleverse.


## Followup

A week ago [@Powersource](@Vz6v3xKpzViiTM/GAe+hKkACZSqrErQQZgv4iqQxEn8=.ed25519) posted about [Friend-only posts and why we need them](%gq5lOL6cyJwLqhDlTiq/QxqSlYqPBqoWtTVChL8P1Q4=.sha256)


## Totally Random

[@nanomonkey](@+D0ku/LReK6kqd3PSrcVCfbLYbDtTmS4Bd21rqhpYNA=.ed25519) [shared a newborn foal with (#)horse](%yJu9v1K9Gim1b/0vqdeFvqJ+SsG5KebBosTGkCrX5HQ=.sha256).

![newborn foal](&IcTSHlvub7+ckFsIYDhS+ugtExfLSQWqfBrJR7zrdS4=.sha256)

[@Rick](@JfQJYnT2o6lbwIfzNcH4GaR+fymvtXSjdfxrKwrc8SY=.ed25519) [gave us a giant bubble](%Dft6+9tU1jA/XDD1drqHKpHjx+uXPipi6OoAd8FXCW4=.sha256).

![giant bubble](&eVACsnIapM5aSYK6mM5yu2bm3f2bZ87unpQVvUXy0I0=.sha256).

And [@nicoHz](@BiXoKLUAuXXZx3m9Fyz8kE4mm0cUfFq7JyH2TjVULcc=.ed25519) [watched a plant](%GnNKopfCKCrK7Ujt6NsWdhcENZdsBHfdtLaJm/X1Wuc=.sha256)

![animanted plant image](&lEeXCIpX7UCoXJqGCZhCl27YQtcwCXNUvIi3NNCF4D4=.sha256)

[@jolyon](@dfCIY3rP5idQFdjuOHrBJqrv6EgsSiNyn1NKz87UTJw=.ed25519) shared [a short teaser video](%9iKgxfeWBlIw1wnMcFlTqvzFj8ggBMC/LQ0/4tCvIio=.sha256) for their local gliding club.

[@Binchan](@5O0JH7d1umXVSD3lcPpSqxx4+MRI64HF9vTodzRUeGk=.ed25519) shared [some Japanese poetry translated into English](%JNG3MYovVwA/rlDROUlYiuRPnZygD2gr5OJ4VAPW1ok=.sha256).

## Community

[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) started [a thread about their difficulties wielding the power and responsibilities](%q7jCWMpU7zl0uecB6ynE1Y6+6Sb49tYEdr51MSUH+zM=.sha256) we've given them while having to deal with some more toxic elements of the community.

From my perspective it's exactly the kind of open reflection we want from the people "in power" and a warning that we could loose the contributions of @mix and anyone else in a similar position if we don't speak up in their defense when we see undeserved attacks. 

This community is small, fragile, and beautifully different from all the other social networks out there. It needs our protection, and that means protecting the people who are actively working to move it forward. 

## Community / Geeky

[@decentralicious](@rjXUb+Oz2GRgCeF1lfQWEBIXciTM9ZlJ4NfMJlt6Q3U=.ed25519) shared "[an idea for filtering content](%GuHlJr6/rFMbPh50K6Ek6Arlw3B275c2ZVQ2hcNKkaM=.sha256). This might be applicable to Patchwork/Scuttlebutt."

----

[@Austin](@EaYYQo5nAQRabB9nxAn5i2uiIZ665b90Qk2U/WHNVE8=.ed25519) asked about [making a "private scuttleverse"](%/g2SSVRYG9KqJSiCVilkDZX2WBEZoDtFaVWkC7jgwKQ=.sha256) and instructions were provided.... kind-of. It sounds like it's doable but there are downsides and private groups (when they come) will probably be a better solution.

content.text:
## Geeky

[@Matt McKegg](@FbGoHeEcePDG3Evemrc+hm+S77cXKf8BRQgkYinJggg=.ed25519) [redefined their grant proposal](%YshVpy9UQfXgxCUheS5gMq0LWRf+6cS6NUzPfxgTcXM=.sha256) for Patchwork dev which is notable more because of the _why_ than the _what_. They redefined it to be working on something in a way that was true to themself and maximized their happiness. 

There are a lot of things developers can work on, but in my experience working on the bits that don't excite you can be a bit soul-sucking and burnout inducing. 

Along the way [@Dominic](@EMovhfIrFk4NihAKnRNhrfRaqIhBv1Wj8pTxJNgvCCY=.ed25519) [suggested that](%2XD4hekD4cEr6/HwUbgSiW9JxwiRwkfjOEkDKfM/1/A=.sha256) 

> Maybe we should divert some (say, half) of the remaining grant funds to be maintainance funds? I would especially be in favor of the idea of having other people help, so that knowledge of patchwork internals is shared.

There was also a little drama inserted into the thread, sadly, but I think [Dominic's response](%SOsmYyqs84idlEBMPsA1wq+FgbgIZ4NcOIIPGLCbjsU=.sha256) summarized it pretty well

> Software is hard - you could walk into any room of developers and scream "this software sucks". We already know that. we are working on it and we don't need someone to angrily tell us that. 


## New People

[@Tim Makarios](@JrVM9RgoJwHcKPzCDZgCrrnZhbPODgm8JP8fDixW/mo=.ed25519) joined us from Lower Hutt, New Zealand. They're a computer geek into "...fractals, and different systems for land tenure and money transfer, as well as [a variety of other things](%JAxEpy7j1dgJX6DYQGup9FI1GvaOHQGgdZrTifm87zQ=.sha256).



post 2 of 2

Today's summary is being delayed until tomorrow as a result of [@masukomi](@LzTjF5eAVC6xprPMGeNzqEP/EEBIGpM6hDaaY10hrz8=.ed25519) volunteering at the [Boston Marathon](http://www.baa.org/), traveling three hours to another state, and now lacking a great deal of sleep. It seems better to give you a completed one tomorrow, than one that was edited by a sleep deprived individual and also lacks any information from this weekend. ;) 

See you tomorrow. :)

A sample of life in the Scuttleverse.

## Totally Random

[@Luandro](@2RNGJafZtMHzd76gyvqH6EJiK7kBnXeak5mBWzoO/iU=.ed25519) shared [some pretty pictures](%k0Df0R9gkj+Y5QQ2my3S0LbOrLgkBndyGopqwOQm9AY=.sha256) from their off grid living including, parrots, puppies, and horses.

## Community

[@Emile](@2YVYXQclEJHVzCON5dsLRwf65b2S6HnvxpGS8/LwjwY=.ed25519) has [Been reflecting on the dynamics of blocking and mobbing, and the siren call for better moderation](%ATV2uXPpYzve4SRigUEkMaZLvZi8tiIIBseIBXDEbjU=.sha256), and shared an article they found about communicating when there is disagreement. Discussion ensued.

## Community Geeky Intersection

[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) paired with [@Zach!](@ZqH7Mctu/7DNInxuwl12ECjfrAKUX2tBLq1rOldNhg0=.ed25519) and very soon you'll be able to have [custom styling in Patchbay](%rRUJN8HLPjDdcyIaD542g30kx4oberL8Rc3xz0uQj/Q=.sha256). [@gmarcos87](%YTzf4lA3JBTu4YKcdP9D4kPa7CmWJUJ+ylXXvTqyPUk=.sha256) described an idea for [an email to ssb gateway](@RmClT86x/o66QdW1dqAfj5Jek4qxUf8rtmvAlhZeZFg=.ed25519) which they are starting to build.

----

[@soapdog] and [@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) made more progress working on [Ticktack](%vV0McdFuzpQ1MWnDMcu3CnE2qTc0RYVVGGdcksOZznw=.sha256) this week, and mix [showed a first pass at the new stats page](%sRzZTGSFupPaURJur8tryyykoISIWaP8pSuf6BnvZu8=.sha256).

----

[@noffle](@C3iYh/12sO1uvKq1KcZXLFxSySzxOkHxXN8rtNB5MGA=.ed25519) created, and introduced [ssb-web Self-contained web sites living on SSB](Self-contained websites living on SSB!).

[@mix](%8HLT/Sq9e9SZoIdO9taB2EgiY6L4N2M1IsqpYUzsgtE=.sha256) was working on Ticktack and [looking for](%8HLT/Sq9e9SZoIdO9taB2EgiY6L4N2M1IsqpYUzsgtE=.sha256)

### Current Stuff

## Geeky


[@Dominic](@EMovhfIrFk4NihAKnRNhrfRaqIhBv1Wj8pTxJNgvCCY=.ed25519) discussed [improvements to how pubs advertise and update their info](%/42EUaUk51JUbiq3zphfImWRN9CZ7CyQ2Za5xrhORss=.sha256).

They also "[hacked in a libsodium version that is compiled to wasm](%QCWYROe5VxhUwVGgdtrFuUrBRTz5517OaXN/EaU2TD8=.sha256) - and consequently: javascript crypto is now fast enough."

And, because they weren't busy enough... 

> I have infiltrated the webassembly illuminati. I am currently sitting in a room and around me is a wizard council designing web assembly.

[Discussion here](%QTE0OgDByGyMaOOxF1Covt7zaExFgRQCyskmYMcmHT8=.sha256)

----

[@gmarcos87](@RmClT86x/o66QdW1dqAfj5Jek4qxUf8rtmvAlhZeZFg=.ed25519) started discussing [a proposal for managing blobs](%HgcF/PMFmPtVOTvEWQlstTpsnrAKUk77Bh40KT66ajo=.sha256).

In addition to being a geek they "..love eating / cooking a brisket, not needinng a car to get around, reading, and traveling."

----

[@Susan Heklicht](@DPo141CEp020akU/7XjdVtq+oLlcCU1QtY/ZGjtK+uE=.ed25519) quit facebook, joined us, and is a fan of art and music. Hopefully well see some interesting posts on those topics from them soon.

----

I apologize to any new-folks I may have missed. This week got away from me. I'll try and catch you all in followup.


## Colophon

This week in Scuttlebutt is brought to you by [@masukomi](@LzTjF5eAVC6xprPMGeNzqEP/EEBIGpM6hDaaY10hrz8=.ed25519). Please message them with interesting news, suggestions for improvement, or anything else you think is relevant.

[@Gerard Achternaam](@PLK5QlI52ItxuZzWrOM4mIwFug/FdhBvJhtu3/JzpKY=.ed25519) has [been building their own offgrid powerwall](%Hlj4XDigcGRcB3loslg5HC2ruvGnWvTJbJy1FlKrpWM=.sha256) since September and has shared the materials, source, and cost with us.

[@ÊåâË±Ü](@a/g1UYTznmhfE1OQrU1/0sT3YM4TuYNxc6EtfFP1iao=.ed25519) and [@joshuavial](@yT9aLYDFw9Gt6b73BEzOGI+G296MJ3p7zQVHYdT9VRE=.ed25519) started [a game of Go](%EOj4gHyUqCKvbEnYNJKKAWnWpf/KrUtDh3bR6kKJfyM=.sha256). It seems weird that we have [ssb-chess](https://github.com/Happy0/ssb-chess#readme) but not ssb-go.

(#)cats was [introduced](%ORPci06b2Z7jBzfog27cAJ5iqmuVHeT51/FseT/Y3ug=.sha256) to [David](@PZjQKGbh9KrWHAp1lo9nH/WXqGLp5rpqpVYLccJLkE4=.ed25519)'s cat Dixon.

(#)dogs saw [@Ono Sendai](@yV/E88uP56s9+AXzktNFCf0zlyt60FkjUxZaphOBGj8=.ed25519)'s [creation of dog](%eQ5RUdJX51uM+Z7f4vDnB0dgUvo9Lpo8qb9RW+qpE/M=.sha256)

I'm calling a tie between this week's animal contenders.


## Community
[@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) wrote another article about Scuttlebutt that made it to the top of Hacker News and has brought in some new folks. 

[Scuttlebutt, A Decentralized Alternative to Facebook](https://www.inthemesh.com/archive/secure-scuttlebutt-facebook-alternative/)

[Editor's note] SSB may not be ready for the influx of people from Facebook but I think we're the only real alternative, and they need somewhere to go... 

## Community Geeky Intersection

(followup)  
[@Matt McKegg](@FbGoHeEcePDG3Evemrc+hm+S77cXKf8BRQgkYinJggg=.ed25519) has [been making progress on private blob support](%hHI7p1WCFObKsTTlBV5VVbH5aXSoL6aIqCXNcCFt/MA=.sha256).

----
[@diefrein.club](@Y2fxCQla30qvtLJufJ57Im0on1QO72H5KECXio5xQZs=.ed25519) now runs ssb-viewer over HTTPs. As points out 

> Simply point [viewer.diefreien.club](https://viewer.diefreien.club/) to any blob, user ID, channel, etc. For example, here is the [pub's profile](https://viewer.diefreien.club/@Y2fxCQla30qvtLJufJ57Im0on1QO72H5KECXio5xQZs=.ed25519) served over ssb-viewer

Another useful alternative when https://viewer.scuttlebot.io/ is being slow.

----

[@SoapDog](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519) and [@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) have continued their work on Ticktack and have added a "reblog" feature (think retweets on Twitter / Reblogs on Tumblr) and you can now 

>  ...copy a Web URL for a post to be shared on other social networks

That last bit may be somewhat buggy still.

## Geeky

[@noffle](@C3iYh/12sO1uvKq1KcZXLFxSySzxOkHxXN8rtNB5MGA=.ed25519) has continued working on [ssb-web Self-contained web sites living on SSB](Self-contained websites living on SSB!) and made great progress. Things seem pretty in flux at the moment, but in a good way.

----

content.text:
[@Dominic](@EMovhfIrFk4NihAKnRNhrfRaqIhBv1Wj8pTxJNgvCCY=.ed25519) has created [a proof-of-concept version of ssb-tunnel](%iqXoP//+WnBt3UhTKK2uKjlV4EojMn8IjY5/rSLKdPY=.sha256) 

> ...it complements the other p2p methods, by using a pub as a relay - A connects to the pub, then B connects to the pub, then B requests a tunnel from the back to A, then treats that as an ordinary connection, authenticated and encrypted with secret-handshake. This means the tunnel connection is encrypted twice and the pub can't see what you are saying.
> ...The really exciting thing, though, is that this (and the work andre and piet are doing) is the critical step to bootstrapping other protocols.

## New People 
 [@RZZL DZZL](%GZLUBu5kjOGz0JTqkGoSBkynMeDJyF2IGgqEwhuRzJ4=.sha256) joined us and is "[Particularly interested in](%GZLUBu5kjOGz0JTqkGoSBkynMeDJyF2IGgqEwhuRzJ4=.sha256) crossovers between design/art/code/poetry and MAGICK." 

----

[@MatthewDavid](@6iX9OOogWptPXM6b2Q3X6aKMv6qWT1QbpEWBrVKoD7o=.ed25519) was referred here, and in addition to geeky things,  enjoys good food and reading books, and they [shared what inspires them](%7k3xaKturlSR6eF22IgEFtHYCjaxPXIbmVZ8D/cYDHo=.sha256).

----

[@Alex Luhrman](@zFLU4sgfyWOHvzlaOQNnqytdcq3eBAjP21vfBnl9ZUE=.ed25519) joined us from traveling in southern Mexico. They "...travel to remote communities down here at least once a month and help with agricultural projects." They also [shared](%D3TcqEm0y+oVs6Nf/tCJXlyjcwGny3+Jid/1lD9FP7w=.sha256)  the lovely picture from a beach at the start of this post, which lead to some more pics of travel in Latin America.

----

[@Retric](@XzFwYf+jw052Rm1NkXT70z95ADXRREmzCntgyAniHYg=.ed25519) joined us from Beijing, and [noted that](%rCFddX+gAyAV6HQ+nxT1/4OmYTaZGououeq2ImheIvw=.sha256) we sound a lot like the network described in the HBO show Silicon Valley. They I "...write about tech and everything."

----

[@Miikka](@VeuM0SzKG4o0x7Zw/8VxV7R8mn+6yyYMooPNOBfebik=.ed25519) couldn't resist our gravitational pull, and has decided to make it official by [saying hello](%539Ki7gY/JryYH68c5/+ZhmXX6hpfUoi3ls3HmsBfBw=.sha256) from Helsinki, Finland. They're into math, programming, yoga, photography, and more. 

The nice black & white photo at the top of this post is theirs and their hello post includes other nice ones you should check out

----

[@enerider](@f90w8qepwhUe1IOicHTv8hCEeLFBaq7jIVWjkYJHDbI=.ed25519) plays Descent Underground when not doing IT work and [joined us](%sjI3VLglF/XgwD19TmmudjmMbxrwqz8BRc6sGpRQIJI=.sha256) from "the land of the long, white cloud"

----

[@yale](@CGApf92jj6zv+/T6ugKEcJSlR0m6yVBCLsyk7VQsSqU=.ed25519) joined us from NYC and is "Excited by the potential for P2P social networks to take the place of behemoths like FB."

----

[@Sleepy Sinews](@KvNlCdDrDiTr0b8RtG6M1ZIj2SkvRmpZR0Uwk5X5ETQ=.ed25519) [shared some of their likes](%as6Bi8nEKQKsHxr3FBXQPZP/VEqwxd6qQyzaOzPFoh8=.sha256), and implied that liver casserole is something to be avoided, and that their mother surely has a recipe for it

----

[@Michael Karliner](%/fY+9ALSs6lxxuekohKMyDLpZcy0rtf/AnvZBORKz6Q=.sha256) [joined us from London, England](%/fY+9ALSs6lxxuekohKMyDLpZcy0rtf/AnvZBORKz6Q=.sha256) "...to see how this works." They're a maker with a penchant for circuits and jewlery. 

----

[@SDr](@r+DMQ56InMNr6eJ2ou0S1bkjFXEn+VWrm6adbcW735k=.ed25519) [uses AI to create medical chatbots](%sjpkRWToKuItof6fYjocbYmxkIMnx+xkyasAUeZhW6Q=.sha256), in San Francisco, California, USA.

----

[@Tom Dewey](@B91wjOr9kTRcnoA7Q9i9LOhgoxmZ+AafiwKhll1mt4w=.ed25519) [said hello](%G8tf3uObrpNxLyxe+PwMX5iihUP0r/03O14+kChyffw=.sha256) and described themself as follows

> I'm a Software Engineer by trade, Miata(MX-5) driver/cyclist by choice. I regularly drink far too much coffee, occasionally too much beer, and never enough water.

and provided a list of Pros and Cons. 

----

[@nw](@/rqdvFOUbARfmgTDO7Axwx/kUpxy57/S8VsmgTPXYHA=.ed25519) joined us from both coasts of the US. With experience in distributed systems and JS they asked us to 

> [Let me know how I can help!](%Jvsu0ubUfTskuZI05VIcHKIaB6WROiwxohWQHqLVh1U=.sha256)

which is wonderful to hear.

# This week in Scuttlebutt
(butt-summaries #15: April 23rd-30th part 1)

A sample of life in the Scuttleverse.

## Totally Random
[@Angelica](@eANNuLfzX/9rlGODXHYV8WJb+zw2h+d7YsT4vpYPvD0=.ed25519) [shared a kitty tray](%02tTaQokJuwanGVh2VzzRoFROtm5gh5AXVG0NTOw9EA=.sha256)

----

[@plomlompom](@Gx0218ivJSonlzWz81Dsbj5JT7v41A+o3U11xTfnQpM=.ed25519) [built a radio](%vveN7kY0wwS+riJcYQCl3V40EHp6+mzZwekYE9JwZ/g=.sha256) from a kit.

![kit radio](&kIKovQ/r1S3u/N3vF+1dxMr/PxBTUyLuNt6XrgIhgPE=.sha256)

----

[@Joey Hess](@BCM6DHYJvWzwWi1lFl2tjDXjaqyZAEmJH5ZONSpXhtc=.ed25519) got Meta in Kentucky, USA.

![meta](&BCkkKsaDGk6gAAo6lxMhz5PcqMG/jgvYm5h63kY6N8g=.sha256)

----
[@dangerousbeans](@TXKFQehlyoSn8UJAIVP/k2BjFINC591MlBC2e2d24mA=.ed25519) is _getting plastic from the sea to print things_, and working on urban gardening. [Details here](%365adNPzif378uAcMGfW+x1c01yWbqh4uS30hSihJVw=.sha256)


---

[@Dominic](@EMovhfIrFk4NihAKnRNhrfRaqIhBv1Wj8pTxJNgvCCY=.ed25519) posted about [emerging design patterns in engineering](%C4NTs6hbODYTK393SQK/EKbKDxdyIrWKen2+JhTgk4Q=.sha256) (physical engineering not programming).


## Community

[A discussion about multi-sig wallets](%kLuR6X34go/JacneyO9kbQkXG3Ul2ac18qlffRFhDxI=.sha256) and shards, and regeneration and keys resulted in [@Angelica](@eANNuLfzX/9rlGODXHYV8WJb+zw2h+d7YsT4vpYPvD0=.ed25519) creating this

![angelica's crystals](&cDRVntoCy7if+jtfNBWRVSU/MPiYX05HYKf91E3WOSs=.sha256)

which resulted in them [inviting Angelica](%j7dIyweh5uqTR28VzOO5ShMYybEDSMc2dTc366wPD44=.sha256) to the wallet for continued visual work. 

----
[@elavoie](@IgYpd+tCtXnlE2tYX/8rR2AGt+P8svC98WH3MdYAa8Y=.ed25519) suggested that "[SSB is a universal community super-power](%raROGngt7ornaUrZu6z+GESVUEgrq3D2uAtXeAERQqM=.sha256)"

> SSB has the interesting property of equally empowering everyone with the same capabilities for social and private communication regardless of whether they are powerful CEOs, government representatives, intelligence agencies, or low-profile citizen. It is actually leveling the playing field. This is not common of technology design and is uniquely powerful and awesome.

----

[@Matt McKegg](@FbGoHeEcePDG3Evemrc+hm+S77cXKf8BRQgkYinJggg=.ed25519) asked "[Are groups the future of communities on ssb?](%uSukBEzOx2Ge8boal0b4v+xqq9bnF62wa2e/usKKlVE=.sha256)"

> I have been giving some thought to the problem of new user overload. I recently replied to an issue on the patchwork github about making it easier to find pubs in Patchwork. I think my response came across as quite dismissive. I tried to justify my response, but I have since realized that I was missing a major vital part of what has evolved here.

----

[@dinosaur](@6ilZq3kN0F+dXFHAPjAwMm87JEb/VdB+LC9eIMW3sa0=.ed25519) [posted a link to The wisdom and/or madness of crowds](%sRJ0lAoiZzUMSn2rc+rxmSQxbJ9/SfsMTmUggTdKwSU=.sha256) 

> Why do groups of people act smart, dumb, kind, cruel?
> 
> An interactive guide to networks & humans

----

content.text:
[@Luandro](@2RNGJafZtMHzd76gyvqH6EJiK7kBnXeak5mBWzoO/iU=.ed25519) [posted a video](%9Db3wW0qqXk98Lte8rqnuskzt33TkdfsjXIk0H6/RLk=.sha256) they created in 2013 on The Benefits of a Slow Life.

> The video was shot in Buscalan village, part of Tinglayan, Kalinga in the Philippines. I spent around 3 months experiencing life with them while reading #graeber 5000 Years and seeing with my own eyes what real life #anarchism and #communalism looks like.  

## Community Geeky Intersection

[@Kieran](@MpDd66GPXgN1+eMNrZInHkWq1THMurWwLdMx8BZ1ncw=.ed25519) started "...[sketching out a few ideas for using #ssb as an encrypted secret sharing mechanism](%hxC/2/FPgNh+cAO699+cszkgkQax/blviZt/rmcaNEw=.sha256)

----

[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) started worrying about [the emergence of a Google-butt](%z28ZLyE7OSAjirrBG5RQyZzpVCilnoCb3MTY2lugwO0=.sha256)

> It starts as a really excellent service - Hey I notice you have a hard to navigate p2p web there... can I interest you in a map or guidebook to help you on your way? YES PLEASE.
> 
> Once the Google-butt is insinuated it's hard to get rid off because it's so gosh darn useful. Meanwhile the Google-butt has some overheads, but you know what, it's been spidering its way across the scuttle-pelago and it sure does have a lot of user data. It's got social graphs out the wazoo. Only a matter of time till your data is the product and things you've said are being batch processed by large institutions.

----
[@Dominic](@EMovhfIrFk4NihAKnRNhrfRaqIhBv1Wj8pTxJNgvCCY=.ed25519) posted about the [next step towards private groups](%PBKwv8CsVZrwLrVFIYEoDYHFKz1wLUmVMjZO6OxcrIM=.sha256)

> coming soon: the ability to share a decryption link to a private message. This will be a markdown link, but including the decryption key. You can reveal a message to just one person at a time, by linking just to them, or reveal it publically, by posting it in a public message.
> ...
> The essential thing about private groups is that you can add people to them later

They had another conceptually related post about [group multisig, & same-as but with people](%D0tue88kaAOdZL7zuBbmRZUF70rBYDvnPZbE+Vd4jwQ=.sha256) 

## Geeky


[@mix](%R/jKpNR2pFrvhpvU6AXlmvg4P1N2el4WFyC1bnvgnmw=.sha256) suggested that..
 
> If Josiah is still up for it, we really want to see tags, and his work succeed. I think there are enough of us that we could swarm to get it merged

[@Josiah](@HjH7assXYIZ5ATQkh1CKtnt6lpVVDY24/NB29okNido=.ed25519) said "let's do it"

So maybe we'll see that coming to fruition soon ([full thread here](%172sPoFMhRs3REwfJwTxHd8yexYS6KReKFjuBhxNhYA=.sha256))

----

[@cryptix](@p13zSAiOpguI9nsawkGijsnMfWmFd5rlUNpzekEE+vI=.ed25519) has been [making progress on the golang ssb code](%M/qtHwvL1qgbQNZUowOnggGXAtgKuagjQMHGgreuETE=.sha256)

----
[@Fabi√°n Heredia Montiel](%+myX1fZaPtss839aWHehhVbmZ7R5qCNL4n1+XAXWpeA=.sha256) and a friend 
> ...are going to be implementing a scuttlebutt client in haskell [ for a school project]

[Thread here](%+myX1fZaPtss839aWHehhVbmZ7R5qCNL4n1+XAXWpeA=.sha256)

[@keks](@YXkE3TikkY4GFMX3lzXUllRkNTbj5E+604AkaO1xbz8=.ed25519) shared the notes from [a call about a new plugin system](%oxtXLx0AdZgcQpLlLYjDfrgzMJw1j8zv0YSwEtFAep8=.sha256).

# This week in Scuttlebutt
(butt-summaries #16: May 1st-May 7th part 1)

A sample of life in the Scuttleverse.

----

There are currently 18 people helping to fund the future of Scuttlebutt through the [SSB consortium](https://opencollective.com/secure-scuttlebutt-consortium)! Their support, and yours, will help to keep making this great place even better. 

----

## Totally Random

Molly [found a stick after a hike](%iqHNpx2XrtR8WPKfT+d2pUH/UooOtEEvLXNSjctBSDw=.sha256).

![molly's stick](&ot0re0UsrkgRBk+L/HEL2Mf1mjuTvtz25e3Cl2ZLr3o=.sha256)

----

[@CallumTheRobertson](@m78GWJOePV1uwy7HUW+U2bWYAKyVoYKRVKfcV7WuySw=.ed25519) stuck one of a microscope at interesting things and the other end piped it into the 'butts for us. 

Check out [the thread](%wQklgvZYgrsJA6HsxBZFF55D1MF/FQ9HZ9m8xPl8h0c=.sha256) to see what this is along with a bunch of other cool microscope pics.

![mysterious pretty thing](&qFUgx/PYjKEKzucHraDPRAlAP8bE7LqW2BkDT/NIIuw=.sha256)

----

[@zie](@FcZCT4lCttqOUhIAyxi00ix2gjYJJ2E2FFekwN4/860=.ed25519) gave us a view from the offgrid life

![sea cliffs](&kjoQWaPcpDdxTmvwdeaL+Iu7LcPx963njTrEfUbaBC4=.sha256)

and [shared some info about their offgrid lifestyle](%1EawZ0iMzHlZOc2YrDD8A1qer3nK4RPLHGkhXUX+QsA=.sha256).

----

[@frostedflakes](%0Lp0ZzY7ZXdy/FOat9VDCogT8sve1GFc4WqZ8Ljkhws=.sha256) shared [A night in the life of an observational astronomer](%0Lp0ZzY7ZXdy/FOat9VDCogT8sve1GFc4WqZ8Ljkhws=.sha256) which is a nifty read with lots of nice pictures, even if you're not into astronomy.

----

[@flpvzk](@RP01FOdcs/QABLmMxTGe1U9myUfSLN/5ItlXQcp7oWQ=.ed25519) is "...building a metronome specifically for #polyrhythm practice.." and [looking for feedback](%P217V1GFtR51LYvOelTU4jTdhUH2VJyHmFLaB7gD2ng=.sha256).

content.text:
## Community
[@elavoie](@IgYpd+tCtXnlE2tYX/8rR2AGt+P8svC98WH3MdYAa8Y=.ed25519) posted a [May Donation Reminder](%4/J4ppE0yYySUv8R5eroz/IC47RmBl00uPWfkWCDG0Q=.sha256) 

> As a first miIestone, I suggest we should target being able to provide one ssbc-grant (5000$US) per month through donations to ensure funded development continues after the Dfinity grant is fully used,** which should occur around August or September.** 

They also suggest some non-financial ways you can help out. 

Personally I love watching folks propose and discuss great additions to our SSB world, and then get paid for making them. I'd love to see this keep happening.

----

Re getting people onto scuttlebutt [@mix](%f23nKO4SMR+6VzJCO5aQfXQodVUsUhOez5Py7ahMVrQ=.sha256) had this advice

> people need to come in their own time. I find a good way to go is to post links and images that are interesting to twitter every week or two.
> 
> In patchwork - right click on a message to get an external link.

( from a pretty [unrelated thread](%f23nKO4SMR+6VzJCO5aQfXQodVUsUhOez5Py7ahMVrQ=.sha256) about decentralization )





## Community Geeky Intersection

[@soapdog](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519) and [@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) [made progress on Ticktack](%WpfeQ5GqyXEDkes2vzwkpBqiR63Fk9VYFhOVgb2tQNw=.sha256)

Including [a new UI for customizng your web sharing metrics](%JLDfIU7CeO7ZDsHz/4RGcysf5X/R7dgG9pZ3rmMDDcw=.sha256).

![web sharing metrics in ticktack](&2UJcDkyF4orJPqd7N6mdPRoxJMgM7zjhh4EvPmJtuf8=.sha256)

and [notifications](%p3etkgtXMefLmqIz/YTb2atGqtRWojK8Ug/i+QrDd/Q=.sha256)

----

[@dinosaur](@6ilZq3kN0F+dXFHAPjAwMm87JEb/VdB+LC9eIMW3sa0=.ed25519) now has a live demo of their buttcloud work. A link to that, and other updates [here](%4D105+Qga+/iiqiW9zJDticlujR0gEQMIjIk20kFWGI=.sha256).

----

[@Tim Schumacher](@o3eDT3n9urv1cyIWDuF+wQHBFj3I8OcE3L4Tla9RR8A=.ed25519) is [making good progress](%nEsmdkKIIK1+rk2jmtocE4WFtIE+FTzYhupIunr8x+g=.sha256) on his new ssb client.

![tim's client](&TbNkUM5mWuoJW9Pp1Jfj15CnH4Kb5EwWb7NcKotpwQM=.sha256)

Later they [started wondering](%CVEJEXfdkS8gRj5kVBtCjr5MhevTcNYlOj/Ntadl1VM=.sha256) about "...how to handle multiple clients that all want to use scuttlebot and want to use the same identity [on the same computer]"

----

In the middle of a discussion about message privacy & metadata [@hoz](@RtsOc2h1gqh0fRrjrUTHAkRBu9YyDgsD+EWsfLpykrc=.ed25519) posted [an interesting little note](%iebPMKACkql5FzvyCFoHwbg4xYcUxS4saRd4eDeTu9U=.sha256) showing that it's actually pretty difficult to tell who's talking to who privately.




## Geeky

[@Cy](@60jitr5ZbnEFQf0NjcZ6zi2NIAKL40lrFqo2SiiHn1I=.ed25519) did [a little exploration into the known memory leaks](%mdQ3/QCjSeTISZK9p83BB3sCLuxT2vcZrjnsEdjcAT4=.sha256). Came up with this graph from running _just scuttlebot_.

![memory leak](&UlurTp8rBltc1sg5j525PKIaKQd8phpbLVMQqxx+K30=.sha256)


----

A couple weeks ago [@Joey Hess](@BCM6DHYJvWzwWi1lFl2tjDXjaqyZAEmJH5ZONSpXhtc=.ed25519) wanted to get some intelligent home automation based on various data the systems were already collecting and "[...dug into the reactive-banana library](%yaNduOGptHdkTEUNpuq7OAiRmjVgraI5/ESUnWLq+xA=.sha256)" and shared some of the thinking and exploration. [@IBob](@vkdMlsuBgzzo5eLS3LZLdqnBpZ26OauJOMIq9gQ2E7E=.ed25519) then chimed in with some real world advice from real world plant automation.

----

[@sentamalin](%5b38fB0mmn9+8wUWdJG7FtBps3pLVGinNS5eRHgB2Io=.sha256) shared [A Creative Approach to Revoking OpenPGP Subkeys](%5b38fB0mmn9+8wUWdJG7FtBps3pLVGinNS5eRHgB2Io=.sha256)



post 2 of 3

content.text:
## New People

[@resir](@UVidV0nqbcEQjOF5O7InmFQqdcwM1ppswI3IKim2eJQ=.ed25519) [joined us a couple weeks ago](%U21W4zlECJg3LuUgLZbCnrLuYRDDc3bp55tLOql+aZ0=.sha256) but i missed it. In addition to geeky things they "..play Rocket League in my spare time" and contributes to a lot of FOSS. Details in their hello post.

----

[@lilly](%N3ybcQ+pwnxy8he6SqjMSNUnAelWXcO2sCb4mHAweK4=.sha256) is an Idaho to Chicago (IL) USA translpant who is interested in 

> ...fermentation projects (lately, especially ferments using koji, the mold which is responsible for miso, soy sauce, sake, and many other foods). I also like hot springs, of which there are sadly none nearby here in the midwest.

and a number of other interesting things that are not related to distributed computing. You should read [their hello post](%N3ybcQ+pwnxy8he6SqjMSNUnAelWXcO2sCb4mHAweK4=.sha256) to find out more.

![nettle miso](&SxtXAd7ir55JcQkRDCSVX6F0xqQfh95MeWuqJ9qwqoE=.sha256)


----

[@Tom](@yUrTaP+JVhZ8fI0fdkhmAsjIg6j1Xpy0nCONw67AQOE=.ed25519) said hello from Poland a couple weeks ago. They "...[love learning about new and thought-provoking ideas, so logically my interests include philosophy and politics](%3a63SwT2u5jZkV6PyRiAbISEsH8pLVwv6FcdnsU5wkA=.sha256)" and offered to share some "bad poetry" with us, although it looks like they may have lost their old identity and now you should follow [@Tom](@EVTdPBjQxViBjNE1Hkh9nRUIeCi6hIVuxReljJpLEAc=.ed25519) instead. 

----

[@Dimple](%mbjp9G3Kh9DqsBwK1iani4/xwKDZTktSgJmL1CsK+xg=.sha256) said hello from Bangalore India. The love poetry and 

> A question I'd like to ask everyone is: what makes you happy?

[answer here](%mbjp9G3Kh9DqsBwK1iani4/xwKDZTktSgJmL1CsK+xg=.sha256) and learn more about them, and your fellow scuttlers.

----

----

These summaries are brought to you by [@masukomi](@LzTjF5eAVC6xprPMGeNzqEP/EEBIGpM6hDaaY10hrz8=.ed25519) who would love to hear your suggestions about how to make them better, and ideas on things to include.

love learning about new and thought-provoking ideas, so logically my interests include philosophy and politics

# This week in Scuttlebutt
(butt-summaries #17: May 8th-May 14th part 1)

A sample of life in the Scuttleverse.

There are currently 20 people helping to fund the future of Scuttlebutt through the [SSB consortium](https://opencollective.com/secure-scuttlebutt-consortium)! 

## Totally Random

[@emile](@2YVYXQclEJHVzCON5dsLRwf65b2S6HnvxpGS8/LwjwY=.ed25519) learned the dangers of jewlers/watch stores and [the power of DIY](%DgRPT4qo/5aX5+kOkDT67B8eNGMFwKZGTdGkBfwTaa8=.sha256).

----
[@zie](@FcZCT4lCttqOUhIAyxi00ix2gjYJJ2E2FFekwN4/860=.ed25519) [found a beautiful heart](&346tNjK2ssYyIcY57bF12htB3mHBQDOefMlLbdSM4RI=.sha256).

![natural heart](&346tNjK2ssYyIcY57bF12htB3mHBQDOefMlLbdSM4RI=.sha256)


----

[@Matt McKegg](@FbGoHeEcePDG3Evemrc+hm+S77cXKf8BRQgkYinJggg=.ed25519) [unveiled their "new hardware based live electronic music rig](%a6QsDKeGW/0vWyDfj050yAKEl3JopVwRatDnALqbbQ8=.sha256) at #art~hack!"

Links to video and music in the thread.

## Community

[@Richard D.  Bartlett](@3r4+IyB5NVl2in6QOZHIu9oSrZud+NuVgl2GX3x2WG8=.ed25519)'s [posted on Medium about being fed up with facebook and regretting his attempts to make things better there](https://medium.com/swlh/im-sick-of-facebook-8e7c7fa03b0a).

> In my little corner of the Big Blue Web I‚Äôve been trying to create pockets for society to sprout in, but now I feel like I‚Äôm enabling the most anti-social behaviour. I‚Äôm feeding a machine that is out of control.

----

[@martin](@pJsYrTaEjm5XW5Qe0W9JW2c+RpYNqJHPMZ0qGFFYXfI=.ed25519) was thinking...

> In what ways do you think are users new to this platform aware of [the fact you can never delete messages], and what could we do to better communicate and mediate this, such that this doesn't become a show-stopper in the adoption to many (or should become a show-stopper, but people don't realise‚Ä¶)?

----

[@Teq](@CxnSXWYjPT160y7QbmTFtWaWT09080azgErYPt1ZeZc=.ed25519) and [@manni](@JSrjjJja0t6v2Lb8wQN3TPecpPMrdcOcOISsDe68dpA=.ed25519)  are undertaking a Scuttlebutt research project Outline

> The Scuttleverse: Alternative Social Media for Decentralised Sociotechnical Communities?
> 
> Over the next few years @manni and I willl be undertaking an online-ethnographic study of the Scuttleverse - please read the following options for participating or opting-out.

What questions are they trying to answer? How might it benefit Scuttlebutt? [Read the outline to find out](%lJ9WIhzVnk0q5hXldrKD+8jVmeNHHExHIemO4PEmwMY=.sha256).

---

[@Simon](@q/0xxglJw8pR+/FBo9XBpIVY+BRjiW3phFW5D1nq4hs=.ed25519) [posted about the book](%oOq1hr4SlVqnUrDpT04pmR9vzHc3tOZTEnLp2HSY9dA=.sha256) "Sunvault: Stories of Solarpunk and Eco-Speculation" which should resonate with our solarpunk contingent.


## Community & Geeky Intersection

[@Alanna](%K+Ua1osLiZaP/D6rOaMGOxeEgpLa+hH6PiQuAOo/vXE=.sha256) posted the IKEA style instructions explaining Public Key Crypto which turned into [an educational and approachable discussion about cryptography](%K+Ua1osLiZaP/D6rOaMGOxeEgpLa+hH6PiQuAOo/vXE=.sha256)

----

[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) and [@SoapDog](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519) have continued to make great progress on TickTack. This release includes ["a beautiful new editor for writing"](%En8FvnwWWEPaIvSYY6hXat2l1adllhkcY0uI5YjwGfk=.sha256), writing stats, web sharing, and more including this, which all ssb clients should probably implement:

> We are enabling users to export their private keys, and then safely restore their identity on another computer at a later date. 

----

content.text:
**[@SoapDog](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519) posted about [Importing and Exporting your SSB Identity](%3xHLk48qIN1STP2vU9iaKkEQ4MifmQPWkmi1Aj6limw=.sha256)**  it's tied to Ticktack at the moment, but all the SSB apps use the same `~/.ssb/secret` file, so even if you aren't using Ticktack right now you could use it for identity export and import, until the other apps get it. Then again, you could just back up your `~/.ssb/secret` and `~/.ssb/gossip.json` files manually.


----

[@christianbundy](@+oaWWDs8g73EZFUMfW37R/ULtFEjwKN/DczvdYihjbU=.ed25519) [made a discovery](%g43FCjvJLgDxPc1++JGT1lyz7WLTqHG3ESucE8WUGVQ=.sha256): 

> I just bumped my hops from 2 to 3 and I got new mentions!
> 
> I didn't even think about the possibility of people outside my network replying to my posts, but now I'm hoping I didn't miss anyone else.

Some people were asking how to change your number of hops and [@Dan Hassan](%prZJt+2PYp3zlQMQagAFRHkoBRAc7N7EI520YcdSua4=.sha256) chimed in and let folks know, and linked to some conversations about it.

----

[@Dominic](@EMovhfIrFk4NihAKnRNhrfRaqIhBv1Wj8pTxJNgvCCY=.ed25519) started going down [an interesting path with regards to issue tracking for SSB](%ZyZge6x3sXi4kROFfhnGs8URgPEDq1thPjC0D8tPfms=.sha256)

> I've been thinking about what if there was an issue tracker optimized for the sort of team project that secure scuttlebutt is? I've been reading harry potter and in it the houses are awarded points, it might be the result of an individual action, but they win as a group. Isn't this the way an open source project should be? we all put effort in, and we win as a community as our software gets better. Could we make tools that emphasise that? Apart from loomio, I'm having trouble thinking of examples of software like this.



## Geeky

[@Noffle](@C3iYh/12sO1uvKq1KcZXLFxSySzxOkHxXN8rtNB5MGA=.ed25519) had some [questions about ssb-ooo](%qPdY+vB+QlPcsbNDzJnYLY7HTFYrbiLnGBBCvbbNA2A=.sha256) that the readme failed to answer for them.

They've been thinking about ["Greater contact Granularity"](%AjezqNh6srJtlFMVVncDWKDrSXozG9bUxV8Cqp7JZqo=.sha256)

> I think the core thing I was trying to communicate (and now I think I better understand) is being able to choose the nature of the relationship you want with a person, which could be more of a UI concern than anything! 


and have made [git-ssb-web improvements](%1VQFAsQFuidH32W5krKjZ1wLSVxFHHH4PeKrVWzSa/k=.sha256) and [wants to hear what's on your git-ssb wishlist](%ZP7RA3T24eM9v3oNAvGn+kTLdQ8s9LUPGaLokXpTDmY=.sha256)

And... they're

> [Seeking a term](%34d7pUNxvXHDBjrALo0bW6aW2VMt1htPCHUcMUIP1t8=.sha256) to describe this growing movement of writing software that respects human beings & the earth, and values them 1st over profit & corp greed.


----

[@dinosaur](@6ilZq3kN0F+dXFHAPjAwMm87JEb/VdB+LC9eIMW3sa0=.ed25519) has [continued to make good progress](%96pgORM3mEi7r4R185pWiEp//pBwHxFK2jaSYHiwjfs=.sha256) on the butt-cloud.


----

[@dominic](@EMovhfIrFk4NihAKnRNhrfRaqIhBv1Wj8pTxJNgvCCY=.ed25519) wrote about "[fixing the non-monotonic timestamps](%mGIrR2DWXceENNZrVNwyEUpukxUv7bKAQABc2nkxizQ=.sha256)"

> Some people have argued for abandoning the idea of monotonic timestamps. Let me be clear, I do not like that idea, but I will not pronounce it "off the table". However, I do insist on some things...I think are loosly the principles we should follow to design a stable protocol.

----

[@noffle](@C3iYh/12sO1uvKq1KcZXLFxSySzxOkHxXN8rtNB5MGA=.ed25519) made some [git-ssb-web performance improvements](%1VQFAsQFuidH32W5krKjZ1wLSVxFHHH4PeKrVWzSa/k=.sha256)


----

[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) is exploring how we'd implement [causally sorted queries](%TyvjVI5zty6O+WmA9En+N3WzhNlY9KPgZOt3KAVlU2U=.sha256) 

> At the moment in ssb, you can stream messages by asserted timestamp or received timestamp. These are ok, but they're a both weaker than doing a causal sorting


## New People
[@schapleigh](@o+cd+eVMK2RCTvCAhOb6/JEny77hX4GZAoX3IgzyWD8=.ed25519) is [a Texan in New York USA](%y4Bsci/PqDFnPtrXhFWFBNz/anVQaInFrE38eLpW6RE=.sha256), who "...recently left the finance world for blockchain world, so naturally I dyed my hair pink to celebrate my freedom."

----

content.text:
[@Ricardo Hz](@I0EUkJOaEX7wnQO0rWmN3GFEpN1WxRzTc7xt6kLSX78=.ed25519) hails from Chile, after some time in Scotland, and came here by way of [@Richard D.  Bartlett](@3r4+IyB5NVl2in6QOZHIu9oSrZud+NuVgl2GX3x2WG8=.ed25519)'s [post about being sick of facebook](https://medium.com/swlh/im-sick-of-facebook-8e7c7fa03b0a). They're an academic, a researcher, a gymnast, [and more](%P0WvuM+fe6MqWTPJNFz/rARwXH9KqrRUkMdUacVO2pE=.sha256). 

----
[@zandy](@ped5H5Bs/p27lGbnVGALuamUUl1L5hrPDKBqTFqPcLY=.ed25519) joined us from New York City USA. 

> I'm a member of DappHub, a collective that specializes in decentralized applications. we treat dapps both as a field of emerging internet technology and as a wider political ideology capable of uniting many different interesting projects seeking to create a new way to live.

You can learn more about that in [their hello post](%2mNIEsZP93yeB6TwSwdIYDpVimJ57CsxSaXlxpgpkqk=.sha256)


----

[@Teq](@CxnSXWYjPT160y7QbmTFtWaWT09080azgErYPt1ZeZc=.ed25519) [introduced](%rz4ef8b1dHmAqxleSSZwUTwneqX1J+ptVIxHGuGBiiE=.sha256) [@manni](@JSrjjJja0t6v2Lb8wQN3TPecpPMrdcOcOISsDe68dpA=.ed25519) 

> I particularly recommend asking about the practices of young-people disconnecting through mobile media, and/or the use of weather-watching technologies when #cycling

which someone did, and then @manni [said hello](%1V+NnQCCaY+EKhLQ3RQ1h/gwewJTF/dej9TQpwmqtFw=.sha256)  and talked about that, and more including

> Personally, I‚Äôm increasingly trying to extract myself from said silicon valley oligarchs but because I study them I have a pretty limited capacity to do so. I‚Äôm not a coder but I strongly believe in the importance of fostering secure, private, + decentralised spaces for people to interact online. I‚Äôm excited to be able to exist in a place that better aligns with those values  :relaxed:


----

[@Pepo](@FFqVndJQLACdYZzE7ELLKO4L6j13BEwmlo2MF6BfWIg=.ed25519) [joined us from Spain (near Barcelona). [They're "...exploring ways to enable powerful distributed co-creation."](%SiY494cEussZCO9zmgdNtqsiXS+d/gBSvs7RVfMl8a8=.sha256)

> We started by building a flexible 'token management system' with additional tools for peer-reviewed value accounting, and tested it with the people from Ouishare Barcelona. Now, we are working on distributed governance, which we are framing more as a communication problem 



----
----

These summaries are brought to you by [@masukomi](@LzTjF5eAVC6xprPMGeNzqEP/EEBIGpM6hDaaY10hrz8=.ed25519) who would love to hear your suggestions about how to make them better, or ideas on things to include. 

Thanks to [@Teq](@CxnSXWYjPT160y7QbmTFtWaWT09080azgErYPt1ZeZc=.ed25519) this week for a few good pointers.

## Special Bulletin
Time sensitive info from Rabble:

[@rabble](@vzoU7/XuBB5B0xueC9NHFr9Q76VvPktD9GUkYgN9lAc=.ed25519) has been talking with folks from the Unicef Innovation Fund, about possibly getting another grant for SSB development. Help is needed to get all the info together by the application deadline. 

> Together we should be able to put together some docs on what SSB is and how it works in the format that Unicef wants. It's like startup funding proposal, but not an investment and it's all open source.

If this sounds like something you can help with, [please check out the thread](%gr3nRg9OPLKWRyfxKM7l5GHf+sq5FnnpkWmXTiHCj2w=.sha256), if not, please try and spread the word. Even if we don't get this grant, having all these docs together will make it much easier to apply for the next one.

![butt_summaries_image.jpg](&cIBYD4wh/L/Ivqb1Zyqc3uwFQJOB6Sgnlv3lITD/urY=.sha256)

# This week in Scuttlebutt
(butt-summaries #18: May 15th-21st part 1)

A sample of life in the Scuttleverse.

There are currently 20 people helping to fund the future of Scuttlebutt through the [SSB consortium](https://opencollective.com/secure-scuttlebutt-consortium)! 

## Totally Random

[@Joey Hess](&T1jFPa+Bh88xfrC5z5asIqtFNaT5QN+EWJcsM68gI8U=.sha256) was "[failing at capturing beauty](%wP3Q8r9VBBfWOkjZAT/4rrO3QP0UlAwaoJFZ131UceM=.sha256)"

![failed beauty shot](&T1jFPa+Bh88xfrC5z5asIqtFNaT5QN+EWJcsM68gI8U=.sha256)

I think Joey's scale might be miscalibrated, because that's damn pretty, especially compared to most people's daily surroundings.

----

[@dangerousbeans](@TXKFQehlyoSn8UJAIVP/k2BjFINC591MlBC2e2d24mA=.ed25519) showed [how to make a cool HDPE & LDPE mix](%8CGHQ8y6j8lsZijf2ETEtX1ED5IVpPuufBSyQSE2V+I=.sha256) from used bottles and then make interesting things from it.

----

[@kas](@dBQlwh9Gtr3i5YMOGtIOKtGNVepeu+nyb6KGl1vtOcM=.ed25519) built an [insect hotel](%d5D83ryylLpnzeEfJ+9szU7fm3KJRRPSBN6tWN10VEA=.sha256). 

![insect hotel](&cHD1aLJz0ylhFUALdgdBsRbIjJOSsAVALItlPzL1TPI=.sha256)


## Solarpunk
[@rabble](@vzoU7/XuBB5B0xueC9NHFr9Q76VvPktD9GUkYgN9lAc=.ed25519) [posted their tale](%R7Kejx4DccK/erhlt9v8gqUPPAh+KY/KBBbMlBZMaLY=.sha256) of building an off-grid house in northern California out of Papecrete.

![zelda window](&vY4XTFvdu62GYiWgQFjiixCZD0+XrHQ3hHybZdvSk7s=.sha256)



## Community & Geeky

[@rabble](@vzoU7/XuBB5B0xueC9NHFr9Q76VvPktD9GUkYgN9lAc=.ed25519) has been talking with folks from the Unicef Innovation Fund, about possibly getting another grant for SSB development. @rabble needs your help to get all the info together by the application deadline. If you can help out, [please check out the thread](%gr3nRg9OPLKWRyfxKM7l5GHf+sq5FnnpkWmXTiHCj2w=.sha256).

> Together we should be able to put together some docs on what SSB is and how it works in the format that Unicef wants. It's like startup funding proposal, but not an investment and it's all open source.

----

[@SoapDog](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519) posted [some updates and a teaser video](%C7U9viRmm/2ooDBoY8DAwax2tGr1lJvaoqLGZXpXdgQ=.sha256) of Ticktack exporting and importing identities. 

----

[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) [made ssb-horcrux patchbay@7 compatible](%XZ/VCXHXNr9msT4p7ijaUp7/5CA18Goc+bIg4B7TXoA=.sha256). According to [@squicc](@k9xSaKW2kc+Ko8Vx+xvFmVC5gEi/tIA2TpV6EBQ7MPw=.ed25519) it lets you 

>  Split your key into some number of parts, give those to trusted friends, and if your computer ever dies, you can re-create your private key. i think

## Geeky

[@Dominic](@EMovhfIrFk4NihAKnRNhrfRaqIhBv1Wj8pTxJNgvCCY=.ed25519) posted about a [friends algorithm rewrite](%FOyO23xiOfbavyD5a8+KE2f5ZuU1bY/ko4dLRdCUpr4=.sha256)

> Because of user-invites and same-as we need a) a more flexible way to represent relations between feeds, and b) the ability for modules to express aspects of those relationships. (and I think same-as will have many uses: same-as for pubs and same-as for groups)
> 
> This is the last piece to user-invites, it's been simmering away in my mind a bit, then I can start putting it all together. In this post I'll write about representing relationships, and I'll write about splitting into modules once I've figured that out..


----

[@cel](@f/6sQ6d2CMxRUhLpspgGIulDxDCwYD7DzFzPNr7u5AU=.ed25519) made some [ssb-npm updates](%UoFH/lOzTMICV851XyzAP1Ciq0q0VAF9zJtja7hyWgM=.sha256) 

Repos/modules updated: 
* ssb-npm-registry	
* ssb-npm
* pull-tar-extract

Details are in [the post](%UoFH/lOzTMICV851XyzAP1Ciq0q0VAF9zJtja7hyWgM=.sha256).


They also made some [git-ssb updates](%H27E0DLMiAGYonayN2qrCEcZDrZAEK0fADBi9TMrRRE=.sha256): some push options, some maintenance, some performance, and fixing an out-of-memory error.

----

## Totally Random
[@Zie](@FcZCT4lCttqOUhIAyxi00ix2gjYJJ2E2FFekwN4/860=.ed25519) shared [a pretty pic of Montana](%It+4aUdxdk9R3zU2ZSEmE5XEtG3rRwDUE0FBdUp9hJw=.sha256)

> ...even healthy minds can be somewhere on the spectrum (a mild case) of a mental disorder, which is okay. the more clearly we see ourselves as we are, the better we can take care of ourselves.

[@alana](@6OxffMLNyxkboLjCqv29WnMPhH8O3qFrcXCR6KrKcPI=.ed25519) [posted](%a3kFJnMnm3CL+aTnFiZnf4RFavL+amv1MjS6K70nzrU=.sha256)

> For several years I've been following, and occasionally advising/supporting a project called Self Help Groups, which is a mobile app that guides facilitators of savings pool groups in East Africa. They just started releasing a series of videos on their blog with stories of the savings pool members and how it's affected their lives.

If you're not familiar with savings pools, they're pretty amazing and transformative things in many poor communities. 

----

A couple weeks ago [@av8ta](@dfCIY3rP5idQFdjuOHrBJqrv6EgsSiNyn1NKz87UTJw=.ed25519) posted about [ssb-chur](%0f+5foyYVp3lWdLgi6EGRynat/ar9Q32VOOFbvk+zqQ=.sha256) as "...another way of going about rewarding people [financially] for their creativity in the scuttleverse"
