[@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) [shared a talk](%tkW5JQrJHcBJHe2MZd5L4yUViiNXH7P5YUjpNUQ7quQ=.sha256) 

 > Eben Moglen talks to the Internet Society about the history of the internet, and how it gradually moved from peer-to-peer, to thick-client thin-server, to thin-client thick-server, to the cloud. And how you should own your data in your pocket. This talk inspired Diaspora, but applies really well to Scuttlebutt.

> Goals
> * Help maintainers
> * Attach no strings

> * Get it done
> * Make it work

many more details in the post.


----

[@noffle](@C3iYh/12sO1uvKq1KcZXLFxSySzxOkHxXN8rtNB5MGA=.ed25519) posted about [message visibility controls](%IQGKmKH1k2ZiiRZR1up2kphywV189YRXey8Sj5/eMFE=.sha256) in the new [scat](%TdxPyxdSDjA2lAGYedQ68ZC5aDKBsHquWpiPRucNPA8=.sha256) ssb chat app, as well as some other thoughts on scat.


----

[@Dan Hassan](@NeB4q4Hy9IiMxs5L08oevEhivxW+/aDu/s/0SkNayi0=.ed25519) [posted a Digital-Security and Privacy Protection ux Checklist](%o2NFZfAjZHdyLDFhjJt2m/WsrnbLKq9Qiwr5XrR40PQ=.sha256) (DSPPUX-Checklist)

> This checklist provides suggestions to promote digital security and privacy for people who are designing and developing tools for targeted communities.

They also started a thread [discussing moving some of the ssbc-grants funds to an alternate Distribution Experiment](%ZnAsKbKDeH1btoSGVE6QzZ0VJylNV/N8w8pQFfqjI74=.sha256)



----

[@Nico Pace](@2AWm36HvcuOOcYeNgGgoybKXcMZx+COIf4/aAxJwnVI=.ed25519) notes that [the arrival of the LibreRouter is imminent](%S+lYRlDxnrFEJwAiLYxy22DO/nywZfyggB45ShtLaoM=.sha256). 

> In order to prepare for the imminent arrival, we prepared a report to have you informed on how it will be and how you will be able to use it.
> We have also prepared a video to explain you how you can use it in your communities

----

[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) added [image search](%EyAz2d9n8Zs+Qd8JsQKUm99c7yDhycmFnf5ijz9v1pA=.sha256) to the master branch of Patchbay and discussed how it works. Short version "you need to start paying attention to how you name images with markdown"

![image search in patchbay](&D9qPkvhdIqxhi2MqIIX+N9KAGF+mba91fZvu4GEBtIY=.sha256) 



## Geeky

[@rhodey orbits](@zObwlZWdllQT42db+l34tJQ9UEkpcoeg+IFhlAGKImg=.ed25519) is [wondering if out-of-order-messages mean they can implement an evicting queue](%oq2I2sbr5awNWjz8W3ma+P8pO0RKHcPeS16rgzMVOAk=.sha256). 

> Is there a way to work meaningfully with a feed when you only have a portion of the whole?

No-one has answered... 


----

[@Dinosaur](@6ilZq3kN0F+dXFHAPjAwMm87JEb/VdB+LC9eIMW3sa0=.ed25519) was [playing with mandalas using React `<svg>`](%KE1REXTUlJb9KqgmDApRoxw3+KDrstSQtnLqFdWDSSU=.sha256) and shared their demo and source code.

----
[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) posted about [flumeview-reduce](%jD+Zl3O5I5VZVC7WImUaBEw6I/0xiRHHHiKy1+KBBu0=.sha256)

Later on they started exploring their `gossip.json` and [wondered aloud](%gWWQhywlAKge0zqGi3GqRJK3VthKmkMDpz/H869UyNc=.sha256) if there was anything in there that could be used to indicate reliability of a pub.

[@doublec](@rIeM8dvwaK/2d/S7zvxQtPxDhDnjo+4F72kGNUdGFeU=.ed25519) [said hello](%KSxhhn3/bM+u3C7Vp0FrmO7E2Rv9+HQw1zOjmsMoi1o=.sha256)

[@the-dark-lord](@n2/9k0xfb0TalKmq9YUVNcV1zpF+SWsZARAlA3YCljI=.ed25519) [joined us](%iN9NwczI9u2ju+cnpbNHS3m34jwdTRFBe/Qy7tJ0co8=.sha256) which was somewhat disturbing to think about (how many horcruxes did he make?!?!) until they said

![butt_summaries_image.jpg](&cIBYD4wh/L/Ivqb1Zyqc3uwFQJOB6Sgnlv3lITD/urY=.sha256)

# This week in Scuttlebutt
(butt-summaries #19: May 21st-28th part 1)

A sample of life in the Scuttleverse.

There are currently 21 people helping to fund the future of Scuttlebutt through the [SSB consortium](https://opencollective.com/secure-scuttlebutt-consortium)! 

## Totally Random
[@dangerousbeans](@TXKFQehlyoSn8UJAIVP/k2BjFINC591MlBC2e2d24mA=.ed25519) is [splicing dinghys](%8Bc9EC4ubIR7xZ+aKsNDinV65t3y8qdRkaidy/764so=.sha256).

![splicing dinghys](&xPf3G+ev0LlT1D9khKBsGTQ/xjor3mqCxz4xQCXZw0E=.sha256)

and disturbingly, discovering that one of the New Zealand banks is [starting to freeze people's accounts over crytocurrency related transactions](%dCdfNa6/omIWwfqzBnZVV577Nnx73JvW8/3SeRL2BU0=.sha256). 



## SSB Software 
[scat](https://github.com/stripedpajamas/scat#readme) is a command line chat app that runs over SSB. It was created by [squicc](@k9xSaKW2kc+Ko8Vx+xvFmVC5gEi/tIA2TpV6EBQ7MPw=.ed25519) and [announced last week](%TdxPyxdSDjA2lAGYedQ68ZC5aDKBsHquWpiPRucNPA8=.sha256).

----


[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) announced [the release of TickTack v0.4.0](%ZGfik3+hbI0uKkpG0aRijRfHLNy6PwdWuuJ2BnR/Bg4=.sha256) which has a ton of new features from the recent flurry of work with [@SoapDog](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519).

They also showed [an impending implementation of tagging posts](%xNt6a3pZulxgoeJHKZgfpNIurC7OJR2ztnDcvU2Ku2k=.sha256). This is notably different from channels which are what we'd call (hash)tags on any other platform. According to [arj](@6CAxOI3f+LUOVrbAl0IemqiS7ATpQvr9Mdw9LC4+Uv0=.ed25519) 

> Tags can be added/changed after the post and they are subjective as far as I understand. I also believe they can be private.

![tagging posts screenshot](&V5XRMdsh0OROmJfOf7XlU3Ca9Wh34KzLF3tFT5VNdLk=.sha256)

---- 

[@SoapDog](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519) continues to make [progress on the firefox plugin](%jrXqCR+wkpqeCD+VZ7k+yFcx/x/Bqo0eHiaG2Bhr4dc=.sha256) (in addition to making TicktTack better) and now has avatars working.

----

[@raynos](@MXqaSWedNyl3G8WND0RM/+IR3m+rdtL81U+yPA3kiwE=.ed25519) shared a long list of ["Some first impressions of using Patchwork"](%0V13YR5YrsyS2LS8hQEDsyQNd3ifZBfFTJPRDlp60oo=.sha256) which shows where we can improve.


## Hardware
[@Juul](@22YV3HX/BGClXH49ZebkcepqRpj7a9f5s0ddwhDSfxk=.ed25519) posted some info about [The $9 Debian NAS with SATA](%HgpzWbJEyOT+zdSiCILwSa9kImXgt3ZUhVuHu9R07TA=.sha256). 

## Community
[@Alana](@6OxffMLNyxkboLjCqv29WnMPhH8O3qFrcXCR6KrKcPI=.ed25519) started a conversation about [the etiquette of uploading profile pics for other people](%7FSY+a3Pt7LlLiNgIfmJr6yZczPf7c5uhDeRW5/uwj4=.sha256) which covered a lot of interesting ground, including, but not limited potential abuse of the system.


----

[@ktorn](@z8aJVHJTc6MM8FwaNE2GIS3AYYt2HYFNWQUO8/iydNw=.ed25519) posted [Straight White Male: The Lowest Difficulty Setting There Is](%xFklgZDlGQgHoVh3nMWVvE3yBZbVCvCkC25yzUaUaZ0=.sha256) which tries to explore the idea of "...how to get across the ideas bound up in the word ‚Äúprivilege,‚Äù in a way that your average straight white man will get, without freaking out about it..."


----

content.text:
## Geeky
[@Dominic](@EMovhfIrFk4NihAKnRNhrfRaqIhBv1Wj8pTxJNgvCCY=.ed25519) started making [some database performance tweaks](%7o/wsv64JDgEUu12mZ/Oy4hL2p5WvLifYxbeuwWEi5E=.sha256) 

> It makes a reasonable difference (more than 15%) but is a slight regression for others.
> ...currently I'm thinking this difference is probably not worth it.

They also looked into [better binary encoding](%PDWcZEfqdYshC14lmh2YWIjXOMgxziG6mjktPb+Hf6U=.sha256)

----

[@Piet]() had [an interesting conversation](%jAWa0zHGpaKExS3mkR/s3sFNvNZL87QEwM0XrCXts3E=.sha256) with [@dinosaur](@6ilZq3kN0F+dXFHAPjAwMm87JEb/VdB+LC9eIMW3sa0=.ed25519) 

>  what if we were rebuilding Scuttlebutt with already-existing software, what parts would we swap, how would we architect the system? 
> 
> welcome to the thought experiment: what if Scuttlebutt was implemented using boring off-the-shelf industry-standard software?

----

[@cel](@f/6sQ6d2CMxRUhLpspgGIulDxDCwYD7DzFzPNr7u5AU=.ed25519) "[...would like to implement a minimum-viable scuttlebot-compatible SSB pub server in C.](%SQ6BGiW5AZzAxX5cscehOFdaj2Iu1kBu2keJl2ZfWS0=.sha256)"

[Summarizer] For those who are unaware there is also ongoing work on [a Rust version](%y2WlAvRUzXdbCRW0k+tghADVA2y80KF83zRxuE54sGI=.sha256), #go-ssb documents the Go-lang work, and there's at least one more language port that I'm not finding at the moment.


## New People
[Oma Morkie](@l/Ccr7jHUv0lYo2jwq6lh33tRGdQCa4EcY/Q+LSrV4A=.ed25519) [said hello](%qoaY3edCti6BkPSTbCpFPo3qsMCAk7qnsPYFQecJLLI=.sha256)

----

[@benoon](@k2QIQhnePPF2iBmM6hXMbpKXd5Um9kAxtTWT8n4REYA=.ed25519) is "[...a European who decamped to Los Angeles](%ILyJ0C1kdPY0Wtpd4BqQB0tFDQ4jTLJKe7Ex5lBO9P0=.sha256)" California, USA.


----

[@Chris Thompson](@B6rhq8NLp/A0vLMPqsV3jYCjHOQ6UsGrdip39IouAWU=.ed25519) [joined us](%lM2XHkuARbfykLWNoshJSwDgx7NxecF2MQ6ABkNZUBw=.sha256) and is happy to talk to you about 3d printing.

----

[@kode54](@TU6163LaDNyNVN1FG5ECFQ/6tppSGexchR5MFJS52I0=.ed25519) joined us from Riverside California, USA.

----

[@raynos](@MXqaSWedNyl3G8WND0RM/+IR3m+rdtL81U+yPA3kiwE=.ed25519) is a nodejs geek who [stepped away from corporate work](%W9Prn8sF85T5jO1ZwfpbiphypL/MHcAwzG6/e5P/Tfc=.sha256)

----

[@arb](@qqkFMW9Lxib9odzdPNsqWy45vmTyRaOyiQG+yPjbadg=.ed25519) joined us from Berlin, Germany.

> co-director and founder of [Trust](http://trust.support/), a space for platform design and utopian conspiracy in Berlin

![butt_summaries_image.jpg](&cIBYD4wh/L/Ivqb1Zyqc3uwFQJOB6Sgnlv3lITD/urY=.sha256)

# This week in Scuttlebutt
(butt-summaries #21: June 5th-11th part 1)

## Totally Random
[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) shared some beautiful pictures from Japan including this one:

![japanese garden](&kir2bzo5s0VxNpakZ7ytrsBrW/awNz9/941CENgee9w=.sha256)

as well as posts about [about architecture](%+K697XMAJEHLQ2QAL1jdE/e6H79XYTjsmTAlPI7paik=.sha256) and [food](%2hShNshTkhcZ9VwQoz5+FE76Wa8kVhOfmOqwFJ1gC0U=.sha256) from Japan. 

----

----

[@dangerousbeans](@TXKFQehlyoSn8UJAIVP/k2BjFINC591MlBC2e2d24mA=.ed25519) [went sailing](%L6y27rJt52svremBfcD64PUhe8W/TIx1hia7+hlgXOA=.sha256)

----

[@Bob Ross](@+o3zqg/JVx4lbA5p4jK8gGtsdZ49O5yhPlYZOr+8Rek=.ed25519) shared what is either [modern art or an incredibly expensive piece of medical equipment](%9/347Jh5ewExnV8sKBQXd59Rg3fJdGrYFt02weuTFnc=.sha256).

## Community / Humanity

[@alanna](@6OxffMLNyxkboLjCqv29WnMPhH8O3qFrcXCR6KrKcPI=.ed25519) [posted about](%XLfh3hcTYZS7ekKRUz7nst2wlME161O+D5NgKdDGwls=.sha256) an article on how to get your children to do chores without resenting it and the relevance that has to "community gardening".

## Community Geeky Intersection

[@corlock](@sHFNLAao6phQ5AN17ecYNUbszDa4Qf6DhyQsjtQfdmY=.ed25519) is [about to give a talk about Scuttlebutt](%GykaIzxd2c7T5NYVdNJkVaI7f2y14P6YCkzr9+YZuts=.sha256) to "blockchain-y" people and is looking for "Any other ideas / suggestions for what might be useful to communicate to this crowd?"


----

[@Dan Hassan](@NeB4q4Hy9IiMxs5L08oevEhivxW+/aDu/s/0SkNayi0=.ed25519) [suggested](%3mPyqUiLido1O0Cg4FE8r3l4tXnabbVYhSqL6Bpa2qU=.sha256) we "[make] short useful blurbs about yourself to be used by grant writers or writers when writing about or for SSB."

## Geeky
[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) started "a dream thread" [about ssb-unread](%CLkVpiKeWwynYAggne6/f5YYvLsWerGHuI5lTe6qEHo=.sha256).

![butt_summaries_image.jpg](&cIBYD4wh/L/Ivqb1Zyqc3uwFQJOB6Sgnlv3lITD/urY=.sha256)

# This week in Scuttlebutt
(butt-summaries #23: June 11th-18th part 1)

A sample of life in the Scuttleverse.

There are currently 23 people helping to fund the future of Scuttlebutt through the [SSB consortium](https://opencollective.com/secure-scuttlebutt-consortium)! 


[@Josiah](@HjH7assXYIZ5ATQkh1CKtnt6lpVVDY24/NB29okNido=.ed25519) made T-shirts, with profits going to the SSB Consortium /  Open Collective. [Get yours here](https://teespring.com/secure-scuttlebutt-shirts#pid=46&cid=2745&sid=front). You have until June 25 to order yours.


## Totally Random

[@juul](@22YV3HX/BGClXH49ZebkcepqRpj7a9f5s0ddwhDSfxk=.ed25519) [wondered aloud](%lv5JQD0egmawlLBdDTDVYd8VfegLQSaZC3yZ4HGP09M=.sha256) about "Missing generic tech names" like what's the name for "Speech recognition home automation devices (e.g Amazon Echo / Google Home)" ? 

----

[@noffle](@C3iYh/12sO1uvKq1KcZXLFxSySzxOkHxXN8rtNB5MGA=.ed25519) started [experimenting with the edibility of prickly pear cactus pads](%vQXM0tQBWSfTwQ+akcsP2Wq17ATzVXPjuXzDzttGCZg=.sha256) after stumbling across a colony of them.

![prickly pear cactus pads](&0W+opEHced0J+crwOEdRDxp6pkwcFD7t2G8qKgQTC3c=.sha256)

Meanwhile [@Joey Hess](@BCM6DHYJvWzwWi1lFl2tjDXjaqyZAEmJH5ZONSpXhtc=.ed25519) made [mushroom and daylilly tempura

](%pQcEtq7xT6W2fpBCWQLuqlHUvdYShDygX3/5w130Vc8=.sha256) 

![mushroom and day lilly tempura](&IGk4jbt+kSSm+yWnSxp37fur9KFHRodvao/SxyCS+qY=.sha256)

----
[@Angelica](@eANNuLfzX/9rlGODXHYV8WJb+zw2h+d7YsT4vpYPvD0=.ed25519) has procured "...some magical, medicinal plants" for us including, but not limited to these...

![purple flower](&jFgThtS0FENpQbv9XTHPue+ayEe0n8En9FKlvI9IGbw=.sha256) ![dandelion](&uQwhjARUniviDd3VHyoh51jrA906QWiRCw0GevnTs7o=.sha256) ![smudge stick](&koM4l0F0/+Is3lSGomJiZ0759gN8GctvL7AISBY+DWM=.sha256)

----
[@Richard D. Bartlett](@3r4+IyB5NVl2in6QOZHIu9oSrZud+NuVgl2GX3x2WG8=.ed25519) shared [some spring flowers](%/ICDJhXvP5YboH4Ks64K70zMn7FRzGa5zZY4uiFbS/s=.sha256).

![spring flowers triptych](&lYy/eYACpHOwnFNONI8rh2CUD+LiT4PqQV9vRes98Gc=.sha256)


----

[@LanceW](@W87GwaaxNj0PSBbtc5qUm/A/xOO8AWPdNtJn6hzR8s0=.ed25519) [commented](%tcMGmzO4QfBarf4sxmiVjp4wBGy2ou9fWsiTRuyIibc=.sha256): 

> As I sit in a coffee shop in a UK city with no wifi and poor mobile phone coverage, I realise once again that #scuttlebutt is the app that works thoughout. Decentralisation and offline first experiences not just desireable for remote or exotic locales.

## Software
[@squicc](@k9xSaKW2kc+Ko8Vx+xvFmVC5gEi/tIA2TpV6EBQ7MPw=.ed25519) has been working on how private messaging is handled in scat. Discussed in [this thread](%RaGGxLLTUvObHRaBoVUVfpoqjl8MvzbvoqWWpNG4ngE=.sha256).

----

[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) has been working on [improvements to the composer](%nw5mrgDhdXI96yU6XhlC+kmD3btg3Hy1TqNWiAnZMxQ=.sha256) which is used in Ticktack, Patchwork, and Patchfoo.

----

[@kropot](%4J6pFOeW30pWQ/EPxgmeKQdoSJ9rbrFM/Bh5uFKSSmw=.sha256) is [gathering some generic data](%4J6pFOeW30pWQ/EPxgmeKQdoSJ9rbrFM/Bh5uFKSSmw=.sha256) about people's SSB usage.

----

[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) gathered people's thoughts on [a "nightly" build of Patchwork](%vJcqRK1XkagswvhSD8ElwqWHKV2Pr1ACukpgdKFzmYI=.sha256) that included some of the nifty features that haven't been fully vetted.

----

[@SoapDog](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519) has gotten [thread navigation working](%xhLi0OYlJI3J3fkm/gJJddc3oafeeiydRVPyhovEYS4=.sha256) within their Firefox SSB plugin.

[@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) managed to [get cabal running on mobile devices](%Iik3lwTtADOhENnR9eLquc1/JLjT3B8Hx4/3+g6NBDw=.sha256). If you're not familiar, Cabal is decentralized P2P chat, that used to only live [in the terminal](https://github.com/cabal-club/cabal#readme)
 
## Community

[@Alanna](@6OxffMLNyxkboLjCqv29WnMPhH8O3qFrcXCR6KrKcPI=.ed25519) [shared the crowdfunding campaign for a book they're co-authoring](%QTthGlknPTejuIazrI+ngNnk4nNtz6vRqh44X6pWhlM=.sha256) with other Enspiral folks.


> As a global community championing cutting edge collaborative organisational practices and launching companies that have social mission at their core, we have generated a lot of tools, practices, case studies, and shared knowledge along the way.

[@Richard D. Bartlett](@3r4+IyB5NVl2in6QOZHIu9oSrZud+NuVgl2GX3x2WG8=.ed25519) [gave a talk](%dywCyGdPJ2QTHHvWs8J6Ji5YPFy0Ikh91XIO94Lltjo=.sha256) at the Direct Parliament conference "...where I could connect the dots between the large scale and the small [governance]."


----

[@dan hassan]() [asks "... if there is anyone interested](%SWSmjELcJwqpVUHYivMAz8GL3DvBp/w9C0+ezKLby5k=.sha256) in being on the [Steal This Show] podcast to speak about ssb and the ecosystem and what it's about?"

[@Pr√§gnanz](%ZMz3KaUEooal2/7ZOlxRcopiNYkPnoKK4A9d8bL11WY=.sha256) [gave us a very interesting looking pdf](%ZMz3KaUEooal2/7ZOlxRcopiNYkPnoKK4A9d8bL11WY=.sha256) about "Building Consentful Tech".

## Community Geeky Intersection
[@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) [stayed up too late](%jT79a7s3GOxZcxebkRRiDfW3ZMlbFy73E7R4s2r3Lsw=.sha256) 

> ...thinking about these grand ideas I'm having about how to setup a generosity network association to fund open source activities, by leveraging reputation of famous developers that withdraw and/or forward donations in a "web of trust"!

And then [posted more detailed thoughts about it](%6HjW0kVQCmRFJCko5cFcdr4rrQ8vaGViaOdJIb2IdQk=.sha256).

On a related note, discussion is still continuing on their [thread about engineering the social dynamics for massively collaborative open source.](%HPMQEUbULKcJJMEAP/iMnVfuykNZ9llEymArjkuEO/A=.sha256)  (i.e. thoughts on a GitHub alternative)

----

[@Jay](@jnVDjZBAyKSw2kasa/MSU4Ul6CnmQH0LcdXnplkmBbk=.ed25519) "...cut the audio from my talk about #cyberpunk , #solarpunk and Land as platform to my slides " [and linked to them](%EyiUHqch7R1YZJNUb3q3+2ZYRP7JMK6vTgyav3S3r9I=.sha256).

----

[@LanceW](@W87GwaaxNj0PSBbtc5qUm/A/xOO8AWPdNtJn6hzR8s0=.ed25519) [debated an episode of Greater Than Code](%5Q3lDfaHJSNXzOor9W/NwjwdAday69l/tytpiVEdGQw=.sha256) titled "Federation is Bad" which I'm bound to mention because one of the hosts is an old friend, and he's here on SSB (although he really needs to log in more).

----

[@rabble](@vzoU7/XuBB5B0xueC9NHFr9Q76VvPktD9GUkYgN9lAc=.ed25519) [wants your input](%UacNJeUFsAPldnPwtnvrpAbygf7/IxjQCwCeiOaq5MM=.sha256) on a project they're considering building on top of SSB "...that may have a deep & wide-ranging impact on the community & would like to engage with community members to discuss my plans in an open manner before the project gets off the ground."

> At the moment, I‚Äôm exploring the possibility of creating an open source business that builds on & uses the SSB network, similar to how Automattic & WordPress operates within the blogging ecosystem but control neither the underlying standards nor every implementation of blogging software.


----

[@SoapDog](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519) shared their thoughts on [Being a Micro ISV, or, Decentralized Apps as an Alternative to SaaS](%ADn3HGQ7/N5QLv0bTaDIibYUvIfdVt/9/eOkg9bgqd0=.sha256)

----
[@Miikka](@VeuM0SzKG4o0x7Zw/8VxV7R8mn+6yyYMooPNOBfebik=.ed25519) [started a discussion](%OSpSaUzMLfRY11oPe3OKmEQKsXrEaZkFN+0DhQqSDfs=.sha256) around a thread that "...criticizes the current generation of #p2p technologies for not building in strong-enough privacy guarantees" How it applies to SSB, and their disagreements with it.

## Geeky

( missed from last week )
[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) is [interested in locking down some of the packages](%fLDEuIiCDBjljsO8DEF3K/G/DPnCs3BVQ8SC6c8FFYI=.sha256) to help stabilize ssb releases.

> I would love a way to have versions of scuttlebot which have 100% known state. There was an instance some time in the past couple of months where an inadvertent semver mistake led to a cascade of breakages which was hard to debug in scuttlebot.

They're looking for people's thoughts on the matter.

They also shared some info and experimentation about using [pull-merge](%6+DQ05ucqTt+0eQdwSZjtBh4XyeTbOpovwKqPQhnUt0=.sha256) to speed up private message filtering.

----

[@glyph](@HEqy940T6uB+T+d9Jaa58aNfRzLx9eRWqkZljBmnkmk=.ed25519) shared [a talk by Dan Abramov](%4czQXnawm6+xm4ydE+5yIELHJVs54fxkAxXe9iL3ZgA=.sha256) called The Melting Pot of Javascript.

----
[@noffle](@C3iYh/12sO1uvKq1KcZXLFxSySzxOkHxXN8rtNB5MGA=.ed25519) [created ssb-exchange](%xGTjfaLQmshzz+F0odjjGxQA09kyJpmp8g1yNOmSzpk=.sha256)

> Small ssb module that replicates two ssb databases over a duplex stream and synchronizes them both, so they each contain the same feeds & messages.


----

[@nanomonkey](@+D0ku/LReK6kqd3PSrcVCfbLYbDtTmS4Bd21rqhpYNA=.ed25519) [continued the discussion](%i6Khqb1W+SCXAYXavopw49+98q8Ujy4fxknD4RJRZJQ=.sha256) of his Recipes work: 

> I'm not 100% sold on my current implementation of using tasks within recipes. In the past I've always used recipes nested within recipes for production processes that can be batched, or done concurrently, and just referenced them as sub-recipes.


----

[@hoodownr_swift](@cWe8dc7juUTJUOq7wRJgscxnbII+Rm7/CUc5Ilx2PKU=.ed25519) continues to make [progress on backpressure](%hg4ZGGhy0POcu/B7RGaq4WPQDyvtXngZ0HJg7xQy0/Q=.sha256), more [here](%zGAdNiPwMVPzPKbetrrgZAZ/om8q7Ji8QdOdTeohVLE=.sha256).

----

content.text:
[@arcfide](@snp/faEAB52u3OuZaOwZ7Dc6+GTDFNuMZb8X/sDe2T8=.ed25519) asked about [the consequences to the network](%vlKAURCDuyMsgoZG3ihWaODM/fbtSr3O3LcADO1Yyec=.sha256) of uploading large git repos to git-ssb.

----
Naming things is important, and hard, and [@ktorn](@z8aJVHJTc6MM8FwaNE2GIS3AYYt2HYFNWQUO8/iydNw=.ed25519) [needs/needed a word](%QmETJymy6f8VJjJRdYWuNWldJFM441CdqsMF6hf9dYE=.sha256): 

> I need a word to describe data that is guaranteed to be encrypted when observed outside of a specific system (due to careful system design, such that the decryption private key never leaves the system, like a trusted-platform module). I need something other than encrypted data because it conveys no such meaning about the private key or the nature of its holder.

----

The thread discussing the [p2p github call](%XTdZUII7d9u/Y5+bG/v2LVjSDMjSKDKvz4D5r/eyyqw=.sha256) "...to discuss what a Social git implementation could look like." continued to have interesting responses.

----

[@sentamalin](@ONFJa2sEtv9lHgH9LhwnfAr+JX9nUK0JuIzjnCVFRH0=.ed25519) shared some thoughts about [Decentralized Identity Proofs using PGP](%308Z0ulS4FNMmo2Q2+3eTw+K/Gjr+jXAYKNyaLFq94w=.sha256).

----

[@Dominic](@EMovhfIrFk4NihAKnRNhrfRaqIhBv1Wj8pTxJNgvCCY=.ed25519) [did some experiments to test the proposed in-place format](%IOlJCmXf4AjUDv/8Cekha9ywTbFqVby0T4gpuKQBeBg=.sha256). Short version: faster. Details and graph in thread.

----

[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519)s says "[I'd love help gathering hard queries](%P0bz0R/GyHHBHvPAYHExpyff4Tu/NRv/wPqfbLjVHeA=.sha256) you might like to do." (against your ssb data).

> Here's the ones on the top of my mind, would be happy to have additions:

1.Gatherings I'm attending
2.Gatherings/ Polls that are coming up in the future (and have had their time edited)
3.Threads I've been a part of
4.Threads my friends have been a part of which I have not
5.Private thread involving a friend, but which they have not yet posted to

What can you add?

## New People

[@jamie_k](@EmToQOnFQAtOL3lsC3M4kaOBil3DKjXKowf0nCkwNF8=.ed25519) from the STEAL THIS SHOW PODCAST [joined us](%u0dgNHUQd/fEjfBWLgzwUsoMo0GkiNHL420CSmhNxR0=.sha256). They've recently "launched... a platform for funding digital creators via tokenized assets" 

----

[@An(arch)druid Wraidd](%iPtGr/dm7B594+6lTVSNS154nzxbwvZp3xCo/p16mQk=.sha256) [said hello](%iPtGr/dm7B594+6lTVSNS154nzxbwvZp3xCo/p16mQk=.sha256), but was a little unsure what else to say.

----

[@Ladislas](%EwgTCsv5FAOwnXIfyGyjnZu1lhtPRVJSh1g5imHWEGg=.sha256) joined us a our latest French speaker, who provided us with a nice long post to new-people that my high-school French is completely mangling. Maybe [you can appreciate it better than I](%EwgTCsv5FAOwnXIfyGyjnZu1lhtPRVJSh1g5imHWEGg=.sha256).

![butt_summaries_image.jpg](&cIBYD4wh/L/Ivqb1Zyqc3uwFQJOB6Sgnlv3lITD/urY=.sha256)

# This week in Scuttlebutt
(butt-summaries #24: June 19th-26th part 1)

A sample of life in the Scuttleverse.

There are currently 25 people helping to fund the future of Scuttlebutt through the [SSB consortium](https://opencollective.com/secure-scuttlebutt-consortium)! 

## Totally Random

[@adamsky](&j/h65YABJ2EMI48nfkN0hSa+QfTYdIJ4ZaQ/UBf+mUE=.sha256)'s [cat awaits transport](%/DEQT9BB9yg7iOzzvnxgC/YWZAkN2op5O9qdm7BfCJQ=.sha256).

![cat backpack](&j/h65YABJ2EMI48nfkN0hSa+QfTYdIJ4ZaQ/UBf+mUE=.sha256)

----

[@skysurfer](@dfCIY3rP5idQFdjuOHrBJqrv6EgsSiNyn1NKz87UTJw=.ed25519) [flew a glider in the rain](%zfaPlEc4GkJYiLFO3XnqlbVgBAp8r4G/I3t6J2zOySQ=.sha256), and shared why that's so notable.

![glider and helicopters](&fzeL28wUPhgoFB4GTHmAgR/QmgVxS9F5EDhfSo+0svs=.sha256)

----

[@sentamalin](@ONFJa2sEtv9lHgH9LhwnfAr+JX9nUK0JuIzjnCVFRH0=.ed25519) reminded us that [crazy long layovers aren't always a bad thing](%yIfcF+3lW9sdZd2QXeY5MbvGEbuZusUtyrLtYnM5oFE=.sha256).

![colorado springs](&VUkUJHakgyoTHExeBw/EKaSeXX9I43YU/MKRR8n9LB8=.sha256) 

That image, some city, and links to more in their post.

----

[@Kieran](@MpDd66GPXgN1+eMNrZInHkWq1THMurWwLdMx8BZ1ncw=.ed25519) [discovered the "Radical Underground Podcast"](%IjEEvPwG3THnSvHujgubQ6QYXkkw5zI9GrcUSXDPI3k=.sha256) which, in their tenth episode, is discussing "stolen generations of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander children" and other aboriginal struggles in Australia, along with an interesting looking soundtrack. 

----

[@dangerousbeans](@TXKFQehlyoSn8UJAIVP/k2BjFINC591MlBC2e2d24mA=.ed25519) is [working on a plastic eating machine](%og+3eQUcneF4wRC8nh00kZOtSxSKXQ4SiTozMPXtnIA=.sha256). 

![plastic eating machine](&15v3ylBdDLL8YBL1ef982549zF6tSwarZVBj2XISPlg=.sha256) 

----

[@Zach!](@ZqH7Mctu/7DNInxuwl12ECjfrAKUX2tBLq1rOldNhg0=.ed25519) has been [working on some "dat zines"](%az1XnZf93QxDuHK2BdRj//atApmogYrOF64ghFsoPBQ=.sha256)  

> Hey hey hey! I wanted to show examples of dat zines. They could be any ol' website, but I wanted to make examples of special websites where editing and remixing them was real easy. So, here they are for you!


----

An on-demand poet made [@dan hassan](@NeB4q4Hy9IiMxs5L08oevEhivxW+/aDu/s/0SkNayi0=.ed25519) [a poem about bitcoin/money](%WapvjoFMJYHoJV84k+iSdVDq4vqShw2KrzKr3QX4OKk=.sha256).

## Software

[@Josia](@HjH7assXYIZ5ATQkh1CKtnt6lpVVDY24/NB29okNido=.ed25519) provided some info about the ongoing [beta testing of new tags functionality](%80bWvl/olZV6V/3Ic7Ckeux2ycu+vnVW4iu/LbCQODs=.sha256)

----

[@squicc](@k9xSaKW2kc+Ko8Vx+xvFmVC5gEi/tIA2TpV6EBQ7MPw=.ed25519) has [updated scat to v1.5.0](%c70YKs0peoUiGJbKlbMhTOJgazexubaJN2FGhO7xNJ0=.sha256) and shared the changelog and current todo.

and [@ev](@8Qee0I/DwI5DHSCi3p5fsl6FyLGArrnDz3ox9qZr5Qc=.ed25519) "[implemented [read only] scat messages in mvd](%CEy8u4dWo/NqaK5rh+C5lJwMNYrQlgZoymg1XxmhE6g=.sha256)"

----

[@dinosaur](@6ilZq3kN0F+dXFHAPjAwMm87JEb/VdB+LC9eIMW3sa0=.ed25519) reminded folks that "every message on your feed, including private messages, are on-the-record." and [went on to explain what that means](%G7BjZsZr02TPAoIeD+w3WgiAbi6Wjh78Fp2jB9JOIjg=.sha256).

----

content.text:
[@ntoll](@EKD0r8MjseRPTmNk2ehZLUNdhljALJeIiJOOTOjnkjc=.ed25519) has been working on [a "...goofy #python editor for beginner programmers" called Mu](%egCA46biSx1Fi1eHDxkDrON6esZYwBhciCQyiIk2qpQ=.sha256) and has gotten another beta out the door with an installer for Windows and macOS.

![mu editor](&aAeNTCszW0vhcV4DCpceuHZZar7DpkvyFCiMAJbx5rM=.sha256)

----

[@dan hassan](@NeB4q4Hy9IiMxs5L08oevEhivxW+/aDu/s/0SkNayi0=.ed25519) is "[Seeking stories, fairy tales and parables with the "True Name" Pattern in them.](%QRi3qJ3xbLW4J/dbbf1A/a0ZN5kaGDUxHdz43xjCtvc=.sha256)"

----

[@noffle](@C3iYh/12sO1uvKq1KcZXLFxSySzxOkHxXN8rtNB5MGA=.ed25519) shared [a "Plant Photobomb"](%ZaZXPZZH09WWR91Q5Q+EvjmAyQk5vB4tqucAyhKPn4M=.sha256) including this and many other lovely shots

![leaf](&2LYGxWQ4pTXkIgxnqLxgyw+OmfC+JqF/vL1nBuQXOvA=.sha256)

----

[@curious-ideation](@fYwH+9NLddq0+LQGR0XAXQoucU1WHJ5J0tahF+rIARU=.ed25519) [has become a homeowner](%KkkAQhsNfDr2RZP2WrPAtbRJk2dzgsvaYHK1QLQRasc=.sha256) and shared some dogs on a deck.

![dogs on a deck](&vx5eY5Eya9ni4GSVWFftvcZDh8rFko4TUHL+i3nq6/8=.sha256)

## Humanity

[@dinosaur](@6ilZq3kN0F+dXFHAPjAwMm87JEb/VdB+LC9eIMW3sa0=.ed25519) shared the idea that many of us may actually be  "[temporarily embarrassed millionaires](%zRZBrxzRPFxDH92Fce7RiSbQXjT0BjGB24ZhQmhMAIk=.sha256)"

----

[@Tim Schumacher](@o3eDT3n9urv1cyIWDuF+wQHBFj3I8OcE3L4Tla9RR8A=.ed25519) [found a grant](%A3iSbi1nW/d1EGREoeuqqhN0ZZciKX/fJUV57rPFQwg=.sha256) which may be useful to geeks in Germany, and that led to a discussion about  

> the [tale:net](https://t4l3.net/) project, which uses ssb to create the skilliverse, where users can create skills and ideas, assign skills to themselves and explore existing idea that match their skillset

----

[@Sam Gwilym](@PEqxT8YRvrkf2fyjAgTl8pmdo8aR4KVsKLyh0b5JyOE=.ed25519) is sharing thoughts from their experiment in blocking themselves from certain websites in [an attempt to reclaim some brain cycles](%ZwP55Yzs0DHoCws3/RBD4ZFZA/YXbYXrUp5Dtpf/Y7s=.sha256).

Meanwhile [C-Keen](@tK2qpPZrF9aRhmnYHOYrYe6uJoY0QqFwWBvPwRHoNNE=.ed25519) is [exploring similar ideas](%QUK4PiTi50XZq7ALrYiEkkzJJPSLBPQ0h8VGfht8Wr8=.sha256):

> I have downsized my exposure to real time information feeds a lot lately.
This includes email, chat, web browsing and social media. I have cought myself with a behaviour pattern, that I have been describing as refresh addiction. Always checking if there is something new, always watching for news.


----

[@gmarcos87](@RmClT86x/o66QdW1dqAfj5Jek4qxUf8rtmvAlhZeZFg=.ed25519) [shared a video about Chamas / Saving Circles](%1gx527LBea0qNyeOdAKHqek8gphbCSFg1HQSKJc8HYY=.sha256) and a note about Champesa (an app trying to bring useful technology to them).

----

[@kropot](@6k1Axt4VxlFOffrbw8ATSn4kfZSQSUTmMbpLBgK54hc=.ed25519) is falling in love with the internet again thanks to decentralized systems and what they're bringing to the table. [They share their thoughts on the topic here](%ha/4R4WrqRQpqBZUPG1j/3EX/tQCQj9cVRCYN8c+wwo=.sha256).


----

[@Angelica](@eANNuLfzX/9rlGODXHYV8WJb+zw2h+d7YsT4vpYPvD0=.ed25519) [made a dat-zine](%gJHINH/OcAwdMWMq7BOYiynUuDrsMMUp60aFB/K5WWI=.sha256) " that guides you through a five-minute computer break"

## Solarpunk
[@ladislas](@SmLddSPxpYkJ/8HH8qDycMEwus+tyojjH+a60beRMdg=.ed25519) shared the progress on building [their geodesic dome in France](%2mjwW9hk9sTLBlJ2X0JdJbowPfS9tKCWdsBoflZtVrs=.sha256).


----

content.text:
## Community

[@rabble](@vzoU7/XuBB5B0xueC9NHFr9Q76VvPktD9GUkYgN9lAc=.ed25519) was "[Talking about the 'verse Company Structure.](%1PaVOVxN3mG3Q2UCD/4BG84YQhiCptbxjnjI4gtCgWs=.sha256)" noting a number of different ways it could be put together.

## Community Software Intersection

[@zelf](@3ZeNUiYQZisGC6PLf3R+u2s5avtxLsXC66xuK41e6Zk=.ed25519) shared some [thoughts from a discussion](%hPIxN3Mf0HbMGfL7QZSKpB5QYm+Dss47EuXYhkT/880=.sha256) about "...potential limits for SSB from becoming mainstream."

----
[@makeworld](@N4qddLUBJq38hNdKrQnZKA+EvYEkT5ShDXIua+YgwNY=.ed25519) thought aloud about "[Preventing Scuttlebutt from being blocked](%ma9r977WRLAiI0Z/RhxQ6KSP+bpp++x4eWffb9nGj3M=.sha256)...Especially in places like China, scuttlebutt might be seen as a place they can't control, and so must block. "

## Geeky

[@doublec](@rIeM8dvwaK/2d/S7zvxQtPxDhDnjo+4F72kGNUdGFeU=.ed25519) [shared some tinkering with the "self" programming language and environment](%CPYuykCczUr/Tva5nFjJ+ZSAGESOnRNVuC2O5V9Cc8w=.sha256).

----

[@jeswin](@d2vneic0a0Y7OoRYvhXf+nCOBIV/lFQXHmOcHNr/3/I=.ed25519)
posted [a roundup of the SSB client stuff](%8+V5EzocB+eANABdRy9LpbZL1JoUYbF8UIm9ZLnwRi4=.sha256) that's been/being written in things other than nodeJS. So far we've got Go, Rust, Python, and C. 

Editor's note: There's also ongoing work in Haskell and Swift, although that may not be usable yet.

-----

[@mijkl](@70mCOxEUBDup8sP1ec7XjCQqJmN6/XQDVf7wRKyjEvQ=.ed25519) posted [an update about the SSB client in go](%5/ZVOk+l51aNp3X9m5R1RqNWRvec4yV/uMwzpaNgX/M=.sha256) they're working on.


----

[@Kieran](@MpDd66GPXgN1+eMNrZInHkWq1THMurWwLdMx8BZ1ncw=.ed25519) met with some ssb geeks. 

> All leveling up coding with scuttlebutt. [Here's our minutes](%Ap8SE2nDI5D309wZCToD+j2maXHmvyL9Exs+KhXlR5Q=.sha256), which is a big bunch of resources on ssb-query, ssb-backlinks and mutant

----

[@Melvin Zhang](@Ew+ujQnMxDVZUYvDg7QYeAwf9K6gxbiMSnBhGS8A2xI=.ed25519) [shared the slides](%mpzKkCbZFuuAUXTMhXvjh4kFt+xakabRXcY43zSzhTk=.sha256) from "...an Intelligent Agent workshop at LccL Coding Academy"

----

[@micro](@wsoeSOhEE3yAIEF1gTVMeStUWnoejIz1P6a3lnvjaOM=.ed25519) shared some thoughts about "[Improving routerless scuttlebutt](%U/9PsCfifqy8MFO/4LSLsXfDuHHtjJS8ha2N2L/wuZs=.sha256)... The goal is to improve the state of zero-configuration networks for scuttlebot"

----

[@jake](@o91tsjBgL0l0zs475aRWYSAXFxvirZS7VrXmirY/msI=.ed25519) made [a nifty drag and drop image conversion to blob](%sHgPrPKN1U1Chi87mGrMCkwx0yFSffCZV2CIoaHHHe8=.sha256) in a JavaScript markdown context ....thing.


## New People

[@Leedscath](@9QDGM+Z8qTJ09VdxFbulPBv0RrsVebZdSyXt/P+rpKo=.ed25519) joined us from the UK, although they're currently touring the US & Canada. 

> meeting coops and solidarity economy projects, especially those with social/ecological just goals or trying to create some kind of more anarchistic world.

They're also looking to hitch a ride on a boat back to Europe in October or November.

All that and more in [their hello post](%hlgAhWVlUiYIM/JKvgA7tGL2QRajRvBQEH32CH0aO9k=.sha256).

----

[@Jack] is a student who (@8VYNBjNNE4zDNOXgrf42tV5uIRuTyYBogZ46aOGbTOs=.ed25519) [joined us](%wPWYiwlZt7X5rRBaovzRHt+aA6DYWV5rvrd3xQC41TU=.sha256) from Hertfordshire, UK.

----

[@Ivan](@+wcvfr7aVP0j1l9eAjkGhwDoxK9Sob0ThsNod62ORSM=.ed25519) joined us from Montreal Canada, speaks English and Catal√† (and [said hello in both](%XHL/Jh0QWtiZvSniPcWuqLmzb5j1swe661cG8/QdDms=.sha256)). They're a free software enthusiast and a Linux network admin. 

----

[@buckket](@1oYSp9SZnT5WCNXRDvIqXHHQFKSfu8ip6cUs8s5ZOss=.ed25519) is [a physics student who joined us from Germany](%9KFlOJJGwxVUyGypK95MshcSkz3DTP5l1GB/3vzeohY=.sha256). They like "building custom PCBs to experiment and interact with the hardware around me" and other interesting things.

[@Aran](@WeZBYERzjvfOVlgU7vMz7RSheqe4WaGEd87ewbMvnvQ=.ed25519) said [Hi from Brazil](%HBavTsHhuP3wWQuaDLTgWBIMC2Y++Pv5xAs0aSZPJdA=.sha256) by way of New Zealand. There's more art in [a followup post](%ZPemOurob+HZbjEUYndFFX4stIBLGj0z85e0kDwZjP8=.sha256)

These summaries are brought to you by [@masukomi](@LzTjF5eAVC6xprPMGeNzqEP/EEBIGpM6hDaaY10hrz8=.ed25519) who would love to hear your suggestions about how to make them better, or ideas on things to include.

# This week in Scuttlebutt
(butt-summaries #25: June 25th-July 2nd part 1)

A sample of life in the Scuttleverse.

There are currently 26 people helping to fund the future of Scuttlebutt through the [SSB consortium](https://opencollective.com/secure-scuttlebutt-consortium)! 

## Totally Random

[@dan hassan](@NeB4q4Hy9IiMxs5L08oevEhivxW+/aDu/s/0SkNayi0=.ed25519) shared this beautiful moment.

![dan and child, clouds](&Aa58eEB72Q4EBAtrI098oWeLhMaWoWxbm/GVp8P+ats=.sha256)

----

[@mix](&TgQW/tSewHY+cdaTtZjZhfdbVbJMSAMzxuy4hb8uHTk=.sha256) and friends [found escapees from a bad sci-fi movie](%mSL+slkJtSarOiHVtMwTNifZAMhCRNlpncZUr/cs/7I=.sha256)

![neon green mushrooms](&TgQW/tSewHY+cdaTtZjZhfdbVbJMSAMzxuy4hb8uHTk=.sha256)

[@Sam Gwilym](@PEqxT8YRvrkf2fyjAgTl8pmdo8aR4KVsKLyh0b5JyOE=.ed25519) shared [some hadmade screen printed cards](%Oj4ApH7IzNiO/JjZhr5uDD1Mv4ce5uWulvvH4Mu+MaU=.sha256) they're working on, as well as thought sabout the process.

![screen printed baby card](&FYKy/AcDBrKRB1lVs/2euk5tWsNo1U3M5X6VA1vTL5s=.sha256)

That and more [in their post](%uCRVqW0NxJIcfvsBhuAQginEc8lfAu9A2Jyh7M0F13A=.sha256).

## Software

[@squicc](@k9xSaKW2kc+Ko8Vx+xvFmVC5gEi/tIA2TpV6EBQ7MPw=.ed25519)  has been working on scat and, with help from others it now has [tab completion, emoji magic](%s46q3xX1RQbERLw44Nyfw1hCT6L6398L14lN4bGi00Y=.sha256), [`/me`](%zxGS/diaK0QQVEZHQdFJkvJCLZ3fX5vTTUnjpVF2a54=.sha256) and `/say` actions.

content.text:
## Software Community Intersection
[@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) [released `ssb-to-graphml`](%exTkaDhz4lhTWXmPV5Ln6/KZ7edLY/OE8A01a6XF2ns=.sha256) which generates an xml file you can load into Graph visualization tools and create pretty, and interactive images of the scuttleverse as your client sees it.

![network visualization](&nRlnhzSRPlb4VxZa5TZXn+0+C9OP7YqUTuvmf/0JFoo=.sha256)

A few of us tried it and each came up with ~7,500 identities we can see. [@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) then built on it and "...messed around with filtering users, excluding people with less that 50 messages to their name, which left only 1032 users."

More visualizations and discussions were had. If nothing else you should scroll through [the whole thread](%exTkaDhz4lhTWXmPV5Ln6/KZ7edLY/OE8A01a6XF2ns=.sha256) and check out the pretty visualizations.

----

[@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) talks about "alternatives for global usernames" 

> In [this thread](%OqEpbdj05L7+QRsMfs+GD2XiHMikZt8rt0gZGkkterc=.sha256) I try to list some alternatives to achieve Twitter-like usernames

----

[@gb](@ya/sq19NPxRza5xtoqi9BilwLZ7HgQjG3QpcTRnGgWs=.ed25519) is [experimenting with the idea of "rapport"](%HTEBgnuPkP920Q6MryMUSofrBV2SNRLvWyCYM3HgYRc=.sha256). 

> What if at a glance you could see the connections you have with the person who just put up a listing? 


----

[@arcfide](@snp/faEAB52u3OuZaOwZ7Dc6+GTDFNuMZb8X/sDe2T8=.ed25519) wrote a long post about "[Long Term Security of Private Communication](%xi5KZV896tT4fpsjliwMXsppEzBLlsE2Wt7qe9/yFhQ=.sha256)" and some of the implications on SSB. [@arj](@6CAxOI3f+LUOVrbAl0IemqiS7ATpQvr9Mdw9LC4+Uv0=.ed25519) pointed to [a similar existing thread](%svAlk4no63+ByONimJA4l+4VVjxya89kwskP11TMvmY=.sha256).

----

[@keks](@YXkE3TikkY4GFMX3lzXUllRkNTbj5E+604AkaO1xbz8=.ed25519) and others are thinking about [ssb-related cryptocurrency vs. radical dogfooding](%1yfraUoetmhtRnq8WPq2peCuEq7u0C+YMWDSRSxVTZc=.sha256)

----

[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) shared patchbay some work on "...[a slightly different layout](%sDma/kisxseFJDVaDq+yCTGKwjbc8d/yAArxIhQI9R0=.sha256)... to fill some gaps needed to make Patchbay a viable alternative for people who enjoy Patchwork generally"

----

[@dan hassan](@NeB4q4Hy9IiMxs5L08oevEhivxW+/aDu/s/0SkNayi0=.ed25519) "...would like to invite people listed in [the index of lost ssb identities] to [share the stories](%rQHCLz1OEwpGE/eNDY9X1gWbyfyvNFpUFW21U0SzYn0=.sha256) of how their .ssb/secret came to be lost."

----

[@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) gave [a presentation at TEDx Geneva about building our own internet](%VOvOcWUR+4zyj0Ba1UxXaPc8cprKkK/3MLEjCaljAmA=.sha256).


## Community

content.text:
----

[@dan hassan](@NeB4q4Hy9IiMxs5L08oevEhivxW+/aDu/s/0SkNayi0=.ed25519) shared a study that, sadly, concludes that [trans people are very unlikely to ever get a date](%TWL0CpURD9MPlz4t1jsfriHpgc1yuCKc40e0Pj/B904=.sha256). 

They also shared [a post about "Nanette"](@NeB4q4Hy9IiMxs5L08oevEhivxW+/aDu/s/0SkNayi0=.ed25519) a Netflix comedy special by a woman existing somewhere on the trans spectrum. 

To quote [@Ktorn](@z8aJVHJTc6MM8FwaNE2GIS3AYYt2HYFNWQUO8/iydNw=.ed25519)

> How can anyone watch the whole show in one sitting? Had to stop half-way. I can't switch back and forth between two types of tears so fast. Fuck.


----

[@peg](@vEJe4hdnbHJl549200IytOeA3THbnP0oM+JQtS1u+8o=.ed25519) wrote up their "[Personal reflections on the Network Convergence in Catalonia](%wrILo3tuX0Kcs0i0+8j2DJ/V532yg5hhTykH3ylSJ8s=.sha256)" 

> For me the gathering had a very special significance of making first physical contact with a network of networks i feel like im becoming slowly closer to. 

[@kieran](@MpDd66GPXgN1+eMNrZInHkWq1THMurWwLdMx8BZ1ncw=.ed25519) wrote similar thoughts about ]the one in Mieres](%jnvLPoTE2MxdjporQnipUhrqrULM+5jqNmLV/DX4OsQ=.sha256)

----

[@Zach!](@ZqH7Mctu/7DNInxuwl12ECjfrAKUX2tBLq1rOldNhg0=.ed25519) said 

> Hello, my friends! I would like to open [a thread about the act of sharing](%D7tywhBBZvlW7tDo+7c8t/D4mtwWkG/61IS368AdI/Y=.sha256), and the personal feelings that come from it.

----

[@dan hassan](@NeB4q4Hy9IiMxs5L08oevEhivxW+/aDu/s/0SkNayi0=.ed25519) is making [a twitter list of Scuttlebutt folks](https://twitter.com/dan_mi_sun/lists/scuttlebutt-cypher-peers). If you want to be added to, or removed from, the list just drop a note in [the thread here](%g7Kgeu4KuAPb87giGHbM/dqSojYOmyordYUAuFVWDjc=.sha256).

 

## Geeky
[@Dominic](@EMovhfIrFk4NihAKnRNhrfRaqIhBv1Wj8pTxJNgvCCY=.ed25519) shared the results of their [benchmarking flumelog-offset](%Gs2NhjWxbNQrsOu1AtL4w8x7BudcvbE5CY8Uc+14DA4=.sha256) "(the module that manages the main storage of messages in ssb has significant problems)" There are multiple pretty graphs for your consideration.

----

[@bentflower](@l+0CONWqxChPs9swKv+tb2ahh80CZqN+1p46KncJnbc=.ed25519)  shared "[A look at how MMMMM spends its time](%dt/WYnVRg+RvIDafYLzuV6wrn/SsqlGp2RVNKl+xFkk=.sha256)" which includes, but is not limited to thought about this:

![mmmmm loading graph](&H7x0JiRgGZNPGHk12gHFrDJfPCWXxPDe6+Yg8YbqMBo=.sha256)

## New People

[@cryptogoth](@qztPFKpm6kfBD1IZVf1cbJ+W4Yy2KqiJ1SWaekLifeA=.ed255190)  is "...working on an intentional living community... for hackers, startup founders, and creatives in NYC" and invites folks looking for "community-minded housemates" to [check them out](%+8OmCFNGARukx+9Z8N+laPl++/kGIuyyx+AYtKvorj4=.sha256).

----

[@joshua](%oG2dg0Zlc0JB7RN2B+zp0kli8Q/322J6NLDs9MO2MZE=.sha256) is a geek who [loves being ouside and building tools to help journalists](%oG2dg0Zlc0JB7RN2B+zp0kli8Q/322J6NLDs9MO2MZE=.sha256). 

----

[@notwist](@LPWCN0NQx3JCwg/bcnK0AtwvZZRESUbHVMfU7u4ZnlA=.ed25519) is "...a nomad who likes to think she's free from nationality", designs games, [and does other interesting things](%zr4z+9LE1xKUVAPQ+8N5E0qZFFJV0HWWrvWO1TCE7d0=.sha256).


----

[@Alberto](@+ISTRPn8o7Sx667rj1EPtQ9ZPiGLLZMGI7qcJjBoA+8=.ed25519) joined us and [is curous to know more about Solarpunk](%hwSx/fKKAxINDOhlGlMa2jcx4UwZCvkAj7Z+xoCNFRI=.sha256).

[@Lisa Gill](@VVTXic56i8Veis5nmmXFJOyhveJI2q+gRCBPkw/ujeg=.ed25519) is into "...self-management and decentralised organisations, specifically cultivating the human skills we need to work effectively in this way...", helps other people with those ideas, and is "...also a big movies and TV series nerd."

[@Lucas](@QTIAJ1macmjKZH+I2DoDM5mD+R0DTqLn5gORzo8aWes=.ed25519) joined us from S√£o Paulo Brazil. They enjoy this world cup but not football/soccer, study physics, [and more](%mnUP4LuSMVCOQP/48hk9/D6wg8Qe45z1yaS6PH5YZpA=.sha256)...

[@Salvo](@4ia1z/x8FyysnV+hBNdYx1XpSkEdjLkE4QvxPFa8Lqs=.ed25519) joined us via "some programming subreddit". They hail from London, by way of Italy, and are [trying to find a way out of the rat race](%QGkpRWoFqk8T34B5VuaLJKox5QN+v8G4eJjXRA8Jc2M=.sha256).

# This week in Scuttlebutt
July 2nd - 10th part 1

A sample of life in the Scuttleverse.

There are currently 26 people helping to fund the future of Scuttlebutt through the [SSB consortium](https://opencollective.com/secure-scuttlebutt-consortium)! 

## Totally Random

[@Roelofpieter](@2cIkwrM43lbBYRBxTdtQgvb22HSdLSpVotsYkWmbFGs=.ed25519) [shared](%+HeTaX3QhRMQ9caHnv3A9a3mi/ArNNap+xv0K/F54bk=.sha256)

![a stack of boxes/building blocks](&fQdQESosK7b8QPsLJsBUVdEwJ1C1ssMuvpUEWlXycZg=.sha256)


----

[@reconbot](@aFLy2SG1AbOJKCHuIDbKPT1Cw6dYllH6NMd9GCXB7Fc=.ed25519) shared an entertaining little story for geeks: [We lived in memory](%OxKNwLJPulTvhy+fQLZDt92lBR9zw0hLVrAZkUkxge8=.sha256).

----

[@dangerousbeans](@TXKFQehlyoSn8UJAIVP/k2BjFINC591MlBC2e2d24mA=.ed25519) has been Etching protective runes onto their tiller

![etching protective runes](&2ixXi1TB0VIpJXweSFFYaKVqn4L5+TlbD+fqilK6hSM=.sha256)

----

[@Richard D. Bartlett](@3r4+IyB5NVl2in6QOZHIu9oSrZud+NuVgl2GX3x2WG8=.ed25519) shared some photos from [a recent road trip in central France](%V9FoX4jrqAFtpQPpsdllloa5dJYja4iFpleVQm3mseI=.sha256).

![french road trip](&iTYpFbrAGyXlxpmp9D6hun2HLoV/iOg8Z3Ki43Jwa64=.sha256)

## Solarpunk

> I'm in the process of [building a deployable, open-source recycling center](%nEi8yHZ/PoIXFFMr4+DfrzJVfo+AIRvly/IXG+oeYAs=.sha256) that is powered by the trash that it consumes, using the heat and power energy derived from breaking down biomass wastes in order to shred, melt, and recycle plastics and re-cast metals back into useful things. More info on that here. - [@Sam Smith](@w87xXIicF6SVqG0VIBqbKfHJ/QuXdBOBhtMUweZxE4k=.ed25519) 



## Software
[Patchwork 3.10.0 has been released](%GTc3ppAxhAIJ3dPOZU1xLFeoEQcVmutT4jXfT8w7IaU=.sha256) thanks to the hard work of many of our lovely contributors.

Lots of new features that you should definitely check out even if it's not your primary client.

Personally I'm finding it _much_ more responsive and am loving these graphical summaries of follow & profile update notifications. Hover over the little half diamond things to see what each one means. Once you know it's obvious and really useful. 

![new follow and update notification ui](&38g21eyvcCLwDWdpgGGQOpfoWkVWWcAHdv35sLCO1x4=.sha256)


----

[ngx-ssb-client 0.1.5](%DBF19qhYyyOG7I4akIoYQM7RCMXEQtgVNw+32wK+LHc=.sha256) has been released by [@Tim Schumacher](@o3eDT3n9urv1cyIWDuF+wQHBFj3I8OcE3L4Tla9RR8A=.ed25519). 

For those who don't know this is a promising looking new Patchwork competitor that Tim's been working on for a while now. 

## Software Community Intersection

[@Josia](@HjH7assXYIZ5ATQkh1CKtnt6lpVVDY24/NB29okNido=.ed25519) (who was involved with the patchwork tags work) is thinking aloud about [the future of channels](%XN4n4qM1h4Q5ceHQGlieZb4191ZQ42PNOb0pU/HefZY=.sha256).


----

[@SoapDog](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519) posted [An ode to Firefox OS](&emqtrG6W7jc2WktBb/AIqn4o7RJbHzYwG6kJXgt/iLU=.sha256).

## Community

[@dan hassan](@NeB4q4Hy9IiMxs5L08oevEhivxW+/aDu/s/0SkNayi0=.ed25519) said "[AMA: I am cis and my partner is non-binary transmaculine](%/1Dw3a+k3WgPLSgo7ctDVc3nTlS1MACybQt25VefoyM=.sha256)" and many people took them up on the offer.

----

[@SoapDog](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519) shared an idea. I'll quickly summarize, but [there's much more in the post](%HrwgHf7XUGyIEtq+N/SVc0jffvmYQ+UWYwGAygXZ9qw=.sha256).

> I've been thinking about the potential of altnets to fulfill the promise of Bluetooth...So, instead of just self-hosting stuff on a VPS. I want to have small apps gossiping to each other passing stuff that concerns only me around them in a personal scuttlebutting network.


----

[@cameralibre](@UhORGzAhEE3gqy/pH5vK+EgbpZfnyYvdI46TVBJH6Mw=.ed25519) is sharing some nice visualizations of how SSB works. "[Here are a bunch of rough WIP drafts to give you an idea](%4IyfRzX1sdoec/wO9yDuPGq4aUaBlXl9VlhFuk0sisQ=.sha256) - though I don't expect much of this to make sense yet..."


## Geeky

[@SoapDog](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519) [transferred ownership](%l38IKP+o3HnSPeHHApSfXsVDyPRx3epeDuGHBhHqJYA=.sha256) of the scuttle-shell repository to SSBC 

and [@kieran](@MpDd66GPXgN1+eMNrZInHkWq1THMurWwLdMx8BZ1ncw=.ed25519) [brought scuttle-invite, ssb-invites-schema, and ssb-invites-db into the fold](%iGqV6DErVC/di7OIl839eiToAzZL8TUR08qgGWBb0SI=.sha256). 

----

[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) showed us [how to write a query that excludes private messages](%pZV+zP4SDyLpHL/wpydLmGGvuc7oIfH7O3bLDHnXzWY=.sha256). 

----


> I've been working for the past little bit on [a database that uses git as the network layer](%/bofevpO39IXUR+H0g3y5OE2H6ZSJ/Aja/KolwMBI8s=.sha256), the thinking is that we should be able to build applications that allow users to choose who they trust to host their private data.
> 
> The main use case for this database would be apps that aim to help you organize your life a bit, things like password managers, note taking apps, todo apps, etc. -- [@davidrusu](@cOYZH4MTrBpyhs5z4cgwG8slrY00BQM0T3dl7X3XfHI=.ed25519) 

----

[@kemitchell](@TqlPr31FOOCjuupH0L9HCJdLjWYySyibbKscNhgLoCo=.ed25519) is offering up [some License Zero Stickers](%QGjDsa4mmilboVEX7DuvIjxYmmQ+o9VS/3a9kMr2v60=.sha256)

![license zero stickers](&JNGZ7VdKGuYdtjtljbDHSnFGFXR10OnX0KLBZMGhjho=.sha256)

and [some updates on License Zero itself](%mWAPw1JOqV7U/Ug3w/WNOGCj2FfGHGbO4Y0sO13yG7c=.sha256). New licenses, better names. 


----

[@Josiah](@HjH7assXYIZ5ATQkh1CKtnt6lpVVDY24/NB29okNido=.ed25519) [shared](%gZIsmmt1CPK6ihzByKUwHvCA8SXrZ3SGYWIwSn26o4E=.sha256)

"An Introduction to Scuttlebutt Development: Your Test Playground", and "An Introduction to Scuttlebutt Development: Flume & Plugins".

----

[@SoapDog](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519) posted about their work [Simplifying Patchfox](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519) which included some wonderful hand drawn state diagrams. 

----

# This week in Scuttlebutt
July 11th - 17th part 1

A sample of life in the Scuttleverse.

There are currently 26 people helping to fund the future of Scuttlebutt through the [SSB consortium](https://opencollective.com/secure-scuttlebutt-consortium)! 

## Totally Random

[@juul](@22YV3HX/BGClXH49ZebkcepqRpj7a9f5s0ddwhDSfxk=.ed25519) shared [some science](%b/Ayu6tskuyL6b7kRLAom/Hj7ttEIjDS48E2/OcTpnU=.sha256).

![Yann prepping FPLC column](&17xPd1KaMNvlU7hLoiKRFrEuYb23TlriNfaf9lbv6Q4=.sha256)

-----

[@ev](@8Qee0I/DwI5DHSCi3p5fsl6FyLGArrnDz3ox9qZr5Qc=.ed25519) provided a [A brief tour of Rosemont, Illinois, USA](%wmGQNXPlCGP5/Lf90iI8wA+C5OKxLpjJR+6np+BmwkE=.sha256) with this and many more pictures

![rosemont illinois building](&bQRiiuyZr5q4F3KAXPBFNCJeFSx+nzi1lEBPeNQfFa4=.sha256) 

----

[@Joey Hess](@BCM6DHYJvWzwWi1lFl2tjDXjaqyZAEmJH5ZONSpXhtc=.ed25519) wants to know how long your milk lasts. [No, really](%RK+YdyvLl7oasuFnk99aUTTQyH4Gp0LjjTjSDSccnKQ=.sha256).

----

[@realisation](@RHCdibs1o7RnEOxHFq7TfDn2RXHC2yeQh7CyK0tAJyc=.ed25519) went to an Escher exhibit and shared photos of many prints which are not widely known, but still beautiful. 

![escher lute](&6f6H1x74lwXq/m7xz/6TsZQEfKaoPemFIk3P507UcDw=.sha256)


## Software

[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) announced [the release of Tictack 0.4.1 installers](%Zk5Ucybx+csIa2NQvf1XQPXa7CwGBXwIZrmgxbrKq2c=.sha256)

Some bug fixes and small features. The most notable from my perspective is that you can use the WYSWYG editor or a Markdown editor (toggleable in settings). See the announcement for some caveats about that functionality though.

Additionally mix notes that they've taught the latest versions of Patchwork and Patchbay both know how to render the posts created by TickTack. So now they're no longer only viewable by other TickTack users. If you're like me you've probably been seeing them show up in your feed already. 

----

[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) added "Patchbay /posts" to the master branch of Patchbay (for those living on the edge).

> So it's rollups, with some slightly different styling and stats that Patchwork. This is just a  :seedling: release, and if you don't like it feel free to keep sipping from the /public firehose  :fire_engine: !

![patchbay posts](&gNj9ADAiA/JaMrzyEnngwrpbVEzwrh4U1LO8JHp52c0=.sha256) 

## Software Community Interaction 

[@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) has "...[been renaming pubs](%S3A6l++nojWSqD2ifDlKFS6omGGrsfZDFCSkWFi5cEA=.sha256) that i connect with, to name the pub owner, in the spirit of pubs-as-second-device. Pubs I'm sure who it belongs to I've been manually disconnecting from."

## Community

[@Dominic](@EMovhfIrFk4NihAKnRNhrfRaqIhBv1Wj8pTxJNgvCCY=.ed25519) notes that we [are nearing the end of the grant program](%Zr9Hsiadh8PNJM+rNYO1ZVVzhF3HR4mZgS8VvTKqCp0=.sha256) (and maintenance experiment).

content.text:
Editor's note: There's  been a lot of great work that came out of it and helped jump start a bunch of stuff. If you'd like to see this kind of thing continue, please consider supporting the [SSB consortium](https://opencollective.com/secure-scuttlebutt-consortium).


----

[@Richard D. Bartlett](@3r4+IyB5NVl2in6QOZHIu9oSrZud+NuVgl2GX3x2WG8=.ed25519) discusses a "[Masterclass in Decentralised Organising](%z0l5iYyB1D9gRVXfD0dTFgeIXlO5gEuowFWDw77AM5c=.sha256)" and notes that they've  "...got 4 workshops coming up: first in Manchester and London this month, then Munich and Berlin in September."


----

[@Angelica](%J2HoYRu63laImEZKw1eWql/zZvYPBbj8Yz+EKq5/JHo=.sha256) 
[gave us some more small Hermes to play with](%IDpVsd3jjOoSjDkWHskmvx6Ciox+1tua0nmkY7pDfWc=.sha256) 

 ![tiniest hermes](&G3Srp1MvTp2E9pYZpX4jaBX5Jw4HmO3nuhgkxaVCgcU=.sha256) ![small hermes](&NnxwRBPw1rIRL+1QpqWcABVW6WAfw+I5b7yx5Lw1hE8=.sha256) ![dancing small hermes](&MICw//Vc1LOa+UDZdW1gbvLShjfRHULT4Bvp6fHelnc=.sha256)  ![star hermes](&PMzJp/fx9j9Y9/VvkVOSHqgD5agJJZ5XPX2Rm1YRKh4=.sha256)  ![i have no idea cheering maybe hermes](&HocG5q0HXqpmH68W2SIdY+XdraoA9bWLQ7ZxLi3KolY=.sha256) ![tiny loving hermes](&/iR2Wkd0XJT22GOym8MiUig5QBh1tYwTrmqpYyhGUFE=.sha256)

Some of those you've seen before, but felt like they should be included.
 
 ----
 
 [@x](@TrxJthkjwSJf2T01fZSDMpLuQU8x0XsBDnrj1+IN/fs=.ed25519) [shared an interesting project](%/IF1aXeaQFKzRRIBptl0aglMiQFx3zcikY2gF84t1dk=.sha256) that's "...building encrypted software to amplify the efforts of activists, journalists, & nonprofits -- anyone fighting for social change." It's called [Pursuance Project](https://pursuanceproject.org/) and they're in the middle of a Kickstater that's already funded, and working on stretch goals now.

----

[@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) shared the idea of "[automatic revolution scheduling](%iVHYM89w6UbB8Lc+sf6tXe+IMSsVRXSoAjRs2oxvRNU=.sha256)... a way how people could secretly committing to take collective action. "


## Geeky

> [Want to learn how to do queries in scuttlebutt?](%l6/G4JRewa3tRr6jByaJfx2upleFLj5hBp9mQPe/Zcc=.sha256) There are a few places to start, but ssb-query is probably the best. > [Creating ssb-wiki](%BYtLfkoF2tGqm1azUZYhtnI2lZrAevdWF5qKBUAI1Ec=.sha256) was a stretch goal for my #ssb-grant. However, I decided to take a stab at making it a reality today by implementing a new post type, wiki. I also implemented the render, and associated buttons. So, it turns out ssb-wiki is ready to go.  - [@ev](@8Qee0I/DwI5DHSCi3p5fsl6FyLGArrnDz3ox9qZr5Qc=.ed25519)

(a followup to their work on mutable messages)

## Software Community Intersection
[@Tim Schumacher](@o3eDT3n9urv1cyIWDuF+wQHBFj3I8OcE3L4Tla9RR8A=.ed25519) is [looking for you help naming](%aBqsa9h7uSfKdz4hUnodsLYLgfqJS5+dGCLJNmc4cPs=.sha256) their new SSB client which is rapidly closing in on a release that's ready for general consumption.

----

[@Lenny Abramov](%03sqyUE2tc0++LjQ6yMTQM5KC/PAARQMyQNLwVDGIto=.sha256) made [an interesting obvervation](%03sqyUE2tc0++LjQ6yMTQM5KC/PAARQMyQNLwVDGIto=.sha256)  

> I've noticed that a recurring argument in discussions about Scuttlebutt's features is: "That's how things work IRL". It seems an important criterion for deciding among alternative solutions - how close they mimic ordinary social dynamics. This is in striking contrast with the arrogant Silicon Valley attitude of disrupting or fixing reality, including fundamental social dynamics 


----

[@noffle](@C3iYh/12sO1uvKq1KcZXLFxSySzxOkHxXN8rtNB5MGA=.ed25519) [wondered aloud](%hKSZ8yQvWwNzw3AmfhXX3ASoXn/IjXzbTsPCSTa2DzU=.sha256) if it would be a good thing if Patchwork (and friends) had a concept of display names like Twitter.

----

> [I was thinking](%n9iqwFzckR50eoRomeYXPjJqI8Z1nccC9NpgJq87wKI=.sha256) about how i saw my old friend @blaine here this morning. See Blaine created #OAuth which we use for delegated token authentication pretty much everywhere. Then he went and tried to get the world to adopt #webfinger, so you could identify who you were on various services. I'm curious what we could go about implementing an identity mapping system on scuttlebutt?  - [@rabble](@5fYRrgyJON0r0R9SPrK0oxR1XKhqNXqiN0FBX+MgfH4=.ed25519)

> Whenever the discussion about blocking or boundries comes up (often because someone needs it) it often is itself a controversal discussion. The hardness of boundries is a wedge issue for us. The simple fact is some members of the community want soft boundries, others want hard...So, I'm thinking we could have expiring block.

> What if we started from facilitation principles and worked toward understanding software? This guide goes in-depth about applying key facilitation concepts in the online space.

[@manni](@JSrjjJja0t6v2Lb8wQN3TPecpPMrdcOcOISsDe68dpA=.ed25519) and [@Teq](@CxnSXWYjPT160y7QbmTFtWaWT09080azgErYPt1ZeZc=.ed25519) have been using Scuttlebutt as part of some research work. 

> Basically we‚Äôre hanging out in the Scuttleverse partly just because we like it here and partly because we want to understand how SSB functions as a sociotechnical community. We hope that, over time, the project will evolve into something collaborative that serves SSB communities by documenting and writing-up some the cool and interesting things that happen here.

They're sharing some of their thoughts in a [Research Diary Thread](%nHp25OhIP/H+LUWquUcIlfy0l2rONINrE7Y30Ki87g4=.sha256).

content.text:
### Community

[@Emmi Bevensee](@5fX6QTmue/udf7tLwW25vQ63wZSENrksghBt6vfL4/I=.ed25519) discovered that **[most of our posts are visible to the outside world via sites like viewer.scuttlebutt.io](%KY353LlSAP/wCLJzAqCnYxqrnWlDvbntoDRamtde1ks=.sha256)** (the links you get when you right click and see "Copy External Link" in Patchwork are hosted there). Some folks were unaware that our posts are shared publicly by default. [@kas](@dBQlwh9Gtr3i5YMOGtIOKtGNVepeu+nyb6KGl1vtOcM=.ed25519) was kind enough to [share the (unfortunately geeky) instructions on how to exclude your account from the public sites](%Xr90+Wk1cBxxORyQcUvL5utix2TFuChZHc28m6fET4E=.sha256).

> ugg...I feel like this should be something you opt in to...not out of. - [@nanomonkey](%xcPZC7P5Pl2IIAVggFGRe8hU/1NMKsW9Gx2gBO/vQto=.sha256) 

Most of the folks in the thread seemed to agree with that sentiment. 

[@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) noted that 

> This is a per-pub setting. Some have them, some don't. Avoid connecting with pubs you don't trust and avoid replicating data with people you don't trust.


The thread is worth a read. Unfortunately, the current ways to address this are not easy, but maybe the discussion will lead to better solutions.

We've talked about free listening not free speech, because that's more accurate to how Scuttlebutt works.

content.text:
> Even if copyright laws applied? Of course they do apply

some laws apply in some places, but again, you can't assume all the laws apply in all the places. The only way this is _not_ true is if we have truly universal copyright laws, which we don't. 

>> The point is than unless you're a big corporation with $$$ for lawyers, copyright is generally not going to help you, and posting copy-written stuff here can screw over your friends.

> That's a huge jump to an outlandish conclusion. 

I'm speaking from a practical perspective. Most folks who've had their open source licenses violated, for example, are indie devs who can't afford to take the violator (usually a big co) to court. If you can't afford to have the law enforced or convince someone to take on the case for free (unlikely), the law isn't enforced, and thus it isn't helping you and the protections may as well not exist (from a practical perspective).

Most of the time people, do nothing, ask the offender to politely stop, make a stink if they don't, but ultimately, don't attempt to take large companies to court because they can't afford it. 

I'm not saying copyright is useless or doesn't work. I'm not suggesting CC or Open Source Licenses shouldn't be used. I'm saying your average joe can't afford to have it enforced, and doesn't have the time and/or knowledge to defend themselves in court against a troupe of lawyers who are even half-way competent at their jobs. 

The practical takeaway from this is "copyright is generally not going to help you", which I think, is a pretty reasonable conclusion given the reality of legal systems in most first world countries. 

What part of my reasoning or conclusion is "outlandish" [@juul](@22YV3HX/BGClXH49ZebkcepqRpj7a9f5s0ddwhDSfxk=.ed25519)? (actual question, not being a smart-ass)


> I think you are right about international law but there are treaties in place governing copyright, and the law within a nation certainly governs servers running there - [@moid](@Sur8RwcDh6kBjub8pLZpHNWDfuuRpYVyCHrVo+TdA/4=.ed25519)

true, but again, there are lots of holes when you consider the 190+ countries in the world. We keep hearing about copyright trying to be shoved into new / updated treaties to make it such that the same protections large companies have in the USA apply in other countries. If things were equal internationally this wouldn't be a thing that anyone was fighting for because it would already be true.

My apologies for writing that last response about copyright from this account folks. That was supposed to be from [@masukomi](@LzTjF5eAVC6xprPMGeNzqEP/EEBIGpM6hDaaY10hrz8=.ed25519) 

I'm trying to keep my personal posts / opinions separate from [@butt_summarizer](@iVPi/B73hJSpsUB8XbSnlxe3NembPXLjOfIexlYdgJA=.ed25519)   so you don't have to listen to that stuff if you don't want to.

cc [@juul](@22YV3HX/BGClXH49ZebkcepqRpj7a9f5s0ddwhDSfxk=.ed25519) & [@moid](@Sur8RwcDh6kBjub8pLZpHNWDfuuRpYVyCHrVo+TdA/4=.ed25519)

![butt_summaries_image.jpg](&cIBYD4wh/L/Ivqb1Zyqc3uwFQJOB6Sgnlv3lITD/urY=.sha256)

# This week in Scuttlebutt
July 31th - Aug 7th

A sample of life in the Scuttleverse.

There are currently only 26 people helping to fund the future of Scuttlebutt through the [SSB consortium](https://opencollective.com/secure-scuttlebutt-consortium)! 


[@Matt Lorentz](@kS1GT34Sg+Kzjcqoehz//afmIQC5+CGo8O/KvMddVrM=.ed25519) notes that [@elavoie](@IgYpd+tCtXnlE2tYX/8rR2AGt+P8svC98WH3MdYAa8Y=.ed25519) is looking for participants for a grant funding experiment. The current grant program is running out soon. If you are interested in finding a grass-roots way to continue funding work on ssb, I think this is a great way to help out. Participation costs $20. All the money will go to directly to someone working on SSB. [Like this post if you want to participate](%p1DwdB6l30hmZjTzxTBqXPEJh0eMP02Ef1elA44jRXE=.sha256). Full details [are here](%WnPIiA403tvVeMpcp5o4lo4rObIlJ7PUzzfnWg106qw=.sha256).

[@kas](@dBQlwh9Gtr3i5YMOGtIOKtGNVepeu+nyb6KGl1vtOcM=.ed25519) A Little Book about Funding: "Just stumbled upon this pixie book about funding from scratch and thought I'd post [a link for those interested](%ajwdC8hHAs1tvQK77PefPPI9Ty70/B456kyZnufgrCc=.sha256)"

> It's kind of the point of so much of what I care about. I'm really excited about it. It's about how the parts of us that just earnestly care for each other and try to find bridges of authentic vulnerability and connection are antifascist at heart. It's about respecting that soft awkward dweeby bit in yr heart that just fucking loves things a lot. To me that is a super radical instinct to be cultivated

Not all agreed, but I still feel it's worth actively thinking about and coming to your own conclusions if you're sharing copywritten content or relying on copyright protection of your content here.

[@cel](@f/6sQ6d2CMxRUhLpspgGIulDxDCwYD7DzFzPNr7u5AU=.ed25519) shared a "[Lightning talk by Gordon Mohr about petnames and @-names](%cqcX6y6jwrNqDzpQK7umpmCGIyvEbNM7GwnUy6gOIrg=.sha256)"

> Gordon suggests "rebranding petnames as personal @-names", abbreviated "p@-names", pronounced "pat-names". (vs. service-centralized @-names, "SC@-names", pronounced "scat-names").

----
[@Matt McKegg](@FbGoHeEcePDG3Evemrc+hm+S77cXKf8BRQgkYinJggg=.ed25519) shared  

> PATCHTRON 3000‚Ñ¢Ô∏è
> A new ssb client powered by Tube Technology!

which will probably end up being Patchwork 4.0 but it's got a ways to go. [Details and pics in the post](%jWVFHBX7MKeSIsrffFEq1G/rldXVi3UFS2FOFbs1hR8=.sha256).

They've also "[...been thinking about sameAs again](%SLw9nLzLRUGEN96zUBN9JZQ/jgZL8+hP8TW1GYR8qHQ=.sha256)" and shared many details of that thinking.

links in [the post](%c0El40YWs/ph0W5EicdFkiI5w1Dvn6z6y/ORikOnxwE=.sha256).

[@Luandro](@2RNGJafZtMHzd76gyvqH6EJiK7kBnXeak5mBWzoO/iU=.ed25519) is [continuing to make progress towards an iPhone client](%ZpWBqdHQI/yAUrjqSKJVF7Qj0Um/0eU3Lwze0h31YHg=.sha256) for scuttlebutt.

[@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) shared "[a principles/philosophy thread that... gives a mental framework to guide our decisions regarding pubs, replication, DHTs, etc.](%4UgKW64tc9NNO94gGhFMXLLLv9mGTxadDpudwjoTq9c=.sha256)"

[@soapdog](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519) has [Patchfox loading threads](%a6vbJpL09Y3YPKEduJ5TZKKJmtmoIGDw1a6qvYG3JOM=.sha256) after the recent rewrite.

[@Jarlen](@PD8VV1biyAJjE3j5CpgH4k1kmsHiUuq+oUPYQ2koEwg=.ed25519) shared [a long post with more thoughts about GDPR](%b4V94fTBCLsIh4I5LKyiv5JUZ1ObypquomqxTkdjHuQ=.sha256), how companies are avoiding it, and ways of "approaching a web site".

----

[@Powersource](@Vz6v3xKpzViiTM/GAe+hKkACZSqrErQQZgv4iqQxEn8=.ed25519) shared [their work on Thankful](%RAwqvuPnSgZV/3ktHWNtIk7nUb2zfh9nKJWt5UnH428=.sha256)

> Thankful is (so far) a browser extension that locally tracks what content you consume from which creators. Then it helps you donate to those creators using #ethereum (hopefully other currencies too in the future) proportional to how much you've consumed of their content and how much you've clicked "Thanks" on their content.
> ...It is pretty alpha still but we'd love if you tried it out and told us what you think!

# This week in Scuttlebutt
Aug 7th-Aug13th

A sample of life in the Scuttleverse.

There are currently only 26 people helping to fund the future of Scuttlebutt through the [SSB consortium](https://opencollective.com/secure-scuttlebutt-consortium)! 

## Totally Random

[@sentamalin](@ONFJa2sEtv9lHgH9LhwnfAr+JX9nUK0JuIzjnCVFRH0=.ed25519) used their flying superpower to head to the Philippines for some relaxation, but ended up stuck in Japan, and deciding to ["make lemonade" and enjoy the time there](%aJV1AQpYSr1cgZ/Ngbf2DaHhJBRohAobB+3D7gZFvJI=.sha256). The many pictures in the post include city life, beautiful gardens, and more.

![Shinjuku.jpg](&a78aeoCYUSyuC8dKHzkLn3q85a6JlWy6gN+OuOzyv54=.sha256)

----

[@dan hassan](@NeB4q4Hy9IiMxs5L08oevEhivxW+/aDu/s/0SkNayi0=.ed25519) shares a dragonfly in [a thread about ssb-bluetooth](%xKwGuqm0Kevhl0+cJ32h3kv5hhA/J3dUrGz1s06z8pQ=.sha256).

![Blue_dragonfly_on_leaf.jpg](&A8eO35XJWXih6LngPdmZ9UI+EAYqH8hT38rIeQBzYh8=.sha256)


----

[@nanomonkey](@+D0ku/LReK6kqd3PSrcVCfbLYbDtTmS4Bd21rqhpYNA=.ed25519) shared a cat within a box within a box with a cat within... in [a thread unrelated to cats, or boxes](%rdg6bOxlTkAX/wfcCxPj5crchH5lfgmrnb/Hxf3fFZ0=.sha256) and yet still somewhat relevant.

![cat-agory_theory.jpg](&Tu2Mm02rEcCxBRhHlDJoJvRw5QFWluzQcHmeLtdelsk=.sha256)

----

[@Richard D. Bartlett](@3r4+IyB5NVl2in6QOZHIu9oSrZud+NuVgl2GX3x2WG8=.ed25519) shared [photos from Croatia](%9GCcSrIK/5t6+FqA45HZURo/Pw7nkZQ17qfiKaktuMs=.sha256).

![lizard](&bU7ae3X5NaUecBQm9pob29W88S2PBlyepZhn1hBhlLY=.sha256)

----
[@Alanna](@6OxffMLNyxkboLjCqv29WnMPhH8O3qFrcXCR6KrKcPI=.ed25519) shared [the questions she and @mix asked each other](%SikKOkEkMtvCKJHrdbhNBcDlVhN0XT91hZ831QuQLrg=.sha256) in their last "relationship retrospective". Asking questions like those seems a pretty good thing to keep a relationship healthy and happy.

----

[@dangerousbeans](@TXKFQehlyoSn8UJAIVP/k2BjFINC591MlBC2e2d24mA=.ed25519) shared a recipe for [Suspiciously Creamy Green Tea Ice cream](%3y49jA5uL1usD/GWzPkEuTy/3lPd+vyrhJcbVWgZHdQ=.sha256) 

They also shared shots from "Drone footage of China's bike rental graveyards..."

## Software
[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) shared some new screenshots from their Dark Crystal work

![Selection_044.jpg](&8wIAJcdWaob0CWOlrZcbbahqtbAKBW2VcgWMnzm1NYM=.sha256)

![Selection_045.jpg](&K8QBWTHy0rgLV2Nn8Y4+1PfkkSy2CoizVVnLFiNzvZs=.sha256)

> [It's all working](%ejup/Puo0CrSwV12WiSwo8BJRHdKYlP1EEEMFQTpLl4=.sha256). Well live reloading of requests doesn't work yet but I'll add that later.
> Gonna merge this all into patchbay master in the next 5 minutes.
> 
> GET READY TO SHARD YOUR CRYSTALS

On a related note [@peg](@vEJe4hdnbHJl549200IytOeA3THbnP0oM+JQtS1u+8o=.ed25519) has been "[Brainstorming coconut-related scenarios](%yAdCqJqI+ihjhCt6DGX9YBhtxujM9P9bwRAjVIZZvKo=.sha256)". I have no idea where the coconut term came from but it's discussing what happens when the custodians of your shards are no longer trusted. 

----

[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) also shared a screenshot from [a new "Blogs" page in patchbay](%7Y0XiAuWDa1eu9fMKoLgXfSySUr6IoSHtXlI58x7bOI=.sha256), and [a post about accessability settings with improved image search layout, calendar display, and more](%AJWG+DP4254FDjywHNLzRj5LkVE6yHFNiPVP3TWe9q0=.sha256). 

![blogs page in patchbay](&IqYlZ0mvM/3pbMNDoCT+xIFpv5gxgLIf/0Ey2u2q9Yc=.sha256)

![image search in patchbay](&2jVjvppa+twur5UCsZTuX2a6TV9bJkapkb1lYdyblR4=.sha256)

![calendar display in patchbay](&p/QM4CC7G6frpqnnJgZvDPvidmgxh9F+U/3qT7aZvvs=.sha256)

----

[@dan hassan](@NeB4q4Hy9IiMxs5L08oevEhivxW+/aDu/s/0SkNayi0=.ed25519) shared some [screenshots and thoughts about imagesearch in patchbay](%30P11Leobmcga41eyLrdB+bQijE3S7j4UFqPUSeLszg=.sha256)

----

[@cblgh](@C6fAmdXgqTDbmZGAohUaYuyKdz3m6GBoLLtml3fUn+o=.ed25519) [shared a screenshot](%hdL40SNnb/6ApQX/yas+p5Kkn2qoo02goQfj1ASi8No=.sha256) of some of the in-progress work on the desktop client for cabal. Looks like we'll have the ability to connect to multiple cabals at the same time. 

![cabal-2018-08-12-by-symbolo.png](&yJvgf7bjvFFiT2mfL1Orh6EQkPJ7rba02lmtGeraY5A=.sha256) 

## Software Community Intersection

[@cryptixInTheCloud](@uOReuhnb9+mPi5RnTbKMKRr3r87cK+aOg8lFXV/SBPU=.ed25519) started an interesting (and only a little geeky) [discussion about transitive blocking](%F46h+hDFp3t80eoG+6KDHMUBUDiaprdDjmSwwnpVkPo=.sha256). That is to say that under certain conditions, if your friend blocks someone, your client could auto-block them too. 

## Community

[@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) 

> I'm getting convinced that it's the Scuttlebutt community, not the platform, which is the most valuable thing we have right now.

and [goes on to discuss why in a surprisingly concrete manner](%Rr/M6shC0QoOYiWP3wrwi1FqnPTktjZSpmBKyO+X+7g=.sha256). 


[@Angelica](@eANNuLfzX/9rlGODXHYV8WJb+zw2h+d7YsT4vpYPvD0=.ed25519) shared [a dat zine they made](%72ucEDknoetGVn4c48b0Bkke6dH/PusRhJ6lKNfhIkk=.sha256) for a Kundalini Yoga workshop. 

----

![butt_summaries_image.jpg](&cIBYD4wh/L/Ivqb1Zyqc3uwFQJOB6Sgnlv3lITD/urY=.sha256)

# This week in Scuttlebutt
Aug 7th-Aug14th

A sample of life in the Scuttleverse.

There are currently only 28 people helping to fund the future of Scuttlebutt through the [SSB consortium](https://opencollective.com/secure-scuttlebutt-consortium)! 

Another new person stepped up. Was it you?

## Totally Random
 [@pSpike](@9WVInPbevHpzVdcmReNiO/+26fRdfcRAkrYziPffbJI=.ed25519) got [a new kitteh](&6YK/qdjU9Ft5/Ta0z3jJHtuihn7iCwTUmeLq9vKS7lU=.sha256).
 
![pspike's kitteh cat](&6YK/qdjU9Ft5/Ta0z3jJHtuihn7iCwTUmeLq9vKS7lU=.sha256) 

----
[@Capt. Andy](@DC22+xLfWynKXqoyPHAwXzxyUIceUcQKNQRrx16UIwg=.ed25519) shared [more pretty pictures from their adventure](%RRUVniQTKK3Sxg+IFCjJ1iEIjHPrCMcwQGDlgInhxUU=.sha256).

This time including pirates, and knights, and just chilling.

![Captain andy harbor boat beer relaxation](&7FT9Oc0mbFUSW8sceQ6BmVs4rUln19bj4y8lpvTQgVM=.sha256)

But later found themselves on a sailboat boat, in the middle of a forest, [with a dead engine](%u4E7Fwed8eFSjDRRWzIIVPSQItenTxTJuqAh6oMdTFc=.sha256).  They limped to the nearest guest harbor and had to buy a new one.

----
[@hob](@RtsOc2h1gqh0fRrjrUTHAkRBu9YyDgsD+EWsfLpykrc=.ed25519) shared [thousands of hermit crabs having a meet-up](%dakvjb28jbjD3G5wBQcvF1KCPO1w5VkzDpE1CY5lJK8=.sha256).

![crab-beach.jpeg](&fdXglPpTHyjSOlw2nFtlCfjTE7NFfVziaJJeqN7g9J0=.sha256)

## Solarpunk
[@Luandro](@2RNGJafZtMHzd76gyvqH6EJiK7kBnXeak5mBWzoO/iU=.ed25519) posted [a bunch of photos](%eK7NDTNXgx8L99Nep1tw55usKU8zAGquuxpMYn7Xfms=.sha256) showing the progress on their amazing house in Brazil. 

![luandro's house casa](&9P0wg9e+Bqk64FtsYv3KHaD/lmsrD76lkJnFiPF+z1c=.sha256)

## Software
For those of you playing around with Cabal [@noffle](@C3iYh/12sO1uvKq1KcZXLFxSySzxOkHxXN8rtNB5MGA=.ed25519) noted about 5 days ago that [the default cabal got bit by a hyperdb bug](%JZcRyIKLfXNR2xXyN22mMUnhEwueUk/ifP4u8vn3GsQ=.sha256)  and the new public cabal is at 

```
cabal://4ae5ec168a9f6b45b9d35e3cc1d0f4e3a436000d37fae8f53b3f8dadfe8f192f
```
On a related note [@cinnamon](@fBS90Djngwl/SlCh/20G7piSC064Qz2hBBxbfnbyM+Y=.ed25519) shares [details about the in-progress rewrite](%kQL5leGw363myRicmAnSBSC5HXUeiga5mnP5VJ6YLtU=.sha256) that will address this and make other things better. Amongst other things ...

> This new architecture supports permissions that are more appropriate for a chat app

----

On a related note [@jimpick](@XdApp72tocY2mRvkyzt/C1nDKT/3lAS0ZK6Hw6GKxnY=.ed25519) made [a bot for cabal](%HPrmyWIrx7bg1sPEpDEespUc9O7jrOzXoULzpJg5Mlg=.sha256)

![cabal-ses-bot.gif](&PEv9ajfpMUP0mF4dwZndChRtUrEiFH2uSwAVR+WgiaQ=.sha256)

----

[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) is [tweaking the calendar display](%br9V1h5tzNpTeV+n3XTO4wZbFrxb1BOM03JvLpeydRA=.sha256) to show which gatherings you are attending.

![gatherings calendar display](&v3R/G/IL3rmQGnqSPBIaHbCbUZfTOWNtikMVkU6qzV0=.sha256)

[@arj](@6CAxOI3f+LUOVrbAl0IemqiS7ATpQvr9Mdw9LC4+Uv0=.ed25519)  "[wrote a small new view for patchbay](%yrtVk33JZlsuoVNE7fe0Dtum/9GNN/iNJbTiAVtLrpo=.sha256) that lets you find interesting posts based on the people and channels you follow."

![post-rank.jpg](&KoiyUny720MwWJs4mlWYOYaln6ibRXQLs8Kggn7nF+4=.sha256)


## Software  Community Intersection
[@christianbundy](@+oaWWDs8g73EZFUMfW37R/ULtFEjwKN/DczvdYihjbU=.ed25519) made [a solarized theme for Patchbay](%R9SxWvsLFwRr9R2MWP/kbP0zUQSONa33Hf9fWGjuzI8=.sha256).

![screenshot of solarized patchbay mcss color scheme](&fHrMSS9Dnt92TqsqgjDRj7HUKDiCzSKoc5doMYWQUFA=.sha256)

----
[cel](@f/6sQ6d2CMxRUhLpspgGIulDxDCwYD7DzFzPNr7u5AU=.ed25519) has introduced [a change to viewer.scuttlebot.io that makes having your stuff displayed there be opt-in instead of opt-out](%Rm7Bo44sEMELc8HTvgNPK4UR7KWXZwJyHpEw7/ERTH8=.sha256). This should address some of the recent concerns that came up when folks discovered that almost everything we post here was being shared publicly on the web and indexed by Google.

Opting in requires command line geekery with `sbot` which is described in the post. 

## Community
 
 [@Richard D. Bartlett](@3r4+IyB5NVl2in6QOZHIu9oSrZud+NuVgl2GX3x2WG8=.ed25519)  [shared a long post about not burning yourself out trying to make the world better](%3UIxDJq1+HC5r5NkBKeR+2UkWrpoMQUM5RH6M6f83YQ=.sha256) 
 
 > I‚Äôve been talking to a bunch of activist friends lately, who are pushing themselves right up to the brink of burnout. So I want to make the case for a kind of activism that is anchored in tenderness and gentle compassion: for yourself first, then for your comrades.
 

## Geeky
[@christianbundy](@+oaWWDs8g73EZFUMfW37R/ULtFEjwKN/DczvdYihjbU=.ed25519)  [shared a screenshot from git ssb-web](%SJH0woWhWp9zy1JJLBp3FAStl3+eL8btiZP6H1T+BJ0=.sha256) 

![screenshot of git-ssb-web working in epiphany](&CaX9QkE4oHLWDQDJsz+01NUUnA9WZcuJIY6Is/VaIds=.sha256)

According to [@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519)  "it's a github like implemntation on top of ssb."

----

[@andresaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) [stumbled across an old bug with lan peers](%W706OosDplF7P0zwOeQnakgZS2Fqp/CMgV56Q8KhZNQ=.sha256) repeatedly popping in and out trying to connect to each other... or something like that.

----

[@davidrusu](@cOYZH4MTrBpyhs5z4cgwG8slrY00BQM0T3dl7X3XfHI=.ed25519) shared the start of HermitDB 

![hermit db logo](&35XmgZ/615uftlKCW8TyMoTL7ylFAJ47/9BSzF31aoQ=.sha256)

> Nearly all decentralization efforts have been focused on social problems, the tools we use to manage our personal life like password managers, note taking apps, todo apps, etc. have not received much love from decentralization just yet.

David sees decentralized networks as a way to sync your personal data across devices as an alternative to the centralized solutions that everyone else seems to be using these days.

----

A sample of life in the Scuttleverse.

There are currently only 28 people helping to fund the future of Scuttlebutt through the [SSB consortium](https://opencollective.com/secure-scuttlebutt-consortium)! 

## Totally Random

[@Joey Hess](@BCM6DHYJvWzwWi1lFl2tjDXjaqyZAEmJH5ZONSpXhtc=.ed25519) shared [a cup of soup atop a mountain](%NbJpsY3ACdCyJS6GDFA+OBB/O8UE9PB+IOquY6JQW6c=.sha256).

content.text:
## Geeky

[@Dominic](@EMovhfIrFk4NihAKnRNhrfRaqIhBv1Wj8pTxJNgvCCY=.ed25519) discusses an "[argument against cannonical formats for signed data](%FI3kBXdFD6j+uISXluhirJm70QZpJIYzc65OX1XPJ5c=.sha256)"


> I think the SDN proposal just goes to show how difficult it is to design a cannonical format, and the benefit of that is just the ability to parse to an intermediate data structure, then serialize again, and have the hash still be the same. Given the kind of data structures different languages and runtimes might prefer are not necessarily exactly the same enough to preserve all features required for cannonicity, this can be awkward...

They also, separately, discussed [better notifications for village issue tracker](%466bQyzBk3xR7fWeEidfqw7yHmrxVSkBXQziybH+ouA=.sha256).

----

[@Alijoscha](@zurF8X68ArfRM71dF3mKh36W0xDM8QmOnAS5bYOq8hA=.ed25519) shared some [thoughts on various small data transfer formats](%/ttYRSNYiCDRwOEIcpSKMHGFpV0dnCwjecQcHvBin2E=.sha256) including ubjson, Smile, edn, BSON, MessagePack, and CBOR.

And, made a post with a [proposed Minimum Viable HSDT](%jt11rmbFmkR6tGQJDm99I4Z939Q2b0LmZCpkiOke/A0=.sha256) (third draft).

[@Dominic](@EMovhfIrFk4NihAKnRNhrfRaqIhBv1Wj8pTxJNgvCCY=.ed25519) then built on that and shared a post about [encoding design goals](%YH6PDaakwNu0D83EBHBLuwSlVhr/5aezVoE8p0IaNf0=.sha256)

> In the interests of clarifying the on-going discussion about the encoding and signing formats, I'd like to list the design goals and name them so that any proposal can easily list what goals it meets.

And discussed [nuances of implicit signing format](%SauuZIie5mLHH2zKl1vZmBXCHI/aNNt0NjoMKDx37Vw=.sha256) 

----

[@Alijoscha](@zurF8X68ArfRM71dF3mKh36W0xDM8QmOnAS5bYOq8hA=.ed25519) also discussed [back-pressure multiplexing](%ScgGMfSbd4WXBtH7ry+pjaaxMFF4GRMdf5ddWdM/uE0=.sha256) and [Extending the ssb message format](%f7tqoQpSfPXt+poGLGlI27DFqRXI2BsaC1CPhy4Rak8=.sha256) 

AND put together  [Protocol Changes - A Todo List
](%QOTRH1C4E0XrpawMrw3u4m6SwGC6GpZ3w9NyP7gJa0I=.sha256)
Alijoscha has been very busy this week. ;) 


----
----

These summaries are brought to you by [@masukomi](@LzTjF5eAVC6xprPMGeNzqEP/EEBIGpM6hDaaY10hrz8=.ed25519). I would love to hear your suggestions about how to make them better, or ideas on things to include.
