content.text:
[@Giarc](@gslfzChyXwRD4A1iJ5a88gi0JmphVXyQeb77fXXj2mo=.ed25519) shared an animated giff showing the "diffs" of [people's about pages changing over time](%JWpK5yN2f0ol8zC/f8ieIelk4tP4MY+1+9o0ldjxlyQ=.sha256). 

> It was quite interesting going through people‚Äôs profile revisions. Especially those that had lists in them like Ashleigh‚Äôs and along the way seeing their list interests change over time. Graphical tools to visualise my social graph just became interesting.

![video:diff Ashleigh HQ‚Äì2019‚Äì01‚Äì26_18.05.26.mp4](&nqyG+KF1Wj907OBkHXDNkXs7oOzcMng8TimBpE1lhq4=.sha256)

There's more in their post, but the biggest takeaway for me is the reminder that nothing is ever forgotten on SSB, so be mindful in what you put out there. 

----

[@mixmix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519)

has [added Multi-Channels to Patchbay](%87n+iSNIYfME9oaTjMrcgxJ8CulhE53YENfT5O9QfOo=.sha256)

![patchbay multi-channels](&IT3uGTiFrjB+MsVYXEXZzNIqfNT+bfcLG3vD/QMvwlc=.sha256)

> same idea as multi-reddits‚Ä¶ you want to see updates on multiple related channels at once.


----
[@Kiba Gateaux](@Ki1+80ZgpEFCv1Pny2ipdepo3QRBdmXn0wbsibQmp8U=.ed25519) [notes that](%wBJjY3v+VRQWyIiHdOK3f+tBOqmARMu9QCR6CAMxfJI=.sha256)

> MakerDAO announced they will be [using SSB to coordinate their pricing oracles](https://medium.com/makerdao/the-road-to-mainnet-release-21931d47f857). Using it as a cheaper alternative to fault tolerant + signed messaging service than publishing transactions on the chain and paying gas and storage fees. A quick look at their MCD repos didn‚Äôt turn anything up, anyone seen it in their code?





## Software Community Intersection

[@zelf](@3ZeNUiYQZisGC6PLf3R+u2s5avtxLsXC66xuK41e6Zk=.ed25519) started building a [Glossary of Terminology](%u/mPdIoOrfwdtmwX6mt35THuL2UMjPlKpRzg5g6eM/s=.sha256)

>  The idea is to create a space where we can share terms, slang or not slang, which can aid in helping each other grow and learn more.


They also discussed Vulnerability, Systems Thinking, and Future Historical Records Through Immutable logs. Some quotes from those sections of their post: 

> For me the question of ‚ÄúVulnerability is a Feature not a bug‚Äù is fascinating as it raises the question of ‚ÄúChosen Vulnerability‚Äù.

> Scuttlebutt from, especially since the protocol itself has a natural way of spreading in a P2P manner which is unlike any global connectivity protocol right now

> ‚ÄúWhat if people had our logs in a 100 years from now‚Äù


[@Luandro](@2RNGJafZtMHzd76gyvqH6EJiK7kBnXeak5mBWzoO/iU=.ed25519) later chimed in with [their thoughts on some of the same topics](%fcy3MhJehNPnmfZc8CtO9Xit43Z1Nyq/0htnckGh4jo=.sha256) as both posts originated from the handshake-council meeting.

----

[@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) wrote about [Deprioritizing first world problems](%u0fnmwUQTBcL9S8HP3uYCdBgnssu4GIyWSuo5XLYvPs=.sha256). They comment about the differences betwen catering to the minor inconveniences of privileged users (those of us with the luxury of multiple devices) and underprivileged ones. The following may be one of the key takeaways from the discussion.


> Meanwhile, underprivileged people are less demanding and more welcoming to almost any progress. In other words, it takes 100h of work to make a privileged audience satisfied, while it takes 10h to make an underprivileged audience satisfied, because of low-hanging fruits and less demanding attitude from users.


----

content.text:
[@DreamClassier](@7TyLAjOwe7FDN2s1mE3An8E+we7ZHjKXXQpvzPB+0q8=.ed25519) warns that...

> [Future versions of Chromium and Google Chrome may very soon not allow third-party ad blockers installed as add-ons](%gxezNGAWqMWmkY4ZhKOUx/TfcLo2HEttC38JTpVt2Vc=.sha256). AdBlock Plus will still probably work, but that comes as little solace if you're aware that developer Eyeo GmbH not only has accepted money, but gone so far as demand it[1], from business citing falling revenue due to ad blockers looking for a loophole.

There are more details in their post. If you've got someone a little bit geeky in your household you might want to consider setting up a [pi-hole](https://pi-hole.net/) while you still have the time to figure it out without drowning in ads and their associated privacy violations. It's actually pretty easy to follow the instructions to set one up. The more geeky part comes with configuring a public IP address so that you can use it when you leave your home network. 


On a related note [@aesthetical](@DTOFiGsg/6TSVnw5jj/XN3d1UU0vAm8aDjLgcoMNKZ4=.ed25519) [shared an article](%ycxUUyIi+Y2V0MbwDBExSSarwkqBy5uNOWQtie8UkQk=.sha256) that included this disturbing tidbit about recent changes to Chrome. 
 
> A few weeks ago Google shipped an update to Chrome that fundamentally changes the sign-in experience. **From now on, every time you log into a Google property (for example, Gmail), Chrome will automatically sign the browser into your Google account for you.** It‚Äôll do this without asking, or even explicitly notifying you.

The bit that's a little unclear about all this is that you can actually be
signed in to _the Chrome browser_ not just Google web sites. Speaking a somene
who used to work for a behavioral targeting platform, the primary purpose of
this is almost guaranteed to be to facilitate tracking your behavior across the net even when
you've signed out of Goodle web sites / apps, so that they can know more about
you and thus help the people who buy ads from them.

----
[@KawaiiPunk](@LVL4qjvmws3Cxavfi4iCQI6dSOqWqOyq5/5CHImILA8=.ed25519) [shared a link to the $10k Sentry Open Source Grant](%/SbBFuu6yImo721OseycclQg5N7IBVlUYEc3WErtYu8=.sha256)

> This grant opportunity is open to anyone who is currently contributing to an open source project aimed at improving the lives of others (social good, developer tools, etc.). We value true representation in open source (we know we all have a long way to go), and we especially encourage those who are underrepresented in the open source community to apply.


Maybe one of you folks in the US can get that and create or improve something wonderful. 

----
[@glyph](@HEqy940T6uB+T+d9Jaa58aNfRzLx9eRWqkZljBmnkmk=.ed25519) has put out a request for support in the form of paid work and / or funding for PeachCloud. [Their post](%SXq2AW5mXwctfnIv0Evml+7zsXa/pce6bmX/3BKvmNg=.sha256) goes on to explain what they've been doing in it so far and talking about ways you can help. One of them being simply helping them find a new paying job so that they can afford to keep working on PatchCloud in their spare time.

----
[@elavoie](@IgYpd+tCtXnlE2tYX/8rR2AGt+P8svC98WH3MdYAa8Y=.ed25519) wrote about "SSB-Land to [lower housing costs for developers](%VANpgQvAMf9lyrsvaJEJE5VN3TDSBNK7InGW++XTjI8=.sha256)"

> [an] effort to identify properties that could be bought for a reasonable price that could help some developers in the community to lower their living expenses, which was started here. This would help the limited money we have to fund future developments go a longer way.

content.text:
## Community
[@Richard D. Bartlett](@3r4+IyB5NVl2in6QOZHIu9oSrZud+NuVgl2GX3x2WG8=.ed25519) was [on the Intellectual Explorers Club podcast](%DYdB/o/+phNr1nQffKuiVZpt6eHfrSzJRb4s/Y7HMPw=.sha256) speaking "...about some of the subtle interactions in groups: the link between status and belonging, the limits of inclusion, good power differences and healthy hierarchies."

----
[@kas](@RuNxm8SRujPcJx6GjtTQHp6hprAFv5voEkcvoAkB8Pk=.ed25519) shared [a concerning software creation](%xU7MmETlsZHC53NNYIeWEyX3pv08HPMVblGCQxV06GE=.sha256) that's emerged in China.

> The ‚Äúmap of deadbeat debtors‚Äù is yet the latest in China‚Äôs push towards a shame-based ‚Äúsocial credit score‚Äù system which has already been deployed in several parts of the country. According to a November report, Beijing has an ambitious plan to control China‚Äôs citizens through a system of social scoring that punishes behavior it does not approve.

We've got a lot of programmers here. Creations like this are reminders that we need to think about the moral and ethical implications of our creations. We must remember a paycheck is never an acceptable exchange for creating something that can only harm others.

## Geeky
[@Aljoscha](@zurF8X68ArfRM71dF3mKh36W0xDM8QmOnAS5bYOq8hA=.ed25519) posted about [Semantic Partial Subscriptions](%KRjo0Ovy/pLbviuNP336aGLcZoHNOXnXGFBd+8aBNRo=.sha256) 

> The question I‚Äôm elaborating on is roughly: ‚ÄúThe leyline-core append-only log supports partial replication based on sequence numbers. Applications however will want to determine partial replication based on meaningful semantics rather than arbitrary numbers. How could an application framework bridge that gap?‚Äù. I‚Äôll propose a few designs of increasing complexity, discussing problems as they come up.



----
As a followup on last week's discussions about handling adult content
[@teq](@CxnSXWYjPT160y7QbmTFtWaWT09080azgErYPt1ZeZc=.ed25519) linked to
[this thread](%6Blj85EQfKBUsuRSa+M+v/fwolKhEXa1G3zouNFcDw0=.sha256) from last
year which disussed a number of options for handling it. Obviously some people
on the internet like posting it, and it's in our best interests to put in good
mechanisms for dealing with that inevitability such that we don't accidentally
end up with NSFW content being displayed at unfortunate times. 


## Geeky
[@Christian Bundy](@+oaWWDs8g73EZFUMfW37R/ULtFEjwKN/DczvdYihjbU=.ed25519)

> In the past few months I‚Äôve been increasingly interested in feed deletion, which gives users the ability to delete content from folks that they‚Äôve blocked. Being unable to delete feeds from your computer is disempowering, and means that bad people can post bad things that have to stay on your computer forever.
> 
> That's bad.

They've been making some progress adding deletion to a number of modules. 

> The gist is pretty simple: flumelog-offsets stores all messages in one big file, and deletion works by replacing the target message with something else. 

[Click through.](%OoBqCtaYm6ayBQqCVlHi66vsWfvaK5+t98aqsXlRyZU=.sha256) Read the details. And share your thoughts if you haven't already.



---------------------------------------------------------------
---------------------------------------------------------------

These summaries are brought to you by [@masukomi](@LzTjF5eAVC6xprPMGeNzqEP/EEBIGpM6hDaaY10hrz8=.ed25519), **with the support of my lovely patrons**. If you'd like to help continue their creation you can [become a patron on Patreon](https://www.patreon.com/the_weekly).

# Recent Days  in Scuttlebutt

## Totally Random


[@Marco](@/VouD2YMzJsJp3LjxkbP/+XmD/xJ45lx7Jq+ETOKClI=.ed25519) shared [pictures from a recent farmers market trip](%NLWfZV6d/asRaG4I/9zq8v5TSvAQaLtOmI50ukZO1uc=.sha256) 

and later from their [food sharing activity](%dkH4j2PclSZR6Q9Jhr3hhdeGYaj1eARi9T4EZWzfIaw=.sha256)

## Software

[@mixmix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) says 

> I started a long overdue tidyup of the profile page. Things I‚Äôve changed in the `master` :
> - made ‚Äútabs‚Äù out of the different relationships
> - now only see ‚Äúfriends‚Äù by defaultm but can switch to ‚Äúfollows‚Äù, ‚Äúfollowers‚Äù, ‚Äúblocks‚Äù
> - added counts for how many of each type of relationship
> - changed the order
> - mutual credits are neat, but they are lower priority IMO than friends
> - made the persons avatar HUGE

There is some more thinking behind the changes in [the post](%T4WTvJAz5H+J9M0wUM56PihuVpmeAzXq8/YxyXhW698=.sha256). 

![patchbay profile page](&xw3iN1YSrEW/y3IbzRdhjPRy0Go0CPk1UC7rLsN8ebw=.sha256)


They also added an experiment to the `peer_stats` branch that may or may not go anywhere. 

> This is a graph of my activity over the past 90 days. Above the x-axis (in purple) are public messages, below the x-axis (in black) are private messages


[More details here](%65duL9E9WCr3wDgJowpE6DpiqrOckz8mx6QBCvNUozU=.sha256) as well as in interesting little discussion about it.

![patchbay peer stats](&RYIoB6koM+GM3DeyQppabZw0B8hcVN8ByFxftaIBGXI=.sha256)



Non-geeks: The "master" branch of Patchbay changes rapidly and requires some geeky skills to work with. The changes will eventually make their way into the next stable release.

----


[@kieran](@MpDd66GPXgN1+eMNrZInHkWq1THMurWwLdMx8BZ1ncw=.ed25519) posted [a pretty detailed summary of the Dark Crystal Peer Testing and Usability assessment work](%Rbg6Gr19sYSXgxYf8CxqGTSe5oelR0M0HwAxh62Q1eo=.sha256).


[@mixmix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) then shared some ideas on a [Minimal Standalone Dark Crystal client](%TLwMkZ4wRFqphEaN3os/i2t6XfXWw5zHsWWeltqC4RY=.sha256) and what that might entail.


## Software Community Intersection

[@KawaiiPunk](@LVL4qjvmws3Cxavfi4iCQI6dSOqWqOyq5/5CHImILA8=.ed25519) shares some thoughts on [What is Lunarpunk software](%1eAh7Gj1fE4u9jUoHwQCwvgexSh4V5fblZKT94kIcvo=.sha256) as well as some info on a couple apps they believe to be "Lunarpunk". 


> The thinking being that #scuttlebutt is a solarpunk platform. It is permissive, social, spacious, noisy, positive, collective, bright. #dat also has tends to have these characteristics both technically and through the aesthetics of the content I come across. These are networks designed to share data, to propagate and to explore.
> 
> The interesting thing is thinking about what lunarpunk represents and which software projects may already be tending in that direction. I see lunarpunk as being introspective, private, reflective, quiet, synchronised. Secret tunnels and underground networks.

----

content.text:
[@Luandro](@2RNGJafZtMHzd76gyvqH6EJiK7kBnXeak5mBWzoO/iU=.ed25519) writes about "using Telegram bots interconnected to valueflows thru Secure Scuttlebutt as transitional ground for community-first applications" 

> Despite not being the most sustainable solution, Telegram presents itself as the best option for users in transition to using community first technology. Having users transition to another app from WhatsApp, makes it easier for them to transition to other apps later on. Maybe a fork that works with decentralized protocols before actually giving them an #open-app-ecosystem :open_hands:
>
> What‚Äôs really special about Telegram though is bots. It‚Äôs seems pretty easy to conceptualize, develop and distribute a bot, making it the perfect testing ground for experimental methods of community governance and economics. Since the bot runs on NodeJS it‚Äôs easy to interconnect it to ssb instances, so that the flows of value can be kept decentralized, and later easy to interconnect other applications. The actual Telegram data can later be downloaded and migrated to distributed storages and protocols.


[Many more details in the post](%hWL3bkb7WyJ9RPVuk4M7NoqOuL9XZuaVbnmNSZR5WqI=.sha256).



## Community

[@Dominic](@EMovhfIrFk4NihAKnRNhrfRaqIhBv1Wj8pTxJNgvCCY=.ed25519) put together [another Hermies t-shirt design](%GFdH1OszQXEm/YNaDGV66GhX0TtD4C1Crn4E2fZeySY=.sha256) that's available on [Amazon US](https://amzn.to/2I55M2A) 

![i hermit crab Hermies t-shirt](&E6Usky9H/wMD+hsLo9DR0EslP4ApjGnvOf8cM5zPllg=.sha256)

[@elavoie](@IgYpd+tCtXnlE2tYX/8rR2AGt+P8svC98WH3MdYAa8Y=.ed25519) shares a meeting in Basel Switzerland on the [First Steps towards an SSB Research Community](%u1Pmv1knra4978VJlDnQyyce34MyIcyz2oMILng+50s=.sha256) 

> Last Wednesday and Thursday (January 30th and 31st), [@Aljoscha](@zurF8X68ArfRM71dF3mKh36W0xDM8QmOnAS5bYOq8hA=.ed25519) and I were invited by @[Christian](@AiBJDta+4boyh2USNGwIagH/wKjeruTcDX2Aj1r/haM=.ed25519) in Basel (Switzerland) to kickstart a paper, jointly written with [@Dominic](@EMovhfIrFk4NihAKnRNhrfRaqIhBv1Wj8pTxJNgvCCY=.ed25519), that we hope to submit to an Information-Centric Networking conference in May. I would like to share a bit of the experience and excitement with you all.

The post continues on with some interesting tidbits for thought and concludes with this pic of lovely SSB folks. 

![basel switzerland ssb research group crab meet](&i1a/rQziyOmVBeNi/fa3It9nfiiDJKa46d0HbZD6FOY=.sha256)

----

[@gwil](@PEqxT8YRvrkf2fyjAgTl8pmdo8aR4KVsKLyh0b5JyOE=.ed25519) shared some advice on [What Makes Documentation So Difficult?](%2B/0lEzLXytpRnP/AWd18haU08uwbvUOD0hRF2/oyU4=.sha256)


![person pushes ball of documentation uphill](&Jws27itogQqHLo6utMW5Z0jDv14lFXPlnMV57XwUujQ=.sha256)


Gwil's post reminds me of a recent short blog post about "[Why NASA converted its Lessons Learned Database into a Knowledge Graph](https://blog.nuclino.com/why-nasa-converted-its-lessons-learned-database-into-a-knowledge-graph) [web link]. 


## Geeky

[@jer](@uf3kajfhBC2Sd3OysKB5LnBLJ5pwgBhBpXnGEGzgG6A=.ed25519) started [working on a single user high frequency trading platform for crypto currency arbitrage](%rPw1QFHw0tU4Fi7Bbwj3Vduc7YWCeE1tdSxAFIpfznw=.sha256) in Elixir.

----

[@cel](@f/6sQ6d2CMxRUhLpspgGIulDxDCwYD7DzFzPNr7u5AU=.ed25519) [put together something](%m0R78xpq2si3GRiRdjtCnyOc3frsxeCA/ILoonrAy6A=.sha256) to show you "...which peers your ssb-server has replicated with using ebt. It is basically like doing `ls -lt ~/.ssb/ebt | head` and turning the ids into clickable links.


![patchfoo-ebt-script.png](&2tpDS1wWneVv4z5SZo35kdRae4xnLKi3KiFD6FUMVFI=.sha256)

More details are available in [the post](%m0R78xpq2si3GRiRdjtCnyOc3frsxeCA/ILoonrAy6A=.sha256).

----

## Useful Info
A number of folks have asked about backing up thier Manyverse identity in case their phone dies, or because they want to reset it, or other reasons.

The answer (via [@cel](@f/6sQ6d2CMxRUhLpspgGIulDxDCwYD7DzFzPNr7u5AU=.ed25519) is that "Android's backup feature allows exporting app data." [They've left instructions here](%B7PGfaqGAoATl5BVlIxtwEwirdYXKXVtTpSNVvKYiFY=.sha256), but the quick summary is "back up your manyverse data using adb command over USB (`adb backup`) and then after OS reinstall, restore it using `adb restore`"

[@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) was contacted by some folks [wondering if SSB might be a good way for a mesh network of solar powered baloons to communicate](%r9Cj1ItFsSb8U3XPJ+q/yMblPx6XAuU6PI1BI4shPcw=.sha256).

----

[@ev](@8Qee0I/DwI5DHSCi3p5fsl6FyLGArrnDz3ox9qZr5Qc=.ed25519) added support for Scat in MVD a while ago.

>But today it occurred to me that it might be cool to have dedicated chatrooms for our projects on git-ssb. Many people use IRC, Slack, and Gitter as open source chat rooms, but what if we could chat about our projects right here on ssb? That‚Äôd be cool! So I got to coding.

And now you can do just that. [Details in their post](%xe1iiJXlnDnqYZmUQWW6Gz901n5fLDnunvkVBw1j3cY=.sha256)


## Community 


[@dinosaur](@6ilZq3kN0F+dXFHAPjAwMm87JEb/VdB+LC9eIMW3sa0=.ed25519) shares info about the "open space" format that will be employed and [explains how the talks of the event emerge during the event itself](%4YfZ1yAWHPcR2wNqiUFONPwwhxeUROF6fAZtIpGVkZ4=.sha256). 


![open-space-board-summerfest.jpg](&Pek06RZuQ0uj3bBYLuvLu+V+Aj5HS93p9PTLpgXRBTY=.sha256)


I've been to a couple programming related events like this and they were aawesome and filled with unexpected gems. Hallway discussions result in unplanned talks later in the day about topics people want to learn about. 

-----


[@kas](@RuNxm8SRujPcJx6GjtTQHp6hprAFv5voEkcvoAkB8Pk=.ed25519) [shared a link](%lmNrtELRy62j15cwR+vBbam5zwBuACDxkGyGh81GjhU=.sha256) to the Data Terra Nemo talk May 17th and 18th in Berlin, Germany.

> Data Terra Nemo is a technical conference for hackers and computer scientists focused on distributed and decentralized systems.

There are lots of interesting speakers including at least 3 folks from the Scuttleverse.

-----

[@Mathijs](@OP9jTRHgk3T999VOhWNAJOBVqAoyhTaTmT5daKBqH8s=.ed25519) shares that [Sol Nascente](https://solnascente.eu/) has just had their offer accepted on 2 hectares with a house in Northern Portugal.

>We‚Äôll have to close the deal within 3 months and want to buy as a cooperative, then build sustainable houses there and live in/with the forest. We are currently with 2 and are [actively searching for participants](%MDQDEUUU6yL2wEUyERWtoe7QkXh+uxJp27ZU+YuHe5g=.sha256).

Maybe you'd be interested in helping this endeavor.


## Geeky

[@peg](@vEJe4hdnbHJl549200IytOeA3THbnP0oM+JQtS1u+8o=.ed25519) [shared a talk](%QXdscpaPnr4oHBdQSpSfOfpl16n6dbsZ13L+kGUnEuI=.sha256) where Daan Sprenkels "...explains how his implementation of shamir‚Äôs secret sharing is secure against side channel attacks by using bit slicing (among other things)."


![sprenkels.png](&dQEgU9xoSBG1v2bIfg+SJUlL75+8o23pn0akum6TqVs=.sha256)

content.text:
[@catweazle](@sJPNsXXmsCGlUAkuw/9qeYkeJOHoIjaKQlS7lifok2o=.ed25519) shared [a recipe for liquid (and hard) soap](%gzT35KCL00RHx0iSPLh0eF+dGT12NU+HMZsNeKipLOw=.sha256). 

They also shared [a recipe for Campfire Bread](%Au1AMC9GSrW6ISC514XHga+kSy7B4LcLgYhxzQvB99k=.sha256) (otherwise known as twist bread).


![campfire bread or twist bread](&MPQo9xL3VVOsJhc8fd2hSxtDXte+tb+m9MyB+s4Bfy8=.sha256)


## Software 

[@arj](@6CAxOI3f+LUOVrbAl0IemqiS7ATpQvr9Mdw9LC4+Uv0=.ed25519) have been making some improvements to Patchbay's control over what pubs you connect to and how you connect to them.


![patchbay-settings.png](&IwCeMcYNhGnRh09CVfsG8haP8wBal0JkFOWixrtAON0=.sha256)

In upcoming versions you'll be able to tell you client to _only_ connect to pubs that you have previously friended (typically by using an invite code), and / or pubs that are within a certain number of hops from you. You'll also be able to only connect over [Tor](https://www.torproject.org/) if you want some additional privacy with your in-transit data.

The Tor functionality does require you to have a Tor daemon to be running in the background.

For those who are wondering "Why should I care?" the reasons (paraphrased from Arj) are essentially:

* Not everyone wants their current IP address to be known by random pubs they are connecting to.
* Not everyone wants to connect to random pubs that might be doing who-knows-what with their data or running malicious code.
* "I wanted to make pubs a more integrated part of the social graph, instead of just a bunch of random pubs that you connect to."


There's additional info in [the thread discussing this](%2UHfNP9XpBR15PVNaucXRtiEA7InF8SAHLthAYmKXTs=.sha256).

----

Multiple updates about Cabal (distributed chat software) via [@cblgh](@C6fAmdXgqTDbmZGAohUaYuyKdz3m6GBoLLtml3fUn+o=.ed25519).

They note that [@nikolaiwarner](@h5/KMVFHxJBoPXdKEZmmaSLctWDeNsjOzsfI5rejtQo=.ed25519) just released "a slick new desktop client called [Cabal mini](https://github.com/nikolaiwarner/cabal-desktop-mini/)".

> A minimal desktop app for Cabal, the p2p/decentralized/offline-first chat platform.

![cabal_ mini screenshot](&vA6EeqBcFpIiwZVVZlUZmfOTV3PbOOqWKgKpjDSzQFs=.sha256)

Also, "the main cabal has hit a replication bug that seems to affect big cabals with a lot of history."

You'll find more details on that, and the discussion of adding moderation, and mobile delevopment in [their post](%x947rBLK9YEGJWO2dz8zxQ5ZKNMYfLGYsE5d9TOQaNE=.sha256) and the thread it's in.

----

[@CrypticWyrm](@pcWEoTxwHQGYRkI+vn1ac6EEW5C9uelPokfd8ARKaJE=.ed25519) dropped [a quick note](%PPDW6zVnidhqTMBh0fk2AtwBN4JPWz1hOTxdr6s7C8o=.sha256) that not only is their interactive fiction tool getting a decent amount of interest it's also available on DAT.

content.text:
## Community
A new person said hello this week and was promptly pounced on in a rather unpleasant manner by someone. I'm sure it wasn't a very pleasant first impression for someone who dared to share some sensitive personal info, but the community rose up and tried to work with the offender and explain why we didn't think their claims were appropriate.


While dramaful, it also displayed a lot of what makes this community wonderful. Afterwards [@noffle](@C3iYh/12sO1uvKq1KcZXLFxSySzxOkHxXN8rtNB5MGA=.ed25519) posted about "the rando problem"...

> What do you do, as a community, when someone starts hijacking threads to spew hate & harm?

[The thread discussing the rando problem](%qtDzPEm9UeVsCsY/YwmnIx7eZfQikRRfs5XapauMiwM=.sha256) is worth reading if you're interested in helping to find a way to mitigate these issues in the future. 


Inspired by that  [@cblgh](@C6fAmdXgqTDbmZGAohUaYuyKdz3m6GBoLLtml3fUn+o=.ed25519) "...figured I would share a bit about what my upcoming thesis will be about. I will be doing this to finish my MSc degree in Computer Science." Lots of interesting [thinking about moderation](%S7o0Po12MrzZY97+MJZyVI0bGf5ob1O5wYTs4rSet08=.sha256) in their post.


----

> What is the best image sharing practice here? No one is sure still. A lot of people don‚Äôt want shit taking up space on their computer. - [@Angelica](@eANNuLfzX/9rlGODXHYV8WJb+zw2h+d7YsT4vpYPvD0=.ed25519)

Having no real answer they [decided to create a DAT zine with their recent drawings](%/7oFkRySwl5nzdNXiNkU988qHPx3ixZw9n+13qzSGCc=.sha256). 


![tengui-sample_waves.jpg](&NydV78izVKD9txQLNDp8ZFhJkJIFgSQ3pnorEgV0V74=.sha256)

Maybe we should try and come up with an answer for that, or at least a plan for having the software better handle the unbridled number of downloaded image files on our systems.

----
The Handshake council is [looking for someone to write a monthly newsletter](%JI9IhVuYP9aqL04HFLi5UgMlLAqPPBNoISQxZ/yChjM=.sha256) "about progressa nd events occurring in our ecosystem." Details are in the thread and the application period closes on February 27th 2019. This is paid work.




## Geeky


[@Matt McKegg](@FbGoHeEcePDG3Evemrc+hm+S77cXKf8BRQgkYinJggg=.ed25519) shared their progress getting Patchbay to run using Patchwork's sbot, which means you'll be able to run both at once. More details and instructions on how to do it yourself are [in the thread](%/AkNUS0N1JV8TeYeJy6rjCHB7kShSenzHnD+bJXfKGA=.sha256).

![picture of patchwork and patchbay running on the same sbot at the same time](&SK/1JWeg5bQgT1ogeTwc4rLsfJ+4ha3b4ThqI6BU6zM=.sha256)

----

[@happy0](@RJ09Kfs3neEZPrbpbWVDxkN92x9moe3aPusOMOc4S2I=.ed25519) has started [trying to bring ssb-ooo functionality to clients](%tgFBOgb15nHb5bCHmupSSPGmR64FdpGNK8ez9deZBAU=.sha256). 

> As a first step of introduction ssb-ooo functionality to clients, I was thinking it might make sense to build a ssb-backlinks-ooo module which wraps the ssb-backlinks read function (with the same function signature) and behaves the same but also adds ‚Äúout of order‚Äù messages to the ‚Äòlive‚Äô stream (messages arriving after sync) if the client has set ‚Äòlive‚Äô to true. This way the content in the thread the user already has loads quickly, and ‚Äòlive‚Äô newly incoming messages may include any messages that would have been missing otherwise (due to lack of follow distance) if the user is connected to peers that have the messages.

# Recent Days in Scuttlebutt

## Totally Random


[@Chromodoris](@XY261NcgFjgLXVsnZbeIPGdA8h+6U4VNLErQjvHXDns=.ed25519) shares [a lovely sunset](%PealQiNphp6+1jfD44gfYCgSGneddCL2ffXsL6s0eY8=.sha256)

![Solnedgang.JPG](&SCd5/uhryrYjqjKnfSxRjxPMF8o9AHnz+o8OQ3+vtdU=.sha256)

----

Scuttlecamp!

[@Piet](@U5GvOKP/YUza9k53DSXxT0mk3PIrnyAmessvNfZl5E0=.ed25519) shared [photos from a literal playground of scuttlecamp
folks](%CKyiQtvGIc9YkXhdC41z4vm0SMvNw8Htyen6t2mI+Yg=.sha256)


![scuttlecamp people playing in playground](&Tkzrqr6Ui0RwmAIxNbI7M3Vut72Ap1/iQebH4wBo0lI=.sha256)



![scuttlecamp participant swings on a rope swing in a playground ](&P4yu7Ab0A1Y5pgb9/logSDZvcyoEtNp8UCS9jCQDlwg=.sha256)

who had previously stopped to smell the roses


![scuttlecamp people stopping to smell the roses](&eqTa1XyZPWr0PrPE/eHs9+vVTLSvi1HGqvFC+O26GYY=.sha256)

There are many more photos of many more people in [the post](%CKyiQtvGIc9YkXhdC41z4vm0SMvNw8Htyen6t2mI+Yg=.sha256).


[@Teq](@CxnSXWYjPT160y7QbmTFtWaWT09080azgErYPt1ZeZc=.ed25519) shares  
"Some loosely-connected ssb-research reflections from scuttlecamp day 1"

> One theme from my experiences at #scuttle-camp from this first day is, unsurprisingly, the excitement people have expressed to me about seeing people known from interactions within the scuttleverse (however conceptualised) in 3D: experiencing the differences between people‚Äôs personalities in digital-space vs. meat-space; the ability to communicate on multiple channels at the same time; quicker feed-back loops and multiple serendipitous connections; the option to converse in multiple languages ‚Äì language switching as relevant to the participants of the conversations; the ability to share space and physicality and learn about each other in ways that are much more difficult in asynchronous conversations; and the reminders of the momentum that the energy of people congregating can generate ‚Äì and the path dependency of that.

See [their post](%cf5zGh5as+0PsmMSCiRQDmSSGTy9tY+kYaqC1RA841o=.sha256) for that and more.


[@Piet](@U5GvOKP/YUza9k53DSXxT0mk3PIrnyAmessvNfZl5E0=.ed25519) shared [a picture of "all"(?) the campers](%hLhNMksptjCxNi+B77DHrYEu26jDTrqgGsfb1+NvuWA=.sha256).

![scuttlecamp participants group photo](&ZBjB10qDDJOiiEawiCzqCLbCFsFcvcvdwzNhyGtIgd0=.sha256)

----

[@Christian Bundy](@+oaWWDs8g73EZFUMfW37R/ULtFEjwKN/DczvdYihjbU=.ed25519) is proposing we try and get a new emoji created for the world to use. 

>  [I‚Äôd love to work with some other scuttle-friends](%Y0V/f2Aq/umM0wuV9Sbvu4hGnRtFMMyc2b1x4jx33Yo=.sha256) on proposing an emoji zwj sequence for a sun with smiling face with sunglasses.

Basically it's just a set of instructions to combine the sun with smiling face with sunglasses. Many emoji are created this way, and this particular image has a lot of history behind it.

## Software


[@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) and  [@happy0](@RJ09Kfs3neEZPrbpbWVDxkN92x9moe3aPusOMOc4S2I=.ed25519) managed to hack together...

> Scuttlebutt‚Äôs first ever replication feature over Bluetooth! 


![picture of phone showing manyverse bluetooth seek feature](&XfuskP2yIeS2WFH/xfpnK+MsVY0cr34O3D8Xi07n6gM=.sha256)

Details in [the post](%KAVHRCOs3/UxeCqh53fS0dRHFGDcxPXw7i3QeowCGX8=.sha256) as well as a link to the announcement post.

----

[@SoapDog](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519) started [a thread listing all known SSB clients](%JptnDFqz7cDwMlIKvcImJKNqmh0Dr1ASAUK/zn7kIDw=.sha256) (even incomplete ones) along with screenshots. There are still more to go. Please take a moment and add your favorite client / pet project to it if it's isn't there yet. 


----

[@ev](@8Qee0I/DwI5DHSCi3p5fsl6FyLGArrnDz3ox9qZr5Qc=.ed25519) accidentally
added support for nested replies in threads to mvd. It's not in the repo yet, but I for one am excited to see this feature spread.


![screenshot of mvd support for nested replies in threads](&gK5U9cLkSBg63XmYPdCqfAy5FcefAJGKc9CPXH/qpic=.sha256)

[Their post](%7txrdBX0M01Bj69WqMZ1I+oIgprDLXAjCl1gIDU6QUo=.sha256) explains how
it came about, how it works, and some problems all clients will have in supporting it.

----

[@gb](@ya/sq19NPxRza5xtoqi9BilwLZ7HgQjG3QpcTRnGgWs=.ed25519) [coded up a prototype version of SSBList](%35QsgAL/xHn37ZYn+W+5aZw3XkEiMT98wM5Z6CUk/yQ=.sha256) with the help of others and it's now ready for general poking.

>  It‚Äôs a way for you to list things to buy and sell, and it‚Äôs early days for the project. Please give it a whirl, ask questions, give push back on how it could improve.


![ssblist prototype screenshot](&QjzbQMyL4YBzNNWiqjOWbR/mgLU8mc64iyZIr5GlrhI=.sha256)

----

[@Schuyler Erle](@Aj30ftcGjrxufcB7xfGxlyTb+SswXacEsPjC8I8I3XY=.ed25519) shared a post about "[How to install a Pub](%AL3MRnc5eCafWLaye05is3NBpBNyps45ZhkNgxiwG3U=.sha256)" on EC2. 

Speaking from experience, if you don't know that EC2 is, you probably don't want to go down this particular rabbit hole. 

If you want quick and easy pub creation with minimal (but still some) geekyness required I'd recommend [@dinosaur](@6ilZq3kN0F+dXFHAPjAwMm87JEb/VdB+LC9eIMW3sa0=.ed25519)'s [ssb-pub](https://github.com/ahdinosaur/ssb-pub#readme) droplet for Digital Ocean. 

Note that both of these Pub installation methods result in a pub where invitation codes are generated on the command line by the pub maintainer, not via a web UI for random people.

## Software Community Intersection


[@dan hassan](@NeB4q4Hy9IiMxs5L08oevEhivxW+/aDu/s/0SkNayi0=.ed25519) put forth a "[Tentative Proposal](%dydmy72ljD8kl89tx+VDIhOmcjcuFPQape+P6/bZCjE=.sha256)" for improved image captions, which will definitely help with vision impaired folks as well as offline folks who don't happen to have (or want) an image downloaded yet.

Your feedback is requested.

----
[@dan hassan](@NeB4q4Hy9IiMxs5L08oevEhivxW+/aDu/s/0SkNayi0=.ed25519) also shared an interesting used of existing SSB. They're [repurposing gatherings to create private todo lists](%HAf1WhTP+Mglv/XpcOsbpQDZ/Z2bK47Pus26JZRl5Xs=.sha256).


![screenshot of repurposing gatherings to create personal todo lists](&1gpP9+mQpglbWaD8Yyw//NU+gEIjpKCzi3ivsiDwDsM=.sha256)



## Community

[@dan hassan](@NeB4q4Hy9IiMxs5L08oevEhivxW+/aDu/s/0SkNayi0=.ed25519) proposed that the Handshake council should [fund a fundraiser](%jSxCJaX9H/Xspk6kqpNgPaGQd6LGeuLmjhhb2zcGV2o=.sha256).

> On SSB we have many people who are excellent at grant writing. This is just one skill connected to one source of funds. A different skill set is that of marketing/fundraising.
> 
> I think we could carve out funds for a fundraiser and this could potentially unleash more funds than the cost of fundraising AND it could free up time from various people.


----

[@polylith](@0nakXtVIodBfdHwRQLVb64p54jTWS+DFHRqg58ky4CI=.ed25519) is [starting a monthly email newsletter](%MxXsqAvfL81w76luxd4Zl4A2T0hhz/ceGtap/YuktVw=.sha256). 

> "...about land and memory, persistence and repetition, walking, imagination. About finding home and sticking around, about giving ‚Äúheart and tongue to stones and trees‚Äù, as Peter Grey puts it. I‚Äôve been walking and digging and writing about these things for a few years now, and I‚Äôd very much like to share the ramble with friends."

----

[@Greg K Nicholson](@JoiN9c9+xO0jgu0gg5yflTf+L1peLTBneFHjrKbmcKo=.ed25519) [shared a link](%KuGJ/F08s5J3BM1JWrl2Rfcjapmk0+4+73/855tJdpo=.sha256) to "NB ‚Äî a podcast about non-binary gender, by non-binary people, from the BBC" 

[Podcast download here](https://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/p06y51dp/episodes/downloads)


## Geeky

[@Justin Abrahms](@fhHAV9+vk4pGf4uePLDSR/KxppwcBbu1t/tXuQwiA5o=.ed25519) coded up [a prototype of an HTTP API in Go](%mUfeHG1oHSLTiZ/f+EUtl2fryYoR6qftTasVq3IjNNU=.sha256) "so external front-end developers can more easily contribute to our ecosystem." It talks to an sbot running locally on your system. 

From my perspective as a coder who isn't interested particularly interested in Node.js this is _huge_.


----

[@cameralibre](@UhORGzAhEE3gqy/pH5vK+EgbpZfnyYvdI46TVBJH6Mw=.ed25519) documented [a discussion about bridging DAT and SSB](%XVrdlc6VR0ZuadGe15qKn516jCcX9IjivnqJZnY9+6w=.sha256).


![people gather around an outdoor table to discuss bridging DAT and SSB](&1/WzwLDA6D/Hm0Ul2K8YxSb/moBih4pQmWtHdjWeEYo=.sha256)

I'd definitely recommend reading this if you're at all interested in how these two technologies might play together better.

If you want to see more of it, be sure to drop them a note and let them know. Without your feedback it may end up being email only.

[@realisation](@RHCdibs1o7RnEOxHFq7TfDn2RXHC2yeQh7CyK0tAJyc=.ed25519) is [creating a musical instrument by combining a phonograph and a polygraph](%VbQ4YCWPedfxWkvvjO8mCBqIPU0Ln8XzU/ArfFjrpyY=.sha256) for their next experimental music performance.

----
[@SandyG](@+McycRyGFiTqEL/mBlu0/RkdBOebqdOFySqCOEjwKx0=.ed25519)'s Soda Machine rebuild project has made [some nice progress](%QW2F0pyS9m2YCYdsxft60QKpE9896kdSS3BsM7RFzOs=.sha256).

![Old CocaCola machine](&1Gnw4tpfdY+rWHSjKlDqWhCL0sJVafjcCt2IF3EHMO8=.sha256)


## Software
[@christoph@verse](@8Y7zrkRdt1HxkueXjdwIU4fbYkjapDztCHgjNjiCn/M=.ed25519) shared an update on [their work on a prototype iOS client for SSB](%HgZ1xhdFfrgA3FUuokQCJvpL9Zxb0mwOGekGsv59g08=.sha256).

![ssb ios client prototype screenshot](&jbU/wnCljd2y9XYKz3t0OTZ3h5SzOFBd/zOzddbNBso=.sha256)

----
[@Christian Bundy](@+oaWWDs8g73EZFUMfW37R/ULtFEjwKN/DczvdYihjbU=.ed25519) made [a tiny little SSB client called ssb-compose](%ecV0znfx9WfNUdWi5w+nQpP9tRONK0W3raBg4v9/9GA=.sha256) that just lets you post, but also gives you a realtime preview of the rendered version of what you're typing.

![screenshot of ssb-compose, a simple webpage with a markdown input and output and a publish button](&EdMspWjCSf+j3SJjTM7FZpuPBMVPxmPZ5H/EwfcsvbE=.sha256)

Requires knowledge of how to use NPM to run. 

----
[@kieran](@MpDd66GPXgN1+eMNrZInHkWq1THMurWwLdMx8BZ1ncw=.ed25519) says 

> Im interested in stories from people who have used or are using Dark Crystal to find out what their ideas for the role it could play in the ecosystem and what that looks like (visually / aesthetically) to them?

Add a note to [the thread](%vxojos+vKMlzdRagF5lWBAoCZS5XdvbrFN0gMdvtMjc=.sha256) or private message them if you have some.

content.text:
## Community Software Intersection

[@Dominic](@EMovhfIrFk4NihAKnRNhrfRaqIhBv1Wj8pTxJNgvCCY=.ed25519) is looking for
JavaScript folks to help improve Scuttlebutt's code documentation. 

> Do you think ssb documentation could be better?
> Would you be willing to help (even a little bit?)
> (also, to prototype a process for village-issue-tracker)
> 
> The idea here is to build a simulation of the process without writing code,
using [HackMD](https://hackmd.io/), direct messages, and possibly a spreadsheet.

[The post](%aNaZqnsO0bhsn7FXDLDy8uQkgINU4WXj7JWcRSQ+AtU=.sha256) has more details,
but this will require some familiarity with
JavaScript code.


## Community
[@DreamClassier](@7TyLAjOwe7FDN2s1mE3An8E+we7ZHjKXXQpvzPB+0q8=.ed25519) put together a post entitled "[Gossip Is More Than Just A Good Idea](%tYDhppQ9zOM2xp4DojdGcfpk1TB/uceyVE3wrxFn6hg=.sha256)" which is an intro to how "Gossip" works on SSB. It's for folks who aren't already here.

> It‚Äôs a recruitment effort for my other social media presences, not for this one, and many of my other audiences require the gross oversimplification.

----
[@Teq](@CxnSXWYjPT160y7QbmTFtWaWT09080azgErYPt1ZeZc=.ed25519) put together a post that combined a number of discussions around "[The Rando Problem](%hZcr0T/9AbxPt/fqOw6IvLUJlzUPmRbKwMKOjy8vnFw=.sha256)" and explores the following questions:

1. In your life beyond Scuttlebutt, what does it mean to be safe?
2. How do we keep people we care about from getting hurt?
3. Which users get access to what feeds (and how does this impact their sense of safety)

----
[@dan hassan](@NeB4q4Hy9IiMxs5L08oevEhivxW+/aDu/s/0SkNayi0=.ed25519) [asked the community](%8n3j4+X8cRhDyitpFTMMX0qZuIsL5YhPVY+h0aY3YFQ=.sha256) if we thought that possibly receiving more funding from the Ethereum Foundation was a good idea.

> TL;DR should we apply for funding from Ethereum Foundation to do integration work between Ethereum and Scuttlebutt where the effects will be unknown. We are hoping for your help in thinking this through. Just because we could, might not mean we should

----
[@dinosaur](@6ilZq3kN0F+dXFHAPjAwMm87JEb/VdB+LC9eIMW3sa0=.ed25519) "...[hosted a support group for core Scuttlebutt developers](%B1ZgTyZrFrfNZVSCjf3ymYw2O4zGQqVq4GqJ/WrfQrY=.sha256) [at scuttlecamp] to vent their frustrations in a safe space...we took turns sharing our horror stories from our experiences in contributing to the Scuttlebutt stack...we‚Äôd drink every time someone said they thought something 'should be easy' 



## Geeky

[@Aljoscha](@zurF8X68ArfRM71dF3mKh36W0xDM8QmOnAS5bYOq8hA=.ed25519) put together 

> "...a boilerplate for writing a single-page ssb application with the choo framework. It asks the user to select their secret file with an html file input, and then connects to a locally running ssb-server via websocket. The credentials are saved in local storage."

Here's [the full post](%HKjBP83pWWkBTCgb2puzr7rAC5a3P9y2R0t19PButZY=.sha256)

# Recent Days in Scuttlebutt

"...just want to write a quick message to all Scuttlebutt friends in New Zealand to let you know you‚Äôre in my thoughts. This is such a terrible thing to happen and New Zealand [is] such a wonderful, open and friendly place.  I can‚Äôt imagine the shock you‚Äôre all in." - That [and more](%o1eufWfidXWvv5aL43pFnlALH0oNFnGJ1nS3TUJSQnU=.sha256) by [@Tom Coates](@7A2ZxHX+WyIVezulnt0FogzeUVWLq3YHmtX3r7ja4Fw=.ed25519)

## Software
[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) shared [a very cool progress "bar"](%NGdVLWh4rb01VSJyt6GxvJ5UMudO3KxX0ADfcnLSJJo=.sha256) whose future iterations will end up in ssb-ahoy.

![hexagonal progress bar](&ktObdjsbVO9eC9zhzrTY6LDa9Xq573AS19ZSFTFH1v8=.sha256)

[The animated version](http://localhost:8989/blobs/get/&G0L3iBjwEP1rC+K0yfcT0HVHs4gZnsDqwPuo8nlQVO0=.sha256) is even cooler. 

----
[@kieran](@MpDd66GPXgN1+eMNrZInHkWq1THMurWwLdMx8BZ1ncw=.ed25519) says 

> I‚Äôm undertaking a rewrite of the Dark Crystal interface as we upgrade to the standalone. Its always been a UI / UX challenge of how to display a shard?

and describes some of the requirements for the task. Got any ideas or helpful thoughts? Share [in the thread](%SRB87obMYNowcKPyuJ1RvlAqotAPJCY1aVFLC5wqCws=.sha256).

----
[@gwil](@PEqxT8YRvrkf2fyjAgTl8pmdo8aR4KVsKLyh0b5JyOE=.ed25519) is getting close to the Minimum Viable Product stage of their "domain knowledge tool", and [the beta testers are using it in unexpected ways](%Tedur+MiBaQUv0NQ+yGTC7/L5lrqYP/Zkqx2+Zu4UmE=.sha256). 

![grocument screenshot](&IEvvj1ETjpqFoPzCr8ZXjXRr+bkHZq5lujQeGxgqx2E=.sha256)





## Community


[@Alanna](@6OxffMLNyxkboLjCqv29WnMPhH8O3qFrcXCR6KrKcPI=.ed25519) shared a post [summarizing the costs and profits for Scuttle Camp](%MaqZlasc13dv4ru0mV5KLfUO8MpR/XhgI6rnaksszEM=.sha256). It's interesting if you're curious how much it costs to put on an event like that.


![a scuttle camp participant jumping off a rock into a water where another person floats](&dugvuTix2qeO/7yACPR/pfRmD6B1h3jKpPEhUUSZH2U=.sha256)

-----
[@peg](@vEJe4hdnbHJl549200IytOeA3THbnP0oM+JQtS1u+8o=.ed25519) shared [their thoughts on the "Rebooting the Web of Trust 8" event](https://www.weboftrust.info/). 

![a person draws sketchnotes on a large sheet of brown and white paper at the rebooting the web of trust 8 event](&t1UPPI4S/S0MIL0d9RMgLxDypwsTuUm24qzr9wNdms4=.sha256)

----

[@dan hassan](@NeB4q4Hy9IiMxs5L08oevEhivxW+/aDu/s/0SkNayi0=.ed25519) suggested that while budgeting things were still being figured out within the Handshake Council, it was clear that they were planning on funding core devs and [maybe a partial payment should be sent out to them](%vfgrjr8i27SRLyu1Pu3dbBHl4Ano3SUscnlepKzdhIs=.sha256). There was further discussion involving how developers are identitifed and timesheets and stuff like that.

----
[@Richard D. Bartlett](@3r4+IyB5NVl2in6QOZHIu9oSrZud+NuVgl2GX3x2WG8=.ed25519) shared some [Upcoming Workshops in London for Decentralized Teams](%UbEPmqrGXpcoSNjUO2FdB3echQDILwvUJq+Qgq3V+HU=.sha256).

----
[@cameralibre](@UhORGzAhEE3gqy/pH5vK+EgbpZfnyYvdI46TVBJH6Mw=.ed25519) is a Mozilla Fellow and shares that they are currently accepting applications for new fellows. If you're an Open Web Activist, a Tech Policy Professional, or a Scientist / Researcher looking into open source proctices and principles you may want to [learn more and consider applying](%ZwZAU8oPkv7Zs6v4r+qUXAVJjJjt1ZO9O2Q1axfhUkM=.sha256)

----
The votes are in and [@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) has announced that [@nanomonkey](@+D0ku/LReK6kqd3PSrcVCfbLYbDtTmS4Bd21rqhpYNA=.ed25519) [will be the new newsletter writer](%1ckE8JH9EASvEsli5om5S38CKmzlB2VK5ajLlxl+rYI=.sha256) for the Handshake council.

## Geeky
[@cel](@f/6sQ6d2CMxRUhLpspgGIulDxDCwYD7DzFzPNr7u5AU=.ed25519) [shared some graphs](%TXSXbnWXXr1hAfzllA9Pc+2DCivhkYJH92+x4+hUME4=.sha256) of the data in `~/.ssb/ebt` 

![graph of ssb network growth over time in terms of number of feeds requested by each peer](&DP4B9fY53jd3rfFOISscZ2u2eJQnNOrUETEoAdspG9k=.sha256)


> So this shows the growth of the network over time in terms of number of feeds requested by each peer. It is biased to the right since it includes only the latest size of the vector clock for each peer.

----
[@keks](@YXkE3TikkY4GFMX3lzXUllRkNTbj5E+604AkaO1xbz8=.ed25519) shared some notes from a "[Friend Graph Call](%brvHL3U+Iv9P2ltp6gpAoqiPxR7iwMIYZntboyP7TlY=.sha256)" which had the following agenda:

* Names for Relations
* Add special ‚Äúinf‚Äù maxDistance
* Example Graphs/Visualization
* Default Values
* Changes to the Experience of Outsider Nodes
* What Format Should We Use for Publishing?
* Open Questions
* message types and schemes?
* space complexity?
* do we run the same algorithm on both the authorative and informative nodes?
* Starvation problem?
* What Next?
* Next Call



----
[@elavoie](@IgYpd+tCtXnlE2tYX/8rR2AGt+P8svC98WH3MdYAa8Y=.ed25519) is "...trying to [understand the resolution of concurrent edits to a gathering](%ZPhda6VbBaTYkfooi+azBFd8SdOkWs2ti2vQTjUA2b4=.sha256)."



----

[@cameralibre](@UhORGzAhEE3gqy/pH5vK+EgbpZfnyYvdI46TVBJH6Mw=.ed25519) shared [how to make a SVG "line-drawing" animation](%awf8/cd95TAMGYN79YGygpHpCids16c4p9S3TAEoRAY=.sha256). 

![animated svg showing the words "sure you do" being drawn](&TdM7Mq5ASuX2/u2alkqQwxJ5m46kdc+z5NwYeXsDwNM=.sha256)

----
[@SoapDog](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519) notes that 

> [The new Patchfox built with hermiebox is taking shape](%DBIQrheQyEsOUAyjkwZh2vU/rRyzh8nPNxFh61mN/ck=.sha256). It is a completely static ordinary JS WebExtension that uses only things that work in a browser. There will be no need for NodeJS or any form of building system to contribute or fiddle with the add-on. Right now, it can launch, connect to sbot and even fetch the top 100 messages.

![screenshot - patchfox loading messages with javascript console on the right](&JjvOQrbf48A67sJiucb01kgzgdgukdhZJe8U1erMmoc=.sha256)


----
[@ev](@8Qee0I/DwI5DHSCi3p5fsl6FyLGArrnDz3ox9qZr5Qc=.ed25519) is [getting closer to the next version of %mvd](%YiCf5WdQIRT44x/VVBE0lYIoRzqaw1jEIBrLccOm/GY=.sha256). Apparently mutable messages are the main thing left to refactor and finish. 

![mvd screenshot showing threaded replies](&3XDfPmw/fZ+lCGbSm586O7Rj8DPWFehch1uzgNdCl/c=.sha256)

This weeks banner is wearing a black band in memory of all the innocent folks slain by hate in New Zealand.

Bigotry can not be allowed to fester. We must speak up at every opportunity, to protect the rights of _all_ people. It's the one thing we can all do.

![the weekly - curated posts from the scuttleverse](&Q9wEqKM6UtKmMpI+W17MuwTSNTQpEtSnLvTFrgVI5EE=.sha256)

# Recent Days in Scuttlebutt

My apologies for the delayed post, my friends. Hopefully the future shall not involve any more complications finding time like the last couple weeks have.

...


I'd like to take a moment to give a shout-out to the [@Current Events](@wNmXqk80DL4FrBjzZcYqbKs/SpsPv6MVX6BLICabPfI=.ed25519) feed.

If you'd like to hear what's going on in the world, but don't want all the political :fire:, you should follow it. It's pulling the daily current events page from Wikipedia into the Scuttleverse. 

## Totally Random

[@Luandro](@2RNGJafZtMHzd76gyvqH6EJiK7kBnXeak5mBWzoO/iU=.ed25519) shared [a series of pictures](%W6vt1QzT+GlXZeNWcEYuzgxFZtVE1yycEtZKqckPKs0=.sha256) showing the lush greenery that still surrounds their house as autumn sets in. 

![flowers by luandro's hay house](&MJmG7rzkHlqwCZMrozhnX15uoZGPqiy+0UouXh1rcz4=.sha256)

----
[@maged](@QJhUSvmaAmqTE+kREYpFqSFeUN13lanMGQg38jmyDqU=.ed25519) shared a photo from N√ºrnberg, Germany

![canal in N√ºrnberg, Germany with arched and covered stone bridges](&ZU2LbnMx1uWjne2X6kEdQacXwiQL4dB8tBZFOF1b7Gk=.sha256)

----

[@zelf](@3ZeNUiYQZisGC6PLf3R+u2s5avtxLsXC66xuK41e6Zk=.ed25519) and [@Kiba](@Ki1+80ZgpEFCv1Pny2ipdepo3QRBdmXn0wbsibQmp8U=.ed25519) are on a quest to use their distinct visuals (in Japan) to become "...[instafamous in Japan](%eAnu3teuK8PDHWwdnCKW071AUkA6rGm5tZwOndpoSHQ=.sha256) in 1 month." and spread the word about distributed webs, solarpunk, decentralization, digital fabrication and assorted coolness while they're at it.

content.text:
[@polylith](@0nakXtVIodBfdHwRQLVb64p54jTWS+DFHRqg58ky4CI=.ed25519) shared [volume two of their monthly newsletter](%AR/lbEL1AxxrJAVDF6J0PtnVARBWn5va9TYX33Bedq4=.sha256).

> I savor the strange perspective standing out in the middle of a frozen lake, which presents infinite possible passages in all directions like the spokes of a slowly turning wheel. It‚Äôs a perspective I don‚Äôt get swimming, and certainly don‚Äôt get aboard a boat. But now that the spring flux is underway, my ski-tracks from that passage are melting away as I write this. They‚Äôll soon join the deep lens of cold water supporting the ice-disc as it breaks up, and none of us will have access to that perspective again, not exactly, until late next winter.

![A black and white photograph of the brink of a high bluff overlooking Lake Michigan. Blades of dunegrass bend in the wind and pebbles peek from beneath a thin layer of sand. In the background is the wavy surface of the lake, and in the foreground is the blurry face of a dog in profile. They have seemingly wandered into the frame just as the photograph was taken.](&jJNO96/xT8kTKckFzP/vEFHmQmBz5DTHz17KddGL/6s=.sha256)

----
[@ragnar](@aOOiECEYKzWWqJsILa17+tuuJTr8Sr2W6eRd/7BoCB0=.ed25519) shared some [really interesting research involving flatworms](%SyqJhCNMpQfv7rTWhgddQEGYPj9FGgBscVfAeLzMbeM=.sha256) and the question of where knowledge is stored if not in the brain.

![two-headed-flatworm.jpg](&m45XTUGmvyPGEdcyT+dZjd03ruFlnKxmEGCFyfhJmnk=.sha256)



## Notes for new folks

Videos on SSB. You don't see a lot of videos here on SSSB. Mostly you'll see people posting screenshot of a YouTube video and linking out to the video there. The biggest reason for this is that everyone has to download and store all the media on their computer, and videos can be huge. You don't want to fill up all your friend's hard drives with large files they didn't ask for.

If you have a tiny video to share, you'll need to use a slightly different syntax than you would for an image:

```
 image -> ![description here](sha hash here)
 video -> ![video:description here)(sha hash here)
```

For example, to embed this video...

![video:sample video of animated bunny coming out of hole](&8lsx8VWXDEYwCTS9pKds0vWBrKtFxJdigy/9/dvPn90=.sha256)

you would say

```
![video:sample video of animated bunny coming out of hole](&8lsx8VWXDEYwCTS9pKds0vWBrKtFxJdigy/9/dvPn90=.sha256)
```

## Solarpunk

[@Eb4890](@iGLjxMHlCW94tu/lEB8woc7AG2dNCzLY0KsebX+x2Iw=.ed25519) shared [some thoughts about smart/micro grids](%JLXMaiWemcsApCyPQw4dEKP3dt6z8jqspDyq2AOXfdc=.sha256)

> I‚Äôve been looking at energy projects that try and help with adoption of renewable energy. Grid management seems to be a big issue with less controllable renewables and storage.
> ...
> I‚Äôve also been quietly thinking about microgrids with @dinosaur‚Äôs trailer park idea. Can you hook up a bunch of trailers, electric cars and make use of their storage and solar panels well? Perhaps with a wind generator as well?

## Software

[@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) has [released SSB Mirrors](%OkwWfFxyjuZzhNrDTxL7WxUvP4Of5fX4CflD5wAeVHI=.sha256). Tiny little pub servers that _only_ replicate _your_ content.

There's some interesting discussion in the thread about the implications of such a thing.


----

[@yi](@oPxaLdSL/bB1IwYjYfg0zcCyy0u7IzD9VlaVPR7beoM=.ed25519) has been making progress on their Decentralized personal bookmarking tool called LocalNative

![localnative-desktop-v0.3.8.png](&/wVxrLS8lDBdqboH+l+TnI5shTH8d1z5AJ6DVgmpFSg=.sha256)

> Maybe the biggest drawback of not using a centralized service is losing the ‚Äúconvenience‚Äù of everything synced on every device.

Maybe the biggest drawback of not using a centralized service is losing the ‚Äúconvenience‚Äù of everything synced on every device.

yi has a solution for that. [Check out the post](%oyXhH+NxI3kKh975I7qXAXClvr1AfoPaDNngpfFajDI=.sha256) for more details.




## Software Community Intersection


[@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) shared a [Quick FAQ about Manyverse and its relation to the scuttleverse](%ncl8fds6GogbDlpHC1O7jzTVHvGpwe2LQuvJJ8enA7A=.sha256) which includes info about the future of Manyverse on the desktop, Android apps that don't compete with each other and more.

----
[@dan hassan](@NeB4q4Hy9IiMxs5L08oevEhivxW+/aDu/s/0SkNayi0=.ed25519) notes that 

> The funding that we have for Dark Crystal from Ethereum Foundation ended on March 4th. This marks the 2nd unknown financial position this affinty/project of people have faced since the projects genesis in September 2017.

They shared [the report they put together for the Etherium Foundation](https://hackmd.io/s/HJpEfRpPN) and the post goes on to talk about [what's next](%UXYdJs7ssEqo1t8dtC3L3n4LqE2vEw3uC4C59sPWZBc=.sha256).


----
[@elavoie](@IgYpd+tCtXnlE2tYX/8rR2AGt+P8svC98WH3MdYAa8Y=.ed25519) has [an interesting proposal for developers doing contract work based on SSB](%SP4kn0Yux8ubildnW3SA9238E2Te/AAXEt5Vt8xukS8=.sha256).

> I would suggest that those that succeed in landing such contracts [voluntarily] add a clause, as part of their rate negotiation, for additional donations of 10‚Äì15% of the negotiated rate to SSB‚Äôs common pool... This would serve as paying forward the infrastructure and community work that went into enabling the infrastructure to reach a level of maturity that enabled the contracts in the first place. 


----
[@dan hassan](@NeB4q4Hy9IiMxs5L08oevEhivxW+/aDu/s/0SkNayi0=.ed25519) is trying to get a feel for how many people have used Dark Crystal. [Have you](%x8wiIu2Gm1FbL3CYe5LY4v1fNpOzXFWJ4AbXh46Dwe4=.sha256)?

## Community
It looks like [@Luandro](@2RNGJafZtMHzd76gyvqH6EJiK7kBnXeak5mBWzoO/iU=.ed25519) is about to start working with an anthropoligist / fillmaker to build a mesh network (with SSB) for an indigenous Brazilian community (the Kayapo's) with no internet access

![kayapo](&DW7nc29u/FeLBtWg5DAPuTTTkuU/5nGuOnKVt9inhcI=.sha256)

> We‚Äôre going to do a first prototype for one association, but all three have shown great interest, and they would like to reproduce it on all 90 villages, if everything goes right.

![kayapo mesh](&1+OyCLmWsT+CDFsRZFtF7AP9jNGUpibsa2V54YHKgN4=.sha256)

More details about the project and the network [are in the post](%tRXIdEOhhPhMf8ExbjsAquFPsLubCAyeGOi791QyDEQ=.sha256)

----

[@Ed Summers](@n2ax/dvrm+u76UhEv6aN0MzlH0Zw7o0MOd5QIHjouSw=.ed25519) was thinking Decentralized Web 2018 could be [an interesting event to have some scuttlebutt presence at](%55mpIb8nrP8PnitbL+/bDfHSSvnplGYn6cl9aiuc4GU=.sha256).

> The Internet Archive is hosting a community-built event: DWeb Camp from July 18‚Äì21, 2019. Or come early and stay late if you want to help build the camp with us: July 15‚Äì22, because that‚Äôs when the fun begins. DWeb Camp is all about connecting: to your deepest values, to the community around you, and to the planet. Can we come together to imagine and co-create the technologies, laws, markets and values for the societies we want to live in?


----
[@Joey Hess](@BCM6DHYJvWzwWi1lFl2tjDXjaqyZAEmJH5ZONSpXhtc=.ed25519) 

> Was just [interviewed by the LibreLounge podcast about ssb](%6/c/lVj3srrEHX6b+tywpzsZOhgQICgW823JWQb8X2I=.sha256) and related concepts, should be an hour long episode released in the next month or so.



----

[@dangerousbeans](@TXKFQehlyoSn8UJAIVP/k2BjFINC591MlBC2e2d24mA=.ed25519) [pointed out that](%VAjo+xAon6h820dd5pzkL3uRsiauD3jU/VoTFC1nTXU=.sha256)...

> NZ and Australian internet providers have started blocking archive.is, voat, 4chan, liveleak, zerohedge etc in response to the Christchurch attacks.

Obviously companies censoring free speech without any legal instruction is something to be concerned about. It also shows just how amazing distributed systems like Scuttlebutt are. There is no web site they can block to shut us down.

To me this just emphasizes the importance of getting our friends on SSB _before_ they find themselves unable to communicate with the people they care about.

----

[@dan hassan](@NeB4q4Hy9IiMxs5L08oevEhivxW+/aDu/s/0SkNayi0=.ed25519) proposes 

> ... [we set up a Gitcoin Grant](%RYr4DG0g3mfQy3yj4cu8U0geS0ooRNKXV1ZytBxnLNY=.sha256) and offer to match fund whatever comes in from the Ethereum Ecosystem. This would then also be matched by Gitcoin up to around 10k USD. Based on past Grants community raises like this they‚Äôd expect something in the region of 10‚Äì20k USD (inc the Gitcoin Match).

----

[@Alanna](@6OxffMLNyxkboLjCqv29WnMPhH8O3qFrcXCR6KrKcPI=.ed25519) shared [a copy of the lovely speech](%Rice2G8ZZN2A7uVOi8QZqS1Q9QnD3/p2H9J4okS7iPI=.sha256) given by New Zealand's prime minister after the Christchurch shootings.

![New Zealand's prime minister Jacinda Ardern wearing a head scarf with hands clasped](&xCAhBUChlKIUH4h/osmFQc2MP9EzxpN5tKOyohLUjIM=.sha256)

----

[@Teq](@CxnSXWYjPT160y7QbmTFtWaWT09080azgErYPt1ZeZc=.ed25519) built on the discussions in scuttlecamp and put forth the proposal that... 

> we should sign the paperwork to start an Incorporated Society for Scuttlebutt in New Zealand (NZ) (using standard rules with one change to allow for asynchronous meetings) that could be modified later by a majority vote of members.

They [went on to clarify and fill in a number of details](%R2Vmkoh7ODUxYdDTUAGqeu9ZvwdNZ/r9UTyRzMLC9wk=.sha256).

content.text:
[@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) wonders, "[Could metadata could be your copyright?](%WDnAEfWn3F958JPG32ab7ZIMcCozGiHubasu+KJFp4s=.sha256)

> Some time ago we contemplated how copyrighting your SSB posts can be a way of defending your personal data, either from data mining companies or individuals who misuse your data. Quickly we noticed that it‚Äôs tricky to claim that your posts are your copyright, because if you happen to copy-paste content elsewhere as your post, as if you said it, then that‚Äôs a violation.
>...
> So a recent thought I had is: what if you waive your rights (CC or public domain or some disclaimer) over the post contents, but you claim copyright over the message cypherlink and cryptographic signature?



## Geeky

[@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) spent some time [discussing what it would take to fully suppert SSB replication over USB](%PRh6SaoRN4at2RKQ207tTvTRiyJUVAXZjmcB8brip7c=.sha256)

> We‚Äôve spoken quite a couple of times about SSB replication over USB, for sneakernets. In other words, it would require packing a local SSB database into one file in the origin computer, then in the destination computer, the file could be unpacked/consumed to update that local database with new data, if there are any.

----
[@Christian Bundy](@+oaWWDs8g73EZFUMfW37R/ULtFEjwKN/DczvdYihjbU=.ed25519) says "...I‚Äôve finally got [a super simple same-as implementation working](%CRxZR8PmT+etS6c0osbfQPv1/ZcrbTKQzezeSR43sns=.sha256) in the existing clients (as a plugin for ssb-server)." Which is pretty amazing.

----

[@Christian Bundy](@+oaWWDs8g73EZFUMfW37R/ULtFEjwKN/DczvdYihjbU=.ed25519) also started a discussion on "[When should blocked feeds be deleted on Scuttlebutt](%p9lmpwpWCT5GiNYejJDntM8fyBff+t4+TfVUEKq1EKY=.sha256)?"

----
[@cft](@AiBJDta+4boyh2USNGwIagH/wKjeruTcDX2Aj1r/haM=.ed25519) shared some thoughts and conversations resulting from [a talk they gave at IETF](%WrTLoVRy+uLUsGmEysx7fTrZZUJObyyFPd+VGS/s0+k=.sha256). There are a number of notable things in the post for us geeks but I felt that these two quotes were the most notable:

> Some did not follow (as they told me afterwards) while others very clearly saw the ‚Äúthreat‚Äù to the canonical ICN model that the receiver always has to pull, meaning has to ask for getting every single content piece (log extensions, in our case) while Scuttlebutt works by pushing new content unasked, if a receiver is in the FOAF distance...
>
> Dave, who has been around since Cisco was founded, is a very strong supporter of append-only logs, but rejects that a push concept can be made to work. I already had it in my slides: his point is that all multicast attempts of the last 30 years have failed, but this is exactly what Scuttlebutt needs.



----

[@tk](@Z2rNu9oinC9LzYPcaaOjEELE7pImbQnKu2mbCzBmsN4=.ed25519) has put together the beginnigs of [an SSB client written in Kotlin](%v0mhHmLZS2+80K3BDSEWU87ZJxx/2e1kjHzAuf8iijQ=.sha256) called Quilt. [GitHub Repo here](%v0mhHmLZS2+80K3BDSEWU87ZJxx/2e1kjHzAuf8iijQ=.sha256)

content.text:
[@dan hassan](@NeB4q4Hy9IiMxs5L08oevEhivxW+/aDu/s/0SkNayi0=.ed25519) forked a thread and discussed the [Semantics of "forking"](%hCd/BMyHocJL6VOYHGLH8dvruXTwOdTRmCO1T10h5+0=.sha256). 


----
[@aramiscd@t530](@d5XKy5Oox4P0vEzB9sAyNChIwyMU5qHH+N2Swvei4iU=.ed25519) has been [spending some time playing with Ygddrasil](%QezH2vdGN+tgE9zAAlc3JwhKyBKojJBZhHGBSTy0CWA=.sha256) 

----

> Last weekend I installed Yggdrasil on my laptops and servers. The whole week I had a big smile on my face. No NAT anymore, no VPN, no fiddling around with reverse SSH tunneling, just simple end-to-end connectivity in a flat namespace. Being online is now synonymous with being reachable.

They've also put together [a blog post](https://yggdrasil-network.github.io/blog.html) to "...provide a good picture of what Yggdrasil is and does." 

----
[@Aljoscha](@zurF8X68ArfRM71dF3mKh36W0xDM8QmOnAS5bYOq8hA=.ed25519) posted "[Arguments Against Fork Recovery](%EwjVUh1q4VqiO0xKF31juhndKAjknTO68CcyHdeNIKY=.sha256)"

> tldr; Arbitrary fork-recovery invalides some of the most basic guarantees that both applications and humans rely on, to the point where ssb becomes unusable. If you want multiple devices without same-as, go for mutual exclusion instead.

[@Aljoscha](@zurF8X68ArfRM71dF3mKh36W0xDM8QmOnAS5bYOq8hA=.ed25519) also started working on [Building the Pavo Programming Language](%4YgCw65KkFlRmryWPusvgWGHY69AEFN4AqXkwVSPV24=.sha256)

> I have a design for an interpreted programming language in my head, and I want to actually code in it. Unfortunately, it first needs to be implemented, and implementing a language is a lot of work. So to keep me motivated, I‚Äôll post updates on the implementation journey in this thread as I make progress. All code is up on github, the implementation language is rust.

----
[@The Writer of Posts](@K/Ipk1KeB20CT6+toD9CNexjgC9oR9yxp5RzZx+uO5M=.ed25519) Made a Python project that

>... pulls a website off the web using mercury-parser and then does some processing with BeautifulSoup and stores a bunch of #ssb-blobs, converts the post to markdown via pandoc and then returns a (hopefully) valid blog message which can be piped into sbot.

[Details here](%li9uOcFSAonVGByi7RPPWo/KFj9kaeY94XD1AlrKvwI=.sha256) as well as a link to the source code.

----

[@David Wales](@S8P2cAzZ7DkP5j6T7RjVa9GXhkLAnoz9q3tY6Ja60+M=.ed25519) wondered "What if a single Scuttlebutt identity could write to parallel append-only feeds distinguished by namespaces?" They then went on to share [their thoughts on how such a thing would work](%WGy8A2rvxkuFbYziFtwYR5utjlah77R5PZO4LVSXZUE=.sha256)


----

[@rabble](@vzoU7/XuBB5B0xueC9NHFr9Q76VvPktD9GUkYgN9lAc=.ed25519) shared a paper on "[Co-ordinating Developers and High-Risk Users of Privacy-Enhanced Secure Messaging Protocols](%d0F9zN3JvMlSpFwCWo6Z6HCMJfKT7fhdGzpztHFEOG0=.sha256)"

> This paper is really interesting because the authors did extensive interviews with activists and marginalized communities who are trying to use secure communications systems for organizing and group communication. This is one of the communities that came up as a target user base for #scuttlebutt at the #scuttle-camp.

-----
This week‚Äôs summary was curated from 1189 threads by 345 authors by [@masukomi](@LzTjF5eAVC6xprPMGeNzqEP/EEBIGpM6hDaaY10hrz8=.ed25519), **with the support of my lovely patrons**, and my wife who saw how much help I needed curating all those posts of yours. If you'd like to help continue this creation you can [become a patron on Patreon](https://www.patreon.com/the_weekly).

# Recent Days in Scuttlebutt

## Totally Random
[@Taeyoon Choi](@W1o0EvTFWz6rOxHl0QYuhWnCYpJ3/lnm1ZuSgUy2kQo=.ed25519) shared [a student creating soundscapes](%5eRncUvjHdUU5upM/CYw2pI9hJhN4JkZdZSNgCZ9uFs=.sha256) during Distributed Web of Care. 

![Filip Wolak by Taeyoon Choi](&g3+fiupx/tlTy7ghz4eMoaF9Cp3K8S215U6A05LK7Ws=.sha256)

----
[@SpencerHadley](@pMMUGwiEuuU1WKTQlby9SM/wkY4s0VKLqZ+P+Wmewpc=.ed25519) decided it's time to be [working out in their yard](%Nn9Lt7FAS8Yc6vFbVFu0IMcSIIZH3yA+zuvwsD8S23I=.sha256).

![a garden with four raised beds, a wheelbarrow, a wooden fence, and some trees](&ozqVKOCzkFkIfrEmkABvzStcY2tIe/jAcFF2R0dj3Rg=.sha256)


----
[@Chromodoris](@XY261NcgFjgLXVsnZbeIPGdA8h+6U4VNLErQjvHXDns=.ed25519) found [some pretty blossoms](%d2CkxwG5ClqTDg7gqLDL1qbBngmAFppSsPxerhMWLIY=.sha256). 

![Aftenblomst cherry blossoms in the light of a setting sun](&QYD3mA5RY+TNsx9izfPbOE/OQ+wJTUzb3u69mprC6RA=.sha256)



## Notes for new folks

When using Patchwork you'll frequently see a number of of "connected pubs"
on the sidebar that you never intentionally connected to. In response to a question about them [@cel](@f/6sQ6d2CMxRUhLpspgGIulDxDCwYD7DzFzPNr7u5AU=.ed25519) made a post [linking to a number of posts about what those pubs are and when its ok to stop following a pub](%NMqKEIZ1I50Lvh2pbZEKRk5Wtc7G5NmeHrVfmbZtNR0=.sha256). 

![screenshot of connected pubs sidebar in Patchwork](&CYKnWC7BZ6b0cpPiJ3mH4qncREGyYnz8ZpZ7B1+yg+8=.sha256)

## Software

[@SoapDog](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519)'s been making progress on Patchfox after the most recent rewrite and it can now load messages and avatars. The post is a bit geeky. For the non-geeks, just know that nice progress is being made.

![animated gif showing patchfox loading avatars](&AgWsgvtfaRacM5QEKf5LmkSAHib+3lj0KLBQ5HnzBPA=.sha256)



## Software Community Intersection

[@dan hassan](@NeB4q4Hy9IiMxs5L08oevEhivxW+/aDu/s/0SkNayi0=.ed25519) [shared a link](%SrzbTlAU2t8AwnQAq2ChxDNBmtxT1MNs/ETnyHDzGUo=.sha256) to [Proportio.onl](https://www.proporti.onl/), which is a tool that makes an educated guess at the gender of the people you follow on Twitter and those that follow you. The goal being to make sure you're hearing from a diverse set of viewpoints.

----
[@befree](@j/eCgqDoTsp0SDzPYDNQh486qKYN9qu8Bzaye5foXQU=.ed25519) shared a poster about Baob√°xia [they presented in S√£o Paolo](%TFm9rpbQsjG3cl9TStUIV1knBVz7g2Kfo7RN2WLwHjs=.sha256). It's "an afro-indigenous, eventually connected, digital media network"

![Baob√°xia BBX poster](&ye/6nPpSUhcjlujDipd2WxXtqGKDZJux5dfm9dIvtUU=.sha256)

content.text:
----
[@cameralibre](@UhORGzAhEE3gqy/pH5vK+EgbpZfnyYvdI46TVBJH6Mw=.ed25519) shared [a curious side-effect of Patchwork & Patchbay's decision to hide replies from people blocked by the original poster](%ax6kmib4LhDU4MmD5/hO6M5Mi/eKd0mV/036K2+5I9Q=.sha256). The person's posts can be there, and be responded to, but then disappear (in the thread) when they're blocked, but they're still being visible in the blocked person's profile. 


## Community
[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) shared [some thoughts on the concept of Cobudgeting](%sW3EmoeHwPbg5OCQQLI1x6tTSzEQc/nClDXjfbHSA+w=.sha256) and how it changes people within a group as it gets used. 

----
[@elavoie](@IgYpd+tCtXnlE2tYX/8rR2AGt+P8svC98WH3MdYAa8Y=.ed25519) posted a [Proposal for the most recent Handshake Council budget](%zmv8Fvm3a7qnAVBs2O7se5JlJXqsrqjBZwB88/Bv8DQ=.sha256) and [later pointed out](%9PIGxL3mK061cdtLnOWIB5zqj+wyEp/0owtkm5D4y7c=.sha256) just how much work [@Zenna](@3ZeNUiYQZisGC6PLf3R+u2s5avtxLsXC66xuK41e6Zk=.ed25519) has put into bringing that budget together.


## Geeky
[@cel](@f/6sQ6d2CMxRUhLpspgGIulDxDCwYD7DzFzPNr7u5AU=.ed25519) shared [some ways to detect if your feed is forked](%DDG//eBz8Lao9mvjDiDh5/f9lo+G94y7Nxb5uWmI9SM=.sha256).

They later shared some "[Limitations of patchfoo development](%5s5Zczlef3Ml8gKqIAhCktu6euwpRCEaXxcTWq7eJ+Y=.sha256)" and some quick thoughts on how to improve the situation.

----
[@kas](@RuNxm8SRujPcJx6GjtTQHp6hprAFv5voEkcvoAkB8Pk=.ed25519) discovered that [WebP image format seems to work just fine here](%s1S5G3/7lARrCK0koJArncTNm3UW3FU/0QYqj3I022I=.sha256).

----
This week‚Äôs summary was curated from 294 threads by 113 authors by [@masukomi](@LzTjF5eAVC6xprPMGeNzqEP/EEBIGpM6hDaaY10hrz8=.ed25519), **with the support of my lovely patrons**. If you'd like to help continue this creation you can [become a patron on Patreon](https://www.patreon.com/the_weekly).

As this is definitely more of a "how do people think it should work" type of problem you should check it out and leave any notable thoughts of yours.

content.text:
After contributing many many hours of effort to Patchwork's evolution [@Matt McKegg](@FbGoHeEcePDG3Evemrc+hm+S77cXKf8BRQgkYinJggg=.ed25519) is [stepping down as its maintainer](%O8KbkRi4BfB/bnBHqhu9HDL775Al/rMa8vI3ikgNpng=.sha256). But, have no fear, they're going to continue to contribute to the future development of SSB. They'll just be doing it in rust via the #sunrise-choir effort. 

This also means we have need of one of you wonderful JavaScript devs to help fill the resulting void. 

----
[@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) shared [some nice news related to funding the future development of Manyverse](%5oOWWSk6+qge7cD4ZvaCsLcxTgzHsj5AIlu2z4AYggA=.sha256).



## Community
[@elavoie](@IgYpd+tCtXnlE2tYX/8rR2AGt+P8svC98WH3MdYAa8Y=.ed25519) put out a [community vote of confidence on the handshake council budget](%SdIiDBvmZQLvysPXmoFNKIOb4MIO/breYoPj7YMUECo=.sha256)

> The main reasons I think we need such a confidence vote are that: (1) many Council members are leading projects that are funded from the Budget, which can potentially create conflict of interests in the decision making, and (2) Council members decided how much they themselves should be paid for their work (and how much I should be paid for facilitating). So the current vote serves as a community counter-power mechanism to ensure that the Budget still serves the community interests and the remuneration of Council members is reasonable and in check.

----
[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) shares that  they just had a call [discussing the upcoming Dweb gathering](%E4oLXLj/gJwVspTK0XXytJZPr3xSLzwCf8deV/p01Ro=.sha256)

> The main goal I heard for the event was to support transformation - to bring change to the dweb movement, because we need to be challenging ourselves to think and build differently (across disciplines, involving many more cultures and groups). This is obviously a goal that‚Äôs strongly aligned with diversity and inclusion. I‚Äôve heard about the work, thinking, and relationship building Ben and Wendy have been doing over the past 4 years.
> 
> They‚Äôre currently looking for sponsors who‚Äôd like to support diversity and inclusion.


----
This week‚Äôs summary was curated from 173 threads started by 93 authors by [@masukomi](@LzTjF5eAVC6xprPMGeNzqEP/EEBIGpM6hDaaY10hrz8=.ed25519), **with the support of my lovely patrons**. content.text: üëã hello [@__snype](@frcHbBInzAq9Xyy1erGfpSYkqBziTI3YeS0NbwVqgHA=.ed25519)

I wish I understood better why there's such a vast difference between the German's understanding of the privacy violations / spying all around us, and how clueless most Americans seem to be on the topic. Also, what we could do to help Americans to "get" it. They _know_ these things are spying on them but they don't seem to understand why they should be concerned. 

[@rusty](@lShKH/7fpHh+b4sk2WLP8aU3E/XCPLuNpa+gBshwa1I=.ed25519)

> Doesn't employment protection imply some sort of constitutional protection too?  - [@ktorn](@z8aJVHJTc6MM8FwaNE2GIS3AYYt2HYFNWQUO8/iydNw=.ed25519) 

In the US you can have laws that aren't part of the constitution. You can also have state level laws that offer protections that the federal laws don't. In this case many states offer protection against employment discrimination but do _not_ encode that in the right specified by their constitution. You can also have situations where the state laws legalize things that the federal laws make illegal, which means you can do something that the state and local police can't arrest you for but that the federal police can. 

Also, keep in mind that offering new laws doesn't necessarily make old laws invalid. I'm fairly certain there are states in the US where you can't discriminate against someone who is gay but where sodomy is still illegal. 

Mostly though, keep in mind that laws that offer protections are usually _not_ encoded in a country's constitution. Changing a constitution is usually _much_ harder than enacting a law to offer some more protections.
bah! posted that under the wrong account. My apologies to anyone following [@The Weekly](@iVPi/B73hJSpsUB8XbSnlxe3NembPXLjOfIexlYdgJA=.ed25519).

content.text:
----
[@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) has been thinking about [How to prepare for climate breakdown?](%WsLloD2TVbzhxn+WmEphGMHLDJKt0lFrVuH6KKFaMoA=.sha256)

> In the most optimistic future scenarios, the climate will still not go back to a pre‚Äì1950 state. We‚Äôre basically at the point of no return, this is a reason why scientists say we live in the Anthropocene. It‚Äôs important to acknowledge this so that we don‚Äôt fall under the illusion that we can fix the climate. There is certainly something that we can do to mitigate the effects and prevent even worse scenarios, but there‚Äôs nothing that we can do to correct it to pre‚Äì1950 levels. We are living in a different planet and I‚Äôm interested in how can we adapt to this new era.

----
[@VI](@enYnrAbM4s4BVadGY7VC0suQ48QitTkE4PlQYTtNT+4=.ed25519) [shared a writeup](%Rgw0wSp8s61e3otBaCiMukKXkqxmSX7vmY2li+X8CiY=.sha256) of their workflow when working offline. Alas, you'll need to be online to read it. It's broken down nicely into comments on a variety of different tools and techniques and is worth at least a quick skim if you're interested in improving your ability to work and enjoy the internet offline. 


## Software
[@rabble](@5fYRrgyJON0r0R9SPrK0oxR1XKhqNXqiN0FBX+MgfH4=.ed25519) shares [an update to the work on an iOS client for Scuttlebutt](%/2lVw5KwAmmTRKvCew3BiZpm9vTVj5N2Tdl1btvcUkY=.sha256).

> Here are some of Tom‚Äôs designs as we work out how our interface will work. In particular we‚Äôve broken out a message type for ssb which is more chat like to put under the messages tab, and we‚Äôll let you see normal posts types, encrypted with a private box, or public in your main feeds. We‚Äôll show in the posting and viewing interface if the content is open to the public or encrypted.

![iOS / iPhone SSB client design mock-ups](&nW6HDb/1eeX7wO3d6I2s612Vt9gywvT1L2rIV1AX5nw=.sha256)

----

[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) has [added the ability to use pub invites in Patchbay](%s7uoqEv01Ka8DVjNz5TIxITay52As09zQI8W6S7EQwQ=.sha256). This is currently in the `master` branch and will probably be available in the next official release.

![patchbay pub invites](&yFHg9hWAqEBn3IGN7T2SDDmi6pUV9SZLf/1tYe3RMsQ=.sha256)


----

[@glyph](@HEqy940T6uB+T+d9Jaa58aNfRzLx9eRWqkZljBmnkmk=.ed25519) has just published their first [update on the PeachCloud OpenCollective page](https://opencollective.com/peachcloud/updates/march-2019-update).

![peachcloud on raspberry pi black and white](&4IGDTwuZ1rYj+ixsU2NHNjiXP5k9UwGmJsJSIhkHt9E=.sha256)

The [SSB post is here](%9J5xUqKvfLoAJjk+7tDDeK3j5YIDA0sirkzx4oTdqAc=.sha256).

For those who don't know Peachcloud is a project to let you run an SSB pub from a Raspberry Pi.

content.text:
[@cel](@f/6sQ6d2CMxRUhLpspgGIulDxDCwYD7DzFzPNr7u5AU=.ed25519) shares [some thoughts on why pubs shouldn't go away](%vOVOwGpkYILd8vXEmtkDKVnKtS8f0LFtgHWu5k8XUzU=.sha256), and "...some good properties of the current SSB pub system. The main thing is the way they enable decentralization."

They later built on that with a post about the [Evolving roles of pubs](%XOUlIjd2S0x2HrEJ9mdqQAE/jDHc20WcoTWVnxUSrCY=.sha256) and one about [Alternatives to public pubs / open invites](%t7betL49CVz6M9vBJiAwc53XAgyJ/VgfNQzhr9rQrD8=.sha256).


## Software Community Intersection

[@Christian Bundy](@+oaWWDs8g73EZFUMfW37R/ULtFEjwKN/DczvdYihjbU=.ed25519) proposes putting together a [Patchwork Working Group: Skeleton Crew](%IO6G84Tz7zocMTWX3wQqFtUfOV8BYtVqWfm9zuhWWLU=.sha256) to take over the maintenance of Patchwork now that [Matt will no longer be doing it](%O8KbkRi4BfB/bnBHqhu9HDL775Al/rMa8vI3ikgNpng=.sha256). 

> I‚Äôd like to continue contributing to Patchwork, but I‚Äôd really like to share that burden together with others who are interested in keeping the project alive. I don‚Äôt want anyone to feel alone or stuck as the One True Maintainer, so I‚Äôd like to form a working group that supports the basic needs of Patchwork and its users until Patchwork becomes obsolete.

## Community

[@Hamiller](@LZSw/izhW0O1VA1ptApOEQovM2U1//8ThdJNsfDqePQ=.ed25519) [shared an interesting post discussing](%DgoOt59a2GR00EHUylAGfHTHWmlJZsUaETgN4BbstlI=.sha256) "How do we regulate the internet?" and the need for a "well-informed debate" on the related issues. 

----
[@hugi](@qpUlHepf9682x9Yg8Vav1ZVz5NB7e7ZM9i8Mzi6AnwA=.ed25519) followed with a post discussing "[What does it mean to build a human-centric internet](%i9lrvJMBD46bjBYRhHRQlwUeI51CbFdWd2ohA92o5F0=.sha256)"

----
[@jer](@uf3kajfhBC2Sd3OysKB5LnBLJ5pwgBhBpXnGEGzgG6A=.ed25519) spent some time writing about [the value of "ownership"](%lssApXICTBqFPhD092ah4wxVVOrkE9jqfinRlhibiD4=.sha256) as it relates to leadership.

----

[@keks](@YXkE3TikkY4GFMX3lzXUllRkNTbj5E+604AkaO1xbz8=.ed25519) and company are inviting folks to [join them for some scuttle sessions](%riUfE65JdGmjxXZrT5O6eDs+6+WDmQdYRJDym8RPvEo=.sha256) after [dtn.is](https://dtn.is/) in Berlin Germany (May 18-19).

----
[@Mike Dank](@5u6NRxnuuG49KHns5Z7VKKfeKRkStNZsXn3Ph7Est/s=.ed25519) shared [the zine they've been working on: NODE Vol 01](%uOL9nh/6zpqKDo8tZkEQhU9e/D/RXVJQW6y921iNyAI=.sha256)

> It's 150 pages and full of info on building and understanding our decentralized world!

![picture of physical edition of NODE Vol 01 zine](&ZyQI2lCiRRD/dpThcWBJnp8QPr+DPa/ePTcoRySpI/s=.sha256)

## Geeky
[@shakesss](@80sEH0YfMhRFdErHzFz1penB3sqdrPFx7UEKiyZdhx4=.ed25519) is debating `async/wait` vs. using promises and `then` in Javascript. 

> I am wondering how other javascript scuttlers feel about async/await and other ES6+ features. A lot of them are awesome, but I also can‚Äôt help but notice large chunks of code in the SSB repos are written in a similar style that Ryan Dahl used in some of his earliest Node examples.

[Discussion ensued](%F9kbzxfpTlYteNEIpXN/SZPO9R9euCMR0ODipsRB7f0=.sha256)

----
[@cameralibre](@UhORGzAhEE3gqy/pH5vK+EgbpZfnyYvdI46TVBJH6Mw=.ed25519) shared [an update to their SVG-remixing project](%2iwx/veyecC/JUhYFSF0hrz0Mk794RNoAd8fK4OnqvQ=.sha256). Read on to see what this is all about and some of the problems encountered in its creation.

![cc hearts with flag colors in an editable interface](&GS3tALok3OgSw77m/oyWJraUqIe82s2GZ/ooFjQC+BI=.sha256)
