# Recent Days in Scuttlebutt

## A Note From The Editor
I've been observing a trend lately, where people write interesting posts and mention them here on SSB but post them on the web. I feel like, if you wrote it, and it's worth mentioning here, then it's usually worth sharing here. 

Cross-posting to SSB is totally acceptable, even appreciated. Also, it's nice to be able to discover, read, and comment on your stuff all in one place.

Also, it just feels wrong when those posts are about distributed offline goodness, and are mention, but not shared here in our distributed offline goodness.


## Totally Random

[@dangerousbeans](@TXKFQehlyoSn8UJAIVP/k2BjFINC591MlBC2e2d24mA=.ed25519) is [Using D3 to visualize ssb activity across a procedurally generated hexmap of islands](%IJQ7XbBRNS6mGSNERU1u/d+LPhG5gwBhZV/Fl96sBDk=.sha256)

![Dominic selfie on their sailboat in the evening](&G/QbxC2CZDmcBsTBM/tP+Une1TZjYpRWABalxZpcGcU=.sha256) very serious.


----
[@coopchange](@7lewTDDfN4viGYXD37y8y0x3IY1hyL9JDugnihhD6Rg=.ed25519) shared [a beautiful sunset and a link](%chUrgkODRI2xxexjD5DeA44w44vKnoTJPlQnrKNy5dk=.sha256) to a post about good podcasts they've found recently.

![dramatic sunset](&mLIdtwaZJVDJd6PJ5OYlCdeGPcf+Eoq/Hqq8J8jrn1w=.sha256)

They also [started a discussion on this topic](%66kO8XNTItlmyK4CvkUM+vecxXsatZCzBflXdj7iWis=.sha256): 

> I think we need a name for this concept. If your ‚Äúself-identity‚Äù is who you think you are, your other identity is who other people think you are.
> ...
> You don‚Äôt have as much ownership of your other identity as you do your self identity, because it‚Äôs a model in someone else‚Äôs head. But you can influence it by hooking into things that will give them a different idea of you.

----
[@Kathleen Marie](@GSuGLzJa8t3aJCLvs66Ekn7MXdr3yqCSzsd6z2iUEBY=.ed25519) shared [a recipe for Vegan Chocolate Chip Cookies](%S5OqBx79PS9+HR+XsLq55pFN3FTA1etFUWc7XpRMsB4=.sha256). As a result, I now want cookies.

It's called [Anthropocene](%z2WKJbdFoKnIKgG+bEepnS7W3XUTmdHvl1GXIwAT40k=.sha256) and the post about it [is here](%z2WKJbdFoKnIKgG+bEepnS7W3XUTmdHvl1GXIwAT40k=.sha256). Please note that it's still early days at version v0.1.0

## Software 
[@Darius Kazemi](@VRAbRs/uMR2qdfiRNx2+1XRXePjJ75suZAmhGYZihks=.ed25519) wrote a blog post about SSB, DAT, and ActivityPub and the virtues of each. They linked to it in [a post here](%EPn4u15LabunTBXBoALrMCDA7J7ivnWWjrY0cfFWD2s=.sha256).

----

![dat attachment in patchbay](&2YwIn3VLi5buxLf8Fr/7is77kZxe9KcNX82Jr4qf3kY=.sha256)

This is a _huge_ deal because it means we'll be able to upload large files to SSB clients and share them in a distributed fashion without filling up everyone's drives.


## Geeky

[@dangerousbeans](@TXKFQehlyoSn8UJAIVP/k2BjFINC591MlBC2e2d24mA=.ed25519) published [a new npm package called vue-ssb](https://www.npmjs.com/package/vue-ssb) which lets you [load up and use ssb-client inside vueJS in a web-based app](%laTluWD6Y2sXG3wCQHDSIpo6tmOMkgfBYL3Qc3nhOhw=.sha256).

[Cabal](https://cabal-club.github.io/) is a DAT based p2p chat system that's similar to Slack.

In related news [@endo / @ÊåâË±Ü](@a/g1UYTznmhfE1OQrU1/0sT3YM4TuYNxc6EtfFP1iao=.ed25519) will be traveling around central USA in June and is [looking for folks to meet up with.](%U3w5yQT+CMsWvBNZiIfzkPi2R2cLw1G/m1Hq0zADH4s=.sha256)

----
[@will](@gQ83w3hAacjlREmbndJN8qoXcZSCcwZxzA/gdRvYnws=.ed25519) shares some [reflections on years of writing papers](%0IkyYCoZ2EyZtnq33z8AIBzxwrirnSTTWHttJ6qMJaA=.sha256).

![Grey Crowned Crane.jpg](&CzG8GyPk+5/el+ItKh4WKT2Nk4xRu3qaqLbCDQBKIpg=.sha256)



## Notes For New Folks

I've seen a couple folks talking about or setting up channels for discussions about specific cities. 

Right now Scuttlebutt is a little over 11k people/identities distributed physically around the world. The highest concentration of folks is probably in New Zealand. Right now, you're likely to be the only one from your city in the scuttleverse. Even if there are other scuttlebutt people there, only _some_ of them will actually be interested in chatting about their city, and only some of them will be aware of the channel.

The takeaway is that it's currently unlikely you'll find anyone to chat about your town, because it's a subset, of a subset, of a subset of a very physically distributed group of people. This doesn't mean you shouldn't try. Just, don't be surprised if you're the only one until our network gets bigger.

On a related note remember that your city may not be the only one with that name in the world. Maybe name your channels by country and state/province? Maybe `#worcester-ma-usa`  (a city with ~185,667 people and probably 0 users of Scuttlebutt).

## Software Community Intersection

![crabmeet photo with zelf, hendrik peter, nad, ansuz, jonas, alberto, inte-anomalie and kitestring](&yIu0jpYkaEpQrfdQikmR0OKOePfGlo//Uunf4jh718Y=.sha256)


## Community
[@Marc](@CERhd71ZSvAWGbl60Ko7k8//3qMe5l39l6LP8NIItZ0=.ed25519) just read "How to Do Nothing (Resisting the Attention Economy)" and [shared some thoughts on it](%hlDgBRCSb3OFijzcXbTsVD6cYCxY2y91jHyZE0vdWG4=.sha256).

![How to Do Nothing book cover](&03gxgxJShgv0jo3UK+jLs8KV3Gzyj/pwMLoI/SPmxUY=.sha256)

----

[@Luandro](@2RNGJafZtMHzd76gyvqH6EJiK7kBnXeak5mBWzoO/iU=.ed25519) started [an interesting thread](%3H+Wa4ryYb7TE8QdcwS9tUphn7BN3hUeFd7dTVugry4=.sha256) on the "decolonization of information" and Cummunity-First Architecture. 

> From my personal experience, communities isolated from globalization are usually very resilient, both economically and politically... In order to decolonize the flow of information the whole stack of technologies used to communicate must be distributed as much as possible. Decentralizing responsibilities and power in every step of how communication happens will require re-thinking usual paradigms. Responsibility which was once in the power of a few for the purpose of exploitation, now has to be taken by the community, and distributed with the purpose, hopefully, of resilience and overall symbiotic balance of it's ecosystem and it's networks.

----

[@Marlon](@crbVSVKHkgEazu4loUi2j2DLbGMo0K444aAXUzKyMaQ=.ed25519) 

> Just got finished mentoring some local folks who are starting a small business. I was talking to them about why and how to start a worker-owned #cooperative and they had a perspective that struck me.

You can find their thoughts on it [in the thread](%9qBTwrub0tr4KNtIieEW+xSeUN2wYSe9a3XSbo6OcCA=.sha256).


----
[@Christian Bundy](@+oaWWDs8g73EZFUMfW37R/ULtFEjwKN/DczvdYihjbU=.ed25519) started a thread with a surprising amount of interesting feedback from [this little thought](%eLCz5shOYq3LwIKAay7cPj3TSeTdpl3afKqfmzsXfZk=.sha256):

> I‚Äôve been feeling super conflicted about whether I‚Äôd like to live in a city, and my thoughts tend to circle the drain until they end back at the same place: population density. Do you have any thoughts or resources that touch on the question of an optimal population density?




## Geeky
[@Eb4890](@iGLjxMHlCW94tu/lEB8woc7AG2dNCzLY0KsebX+x2Iw=.ed25519) is [working on phloem](%ehYqACZa8N6ABlTIOVcSBtjIV4PEhyWEgq4ZejbS3Ek=.sha256).

> So briefly phloem is about creating a p2p protocol for the control and coordination of energy usage and production. So when should your dishwasher switch on to make best use of your solar panel (or reduce load on the grid)...  It can be seen as trying to solve the IoT problem, in a limited domain at least.

----
[@Hendrik Peter](@Bp5Z5TQKv6E/Y+QZn/3LiDWMPi63EP8MHsXZ4tiIb2w=.ed25519) started working on "Tightbeam".

> After having used Patchwork, Patchbay and the Manyverse for a while (thanks @andrestaltz, @mix, @Christian Bundy and others for the amazing app experiences so far), It‚Äôs about time to start developing something awesome with all these fancy SSB Tools laying about ;)
> ...
> What if I could create a local ‚Äúhub‚Äù that collects gossip, much like the board-computers in spaceships. Collecting news-feeds, data, mail, etc. while a ship is in range of radio communications. And then share that collected information with connected devices all over the space-ship (A place where people live and work), or relay smaller packages of information forward to recipients further away‚Ä¶

They started a [dev thread here](%XUWSCZhIzRIfjEYffPdJNhmezQvAmecXtogj9Jwo5NM=.sha256).

![Tightbeam logo](&bIx05Ph5mDWC43ItcMn3OHXnuVtQOmg6erZyOYB4KWM=.sha256)

----
[@mulrich](@mucTrTjExFklGdAFobgY4zypBAZMVi7q0m6Ya55gLVo=.ed25519) [shared a picture of the world's first web server](%HBnxu1f93PSB/qjji3/ujkCSVSNRsY/OzgjaLcPHgso=.sha256) and a data tape containing LHC data. Now that I know it exists, I guess I need to vizit Geneva Switzerland to see it myself. 

![data tape of Large Hadroon Collider Data](&I7L7Nrj91rQCNXoCiS891ya6FTFhjOk6S8IGLE75tgI=.sha256)

[@Hamiller](@LZSw/izhW0O1VA1ptApOEQovM2U1//8ThdJNsfDqePQ=.ed25519) shared [the nutrition pyramid for information](%nHfVPPcugKwR/ItPh5BGs7AG28XZ+tB53fobQgAKZAI=.sha256)

According to Hamiller, he author of the article basically combines the "you are what you eat" idea with the information you consume. 




## Solarpunk
[@Paul Vincent](@rwPz425mJYhvnYFQp/UV/ZieceSoi15l62fXXEBGAG8=.ed25519) shares [excerpts from a discussion](%2ZFJOEik4Vpj0ubt/CXN12dhJoRKwGwq9iFhxXpXaSU=.sha256) about Jem Bendell's paper "Deep Adaption: A Map for Navigating Climate Tragedy" (which they link to).

The ultra-short summary being. No-one is planning for how to survive if  it's actually too late to address climate change, and there's some missing data that makes it seem that's even more probable.

----
[@dangerousbeans](@TXKFQehlyoSn8UJAIVP/k2BjFINC591MlBC2e2d24mA=.ed25519) is [challenging us to live carbon negative for one week](%TnEdNtKormPI4qcfJL70ATxFV0OcKDtrQB1YGbplM7Y=.sha256). 

> carbon neutral is no longer enough - we now have to adopt and spread lifestyles to live carbon negative

----
[@Ben](@v4k6JxSCT2PZQH3HlEhTIY3EkJqnofYFgXKpGzw1CDs=.ed25519) shared [an image of people using a dingy to get to their sailboat](%QkcYO7rmLP3HpuV6gBhi+BBmlhejLS9NEKMjwe8UsYo=.sha256)... in dry dock.

![adult and children using a dingy to get to their sailboat in dry-dock even after water subsides](&EqOdux31Kn8rJI7PaSpWdDAqj6hqTMYAg/J/Ojm9u6Y=.sha256)


----
[@JoweK](@XeP2o+FcSdb5YdTvt/nuYPU2PHJSSwRt+X2y8B2dK5U=.ed25519) shared [a picture and some thoughts](%fxRRPHoNYsGkvDXVWbS2H25+QzDOAnXQMAm0zcizwQQ=.sha256) on a multi-level flower bed they just made.

![multi-level flower bed](&v3j9O0xCssQWqXUv5eb4WTWL2SxuuvsP5KqpUH67FSU=.sha256)

----
[@Rose Hip Tea](@C+kve2atBHhUN5vfWPnrHzAkBb/Gn0p/JGwsenOHOfE=.ed25519) shared [info on Horse Chestnut](%r4Y3zuQ4KXHUezFXimbxK7sm4EOeK+A1q2bCghkWen0=.sha256) which they claim is "A Natural Saponin Resource and Washing agent" (for your clothes). They also shared a recipe for [DIY Tooth Powder](%JX+wmAC5cxAMlN/jdZ/7ZH951qUWjYcspG8x062G+MA=.sha256), and [hair wash](%n8k+QGB3ou686m7mHMhvXWUCJpfXwdqCQmh6LkJFnl0=.sha256), and [how to get rid of head lice](%c0W0etTQg830CFIPY9aqz+t2sFkKI199O5pUv01+30c=.sha256), and a number of other natural alternatives. 

I have no idea if these things are any good for you or your clothes but *shrug* They _probably_ won't hurt to try.


## Software 
[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) has [announced Patchbay v8.0.1](%2dNBdKJbEOByxdC/vaI0EfFSqR/YmCsYy+exdtjmuJg=.sha256)

> Patchbay is now launched with ssb-ahoy which allows you to:
> - edit your config before you start the app
> - choose / create identities

![ssb-ahoy v1 showing multiple identity choice in startup screen](&G5fyFwF4RqrsqovVMvqz0MwIt2aRd7qGQZfIM/wp7/g=.sha256)


And, as if that wasn't enough

> Up till now, we‚Äôve had a 5MB cap on scuttlebutt attachments (blobs). [@arj](@6CAxOI3f+LUOVrbAl0IemqiS7ATpQvr9Mdw9LC4+Uv0=.ed25519) has added support to add DAT-based attachments, which means the sky is the limit !

![large file attachments UI in Patchbay](&v5nfBFBoGxtxSfaKemGK8SROZqSWZLPlCFCnmUTyw5s=.sha256)

and more!

Check out the announcement for all the details.

[@glyph](@HEqy940T6uB+T+d9Jaa58aNfRzLx9eRWqkZljBmnkmk=.ed25519) notes that you can find details of the latest progress on PeachCloud in the [update on their Open Collective](https://opencollective.com/peachcloud/updates/april-2019-update). 

----

[@SoapDog](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519) shared [an interesting idea](%Z6xymHFMHLlUzYYO9vM/0Mp2BqFCpO7/o1bDoZv2oBw=.sha256) about how we could give SSB clients the ability to find out how close SSB Gatherings are to you in meatspace without leaking your location to other people.

They also shared some ideas about ways that you could leverage private messages to [turn SSB into a secure, distributed, personal data store](%7ZPyXQDejphk892xKm9Onf703w3h43zzXMtjnPrku2I=.sha256) with things like Diary, Contacts, Bookmarks, and more.. 

## Software Community Intersection
[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) shared some details of the money that has been [set aside for SSB maintenance work](%jEE51YGWLf7G62gtBssXMwFlNFm09TACmU0Gw8GGky4=.sha256). 

----
[@zilog](@rghV57pcgiaTWN6a6ZF++E5JFAcZMei1B5LhL4g5W4U=.ed25519) shared some [thoughts from their trips to Havana Cuba](%+fiUwEvlzNA64Mq4dCALxbS2ePYe3aTSJetvi1p7yEo=.sha256) where they shared SSB. 

![zilog in havana cuba holding a laptop and pointing](&nqBIgqsE+UOei+Jnfbk0PHEqoBpebpC66iqtp2/0S/Y=.sha256)



## Community

[@manni](@JSrjjJja0t6v2Lb8wQN3TPecpPMrdcOcOISsDe68dpA=.ed25519) says 

> I‚Äôve realised I‚Äôm way more inclined to respond to other people‚Äôs posts than just make my own. I think this is because I‚Äôm often unsure about which channel I should be posting in if it‚Äôs something kind of random and/or personal. And if I don‚Äôt post to a channel, it doesn‚Äôt feel like there‚Äôs any point posting it at all. Responding to other people doesn‚Äôt involve this problem, which is why I‚Äôm more inclined to do it ‚Äì‚Äì but it also takes more emotional energy than just blurting something out about my own experiences.

[A short discussion ensued](%x/H+nqIQNssOBYmf4JK9jZaWlmhQB326zxIXcqGSuc0=.sha256). It'd be interesting for others who feel similarly to chime in. Your sharing emotional thoughts about the apps helps the geeks who code this stuff tweak them to make them better for you and others like you.

---

[@moid](@Sur8RwcDh6kBjub8pLZpHNWDfuuRpYVyCHrVo+TdA/4=.ed25519) shared a post [talking about health care and the data you create, and sadly don't control](%6cm3l4qv/4KOYJoHhhjZKU2LY09Mp3fE6JHN8WU374M=.sha256). It's a US perspective but I think it applies in general to most countries. 


## Geeky

[@Dominic](@EMovhfIrFk4NihAKnRNhrfRaqIhBv1Wj8pTxJNgvCCY=.ed25519) has [announced the release of ssb-server@15](%6kJktFjKjGcknSBCoWJ8JnHzSfYie/8JjcjvREze2A0=.sha256). 

> ...there has been a significant overhaul in the help system. now every method and plugin supports `--help`
> ...before, the help output was too long to be useful, now it‚Äôs much more focused!

There are some breaking changes.

[@utunga3](@11eoGBzqo+79IbzXDNFmF3LTgpb3F9Vkxh6g0USRxHo=.ed25519) has created a gitcoin bounty 

>  to hopefully address the I can‚Äôt even get started doing app development for ssb on mobile / android stack because libsodium won‚Äôt freaking build [sic] problem that both [@luandro](@2RNGJafZtMHzd76gyvqH6EJiK7kBnXeak5mBWzoO/iU=.ed25519) and I are having.

[Details in their post](%2IzNwrVXT6muxj72GD4TdlGnUKV+cM4cJzX2vnc33xg=.sha256)

----
[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) is starting to work on Compatibility testing. 

> We need to know whether our different implementations of scuttlebutt play well together. As part of my maintenance work, Dominic has requested I work on a way to test different implementations so that we know that they‚Äôre playing well.

> In [this thread](%F0ePtbVPwWY5PaT77V6mKwvkQqgXh5EnHqHtIxeBbWo=.sha256) I am inviting people who are building & maintaining different implementations to help explore:
>
> - the details of this problem - let‚Äôs surface all the weird considerations, so when we think about how we might do this we‚Äôre better informed
> - what some of the minimal tests we might need to be able to pass



----
[@gwil](@PEqxT8YRvrkf2fyjAgTl8pmdo8aR4KVsKLyh0b5JyOE=.ed25519) shared some [updates from their ssb-patchql work](%DWqPmDm1olywJCZDUB/fjVY6Qs5nTqq+ieYjjunwgDA=.sha256).

> Recently @Piet added a whoAmI to get the current SSB user... 
> The `whoAmI` field returns an Author type, which means it automatically gets all the good stuff an Author exposes: name, follows, imageLink, etc. Now building a UI that says something like ‚ÄôWelcome, Sam Gwilym!` at the top of it while showing my icon in the corner becomes trivial.

They then go on to share the two directions the `whoAmI` field could take and the importance they think it playes in GraphQL schemas.

In addition they talk about Global Object Identification and the Node Interface.


----

[@jaccarmac](@oW3ngfR0LsYHH45UHoWion1660/SM3Cs5YM50RUkz5w=.ed25519) has been trying to get [Fossil](https://fossil-scm.org/index.html/doc/trunk/www/index.wiki) working over SSB.

> ...so some ideas have been ruminating. [Putting them here](%0VbbIGvci7jMVVazgfzhnab0TczpOSDV3oxM/AJf/tY=.sha256) in the semblance of a diary so I can refer back to them when actually spinning up the repo.

----
[@Powersource](@Vz6v3xKpzViiTM/GAe+hKkACZSqrErQQZgv4iqQxEn8=.ed25519) released [a new NodeJS module: dat-offchain-ipfs](%Q65iVQwtSkcPARGzcLDyBnBzmzNXQp9CJfK+ZLcOKGk=.sha256)

> Situations where this module can be useful:
> 
> * You want to use dat but don‚Äôt want/need the inherent revision history of it.
> * You want to use ipfs but need dynamic content and don‚Äôt want to wait for ipns/iprs to be bug-free/implemented.

----

[@Hendrik Peter](@Bp5Z5TQKv6E/Y+QZn/3LiDWMPi63EP8MHsXZ4tiIb2w=.ed25519) is [making progress on their tightbeam SSB client](%nI7lnipDK6qafUBKRyHfW6GvyQ/mmg7IUHANglUIuuo=.sha256) and starting to think about leveraging DAT for starting connections on local networks.

![the weekly - curated posts from the scuttleverse](&Q9wEqKM6UtKmMpI+W17MuwTSNTQpEtSnLvTFrgVI5EE=.sha256)

# Recent Days in Scuttlebutt

## Totally Random

[@punkmonk](@EaYYQo5nAQRabB9nxAn5i2uiIZ665b90Qk2U/WHNVE8=.ed25519) shared [a very naughty cactus](%qnT8DPEHBpZ7c3+dYwqsJyp/Jg2HW3ZTwvzxcyFZJw4=.sha256) with us as well as the thoughts on its loving childhood.

![naughty evil cactus with horns flips the bird](&GzTPINbpEBGFl1eIZHci7DiXwFVc3sWlxaxCh8k9IP8=.sha256)



-----
[@cinnamon](@fBS90Djngwl/SlCh/20G7piSC064Qz2hBBxbfnbyM+Y=.ed25519) shared their creation of [custom ergonomic musical instruments](%xCWthcbLElqwm+x1TOHdtVPjS5iGLrmulKa1zD4UXPU=.sha256) to compensate for Carpal Tunnel keeping them off of the piano.

![waffletone instrument](&pUKbtSN8o4+1zjZvVrk8Q1BinEaMHZZJEx8GGeO78MM=.sha256)


If you're a geek who likes creating music I recommend you check out the post. It includes things like...

> The regular grid means you can easily transpose a chord to any key just by sliding it around, keeping the same shape. That makes it 12 times faster to learn than piano, which has a unique hand shape for each transposition of a chord.

They've also included a link with instructions on how to build and play this. 

On a vaguely related note they also [posted about Janko giving away free keyboards](%9StzrgPkgAdM5bwJKSYdbPuGHI31P2XPZ1Li+XaNOOE=.sha256) in an attempt to drum up awareness of this more ergonomic keyboard layout.

![chromatone](&jQwIZwbMEjAxfQB9g9NkxFnM0Md6m4otvEiyUto1Lxg=.sha256)



----
[@gwil @ home](@QjunTsov2H2DX3fzLGv38w3aBSf1UQBTEV3FPBq90J8=.ed25519) started making [some interesting graphs of our world here](%Ale5LLXkKSj/r8DnZ4BoK0nK1USCdyQTWYxw8FGL088=.sha256) with `ssb-patchql` 

![a directed graph visualization of part of the SSB network](&I94QEXHIYEV8XGiZzGxINjeIlUYHXTxi/MOxArCUX4Q=.sha256)

Check out the "Geeky" section below for more about `ssb-patchql`.

----

----
[@ÊåâË±Ü](@a/g1UYTznmhfE1OQrU1/0sT3YM4TuYNxc6EtfFP1iao=.ed25519) shared [their plans for a homemade low cost bivvy tarp](%dq4ZGKwkMaKYwW5rWvm5LBM7swUtZmOY4LggQV254JE=.sha256) and asked for advice from anyone who might have it to offer.

![bivvy tarp drawing](&yoBalLcyAOO9PxGjtQ3Vqr91QjIWo+3mg1eh+Gx0Uz4=.sha256)




## Software
[@dangerousbeans](@TXKFQehlyoSn8UJAIVP/k2BjFINC591MlBC2e2d24mA=.ed25519) has shared [the latest update of Guild Lands](%hagbVpbADoNQ6zmhovB3HhzRzrcSEkY0G0g3Dd+QMwE=.sha256) as well as a public instance of it.

![Guild Lands](&tBRaQ4B2HAqT+VL377mSHw2SEqY4kHi3gMt+odkpj/w=.sha256)

I'm not entirely sure what we're looking at, but it's neat.

----
[@cblgh](@C6fAmdXgqTDbmZGAohUaYuyKdz3m6GBoLLtml3fUn+o=.ed25519) shared some [updates on Cabal](%LLJtRcp9E9xh0/amjGCs7u+SemKAOPtRqi0WWGWpmgM=.sha256) including _images_! Yayy. Still early stages, but this changes everything. 

![animated gif of cabal mini showing image support](&/Rlxqm5ZLS7f1EkzjtuzN9SkHrc7VoKjtnVhFVfwylY=.sha256)

[@Fenwick](@Q4rYvVUlbC0wdOhl0tmisTeJhTR/Y3PIu8yfXiMYXxY=.ed25519) later shared [a new release to the cabal-clone client](%bakfdgSJmq3UsXsTviAVMbXDPN/mA2W2cE77T3uQiqo=.sha256). 

![Cabal clone v0.3.0 animated gif screenshot](&mTNR1wS70RG+Uz+srXqKpBJ0F+w1nTCJDAP7LfGpOms=.sha256)



## Software Community Intersection 
[@kas](@RuNxm8SRujPcJx6GjtTQHp6hprAFv5voEkcvoAkB8Pk=.ed25519) shared some interesting stats from Diaspora Europe which pretty clearly show that there being > 12k knows ids here and only ~150 (probably just a rough guess) daily posters is right in line with what we should be expecting. 

[dino∆ßùî∏‚ìä·ñá](%buttbtco6nSqPt37ARIRT9XvjWLrxpbNCIFGk6RDEgc=.sha256) shared a link to "[The 1% rule](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1%25_rule_%28Internet_culture%29)" in support of this idea.

Anecdotaly, It takes a _huge_ number of people on a network to create a large active network, but the more users you have the faster it grows. 

-----

[@kieran](@MpDd66GPXgN1+eMNrZInHkWq1THMurWwLdMx8BZ1ncw=.ed25519) shared [their experinces at Data Terra Nemo](%pWXOuNcG7ze2EwH4Hz8ywCxQvMJgu0GUWgmLisgGX5U=.sha256) which included listening to talks from a number of 'butt scuttlers.

One thing they mentioned was Beaker Blue. [On Twitter](https://twitter.com/_lrlna/status/1129768344352116736) Beaker shared this Sketchnote overview of it 

![Beaker Blue sketchnote](&HnPSGC9SJljdxyTzXX7ynAEFmmsNb93KgkBDvWUZhyA=.sha256)

According to kieran 

> beakerbrowser are making some super interesting innovations with beaker.blue, going more of the social network way, and making it easier and easier for almost anyone to build public applications. 

[@happy0](@RJ09Kfs3neEZPrbpbWVDxkN92x9moe3aPusOMOc4S2I=.ed25519) posted [a series of photos](%1ZhdGdaXxg3LB//cvpQc8MBGUDOWfS8cpdqMlgCrIgQ=.sha256) from around town as well as some smiling 'butts like this one.

![Rabble smiles while standing in front of posters](&Z/nLEC0gksA9VA3zvlXjhXsaNblAwVxaNWc8LLhh8a4=.sha256)

## Community
We have access to some money, and some of Mix's time for SSB "maintenance." What should that maintenance look like? What should they work on? 

[Leave your thoughts in this thread](%ii+KMhlp0tm2bG8D2GDsiQjEjYVnRk8wEQBmnwBW4QU=.sha256)

----
[@corlock](@sHFNLAao6phQ5AN17ecYNUbszDa4Qf6DhyQsjtQfdmY=.ed25519) is wondering if anyone would like to get together in Berlin Germany "...for another #crab-meet and go deep on some SSB docs ?" They're hoping to team up with others to [tackle some documentation improvements as a group](%fMbvRPCHU+OXCIfFxWvYvylztu7jSYAKgUAu4IdwIiY=.sha256).


----
[@elavoie](@IgYpd+tCtXnlE2tYX/8rR2AGt+P8svC98WH3MdYAa8Y=.ed25519) shared that [@cft](@AiBJDta+4boyh2USNGwIagH/wKjeruTcDX2Aj1r/haM=.ed25519)'s paper on "A Broadcast-Only Communication Model Based on Replicated Append-Only Logs" has been published in a Journal. 

> While the content of the paper has not been reviewed by other peers, because it is an editorial note, its inclusion in the journal means that the editors do think it is relevant to the current research communities....

The full post with more details is [here](%nhudqNOheiVcEfIpU8DzIUhfe8cSVMg3AIM/ejYWbSU=.sha256).

## Geeky
[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) made [a "demo cast" of ssb-patchql](%2OmtLqgVGIH+Yl+9QKZzk67k/lC0tjJMmTeqtuo3fzs=.sha256) and shared the video on YouTube.

![ssb-patchql demo video](&oxjvrKXW5NGM6xxdK/KuAabr04/Hj+OnHutBboJTnww=.sha256)

----
[@SoapDog/SurfaceGo](@qv10rF4IsmxRZb7g5ekJ33EakYBpdrmV/vtP1ij5BS4=.ed25519) has been tweaking Patchfox to use Spectre CSS and [shared a screenshot](%cLuKLKR6M1vIj2B5ZQ/1ndYWw2VcUXBWYs0pnBt0DAo=.sha256).

![Patchfox - Firefox Nightly 2019‚Äì05‚Äì26 12.02.57.png](&lTqyq9/AforAtpYseS27iSuf32wHHNsK3cOAwmLgS2M=.sha256)



----

[@masukomi](@LzTjF5eAVC6xprPMGeNzqEP/EEBIGpM6hDaaY10hrz8=.ed25519) (me) wrote [a post about accidentally creating an SSB client](%raM2a+GNZd4nEbE2vpN0kPZysbVQjhDd0ZFNA/sjJYo=.sha256). The notable takeaway is that if you're a geek who's dissatisfied with one of the existing clients, it only takes a handful of calls to `sbot` and some way to organize and display the output (HTML, Markdown, whatever) to address your biggest complaints / concerns.

----

Speaking of custom clients, [@Hendrik Peter](@Bp5Z5TQKv6E/Y+QZn/3LiDWMPi63EP8MHsXZ4tiIb2w=.ed25519) has hared [another Tightbeam update](%NfbR6m2nIcDQAPLeTHYfm5cUeMP53+/Jdq5uReTyB+g=.sha256) update with us.

![tightbeem week 1](&b5jOKowJtKBglR/YNoxK4jVGpxfmvsnscSsXFs1LaPs=.sha256)

> I started out writing a simple react-native front-end for Android and IOS that deals with showing data to a user. The Home-screen is starting to get some kind of design slowly.

More details in the post.


------------
### Editor's Note
As some of you know I've been job hunting for a while. Money has gotten tight, and today I went to Patreon and asked them to send me what had been collected so far in support of The Weekly. It's not much each month, but over time it builds up, and as of today the total had grown to ~$75 US. 

That's probably not much to many of you. It didn't used to be much to me. But right now? That amount makes my heart swell with thanks. Thank you for being such a lovely community. Thank you for your support. Thanks for giving me that tiny bit of comfort. 

------------
### Summary Data 

This week‚Äôs summary was curated from 314 threads by 154 authors by [@masukomi](@LzTjF5eAVC6xprPMGeNzqEP/EEBIGpM6hDaaY10hrz8=.ed25519), **with the support of my lovely patrons**. If you'd like to help continue this creation you can [become a patron on Patreon](https://www.patreon.com/the_weekly).

## Software
[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) was working with a Pull Request for modifying hops in Patchbay...

> I reviewed what she had made, but ‚Äúdescribing hops‚Äù to someone using this in an accessible way is still super hard to do well concisely. So ‚Ä¶ I carved up this SVG from the protocol docs that @duncan made and I‚Äôve made it respond dynamically to the slider.

![modifying hops in patchbay](&3pv07S7nXAd4wHffMuD5W7eU7ixJFp/Vbk7H0BXykqA=.sha256)

[The post is here](%q4z7EZ28ZqY9Ys3S5E+1kcpAcG38P5jAMzs+5JTdMuE=.sha256)


## Software Community Intersection
[@SoapDog](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519) has put out a call for help for those graphically inclined individuals amongst us.

> [can someone help me with a logo for Patchfox](%HQwQdMNdSowq84+T7PKFC9eybp+ibRlrFTjhaIHK09I=.sha256)? Many clients are just using our standard hermie which leads to some confusion, I think Patchfox needs some distinctive logo‚Ä¶ I have no design skills, halp! plz!

In related news, they shared a little gif, with details of [some of the UI progress](%qRyMwQwjMgkhw1P8GGPkriKY8Ae0A/A0+Q4ZexV1lmI=.sha256) in Patchfox showing the stages the avatar goes through as Patchfox boots and connects to the server. 

And [how you can now run Patchfox in the sidebar](%kttrTZ3lGKyWT1p5aG+p4EI8SqWdGJodxTazCSeneq8=.sha256)

![Patchfox running in the browser's sidebar](&R7bGaAVTxxprUVWjtbZD09rdtWyJhH2fyjap0rBZP1Y=.sha256)

[@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) says 

> At data-terra-nemo I participated in a panel that had the following proposition:
>
> * What tools and frameworks are there and how can we use them today?
> * What are some of the apps we want to see in the future?

and then [posted their notes from those questions](%aOp90YlpHyZES9O2BsL0mTYx7twufuAJOprvnsCtX5c=.sha256).

----
[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) shared this interesting diagram of some of the projects and collectives around SSB.

![graph of connecting ssb apps, funds, ventures, and cores](&XGw5nKtVhN3rc7AMRwOn9/5z8vXbaRD9q0RlrL7beXI=.sha256)



## Community
[@mnin](@SXVoA/7CuMRS5IDTNsO8HU2PvCIVq8HKUUx/k+idDiQ=.ed25519) shared some of [the current thinking for upcoming SSB Website Redesign](%90cpJesddE8aullfGxLR70nCRWE7i2F1gkuwZNujRnc=.sha256).

![ssb web site redesign idea notes](&s6Fg1nzoWT4bDR8Kf5hBScQeM0V3XX1EYPNgh8qAc4c=.sha256)

There are more details in the post.

[@happy0](@RJ09Kfs3neEZPrbpbWVDxkN92x9moe3aPusOMOc4S2I=.ed25519) asked 

> Would any of you with the appropriate skills be [interested in making a wee leaflet that we can print and put up on a place‚Äôs notice board](%nlQjS+97zjH6rot+kk0RG+xcQBTfGG6Pi47MM38TCQw=.sha256) that encourages people to try scuttlebutt?

I think it's a great idea for folks with nice coworkers.

## Geeky

[@happy0](@RJ09Kfs3neEZPrbpbWVDxkN92x9moe3aPusOMOc4S2I=.ed25519) has "...been working with [Openlaw](https://www.openlaw.io/) to bring scuttlebutt into their back end architecture. While doing this, we‚Äôve been able to work on some exciting open source work that I think will be useful to people as libraries to use and examples of how to achieve certain things.

* Scuttlebutt Java functionality (just client for now, not server / replication)
* A scuttlebutt akka persistence framework plugin

Details on both of these in [their post](%jGxnsCesSFaLD1zMXy+jTydKsldh0fQ+aOTfgJf+r+A=.sha256).

---


[@Hendrik Peter](@Bp5Z5TQKv6E/Y+QZn/3LiDWMPi63EP8MHsXZ4tiIb2w=.ed25519) has [continued to churn out new functionality on Tightbeam](%4HSD2Rgd4SwECERcpcxUCBVHwaP+71kRd0Qs2Hqt9bw=.sha256).

![Tightbeam screenshots + tightbeam hub icon](&DdmDeG8Nec6yrNxUBhHLYLPeuGwFCXxO49+QyQo6MFU=.sha256)

![tightbeam hum sketch](&ZErLJYBs4pVBoT9tSUcIdBltpOFR3CBXY310Y77Umq4=.sha256)

> After [@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) had put out his Patchbay patchqll branch I had to try. It went south fast with new features and functionality exploding into the app.

----
[@polylith](@0nakXtVIodBfdHwRQLVb64p54jTWS+DFHRqg58ky4CI=.ed25519) has shared [their latest newsletter](%8ITJmHOQWffdRDKxtX/Qukt4mdL6HLEpXcbVkJaqglU=.sha256). 

![A black and white photograph of a small wave washing over pebbles. The water is clear and the pebbles are worn into round, smooth shapes.](&i30abYp78l88a6UTvupQs4L5IVM420z5lxeBbe6BDNs=.sha256)


----
[@hugi](@qpUlHepf9682x9Yg8Vav1ZVz5NB7e7ZM9i8Mzi6AnwA=.ed25519) has access to "...a post-industrial island Stora H√∂ggarn in the Stockholm archipelago. We can host events using most of the island at a price that is pretty fair for the location, including access to some barns, warehouse spaces and a fully functional demilitarized minelayer with 20+ beds."

![post-industrial island Stora H√∂ggarn in the Stockholm archipelago](&PExNUSbbvUy41EmC5/ojQVl2kXCGvCL/kTh9VPrtTio=.sha256)

It's a very cool looking space and they're looking for ideas on how to take advantage of it. The photos of the old buildings and surrounding lands are pretty neat. Plus, who wouldn't want to have a conference with lodging options of bunkspace on a boat or camping? Ok, I can think of a few folks, but it sounds great to me.

![the weekly - curated posts from the scuttleverse](&Q9wEqKM6UtKmMpI+W17MuwTSNTQpEtSnLvTFrgVI5EE=.sha256)

# Recent Days in Scuttlebutt

## Totally Random
[@Emmi Bevensee](@5fX6QTmue/udf7tLwW25vQ63wZSENrksghBt6vfL4/I=.ed25519) and [@mixmix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) spent some time making [more pretty visualizations](%BBV2BEmskpeVBACrdmdgL62hXZqV3BUmyqBN3rsz5uI=.sha256). 

![active ssb people](&iuaAttMB8TDVD337hwJosk++Cv6gmoOAV50ohsqDj+c=.sha256)

The 2nd image in the post reveals more details about those big blue circles in the center. 

I love these visualizations people have been creating, but at the same time I'm not sure how to make them actionable. They're just _so_ dense.

----
[@KawaiiPunk](@LVL4qjvmws3Cxavfi4iCQI6dSOqWqOyq5/5CHImILA8=.ed25519) says 

> Any musicians (of any level or aspiring) out there want to perhaps [do a bit of a faerie-rings experiment where we do an audio call every two weeks](%YFbasHiLS/rdZWxvY02RPiHpohvn4qX7dNTXczwk+HE=.sha256) to talk about what we‚Äôve been working on, what struggles we‚Äôve faced, what we‚Äôve explored etc. A different member of the group is resposible for facilitaing the call each time.


----
Speaking of music:
[@Zach!](@ZqH7Mctu/7DNInxuwl12ECjfrAKUX2tBLq1rOldNhg0=.ed25519) shared 

> ...a thing I‚Äôve been working on and dreaming of for a bit...
> [This is a Song Island](%TYOYNAqUqpuNcGqHQcsAou8e/v7JqqG7wj3fG8xe9Fs=.sha256). It contains a song, some words, and a picture. There‚Äôs a whole frontispiece for it, but everything is also held as a text file in zine/songIsland.zine‚Ä¶which means you can include it easily in other beaker sites. If you fork it, you‚Äôll see an edit button and can make your own island to share your own favorite song with your cherished ones.


![song island screenshot](&xfJKsRpo1ifJpfTkq53lxWCuU+tD5X9xofDYAIYHpPw=.sha256)

Many more details in the post.

----
And yet more music related stuff...

[@rgb(0,0,0)](@NY7I7C++ahwm/+veCLahRm57KB4o25LWqmd894A0dN0=.ed25519) started building [@cinnamon's](@fBS90Djngwl/SlCh/20G7piSC064Qz2hBBxbfnbyM+Y=.ed25519) Waffletone musical keyboard thing and is [taking us along for the ride withe a build thread](%xg1zXV2I12LoODGYB2F5UOOgeIfgl/qXiLwvPXltu7w=.sha256)

![waffletone circuit board...maybe](&cUWAmO62ijRIsN4m4Y3B38QYnzxx7aiTi/3E6isD03Q=.sha256)




----

[@glyph](@HEqy940T6uB+T+d9Jaa58aNfRzLx9eRWqkZljBmnkmk=.ed25519) made "[Sea Lettuce Soup](%51vfaxOOF/U0tIkAvJ8XESs9GNtH6J+b6a2kXPKQTMQ=.sha256)" from locally gathered seaweed. 

![Soup in a bowl](&Ijg2THt16tjd+J2uJukFg4YVEWdOLeipbSr2ADyWzZQ=.sha256)

## New Folks
I occasionally see folks wondering if you could build a chat client on top of SSB. Well, it is not only possible, but it already exists.

It's called Scat and there's a [command line client](https://github.com/stripedpajamas/scat#readme) and a [GUI client](https://github.com/stripedpajamas/gester#readme) just remember to _turn off_ any other SSB clients you have running at the same time. Right now it's my understanding that most SSB clients can't run simultaneously without... potential issues.

## Software

[@SoapDog/SurfaceGo](@qv10rF4IsmxRZb7g5ekJ33EakYBpdrmV/vtP1ij5BS4=.ed25519) has [released an alpha version of Patchfox](%gVHQRIHvqtn5qoqqo7HKgFaBGEA8Awr6XLOXKQK0Ots=.sha256)!

It should be noted that it does require the Developer / Nightly version of Firefox currently. It also piggybacks on scuttle-shell or a running sbot, or Patchwork or Patchbay. 

More info in the post and at [Patchfox.org](https://patchfox.org/)

All the congratulations [are happening in this thread](%+bvmR68ly9At4Lyi9TtlzU8Q7njt+LMcvH9bBQNtid4=.sha256)

----
[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519)

> Just added another default font to #patchbay to ensure [everyone can enjoy unicode emoji](%HtcPd+3q3IA3VCDDFm+XzYI4sceHO5V6o4xvbEub7qc=.sha256). No-one has to learn how to install stupid fonts to know what their friends are feeling !

Before:
![Selection_363.jpg](&BNfiHzwUUJ3mpYdbDx2xyN1Fr+KOgyRG85Qd8UDy3Ac=.sha256)

After:
![Selection_364.jpg](&Uuo4K7BbjUEksxbXCh2b419ApohtY4AJRMTZo9hervc=.sha256)

---
[@dangerousbeans](@TXKFQehlyoSn8UJAIVP/k2BjFINC591MlBC2e2d24mA=.ed25519) has been posting a number of [updates about their SSB islands map ...thing](%EkpwXBMfMh/yiBcG1jO4b9swCLhllxNsu786w/zWOlo=.sha256)

![islands.gif](&7sfNh/CtDBW/ORvAVU0rEY5mlNg5t0yxna8oxQiofzs=.sha256)

New features, mobile support, and more. I'm still not sure what it is, but I am also still fascinated with it.

## Software Community Intersection 

[@cinnamon](@fBS90Djngwl/SlCh/20G7piSC064Qz2hBBxbfnbyM+Y=.ed25519) improved [some great diagrams that simply, and visually explain the differences between Centralized, Federated, and Distributed systems](%ZY8v2yNcDtoLsYuDRWyY4kYbiUkvMiMGdGhDEnr/jgM=.sha256), and included a link to the source, and SVG versions. The source on Figma includes non-text versions. 

![decentralized-text.png](&d5LNWBQuI6+k2u1j0/kxrJCmEVFM0Aj+rN48aYf9p2A=.sha256)

Please use and spread these. 

----

[@glyph](@HEqy940T6uB+T+d9Jaa58aNfRzLx9eRWqkZljBmnkmk=.ed25519) shared the PeachCloud folks' [recent application](%ma9BV6tB1sa60x9xEZXNXLBzrYNOUczXZLcVMtUe9aM=.sha256) for a funding grant for "Privacy & Trust Enhancing Technologies".


Folks in this community seem to be gaining a fair amount of experience and knowledge in how to get innovative projects funded via grants. That's a pretty amazing resource for those creative types out there who want to spend more time doing awesome things.


----
[@dan hassan](@NeB4q4Hy9IiMxs5L08oevEhivxW+/aDu/s/0SkNayi0=.ed25519) shared info about [@Dominic](@EMovhfIrFk4NihAKnRNhrfRaqIhBv1Wj8pTxJNgvCCY=.ed25519)'s recent [interview on "Let's Talk Bitcoin"](%w5FW0Q/Pf9R4CpCyW8BND4vxA+dTV/v3ZZnAroMhA/g=.sha256) about 

> Secure Scuttlebutt ‚Äì The ‚ÄúLocalized‚Äù but Distributed Social Network 

There's even a DAT link of the mp3. 

![stylized image of dominic tar's head and shoulders with name below](&jSbN/EhV7LWHXCbNYHW+Sayw7WmnTiFg58Vs/Han5io=.sha256)

## Community
[@zelf](@3ZeNUiYQZisGC6PLf3R+u2s5avtxLsXC66xuK41e6Zk=.ed25519) shared the proposed "[Rules of Scuttlebutt NZ](%B7aXkpUjWocMTJdszy4ybLaLDpYWkg86SY24YHgsjmk=.sha256)" for the new legal entity they're working on. 

----

[@cameralibre](@UhORGzAhEE3gqy/pH5vK+EgbpZfnyYvdI46TVBJH6Mw=.ed25519) reposted a page linking to [articles on the representation of diverse peoples through improved iconography and illustrations used in tech](%ciL5yCrxwlG6AQ2eHLVXbTFydb4xdlykxohSSwO94qQ=.sha256).   

----
[@zelf](@3ZeNUiYQZisGC6PLf3R+u2s5avtxLsXC66xuK41e6Zk=.ed25519) shared some thoughts on "[How memes are increasingly running society and how it‚Äôs leading to a societal gap between the sexes.](%8+CGdFA7Zj+onCSva39wP2kmKIzEl9FgWvSETHWFLI0=.sha256)"

Discussion ensued.


## Geeky
[@Christian Bundy](@+oaWWDs8g73EZFUMfW37R/ULtFEjwKN/DczvdYihjbU=.ed25519) asks "[How can we deploy new transforms to Scuttlebutt](%Sv2DRcGmHb+YnxPFGGj2t7uoZ887JkNKWFn8/Yg/PmY=.sha256)" 

> The JavaScript implementation has a database called flumedb where each message is passed to a handful of views, which extract the information they need and save it in their own little database. These views are isolated from each other, which is usually fine but presents a problem when you want to transform the messages before the view sees the data.

Discussion ensued.

----
[@AceNovo (Dt-M)](@0aMznTCPe2g2g3IR9LEJKj4pzM0mjIvuzUJeBfc5k6g=.ed25519) shared 

> ...part of an activitypub server I‚Äôm building that‚Äôs intended to interact with data across multiple IRI schemas. I‚Äôm mostly interested in ActivityPub as a transient application protocol for ephemeral interactions, social discovery, and public key infrastructure. Even without structural support, it‚Äôs a lot easier to make SSB connections over ActivityPub than from web sources alone. Using an AP service to distribute pub invites is one way it might be used to facilitate on-boarding to SSB and enable new applications like the creation of ad hoc networks or graph obfuscation.

Check out [the post](%i1oMG7guOnWHjVdl4JNdoTzvCz+M1do5uo9cXzG+X4Y=.sha256) for all the details. 

------------
### Summary Data 

This week‚Äôs summary was curated from 408 threads by 151 authors by [@masukomi](@LzTjF5eAVC6xprPMGeNzqEP/EEBIGpM6hDaaY10hrz8=.ed25519), **with the support of my lovely patrons**. If you'd like to help continue this creation you can [become a patron on Patreon](https://www.patreon.com/the_weekly).

(short post this time because it hasn't been a full week)


## Totally Random
[@dangerousbeans](@TXKFQehlyoSn8UJAIVP/k2BjFINC591MlBC2e2d24mA=.ed25519) shares [some beautiful growth on their sailboat](%Fr3pEmcLhiYjOsiYmaj8eCUR/pSNozqDsdHWq+r/g6U=.sha256). 


![sailboat growth](&eYPBMHRPK5Ihix6uTqNge6udbbLrTV7o1vNjp0MOAE4=.sha256)

On a _very_ related note "[Scuttlebutt has bought its first ship](%9vW9vgkE1/bteKIO2JfT5jnT5c4ZzbQMjdGD4phLW7I=.sha256)"

![alchemist ship photo from inside with SSB stickers](&s0u8mCiNICuHp6W/JjuWL257VTKriSZoahAmrqjHk2s=.sha256)

> We‚Äôre now sorting the paperwork, figuring out whats even aboard and picking up all the random other parts of boats which are all over Auckland and Northland

The thread has more photos and details on the current state of things and ongoing progress.

----
[@hoodownr](@YND2Cb9uk3ZdFyzXpaXDH5HZ9udu+qjg4MhNcynK2RE=.ed25519) shared a couple posts showing how you can [take an image, and make it into a stencil](%Eh+TZ+wDoS5NPnhBN5nD8zU9sSxUQCiYwolVy6KTANU=.sha256) 

![cut-out image about to become stencil](&jDGrCIauJtk6YoQXmCpkNXCuE86sNXOngdUk3jvUmjQ=.sha256)

and then [the results of using it as a stencil](%qHvWSyVpIzhqRoVRJHqwRLylRasRN9IEqhfNg8KV/1Q=.sha256)

![illustration from photo stencil](&eGP0KDX21TWNoK7ByDBYxhScQf8TN4mynHbRxXzXsQg=.sha256)



## Software
[@SoapDog/SurfaceGo](@qv10rF4IsmxRZb7g5ekJ33EakYBpdrmV/vtP1ij5BS4=.ed25519) has added [support for SSB Blog posts to Patchfox](%o4aHrlo5Bugipj/Xhew0XYOuQQv2jR8+J0OG1tM1AoE=.sha256).

![blogpost.gif](&Ltg0xQv4XEmrW6G+ikrio5AgRgrAhzClS578r9YVtqg=.sha256)

They've also got [some impending improvements for the action menu](%TNXbfNW2CmXDrL5b+XwO5/897WJjZmjK1m35BOZBB5Q=.sha256) on messages. Also, some [public timeline options](%BrC/h8EdlYcu6TlF4r+z4Z40UJXLvHIek3Uus9MbUDg=.sha256)


----
[@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) is proposing the [creation of "room servers"](%dlRtBNmQDcWgM8eTUkUyMpZZpkSQxOF3nKije0ztUtc=.sha256)

> I‚Äôd like to build a new type a server ‚Äì called rooms ‚Äì that stores no persistent SSB data whatsoever, but allows currently online clients to replicate SSB feeds with each other. Once a client connects, it asks the server who else is online on that server; the server responds; then the client can connect to other clients. This would use SSB tunnel to create an encrypted channel between two clients in such a way that the server cannot decrypt the data sent back-and-forth between clients. Rooms are like the LAN sync experience (find SSB accounts around you), except online.

Check out [the post](%dlRtBNmQDcWgM8eTUkUyMpZZpkSQxOF3nKije0ztUtc=.sha256) for why and what problems this will solve.

## Software Community Intersection
[@cinnamon](@fBS90Djngwl/SlCh/20G7piSC064Qz2hBBxbfnbyM+Y=.ed25519) shared some UX ideas for "[Shellogram, an imaginary SSB client](%sjJA4Ii6N5nPz3xSdAqjKsYG8sBrZnMKgloKL8EOyAM=.sha256)"

![shellogram-v1.png](&mDCplnI0cxMAQc0UGtf4OZroQlrDj0FZwDFbinV/BrQ=.sha256)

## Community
[@Daan](@MRiJ+CvDnD9ZjqunY1oy6tsk0IdbMDC4Q3tTC8riS3s=.ed25519) (and friends) set up a Europe-based SSB [Mumble](https://www.mumble.com/) Server for SSB people to chat on. 

> Feel free to use the muchmuch.coffee mumble server for hanging out with ssb folx. 
> ...you don‚Äôt need a password and it‚Äôs on the default port. Feel free to connect. :smiley:

----
[@Alberto](@+ISTRPn8o7Sx667rj1EPtQ9ZPiGLLZMGI7qcJjBoA+8=.ed25519) shared [an interesting tactic](%eniSVhVkjhQQjjIhU8zdomwc0GJEZ4Awwo2LdRLl0CM=.sha256) taken at Edgeryders events. "...we used to carry badges specifying the level of disagreement each of us was comfortable with."

![LOTE2.jpg](&IbdIx+lh3WqLmY8/XwjWtPDczMkrNd/HC7CSi7DWuYQ=.sha256)

> This was a boon for those of us who are not neurotypical and do not necessarily read body language well. And, frankly, also helped everyone else, by reminding us that disagreement really need not be personal. I miss this way of working together. :blush:


----

[@cinnamon](@fBS90Djngwl/SlCh/20G7piSC064Qz2hBBxbfnbyM+Y=.ed25519) says 

> I had an insight today:
> 
> **Communities require labor**: caring for each other, setting norms, matchmaking friends, resolving conflicts, protecting people from harassment, finding and sharing news and resources. Care labor, emotional labor, glue labor.
> 
> **Large social networks automate or avoid community labor** so they can scale and save money. They use algorithms to signal-boost things to make them popular; automatically ban people (or fail to); play matchmaker by suggesting people to follow. They fail to care for people or resolve conflicts.

They went on to expand on these ideas in [their post](%JCYVg39uhY3QgJqIiN9OCHsTOHEMe5XPA9CgVow8nDg=.sha256). Particulary talking about how algorithms and outsourcing aren't the solution to hazardous content.


## Geeky
[@dangerousbeans](@TXKFQehlyoSn8UJAIVP/k2BjFINC591MlBC2e2d24mA=.ed25519)  says 

> [I made a behaviour change plugin to ssb-server](%ZHIOCobHeQkEM3+Q5pc4qvuOInQjTkewYiRKDVjr67A=.sha256) which makes it way more friendly to strangers, kind of like a search and rescue dog.
> 
> If it sees any connection, it checks if they already follow them. If not it just follows them so they‚Äôre not alone anymore.

----
[@cblgh](@C6fAmdXgqTDbmZGAohUaYuyKdz3m6GBoLLtml3fUn+o=.ed25519) asks

> How can we tell when a peer is flooding messages (malicious) and when we‚Äôre merely establishing an initial connection and receiving their log (harmless)?

[Their post](%br0bMEJXqsP0rRkCbavwSK6fXF4QAIGiZd7tzf9XavA=.sha256) expands on this question and why they're asking it.

----
[@zacstewart](@SFv/oBRPsU4Yk04TLe4YCTgI/XjTUqyxh43tqWx+NFw=.ed25519) is making a phone, and sharing the details with us.

![zac stewart's phone](&ynoMQvtYoMZ3u4YgOYWYiqpp13J5QaDhog0ZBoH9AJY=.sha256)

* [Part 1](%Pc5mfngm5ug0bbaY+zZW+ZP6w5kfPD1oErLaMyUfeh8=.sha256) 
* [Part 2](%c2p0dbP0ztqWHsB07QNejOa0/+PKkzVpiQYr/k0S9lo=.sha256)

------------
### Summary Data 

This week‚Äôs summary was curated from 233 threads by 93 authors by [@masukomi](@LzTjF5eAVC6xprPMGeNzqEP/EEBIGpM6hDaaY10hrz8=.ed25519), **with the support of my lovely patrons**. If you'd like to help continue this creation you can [become a patron on Patreon](https://www.patreon.com/the_weekly).

## Software
[@SoapDog/SurfaceGo](@qv10rF4IsmxRZb7g5ekJ33EakYBpdrmV/vtP1ij5BS4=.ed25519) announced [the arrival of channel navigation in Patchfox](%EugyG+PdR3bln8Ut2ChQY6HqgYreWr9DHiGmVa//5ts=.sha256) and then [a new channels view](%gzLgOj5pu7NP0oPPCgkWsL1eThCmt+Y027AEcz/EhN0=.sha256) and [a new mentions view](%T3nfM2aK7H7eeXR5CcQpnIE0UIYHytG3kSJk8xYGcE0=.sha256) and [drag and drop to attach images](%SX7bCZu/+ByeUJwKCIYVJXMFl9iH90gLWJZOU/g9oHo=.sha256)

![Patchfox - channel navigation](&BKaJPEBrisHm4W0gEL9Y4iU9kdnf8/UnUhFLiII3Cww=.sha256)

> On the screenshot above you can see two panes of Patchfox :smiley_cat:, one showing a view of (#)tuakana-teina and a sidebar with a compose window showing this message. Patchfox is the only client that I am aware that allows you to compose while still browsing SSB, this is a really cool feature.
[@SoapDog/SurfaceGo](@qv10rF4IsmxRZb7g5ekJ33EakYBpdrmV/vtP1ij5BS4=.ed25519) announced [the arrival of channel navigation in Patchfox](%EugyG+PdR3bln8Ut2ChQY6HqgYreWr9DHiGmVa//5ts=.sha256) and then [a new channels view](%gzLgOj5pu7NP0oPPCgkWsL1eThCmt+Y027AEcz/EhN0=.sha256) and [a new mentions view](%T3nfM2aK7H7eeXR5CcQpnIE0UIYHytG3kSJk8xYGcE0=.sha256) and [drag and drop to attach images](%SX7bCZu/+ByeUJwKCIYVJXMFl9iH90gLWJZOU/g9oHo=.sha256)

![Patchfox - channel navigation](&BKaJPEBrisHm4W0gEL9Y4iU9kdnf8/UnUhFLiII3Cww=.sha256)

ou can see two panes of Patchfox :smiley_cat:, one showing a view of (#)tuakana-teina and a sidebar with a compose window showing this message. Patchfox is the only client that I am aware that allows you to compose while still browsing SSB, this is a really cool feature.

Also check out [this post](%eJm+u97rZ/2dsf+hx2CJ93RofEwTsY1ppd0lRcEZ76o=.sha256) with a gif of how you can click web a link in Patchfox, and have it open up while still having SSB visible in the sidebar. 

There's also a [new settings pane](%TT+mI0wJvV2YpAuRb3/j9y1ZBs0VQc2lo2ASd6dm140=.sha256). 

> This is really progressing fast now, it‚Äôs great! :)

I couldn't agree more.


...

They also want to know [how you'd like Patchfox to behave](%x4dIhbZI8Y3DUDjZSkaQdxU/BUDx+bq7rmyBO2R/d+E=.sha256) when it encounters a message type it doesn't know how to display. For example, what do do with a chess move message when it doesn't support chess.

## Geeky
[@zacstewart](@SFv/oBRPsU4Yk04TLe4YCTgI/XjTUqyxh43tqWx+NFw=.ed25519) continued their series on building a phone [here](%oSboStN4v114mBik1nXWMRG3cUPxJs9UnyTAZpJvaBw=.sha256) and [here](%6nvB0gMJTj+XS+iINJcPMmwpDQEIKdZ2316SjdCgeig=.sha256) and [here](%2yRFJesmO40UnvhEn6yaONkT28fGHA6UD3mV160HXmE=.sha256)

![small circuit board with chips held between finger and thumb](&EjFFQgQ679RB3zUopX0BtnfqSJlq95vCmKahhftpJ0M=.sha256)

----
[@Aljoscha](@zurF8X68ArfRM71dF3mKh36W0xDM8QmOnAS5bYOq8hA=.ed25519) posted about "[Append-Only Ropes](%iS7URZVr3j1eIk1Ni05z4iHDhQV/qeUjmsre+NbFw00=.sha256)".

> Suppose you want to build a version control system like git. You have a file that evolves over time, and you want to be able to access it at arbitrary points in its evolution. The trivial solution is to store a full copy at each timestep. This is however very inefficient. An alternative is to only store the changes (deltas) between the versions. The very first version is stored as the delta to the empty file...

content.text:
![the weekly - curated posts from the scuttleverse](&Q9wEqKM6UtKmMpI+W17MuwTSNTQpEtSnLvTFrgVI5EE=.sha256)

# Recent Days in Scuttlebutt

## Totally Random

[@dangerousbeans](@TXKFQehlyoSn8UJAIVP/k2BjFINC591MlBC2e2d24mA=.ed25519) [tested the sails](%mzvJZeYp0GfiultJm1iOLQVKGciAY5EpPMdDVMDag6E=.sha256) on Alchemist

![Screenshot_20190625‚Äì172350_Photos.jpg](&T1RgYHCOIfnUr9zUjZp5kqQS2XrEym5NttaY6W7UVzs=.sha256)

They also shared a [video on YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IjyNGSb7M8A) of them along with [some quick comments here on SSB](%SLoX1Q9d6BM08gpBKVmNrlIKioF3e33jJJs6DxJKVpo=.sha256)

And they uploaded [a post about fixing "The anchor puller upper thing..."](%ev6DDaJ6Ldqh7LfI/JHgd5bCyxiEzwG1NgC2rJ+h2sM=.sha256)

![anchor puller upper thing from a sailboat](&B2JDnKW4Yybc5bFq/FuCU4Yr8ymUqUa6O4lhRy98ojo=.sha256)

AND...[a post about a mysterious box of radio equipment](%8g4JTnVeoTCb3ENTw+z60EHqBAehFB+t6+/6QEYKkUQ=.sha256).

----
[@emile](@2YVYXQclEJHVzCON5dsLRwf65b2S6HnvxpGS8/LwjwY=.ed25519) shared [their new Catio](%ex1gof98HJ1/JfuVSz7LDWeywF1+JpdbdQqSjpYwJ2w=.sha256)

![catio](&+92546oui7PjwTNgYCb8GC2yldz9U4aTIHOVsXwkv10=.sha256)


----
[@Alanna](@6OxffMLNyxkboLjCqv29WnMPhH8O3qFrcXCR6KrKcPI=.ed25519)
 and [@mixmix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) have been tracking their infant's sleep as they grew. Now they've [shared a visualization of the data](%Chf9vZq5wQkxX9bHPGIm4iaXwBAqWR+d5g/dH/3pNOA=.sha256). 

It's interesting to see those seemingly random blips of sleep gradually converged into something that is actually manageable.

----

[@substack](@9nTgtYmvW4HID6ayt6Icwc8WZxdifx5SlSKKIX/X/1g=.ed25519) put together a phone computer case for off-grid scuttling / computing. [@noffle](@C3iYh/12sO1uvKq1KcZXLFxSySzxOkHxXN8rtNB5MGA=.ed25519) [reposted the details here on SSB](%9GpBKyN3ne/n4ryJHM2WNlieydEHafdUv8n5wZnf1Vc=.sha256) for us. 

![a free phone strapped into the lid of a free hard briefcase with a keyboard and battery strapped into the other half](&LfB0O/AKu5sODSD4HfN4urnNvrsXAccZG04Q2yxWCcY=.sha256)

----
[@Taeyoon Choi](@W1o0EvTFWz6rOxHl0QYuhWnCYpJ3/lnm1ZuSgUy2kQo=.ed25519) shared [an image that uses the earth's layers as metaphor for hardware, software, and information](%/S9cRbr3p0S0fN8VqMnk38O1unluMbWrRT0gcay7YQc=.sha256).

![the earth's layers as metaphor for hardware, software, and information](&UyEag3KVUOMtsVXf1kcvLPi8lQF3t/BIULzeoRxWNzQ=.sha256)



## Software
[@SoapDog](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519) has made another Patchfox release.

![Patchfox 2019.6.2 release graphic with stylized fox and hermit crab  with two hearts between them](&ySXUVios0Y6ZTWbqiT49NkGOuST9P3DOF9dUK2G5xEg=.sha256)

It includes new features and changes which you can learn about in [the post](%/sRf4mDcdep4OxB5s+HKaD4+sMCCAvld7J7EfxovNbQ=.sha256). Also SoapDog clarified that it will work with _any_ Firefox, not just the nightly or development versions. Those are only needed if you want to try developing against it.

Coming soon is [the ability to attach files via IPFS](%WLja5J58BL55TYI47v3D0XszfzawwrFhDfuMyAuPJw4=.sha256).

![animated GIF showing IPFS attachments in Patchfox](&jxDcABdXUXC78gAOTP7Ll5d9lBVBm8vND1OXrR+sNvk=.sha256)


On a related note, [@dan hassan](@NeB4q4Hy9IiMxs5L08oevEhivxW+/aDu/s/0SkNayi0=.ed25519)'s company can [match donations to Patchfox up to $25 USD per month](%MZ520kwPx2wYIukmor5QTssziyOQCXDwdh65MKBoem4=.sha256). 

----

content.text:
[@Christian Bundy](@+oaWWDs8g73EZFUMfW37R/ULtFEjwKN/DczvdYihjbU=.ed25519) says 

> I took a couple of hours yesterday and started implementing a new Scuttlebutt interface! It doesn‚Äôt do much but it‚Äôs simple and I like it.

![Screenshot of a web browser with a Scuttlebutt interface. It‚Äôs displaying posts from myself, Andr√©, and Mix in a single column.](&dbPJhP8URoDAiQvPTgte2KrEXGB9DJQ9216Rmh2yTIE=.sha256)

Regarding the future of this: 

> No idea. I‚Äôll probably forget about it and come back to it in six months, but I wanted to share my progress anyway. It feels super empowering to be able to build an interface in only a few lines of code.

You can find background and details in [their post](%owvZa0OwPBH2olaKUiex1wqyBO/+AeBlxEHcH7jORtA=.sha256).


## Software Community Intersection
[@Dominic](@EMovhfIrFk4NihAKnRNhrfRaqIhBv1Wj8pTxJNgvCCY=.ed25519) notes 

> Scuttlebutt is a protocol that anticipates future changes. So far, scuttlebutt has changed has mainly been incremental - new features added, one at a time. But now we are figuring out how to make some more significant changes.  
> 
> So therefore we need to figure out what sort of changes are still scuttlebutt. [I started describing what this might be like](%ELs+CjM0LzyGmmtmzLO9fk2oKQib1lARAMX8P4KNMFk=.sha256).


----

[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) wrote about how Patchwork development "...has been so hard..." and [talked about ways they could possibly improve](%b/9Nz7L6epu+I5nXix4duEWPUyj1PhZW62joKxSJ9Ek=.sha256) how the team deals with contributed code in Pull Requests and decides what should or shouldn't be in Patchwork. 

----
[@zelf](@3ZeNUiYQZisGC6PLf3R+u2s5avtxLsXC66xuK41e6Zk=.ed25519) shares [their work on ZMESH](%EYnJN3sQ7hu+8kUPHS5Q8HBpbPu4lg7Nm+wWAsbGqwY=.sha256) 

> ZMESH aims to explore the intersection of two cutting edge technologies to create a new local communication infrastructure by implementing a Peer-to-Peer (P2P) protocol over Mesh-networks.

I would recommend following their links to the DAT or HTTP version if you have a net connection, as the "brochure" style formatting and iconography helps the reading quite a bit.

## Community
[@Matt McKegg](@FbGoHeEcePDG3Evemrc+hm+S77cXKf8BRQgkYinJggg=.ed25519) says 

> I‚Äôll be starting to host regular calls (once a week), where anyone is welcome to join to chat about:

* Understanding the Patchwork codebase
* Sunrise choir stuff (I‚Äôm mostly focusing on inter-app coordination at the moment)
* [bonus] ‚Äúnerding out‚Äù about building software and hardware for electronic music jamming!
* anything else that comes up

Want details? Check out [their post](%DztxQ/UzcIXjiJNmmbQDvYQ+u2+N6W1VPLpiImVqO9E=.sha256).

content.text:
----
[@dan hassan](@NeB4q4Hy9IiMxs5L08oevEhivxW+/aDu/s/0SkNayi0=.ed25519) shares a PDF from Radical Routes about [How to set up a Worker's Co-op](%nMnF6H0v0GrNWgJ3qw9l4hLCiiRW9I6TFQZXegXCMxQ=.sha256)

![screenshot of how to set up a worker's co-op pdf front page](&G+i6WNufHUbvRSmWeYNbjl8EPPwv90e2JO9MDFJwg/U=.sha256)

----
[@polylith](@0nakXtVIodBfdHwRQLVb64p54jTWS+DFHRqg58ky4CI=.ed25519) shares [the latest issue](%6YYGHZCI3yxmRyyF/Lz0v2FGUqjN8eoORzhU/Xd1ex8=.sha256) of their monthly newsletter.

> Hello fellow resonating bodies and minds. This letter comes to you from beneath a silica sky stretched taut over the peninsula, pinned beyond the horizon against the occasional sweeping wind, vibrating with all those strong midsummer sun rays streaming through. The lakes are warming from the top down and the wind periodically pushes all the surface water in to shore. Go for a swim if you‚Äôre able! Summer‚Äôs stride may wait for no one, but when we let go and submerge we find that it‚Äôs a long stride.


## Geeky

[@Christian Bundy](@+oaWWDs8g73EZFUMfW37R/ULtFEjwKN/DczvdYihjbU=.ed25519) created an [RFC for Off-chain content in Scuttlebutt](%LrMcs9tqgOMLPGv6mN5Z7YYxRQ8qn0JRhVi++OyOvQo=.sha256)

> Each time you publish a message on Scuttlebutt the content of a message is signed and stored on your feed, which is an append-only log. This design makes message replication simple and reliable, but makes it impossible to delete anything you‚Äôve published without corrupting your append-only signature chain.

> Another option would be to only publish a fingerprint of the message content on the feed. Peers who have both the message and its content would be able to verify its integrity, but peers with only a message and no content would only see the metadata of the message (timestamp, sequence number, ‚Ä¶).

> This alternative has been suggested, discussed, and prototyped as ‚Äúoff-chain content‚Äù, and I‚Äôd like to propose that we deploy it.

----
[@cinnamon](@fBS90Djngwl/SlCh/20G7piSC064Qz2hBBxbfnbyM+Y=.ed25519) is putting together a "[Spec for high-level library to make clients easy to write](%aZzhlxMOJ8C4CUKRccuP5MRyMpJrLSp++zpobSI4x+I=.sha256)" 

They're gathering a list of all the library functions and queries that a client needs. You are encouraged to add to it.

----

Despite the tremendous recent progress with Patchfox 
[@SoapDog](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519) is [Preparing for a major rework](%oxXKoCVtqM111XqKyTyTOCXt6s/51/xI01O8F7DBbRQ=.sha256) to pay off the technical debt acrued during "about nine rewrites" They go on to explain the thinking, and give a high level overview of how Patchfox is constructed under the covers.

----
[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) is [working on getting `ssb-peer-invites` into Patchbay](%ThjbfJz+Iwblex8czvFWC9Xal6zTnrgrKJ7Wt1ktPSE=.sha256).

![ssb-peer-invites in patchbay](&YmDADh8TJYVNouL6v7cjEQ48yd2TfnjnKti5kYlw11c=.sha256)

----
[@VI](@enYnrAbM4s4BVadGY7VC0suQ48QitTkE4PlQYTtNT+4=.ed25519) shared some [Thoughts on how to build a gossip-web](%bh7GPg6oaLAc3eZw/TNrNvRWNM0LRtJy8Ycni3YfPEM=.sha256)

> Right now, the building blocks for the next-generation web are at our hands, enabling us to build a network that reflects and embraces the strength of our social connections.  
>If we want to declare the Cyberspace as independent, we must pursuit the
technology that makes independence become reality.

----

content.text:
[@gozala](@B/Pg4xaGbgy2CFrza9g5kGZurAILCk+NapOcTXah98I=.ed25519) shared [a post with useful links to help you learn about IPFS](%5V2Xqjh9ijTxuIYZ4nB4BGu+2ZZsNa2IB+AY6yJkz0s=.sha256).


----
[@nxo](@x99SXLtu8laSHk4/cGCY+vuj+IaG/6sh946zbBwpB+8=.ed25519) has released "[The Ark Dev Kit](https://www.crowdsupply.com/the-arkadia/the-ark-dev-kit)". It's the components you'll need to build "An offline-first portable computer".

> The Ark is a portable computer powered by the Raspberry Pi Compute Module 3L. It runs a Debian based operating system and includes the Dat Protocol installed by default allowing users access to peer-to-peer applications including p2p chat, file-sharing, and websites. The Ark Dev Kit is for developers who want to build an ecosystem of hardware and software that puts people > profits. 

----

[@noffle](@C3iYh/12sO1uvKq1KcZXLFxSySzxOkHxXN8rtNB5MGA=.ed25519) [shared a link](%aPJHq1vHJqaHwdvTGXObl/ewSEhNmkN+FyCdxfEk+Ok=.sha256) to [Lisping at JPL](http://www.flownet.com/gat/jpl-lisp.html)

> This is the story of the rise and fall of Lisp at the Jet Propulsion Lab as told from my personal (and highly biased) point of view. I am not writing in my official capacity as an employee of JPL, nor am I in any way representing the official position of JPL. (This will become rather obvious shortly.)


For those of you who don't know, Lisp used to be the go-to language for the various computers NASA has shot into space. There's a _lot_ to be said for it, and I've never really understood why they would choose anything else to replace it. Maybe I will after reading this...

----
[@agentofuser](@/6Xvv3L7eYrQDsJQQkhcxf1G8xaP9HIj4LDqAJmYXyw=.ed25519) started [a podcast about the edevelopment of Keycapp](%CMFlk+nuETby9c4v2mWEUHpLf3m52XlTIVWVFO8B0Tw=.sha256) ("an inclusive, predictive, and programmable keyboard for all").


------------

This week‚Äôs summary was curated from 240 threads by 93 authors by [@masukomi](@LzTjF5eAVC6xprPMGeNzqEP/EEBIGpM6hDaaY10hrz8=.ed25519), **with the support of my lovely patrons**. If you'd like to help continue this creation you can [become a patron on Patreon](https://www.patreon.com/the_weekly).

Check out [the post](%FvXVu/f4sllBIZIWA1mFJZXOYI7dnvNjvkMPKp9K9fo=.sha256) for additional details about the release.

----
Did you know there's a bot that updates a count of the unique identities it can see on the network? It's called [@uids](@UIDs8oWKQBK8QTSAGV6SZiE80jwQlHTuEjhEaNRV8Zw=.ed25519)

While I write this it's latest post says

> Unique IDs as of 2019-07-09: 13277

Give it a follow if you'd like to have a tiny daily update of how our network is growing.

----
[@dangerousbeans](@TXKFQehlyoSn8UJAIVP/k2BjFINC591MlBC2e2d24mA=.ed25519) [added zoom to their ssb map...thing](%FJA0E2e8Q2VrDtP8UVu1cOz03qhJVZ2lURl4Ab387Jg=.sha256)

![zoomzoom2.gif](&jho5h1JaFi9338nFCegOfXg94gbAkfrJWnjNh/8/8QU=.sha256)

... and accidentally lost most of the data along the way.

----
[@SoapDog](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519) is working on [adding abuse prevention tools to Patchfox](%t3LIs8w3lMgEBGMY+Xk0hrJyszw0iLn4mOPKF39Q++w=.sha256).

> The next release of Patchfox will be focused on providing abuse prevention tools so that users can self moderate their Scuttlebutt experience. These tools will not affect gossiping or data storage, they will only act on displaying data.

Check out [the post](%t3LIs8w3lMgEBGMY+Xk0hrJyszw0iLn4mOPKF39Q++w=.sha256) for more details and an animated gif of the functionality.

## Software Community Intersection

[@polylith two](@p6c9a7caxwvxYRWzd1ZPV+WwUaRbMtotyR7IZVPlir0=.ed25519) [asked for feedback about typefaces](%j4HfyrhqU7VUimscKFvGgTT8P84D7ikRL2+rMp/JsGI=.sha256) for the new Scuttlebutt web site. 

![Two side-by-side screenshots of the in-development SSB website showing both typeface alternatives](&WEWXrwJuDR7M1DfH2/ruf++D7PxZsZiJLA15BjhRm18=.sha256)

----
[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) was thinking about [how you might limit the visibility of a post in the context of a family](%qX4zMHdAmc2Nf3j4EI8lVKjPuiuMajoZr1g5kIHGRgY=.sha256).

![how to run a small social network for your friends](&ubrOB313+uUJF0M2XmnCA/xOwP885Dzm2Tkfks+bWPw=.sha256)

[@RangerMauve](@tdeT1cU3xUQaD2Ne5Ox0Dndly50qS+c5+//Fl7tyPqg=.ed25519) [notes that](%NY12Rf5HfSLekbLnCwl96+LDZuBeqvLcBqfGb5Wr6TM=.sha256) "dat has a montly newsletter which you can subscribe to [here](https://blog.datproject.org/subscribe/)"

[@Joey Hess](@BCM6DHYJvWzwWi1lFl2tjDXjaqyZAEmJH5ZONSpXhtc=.ed25519) shared [a fallen tree](%ZgUELrTAAKRkOEAnNs7UVEOxIEbIbWb6mLqBmRvxcj4=.sha256)

and made a DAT site with details and references to implementations in various languages.

----
[@dangerousbeans](@TXKFQehlyoSn8UJAIVP/k2BjFINC591MlBC2e2d24mA=.ed25519) borrowed [@kor](@uqFI3UmCNGNcG8+25YGYN651jBtb7H7WxNmoHtaNYSY=.ed25519)'s dinghy and [pilled it high with supplies for Artemis](%33iwUsdbM7Krxnq4jfDNvG5X5A91aZuyBWy43y1psw0=.sha256).

## Community
[@Alanna](@6OxffMLNyxkboLjCqv29WnMPhH8O3qFrcXCR6KrKcPI=.ed25519) notes that [the funds have arrived from Dfinity](%OF81cGvf+qMOxYdfKqxQFOH0Hn2N1st4AQGTrMif8dw=.sha256) and have been added to the scuttlebutt maintenance open collective.

![scuttlebutt maintenance open collective screenshot with NZ $44k budget](&8vi9MrpJMaQR5M6/KUpJ6+EY+o0a3OkCBBJ8uB7aMw0=.sha256)

----
[@olizilla](@8eknhbALZv4xn31LfIWJ4iBoR/shQFkqVENbprVIRYM=.ed25519) shared some posters from gov.uk with basic do's and dont's when [designing for users with dyslexia or anxiety](%L6JU8ahyyLvWgyY5wAXCwZ8Zf/5bSdyjIZxSXoORIFE=.sha256)


----
[@Daan](@MRiJ+CvDnD9ZjqunY1oy6tsk0IdbMDC4Q3tTC8riS3s=.ed25519) discovered a book by Extinction Rebellion [and shared their thoughts on it](%/pmINxbWy9AKR35ToBCzBu0ios9APHqdWo1G8kxGnos=.sha256).

![Cover page of ‚ÄúThis Is Not A Drill : An Extinction Rebellion Handbook‚Äù](&RXIN9Zcg5AhLp3nuohmP87TCAhVreA2aaw4oZWhlBNE=.sha256)


----
[@Hendrik Peter](@Bp5Z5TQKv6E/Y+QZn/3LiDWMPi63EP8MHsXZ4tiIb2w=.ed25519) shared [more from their work on Global Code in Ghana](%6yv1XPVtI6EQ/jmYYKqeSfj7H6ZqdblFzBMHU6nQjLs=.sha256).

> Once most of the students were done setting up their machines and doing the bash-crash course we continued with STICKERS!. I had taken along an envelope full of stickers from some book-stores in Sweden. The class went bananas with them, dressing up their new Raspberry Pi cases.

![stickers on a raspberry pi case](&vnnnfmDpNHXMxRHTQz7rKda+3tNg0LVBebN6ylziHoo=.sha256)

That, and much more, in the post.

## Geeky
[@mulrich](@mucTrTjExFklGdAFobgY4zypBAZMVi7q0m6Ya55gLVo=.ed25519) has announced [a new SSB Implementation in Elixir](%mUPHgtq8kBUaWClE3mU3Do54TCGXSftHyFD9eQt8S9w=.sha256)

![Elixir code related to blob handling ](&7G0iXiUJNJ/kTMgvy1Ft+KBPPKDm684w1b9MsHNGDC0=.sha256)

----
[@cryptix](@p13zSAiOpguI9nsawkGijsnMfWmFd5rlUNpzekEE+vI=.ed25519) has [a proposal for offchain-content](%3ATKLKIHdM+beamr1dqoO2Jd6BC7oW5zj0ygLvmDsEc=.sha256)

> While I like the ideas of Bamboo, I think it has to much not invented here, namely encoding schemes for hash references and variable sized integers. IMHO this shouldn‚Äôt be the exciting part about a new chain format but to introduce the features it offers compared to the current one. 

[Check out their post for more details](%3ATKLKIHdM+beamr1dqoO2Jd6BC7oW5zj0ygLvmDsEc=.sha256)

----
[@punkmonk](@EaYYQo5nAQRabB9nxAn5i2uiIZ665b90Qk2U/WHNVE8=.ed25519) 

> playing with a scuttlebutt backed filesystem today. it‚Äôs super broken and buggy but i was tickled that it works at all!!

Check out [their post for details](%rmRqAv0Ab16vM5IH7Lmnha+lQ/bGBXitR9yLIKpKuGw=.sha256)

----
[@cel](@f/6sQ6d2CMxRUhLpspgGIulDxDCwYD7DzFzPNr7u5AU=.ed25519) is [experimenting with ranking posts](%uirGnTIR9I1Q5D9wiXc/vF2Bipuzp+dgH2f3gKSP6fg=.sha256).

![screenshot of cell's ranked posts experiment](&jCqUzNT6c7yguy5eXfJ8UQc42vTpD2LqXUL08NIORsQ=.sha256)

![the weekly - curated posts from the scuttleverse](&Q9wEqKM6UtKmMpI+W17MuwTSNTQpEtSnLvTFrgVI5EE=.sha256)

# Recent Days in Scuttlebutt

## Totally Random

[@SoapDog/SurfaceGo](@qv10rF4IsmxRZb7g5ekJ33EakYBpdrmV/vtP1ij5BS4=.ed25519) has been teasing us with [pictures](%O4PH7nOB+PyRDavywnXobj9mqc9EDN3jMa8VjlnrpfA=.sha256) of [tasty coffee](%6Flk65Ln2WeQwffTrTU83rHMeoulUiWI7qJY56HnH+k=.sha256) in quiet workspaces.

![soapdog's laptop and coffee in front of a window in the British Library with a view of shelves of books ](&CjFFANBpLDu0CNzM5D246mXey3g8zHwuOC2yQNti6TY=.sha256)

![A photo of soapdog's macbook showing a glimpse of patchfox next to a glass of a double cortado coffee](&R9YHLF8PuqKHBtJHc5sgJK5WS4JU7kW+YC1FJhSEB0o=.sha256)

---
[@dangerousbeans](@TXKFQehlyoSn8UJAIVP/k2BjFINC591MlBC2e2d24mA=.ed25519) shared an update on Alchemist with many photos.

![loading anchor windlass into alchemist from a row boat](&RttWdoOlTiQGYz7W0+WuIBlLFW+Zi9jxvI2d1wXOWS8=.sha256)



----
[@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519)  found [some crabs on a boat in Helsinki](%/XgrmR5I7KXa2gjIf3h4h5ZhRNtUHIK3OTn1dibTsS4=.sha256).

![andrestaltz teemu and dominic on a boat](&VpvK99W/2Ukyyx++7VBVZjGC/bCKByYu3mxwKsEotPg=.sha256)

On a related note. [@zelf](@3ZeNUiYQZisGC6PLf3R+u2s5avtxLsXC66xuK41e6Zk=.ed25519) has [caught the boat bug](%rmLfzODKvHrFIqN7sSoi0zCWuq6isdYWMwAoHxbHrWE=.sha256) and is about to move onto a sailboat themself.

I think Dominic may be infectious. 

----
[@Daan p20 üìü](@tUMwMvb+roaOJAyohpGUxgqYo4E7HfBlY0NkUzALqjY=.ed25519) shares [a simple thought](%jQwhipsXTSBgeAQUG4d3ESYt4RjdA7EZo4TXJxaOEcM=.sha256) that gives a disturbing glimpse into how the innocent data you leave through simple interactions can be used against you. 


## Solarpunk
[@Jackalope](@EpTy67PmCoiO8RWg83TEG7jK9PsYbN/KIhirnN3Wk6E=.ed25519) asks, and attempts to answer, the question of "[What is lunarpunk?](%2hGnNsZRxPwhV3KtApW4wHq7Y4MBorEBlOPQZHoig1A=.sha256)"

## Software
[@cel](@f/6sQ6d2CMxRUhLpspgGIulDxDCwYD7DzFzPNr7u5AU=.ed25519) shared [an SSB project that came to them by way of Freenode IRC](%TY/EVt7IQWf+9yCbxlMBre+F5q7qvb9dAWajg0FRvW8=.sha256).

> a prototype solar powered offline ssb pub that could be dropped off
in remote areas. 

![pttx-ssb-project-hardware.jpg](&KuR5vM3P4NI+Nvn14fj/veF1gsX2PRiMQtj7wC9fJfE=.sha256)

## Community

[@Aljoscha](@zurF8X68ArfRM71dF3mKh36W0xDM8QmOnAS5bYOq8hA=.ed25519) wrote up 

> [What is Secure Scuttlebutt?](%lcvqRnI7nIgkiMoJ3q8liX3TImkWqakZNZb4xYxwCWQ=.sha256)
> July 2019 Edition, Aljoscha‚Äôs point of view.

It's a long 3 post entry that covers

* The conceptual space occupied by SSB
* Verification (‚Äúlower scuttlebutt‚Äù)
* Self-descibing data (‚Äúupper scuttlebutt‚Äù)
* evolution, compatibility, naming

It gets down into the weeds, and is not the type of thing you'd hand to a stranger to spark interest in SSB, but it is filled with interesting information.

The [@scuttlebooth](@N0aRJ78hCNkcBEGGbwJuW0Rp3V6X02L6gPiwV1r3qzk=.ed25519) posted a number of pictures of folks from DWeb camp. Some group photos. Some of curious individuals. Many of people hamming it up for the camera.

> I am a photobot that posts photobooth pics!

![group photo of people at dweb](&bm2Rvu6tjGyEGXUNrmqLIfcYbNMxA6/y5X7O+jpJFPY=.sha256)

I recommend clicking through to the account and then scrolling through all its images.


[This post](%D+omDavMA4h70dXDcjhe8an76IqZBcl6KYlZEljFoh4=.sha256) from 
[@Trav](@Gs0Rz7yEabDd1GyrnjZ1acPrcHL+rx8irnLl4ys/sU4=.ed25519) shows what it looks like to the people being photographed... or what it looked like when it glitched out. 

![scuttlebooth glitching out](&/bMyN7xK3ZY//DEix6E6g9eio0EZjiHkRgbDVlv3HFs=.sha256)

In one of the photos in its stream you can see the thermal paper image prints it created for people. 


----
[@dietrich](@vB/yLGZ7vBGgPMTG5NEczZc6ufr0YqhxRScOk6jPi60=.ed25519) shared some [photos of the DWeb camp buildings](%mR5ISmIdLEqpgd1/7wKr0DeVU+3V0t3V07WR/Do1gg4=.sha256).

![panorama of buildings at dweb camp](&nJg24tx1us3Ck8XYUN6neOD83eEOHkNm8rNfyuDSG9Q=.sha256)

----
[@DC](@UMi9bjtOM7OhfYUhJh9dPfJnVkGwQdjlHC9aKnR4g0g=.ed25519) shared [a stroll to the shore at DWeb Camp](%Umypo4Vj5PRvD6+yBCt0BbTWaxFiH/Nf0nLqxhxm9FU=.sha256).

## Geeky
[@mulrich](@mucTrTjExFklGdAFobgY4zypBAZMVi7q0m6Ya55gLVo=.ed25519) shared some [updates from their SSB in Elixir work](%WOb/sWMUda11iGhiuIJyzGiPeGFGbycx2RsDNrEMgv8=.sha256).

----
[@cel](@f/6sQ6d2CMxRUhLpspgGIulDxDCwYD7DzFzPNr7u5AU=.ed25519) created "peers.js" 

> It gets them from #ssb-server 's internal peers list, which includes ones not shown by `gossip.peers` or status RPC calls. It also uses `ebt.peerStatus` to check which peers are using `ssb-ebt`

![ssb-exec-peers.png](&Wz/CgP3Hl8iCqpr1bJaT6esAjYqlVs+UJjtUpGng7ok=.sha256 ‚Äúscreenshot of peers.js ssb-exec script in patchfoo‚Äù)

----
[@kravietz](@6EIv2P7r5LF0DI6yt62e4Wg1ns1V/JsUZmhPv9p0YSw=.ed25519) [shared an article](%vIliYXa0r1PJC8Zvm8buJ7VJF3apP61E+IYJuxNtwUw=.sha256) entitled [The PGP Problem](https://latacora.micro.blog/2019/07/16/the-pgp-problem.html) about why cryptographers don't like PGP and want to replace it.

 shared [the latest volume of their newsletter](%WuyfQI0rurlkfh53gvTaSYLHevrdy3ikNDPzxw3nlBo=.sha256).

> Have you heard the cicadas yet? They just started singing their circling high-sun song a few days ago here. To my ears, the sound is warm in its echo of other summers, but uneasy in its sonics. Cicada‚Äôs song enters the body and having nowhere to go vibrates in the teeth. Contrast that with the sound of honeybee, whose collective harmonics pass right through the body, eddying warmly in the muscles. The sound of a honeybee colony is nothing less than the hum of the great goddess. There can be no mystery why we are urged by men to fear the sound of bees.

![A close-up black and white photograph of a pitcher‚Äôs thistle in bloom. [@mala](@4lHlogQpBCRPBEIfndVXxwx2kq9EoyuXSpzikIrqfTY=.ed25519) had [a prediction](%k2snJxSjfb4GMoHbV2IzTCwC8QIzSTo5hXqu+nn3gwI=.sha256)...

> I totally predict aliens will ask if they can touch our ears all the time.

## Software 

[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) shared some tips about [selecting date ranges in Patchbay's calendar](%aCMYeTnbb/FiEhutw2Iti8hch95+AsJEp3S88Z02sPY=.sha256).

![one month calendar in patchbay](&KC2ookJd7O00HB/ZOZ7XBpAQ3JnIezZRO3Sl/sO1DxI=.sha256)


----

[@SoapDog](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519) shared some info about their work on [a modern incarnation of something HyperCard-like](%JtSfRK2C3dZXENrg29jwp8GOzl8YRw0octqJHWQii+c=.sha256) called LiveCode.

![LiveCode-start-center.png](&7zc1qOSFKtJdOH8qHzcRO7/jyGz765/QqF2gq1emrtY=.sha256)

[@Rabble](@THUzexG1y6kWofwiN8Lix/jNH/P6roYdlCDgpAn2HSc=.ed25519) shared some thoughts about what [the intersection of Tor and Scuttlebutt](%diEIctW0FhNJbrobH7g8N4NfLPxKBoKPubfNBZq2e1g=.sha256) could mean for us.



## Software Community Intersection
[@dan hassan](@NeB4q4Hy9IiMxs5L08oevEhivxW+/aDu/s/0SkNayi0=.ed25519) shared more about the "[CoBox for a peer-to-peer cooperative cloud](%tvkIuqgl0lgJtwjJDeSnWFsAQ9gA4xQIx4fIN9/gO7g=.sha256)"

> CoBox is an innovative suite of open hardware and software providing accessible governance tools for organisations and networks. It comprises a human-centric plug and play server with pre-installed privacy enhancing coop software designed to promote members‚Äô data sovereignty. CoBox seeks to build on the historic tendency for networks of coops to collaborate.


## Community
[@Aljoscha](@zurF8X68ArfRM71dF3mKh36W0xDM8QmOnAS5bYOq8hA=.ed25519) notes that the SSB paper they wrote with [@Dominic](@EMovhfIrFk4NihAKnRNhrfRaqIhBv1Wj8pTxJNgvCCY=.ed25519),[@erick](@IgYpd+tCtXnlE2tYX/8rR2AGt+P8svC98WH3MdYAa8Y=.ed25519), and [cft](@@AiBJDta+4boyh2USNGwIagH/wKjeruTcDX2Aj1r/haM=.ed25519) has been accepted at the [ACM Conference on Information-Centric Networking (2019)](https://conferences.sigcomm.org/acm-icn/2019/). 

-----

[@cblgh](@C6fAmdXgqTDbmZGAohUaYuyKdz3m6GBoLLtml3fUn+o=.ed25519) shared [links to lightning talks from dweb](%Xu33O3sUvcHepK8H6ulEIrFpi6TUpJsSdXmm6Fvm+6Y=.sha256) that have been posted to YouTube. 


[@Taeyoon Choi](@W1o0EvTFWz6rOxHl0QYuhWnCYpJ3/lnm1ZuSgUy2kQo=.ed25519) shared some of their [thoughts on Dweb](%AjHzzECLyvOLJLXsINBznJA650QxSAKF0FSC247ykHM=.sha256) as did [@gozala](@B/Pg4xaGbgy2CFrza9g5kGZurAILCk+NapOcTXah98I=.ed25519) [here](%+FhzR6IlcFfiSs70k7fTYq2IhVKyUNZgmamKHETLhwI=.sha256) and [@khimaros](@54Ty4Or83kQxOyUYndMwfOFu4HwZqFRBAW7IpVyB62k=.ed25519) [here](%zp8KdVwGB88jL5cK8Cn2/0Ev4QI307AGhr0ZXBCfkuA=.sha256).

[@Lisaur](@oCGLr8gsmnfb6S4j0mUtK8i9cR6xilseqjy+a150qgU=.ed25519) shared [art](%nSHK2GAJGDwTa6GpAP1FxlRf4chmWtByEcmElhyaQkw=.sha256) instead.

content.text:
My lovely Scuttle-friends: 

The time for this week's summary has come and gone, üòû and I shall be on vacation with friends next week. üòÑ

Alas, this means two weeks without a summary for you. 

I hope you fare well in all your journeys, and look forward to reading (and summarizing) all the details.

![the weekly - curated posts from the scuttleverse](&Q9wEqKM6UtKmMpI+W17MuwTSNTQpEtSnLvTFrgVI5EE=.sha256)

# Recent Days in Scuttlebutt

## Totally Random
----

content.text:
----
[@Lando](@cnLKkzXHWFfPa2c4N74pMKCpw6Gmp1vnydEF4qlZsTE=.ed25519) is wondering if anyone has ideas on [how to easily cut bicycle tires into strips](%eljnLD6/LOEYDpmcDOlfPYyKmz6ic7IyyKFA5lLtdsc=.sha256) since they can't get one of these shipped to Berlin.

![double exacto knife.jpg](&9DCN/5m/f07yWRNQ/+zlmFgJz7BSyA3AOL4IMLSnLvg=.sha256)

----
[@enkiv2](@Q6jeOaoJOdFq8/3oFaOYC6bKhaVCD3IIdpjG+7Fab2M=.ed25519) shared " [A 'Player's Bill of Rights' for Visual Novels](%mYmWjVpckV6uWekOo+ApC1P6+b0M513HjbFCdsE9AfM=.sha256)".

It's a high level guide of things Interactive Fiction creators need to keep in mind while working on their stories.

----
[@polylith](@0nakXtVIodBfdHwRQLVb64p54jTWS+DFHRqg58ky4CI=.ed25519) has released their [next monthly newsletter](%WuyfQI0rurlkfh53gvTaSYLHevrdy3ikNDPzxw3nlBo=.sha256).

----
[@artyr3](@xzWH/SRiCkIRMFVOsKjK2LPWzbirOkNr4f36EP42BI8=.ed25519) is [starting to think criticly about the electronic devices we use](%lnpp0jUItS8n7ZmFD7/XRAcUvZAnSFFU5rFIW+kqMP0=.sha256) every day. Do we _need_ to use things that consume that much electricity? 

----
[@kas](@RuNxm8SRujPcJx6GjtTQHp6hprAFv5voEkcvoAkB8Pk=.ed25519) came across a couple [Leopard Slugs mating](%r8FOj1+AKfAst1r3dDkZNreq82528z1w3C195c7UMmk=.sha256).

![leopard slugs having sex](&VdhSMzFO5iZzKojfD0nO2jH8XuJ6ucazOrg0KNOZzYI=.sha256)

----
[@richard](@ImPMXDouLoXuNPccfTuYaATWHwVn/0iRoCcr9K+/uTk=.ed25519) says 

> I have an Alfred program that I run most days, called ‚ÄúChats‚Äù. It opens up all of my different chat programs at once, so that I can catch up on messages, close them, and then hopefully ignore them for a few hours. I've had Patchwork in this mix for a while, but I never post on Patchwork.
> 
> There are a few reasons why I don‚Äôt:...

[Click through](%87XXa9YBqMtHDACWvoMrE5P+5U/wnkoxJhq+uTgtTMY=.sha256) to learn why. I think their reasons are shared by many others.

----
[@noffle](@C3iYh/12sO1uvKq1KcZXLFxSySzxOkHxXN8rtNB5MGA=.ed25519) is [practicing "urban bushcraft"](%ESQX0M5TUi7HtGh5SmVLYkgTrSB6LW4CmuG0H08iOLs=.sha256)

![a bow drill noffle created](&BDM/WZQPEq7w30/WQdK19wcdxf2/HRdo9NwZGWG/P2k=.sha256)


----
[@dangerousbeans](@TXKFQehlyoSn8UJAIVP/k2BjFINC591MlBC2e2d24mA=.ed25519) notes that [a waterspout came through Aukland and did Bad Things‚Ñ¢](%Cm4urCeZ1MAWT8M/sG7HkvxmF8XUlM65XyeR9tsDAH8=.sha256)


![an upside down catamaran](&wQr9rv+XuZWjefFxn6oBsjMkVn1OYiK28O0XxM1OiB4=.sha256)

----
[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) asked [how people cook rice](%kgXoQib7aJsO1aObuvOIEMrYy4LY2FHWS4sywPT3bUM=.sha256) and a surprisingly long thread ensued.

## Solarpunk
[@will](@gQ83w3hAacjlREmbndJN8qoXcZSCcwZxzA/gdRvYnws=.ed25519) started [thinking of their house as a Houseboat](%T4j+vZHlSb0RuDw+9hPuoSBQcdbh4k5F+6StEdM2HzA=.sha256).

> Most of the time I think of our house as a house. It stays in the same place. I sleep and poop in it. Another way to think of it is as a living being. It has needs and stores of energy and, most importantly, flows that keep it alive. What are these flows?

They go on to list and discuss them.
