## Software 

[@SoapDog/SurfaceGo](@qv10rF4IsmxRZb7g5ekJ33EakYBpdrmV/vtP1ij5BS4=.ed25519) shared how [Patchfox can now load up DAT zines via dat-fox](%efD09B2e/0R82ZgfKauE3neTpIstYlVXFkg3D5PgBMs=.sha256). 

> Working on a browser allows us to bridge different protocols and the web. 

![animated gif showing Patchfox loading a dat zine via dat-fox](&we5v/1eERGxBf1XuBlQRl1q8VBcT5JErpMi/QiK8hQU=.sha256)


----
[@cinnamon](@fBS90Djngwl/SlCh/20G7piSC064Qz2hBBxbfnbyM+Y=.ed25519) notes that Patchwork is about to get support for Content Warnings! 

Here's what it'll look like with hidden content:

![screenshot of content hidden behind content warning in patchwork](&4tQyVrHSEFDwZSUvjHdMt9cwrolA8EtIgxk7pYwn5QY=.sha256)

[Click through for more details](%cf9ugUiqCzwVrvQILk5TrEHGX0LwhNOMzonbabzTVII=.sha256).


----

Speaking of DAT, [@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) has [created Boom Box](%ZjaDHJ8bnkW9MIDAcEmhHNF+Ofc3kJbPTLv2o7S6qng=.sha256)

It's a DAT app which allows you to create and retrieve mix-tapes

![boom-box dat app](&6hyP/UaHA/X+EDx480Kyv4Ro2bGA2toDj1ggsaqFmv8=.sha256)

----
[@cinnamon](@fBS90Djngwl/SlCh/20G7piSC064Qz2hBBxbfnbyM+Y=.ed25519) shared "[Filigree, a tool for generating poetry and bots](%zIgLoZgm8bb4zHQMHFfFJufueAEfPzhSp0j1YipRJes=.sha256)" 

![filigree website screenshot](&Yi0uDKY6EVQXJUXtDYuAuHyN1nIuob4y63NqHaRvM08=.sha256)

----
[@kemitchell](@TqlPr31FOOCjuupH0L9HCJdLjWYySyibbKscNhgLoCo=.ed25519) is proposing a "[Bolt-On Credit Requirement for Open Source Developers](%twO5CvdbquaTSMtHkDH6qYbXOQ8XsuOIxNrhPJ9JmSo=.sha256)". They mean credit as in a list of names, not financial.

> Along with a few others, I've begun work on a legal tool that adds a requirement to give credit to open source contributors and open source projects. That requirement becomes part of the license and requires credit in the usual way for kinds of goods and services that have existing conventions, like film and music, but also according to new conventions where they‚Äôre missing for software, as for web services.

More details in the post.



## Software Community Intersection

[@SoapDog](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519) started what became a somewhat long thread about the known potential abuse vector of bullying / harrasing / demeaning people by giving them unkind nicknames (which are currently public).

[The thread](%4fbY7wIRU9bhs5FMJ66WMqiObXCE6ajZYPTocLlniIs=.sha256) addressed the social and technical aspects of the problem.

----
[@Taeyoon Choi](@W1o0EvTFWz6rOxHl0QYuhWnCYpJ3/lnm1ZuSgUy2kQo=.ed25519) made "[a QTPOC guide to Decentralized Networks](http://distributedweb.care/posts/decentralized-networks/)" (web :link:) . For those of you who may be unfamiliar with the abbreviation (I was) it's Queer & Trans People Of Color"

![gathering of queer and trans people of color](&A418biJrD3knc0+whWxq05MI3p9W/JmhCI9abclA+K4=.sha256)

The [post is here](%EH0RYcHKTh+mgSXF0QNDDR3m6gett9FR7Afmdy9FQME=.sha256), and they'd like your feedback on the guide.

----

content.text:
[@buoyantair](@b3ae566cmHDS8GYSHoKP8vsjRExQp5glpGRF1+dg0Sw=.ed25519) has annouced the [Scuttlebutt Documentation Project](%pVcBVqTq8NWrKVHTKQBGRbtLnq2IE/Z1j3KGKX0I+II=.sha256) :tada:

> Hello everyone! I have taken up the job of contributing documentation for the scuttlebutt project :yum:. This is really huge and I am so excited to finally be able to contribute to this wonderful project after a long wait! I have discussed the specifics with @mix a couple of days back and the following document puts forth the big plan of writing documentation for scuttlebutt. Please feel free to give feedback in the comments!

Check out #ssb-docs for more posts on this topic.

----
[@yarrow](@FITBOZq3SSmxby/6KnMj5k34qyPdub9D4Bd9jMWYzPE=.ed25519) says 

> If you‚Äôre interested in exploring the frontier of distributed democracy, check out The Kh√¥ra Project!
> Essentially, my view is that a technology like IPFS, which provides an immutable filesystem that is resilient against censorship, serves as a natural platform for a kind of holarchical, liquid democracy...

Their post, with more details, [is here](%WLq5UCvRAGBTu+lus61fgpNS5hLmdflaklr3I75m5gM=.sha256)

----
[@mnin](@SXVoA/7CuMRS5IDTNsO8HU2PvCIVq8HKUUx/k+idDiQ=.ed25519) shared [photos from a camp where scuttlebutt was discussed](%27SJtDObmwnMcYnI/yIKUOR0wdX19dgcnRVFHo4EIQk=.sha256).

![Camp Day Two July 19 Mitch Maher _0043.jpg](&E/VyvAio7pm9N0MquJ2mD/jqtSHQI5ahSZ9mtX8CLVg=.sha256)


More pics here

![Camp Day Three July 20 Mitch Maher _0046.jpg](&VwiLM8S5ADKrfVO8F3aZjDR3ak5XAL4ZT4aruYh9r0E=.sha256)


## Community
[@Christian Bundy](@+oaWWDs8g73EZFUMfW37R/ULtFEjwKN/DczvdYihjbU=.ed25519) is thinking about creating a local SSB to encourage local people to connect to each other. It would combine a "clingy" pub, a Raspberry Pi, a wireless router, and a Captive portal with SSB installers. 

[Click through for details](%Cns3Scaa/0zmDD82BbKsCy/UXq4k+3nP2/7DS1eBzu8=.sha256)

----
[@warkruid](@ClMpM97cLGgpieYNBfVHwwljjcBVZGxb0v47FYmhllw=.ed25519) has started a series of posts entitled "Gripes On Autism". If you're not autistic, but interact with autistic folks, or would just like to understand a little bit more about what it's like for some of them, you should follow them. 


----

[@Mia Gooper](@EZArijiRCJQLZAnpcZOTYzu8IVaUMyqQPGGDLFS2klk=.ed25519) shared "[A guide about how to interact with me](%RI5TT70SJxvT3oeLv/kIEpDRpCUlfF2cFsdPtKYwUmQ=.sha256):))". I think the world would be a much better place if we all had something like this. 

![mia gooper interaction guide](&W6nYvX3OLBvIOXvG84NU35OZJli1zvass6qV1tGR9nw=.sha256)

[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) thought so too and created [a textual guide for themself](%wFVjehzWnLEd9kJTC9Bfa0SVWvNqz5i4Dnopc9VsLr0=.sha256).


## Geeky
[@Piet](@U5GvOKP/YUza9k53DSXxT0mk3PIrnyAmessvNfZl5E0=.ed25519) announced that they've got [bamboo-rs working on a micro controller](%8l4RVAV6Sc1CgDNGB3z0WF4db5TNcvHjpuSbEsbt06E=.sha256), and that it's [getting bindings to other languages](%1nRWQKt+EclrdhbonSiltdtVn6hHD3qUe6tTsk/7+44=.sha256)

----
[@Powersource](@Vz6v3xKpzViiTM/GAe+hKkACZSqrErQQZgv4iqQxEn8=.ed25519) asks 

> What if we basically do the reverse thing of what dat is doing? I.e. we already have social graphs and people feeds, what if we also had filesystem-like feeds, separate from the social graph? I don‚Äôt think we‚Äôd have to implement too much, most of the pieces are already here (at least low-level stuff, the ui would take some effort)...

[Read more in their post](%8Cd/oyBaMFzLMBzBnIncbUDUay2rtlL1kRLZG8Np8z4=.sha256).

content.text:
## Community Software Intersection
[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) started [a thread about adding adds when you install ssb-server on the command line](%FWwFYWPFAgQWh0fStot08GoDkK9c/HPYZvpE36vTKjs=.sha256). They'd only show up during install. It'd be a way of funding the OSS work. Needless to say, there were many divergent opinions. 

## Software
[@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) shared a bit on the future of text-to-speech: [one voice per author](%jDVlrYAX2+PIsqKGhG9iRq8fPeTGNKp6XelqIALYeOo=.sha256).

> On SSB, this would be perfect. You could have a button ‚Äúlisten to this thread‚Äù that automatically starts playing the comments, using the voices of the comment authors.

It's surprising that this doesn't exist already, as it's really not hard to do, even without AI. 

----
[@glyph](@HEqy940T6uB+T+d9Jaa58aNfRzLx9eRWqkZljBmnkmk=.ed25519) I just published [the July 2019 PeachCloud Update on their OpenCollective](https://opencollective.com/peachcloud/updates/july-2019-update).

## Geeky
[@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519)

> [I just created pull-drain-gently](%gBJ638GJIzteQ4K6q0lqo5fhZzxG/9k0d7xLOCR+zHE=.sha256), a module that does the same thing as pull.drain, but respects CPU usage by attempting to not pull too fast, but just about right. The problem I‚Äôm trying to solve is that pull.drain is too eager and seems to consume pull streams ‚Äúas fast as possible‚Äù, which ends up taking priority over other important things, such as UI responsiveness, specially on mobile...

![pull-drain-gently](&PhjJqQ3HxXVAXn4Po9J5ysrawQnpeZ0gUKGbwUtjo1c=.sha256)

----
[@SoapDog](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519) suggests that the "[Patchfox opencollective wants to take over Scuttle Shell](%HmL9FVOA8cZVGDUmdQyLtdKt6y6k0AoW1xUmM+QrWnQ=.sha256)" 

Translation: SoapDog is taking on more coding responsibility and anyone who cares about Patchfox should [be supporting them more](https://opencollective.com/patchfox).  

----
[@Aljoscha](@zurF8X68ArfRM71dF3mKh36W0xDM8QmOnAS5bYOq8hA=.ed25519) shared [Two Insights on Access Control for Feeds](%Zot41pVDzqKMM5HEyiferi1Z0yHMlEdp63aRREpPM2w=.sha256). They go on to explain their insights about Transitive access Control and Interplay with Partial Replacation.


----
[@buoyantair](@b3ae566cmHDS8GYSHoKP8vsjRExQp5glpGRF1+dg0Sw=.ed25519) says 

> I need help gathering all the core modules in scuttlebutt now from the community, so feel free to chime in when you have time to help me out!
> ...So far I managed to figure out that these modules may be core modules due to their high number of dependents and also because it‚Äôs obvious from name:

Know your way around SSB's Node modules? Curious about what bouyantair has found? [Check out the thread](%sj+nNXuJcvwig4bnB0wr/BWrATW/fFo1qRjMiwjcmlE=.sha256).

----
[@Aljoscha](@zurF8X68ArfRM71dF3mKh36W0xDM8QmOnAS5bYOq8hA=.ed25519)'s been making progress on their Pavo language and has [released the first chapter of "The Pavo Programming Language"](%JuHEFsNUnGO5VgaB9e6cHgmK9Dk6Q7bU1vwqUJmYXOk=.sha256)

> A human-friendly introduction to the pavo programming language, for coders and not-yet-coders alike. May contain traces of math. Which may actually be a good thing.

# Recent Days in Scuttlebutt

## Totally Random
[@zelf](@3ZeNUiYQZisGC6PLf3R+u2s5avtxLsXC66xuK41e6Zk=.ed25519) shared some a whole bunch of [pics from the DWEB crab meet](%deLfvV8HDPUt2H9TZt8UW9cFvR9aBStAoJqIMkfXlZA=.sha256).

 [went out at night](%T+5h+HgZ/BE7U/OPbzURCtI6mTHEGNduTquZgve3m0E=.sha256) and captured multiple creatures doing their thing. Here's one of them.

Multiple folks took them up on the challenge. Then mixes we remixed. 



## Solarpunk
[@dangerousbeans](@TXKFQehlyoSn8UJAIVP/k2BjFINC591MlBC2e2d24mA=.ed25519) wanted you to know that [you can make solor cells with cherry juice, and tooth paste, and a fancy piece of glass](%mKyxrrZPXbFANAbdEtAX8VTWSzoqIpTCPQgwJ9eyIfs=.sha256)... although the tooth-paste probably not the best source of Titanium Dioxide, and the results are far from the efficency levels of commercial cells.


![solar cell made with titanium dioxide and cherry juice](&GdNjkBr0dBT/BJdmVG6OVmdNzuW1vx8w9Jb7L8Ag43g=.sha256)

----
[@Joey Hess](@BCM6DHYJvWzwWi1lFl2tjDXjaqyZAEmJH5ZONSpXhtc=.ed25519) [managed to harvest a bushel of sumac](%L5zq9GaJKUW2jn+Sqfo8QvA9cMn45yBruVJa32mbpmw=.sha256) this year.

![sumac](&Lz4smexGJpLIBk3Hvw5WhrPP4Tws8Hdg4aUmU0zv9Tc=.sha256)

----
[@Explorer](@ycIUheJjfplcxS3FqWRWXxtnMu5jHYSA2dKVjifPnvE=.ed25519) asks

## Community
[@Gwynne Michele - The Village Hermit](@sIUNxUceD7BmcEVWlurZVhoGVHVRpFfigKgK2XbiCTc=.ed25519)
 shared [the results of their LeftValues scale](%yxw8DiUpZpZnzT4YaOyGI9KoDSPPVmcexOIG5zAVUdM=.sha256). I went to the source and [found the 74 questions very thought provoking](https://leftvalues.github.io). I'm sure anyone who's read about historical socialist, Marxist, and communist thinkers has probably encountered them, but it's good to be reminded sometimes.


## Geeky

[@Aljoscha](@zurF8X68ArfRM71dF3mKh36W0xDM8QmOnAS5bYOq8hA=.ed25519) felt it worthwhile to provide this PSA to clarify things:

> Public service announcement: bamboo is me messing around with design ideas, it is not an ssb thing. It is also just an intermediate step, not the final design I want to eventually build upon.

----
[@Dominic](@EMovhfIrFk4NihAKnRNhrfRaqIhBv1Wj8pTxJNgvCCY=.ed25519) discussed an interesting quirk of tags (not channels) in SSB. There can be multiple identical seeming tags that are actually different things. [Check out the thread for more details](%ooEVxd4LE+pomo6XtB7kEwS13b9wlXASCvFGASJqS6w=.sha256).

----

[@alanshaw](@95pGuafWywXH4M86R+D4Y7HFw6jZbTsTUI46Brx5emg=.ed25519) notes that "You can now [pubsub with the JS IPFS HTTP API client in the BROWSER](%eS9UM7Q/aZYpfTk+DImRYjtviJ0ru8BSrBzRi3rP3pg=.sha256)!"

![ipfs pub-sub in a browser](&8qXMVYo6aCilwcUF33uBzrJ9KJVyCgYcFgwb7HSOSqk=.sha256)

There are more details in their post.

----
[@SoapDog/SurfaceGo](@qv10rF4IsmxRZb7g5ekJ33EakYBpdrmV/vtP1ij5BS4=.ed25519) is thinking back to past days of BBSs [and yearning for a SSB terminal client](%ktW5NmtO/4ogdlw4QNkQ5AtVAEdd7hrwDEi47NhLAZI=.sha256) that looked as good as some of them did. 

![Blue Wave BBS mail system splash screen](&BaguWcNzXT8m78ev4xIxlfatEcPicg6/jf5LGm0Z/JQ=.sha256)


----
[@gmarcos87](@RmClT86x/o66QdW1dqAfj5Jek4qxUf8rtmvAlhZeZFg=.ed25519) would [like a code review of their work](%6p2sPJY83IQRYAzWaNCXwYGvvovlMK4ekEjiPvYwmSg=.sha256) on ssb-promiscuous

> This plugin makes all the local instances to be automatically befriended and synchronize their feeds.

content.text:
Last minute addition: 

I neglected to add this because i didn't see a post about it _in_ SSB this week. But, [@andre](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) announced [the public release of SSB-Rooms](https://www.manyver.se/blog/announcing-ssb-rooms) this week. The post is a good overview of what they are. They are currently available in the Manyverse client and there's a Pull Request to get the functionality added to Patchwork. 

There's already been a fair amount of discussion here as to the üëçor üëéof this idea. Regardless of what any of us think about them, the fact that Andre was able to add them to Manyverse without forking the community or anything dramatic like that shows just how great decentralized platforms are. :)

![the weekly - curated posts from the scuttleverse](&Q9wEqKM6UtKmMpI+W17MuwTSNTQpEtSnLvTFrgVI5EE=.sha256)

# Recent Days in Scuttlebutt

## Totally Random
[@emile](@2YVYXQclEJHVzCON5dsLRwf65b2S6HnvxpGS8/LwjwY=.ed25519) shared an aquatic sunset. 

![a sunset silhouetted behind mountains beyond the edge off the ocean](&Z4qyscIDuWpZbBMh6ECiQoWz1iSGVaVtIofOMYKaZJ4=.sha256)


Later on they [applied math to their motor](%PqnZUO4SK8yTjbNwgzlHfaX38ArTakQ+xdjH82zPpYo=.sha256) and discover "The propeller is pitched too high, causing the engine not to reach it‚Äôs design rpm."

----

[@abi](@pHdR5dGFMJPFwlhaRD1AM/TVSKttjyLo+n1Oig79YmI=.ed25519) found [a caterpillar and a bee](%cMA1u56HALJZRfVStdTZk9684V43rcIJzFHkb0yvcpU=.sha256) and the challenges of grad school.

![a caterpillar on a seed pod](&yhk5umazHH2GMVAfXMBApXliYxAVnTksFqv0zk50xVQ=.sha256)

----

[@kira](@C3iYh/12sO1uvKq1KcZXLFxSySzxOkHxXN8rtNB5MGA=.ed25519) is [making cordage the hard way](%Z8RPdKiy5py5nrnNoqI+0aVDYCIq2jAElPASNP7crvQ=.sha256).

![reverse-wrap cordage with dogsbane - wrappet cordage on top and scrap on the bottom](&qiWwBdFgJEzH/a0ozja1qZWwOvRq0IQeo/GOcIBTSQQ=.sha256)


----

Our very own boat now has it's own account! Welcome [@Alchemist](@na1AJv1iWOflQOwsQ4srJJhYynkYawXiWDwM0ln4DgY=.ed25519). 



On a related note  [@Dominic](@EMovhfIrFk4NihAKnRNhrfRaqIhBv1Wj8pTxJNgvCCY=.ed25519) posts about how [alchemist needs a dinghy](%KG4uZtDkw5+VsbSzzCVmkhl/7lPf3izdCpiZ+q+cStc=.sha256) and ponders something like this:

![two people with life preservers in a small 3 masted dinghy](&hCCb0jqbAgPiaiUtueIxjMYmqvIt+Pt+UWMz/vFDpro=.sha256)



----
[@jaccarmac](@oW3ngfR0LsYHH45UHoWion1660/SM3Cs5YM50RUkz5w=.ed25519) asks, and [attempts to answer the following questions](%GRrW3rEmJUj/8ewQjI+ocixV2jNwIhwyFVLy7g0rGwk=.sha256). 

1. Can music be generated from SSB messages?
2. Can music be generated from SSB messages according to some set of sensical rules?
3. Musical quines are easy, what about musical autograms? Does that even make any sense?
4. Could we generate music from an SSB message and then embed that music in the same message, self-referentially?

## Solarpunk

[@Luandro](@2RNGJafZtMHzd76gyvqH6EJiK7kBnXeak5mBWzoO/iU=.ed25519) shared their [sun powered water heating system](%i9Kpl6g/J7BIimJmAKSgZOmSsv58XkAt5IWR3iPrRpg=.sha256) with lots of details and build pictures. 

![image of a solar powered water heater and an infra-red thermometer measuring it at 36.7 degrees celcius](&VlsUTxPh9mzlcYkBCO4Nmpe7MLPm9TlkD+/1+pKdJ6o=.sha256)

----

[@Joey Hess](@BCM6DHYJvWzwWi1lFl2tjDXjaqyZAEmJH5ZONSpXhtc=.ed25519)'s off-grid refrigerator has been [getting some attention in No Tech Magazine and Hacker News](%rf0lD5Hj2S0vucgt5+34tpgi6OJzdNB0EO7Nh1Ih/0c=.sha256). 

and their home region now [has yellow highlights](%qKlsX4/YkrdP6bz5hmto8Ya1q+ot4QXU+v4vlBRZNY0=.sha256).

![yellow fuzzy plant tops in front of a green mountain range](&4Xmf4+4PKSt+IH2P7CgLzmYXSD9RJh+iUcMNRtDfWRY=.sha256)

They've got a few more posts with recent mountain scenes from a hike. You should check them out.

The moderation is pretty interesting 

> the gist is that you‚Äôll be able to pick your own moderator, allowing them to ban people on your behalf. if they abuse their power, you as a peer have the ability to retract your choice of them as a moderator. basically, cabal now has subjective moderation

content.text:
## Geeky
[@SoapDog](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519) is [rewriting Patchfox](%/1T7vSkne7H2RPuSB86fTODJDp4uATxYfXHmza+jkyE=.sha256).

> ...in the new Patchfox, we have the concept of packages. You can think of them as little apps that add features to Patchfox. They shouldn‚Äôt be distinguishable thought, the idea is that they extend and enhance Patchfox but that they are kind of invisible to the user. Instead of something like a Smartphone with many siloed apps, you can think of Patchfox as an add-on that is extensible with packages being able to add new views, menus, features, etc.
> 
> In essence, patchfox is now nothing but a opinionated collection of such packages. 

More details in the thread.


Separately they asked:

> What if we wanted to use devices that can‚Äôt cope with our current stack or crypto needs? There are a lot of old devices that could be repurposed into little SSB machines but not all of them can run our stuff....
> 
> I‚Äôm thinking about trusted communication from a lightweight device into another device which then signs and gossips, the larger device (the gossiper), holds the feeds, keys, etc. The smaller device, communicates in a secure but simpler way.

More details in [SSB Signing Services](%/tz2oqcygNCWqq3LQTdPIu+HTIE+sYm1DuOk/s7qg+U=.sha256).

Separately from _that_ they gave us an insight into [what FidoNet was like](%ll0Im6u37J52cJWTaMM96raxdJ66x/ZuSvLATHFGYhc=.sha256). 


> I don‚Äôt know how to classify FidoNet in the grand-scheme of centralization/federation/decentralization. It is a heavily coordinated constellation of independent machines. You could spun your own FidoNet compatible network if you could find people to join and the network topology could be changed easily but it was heavily coordinated through federation.

I see a lot of similarities between it and ActivityPub / Mastodon. Maybe we could learn something valuable from what worked and didn't there.

----

[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) discusses building documents from tangles. 

> If a document is the reduced state of a particular thing the current dominant way to do this is to publish messages as part of a tangle.


![tingle tangle](&S7TKxD4Ha3Vp69ZPv5QAkQhRZnFN0caZr6qkA2rFdDQ=.sha256)

and goes on to share tangle specs for:

* [merging](%srieHmVWtU5b1d9+zQvXuMrqQXRAgFHFqK+NoWghsC4=.sha256).
* [document roots](%QHU3wmGCXSYj1vZyiAivw35EI4jj6quZ9agzl6oUUs0=.sha256)
* [encoding](%XanPyeLuluq2Spa9eAXFiA0fHQtEZ6uOniIXyd8RoJM=.sha256)
* [authorship](%S4fm7BynyaD5U5OMJh0Fa5QJ2wDc7TAKdmQYBPAFS6Q=.sha256)

----

[@Christian Bundy](@+oaWWDs8g73EZFUMfW37R/ULtFEjwKN/DczvdYihjbU=.ed25519) says 

> I‚Äôve been playing around with a silly experiment that I want to share: <https://thin-manchego.glitch.me/>

It's a random map generator, of sorts. More details in [the post](%Sm7waKYWGBliqritDaXktMFlryzX1uymdtkh4XgP2o0=.sha256).

![Screenshot of green, blue, and white tiles forming a randomly generated map of continents and islands and such. Some small yellow dots form settlements, which spawn little red dots that are units who walk around.](&Uu5jRE0+JsCqNA45sRkX8bjE5+O9IIpU1ujP72LyAgw=.sha256)



------------
### Summary Data 

This week‚Äôs summary was curated from 233 threads by 102 authors by [@masukomi](@LzTjF5eAVC6xprPMGeNzqEP/EEBIGpM6hDaaY10hrz8=.ed25519), **with the support of my lovely patrons**. content.text:
[@Taeyoon Choi](@W1o0EvTFWz6rOxHl0QYuhWnCYpJ3/lnm1ZuSgUy2kQo=.ed25519) shared notes from The School for Poetic Computation and Yamaguchi Center for Art and Media's seven days intensive program for poetic-computation in Yamaguchi, Japan. Including 10 steps for "[How to help create an international community in seven days](%klhaCcMt+SZBIrZjU2lChjAv1ZtvuFHqn1alq0vhgCY=.sha256)."

![organs-medley.jpg](&M/xy3aS1EHOjFUpoESNpl3Hgai91b+bt6wANGMMYuVU=.sha256)

----
[@mnin](@SXVoA/7CuMRS5IDTNsO8HU2PvCIVq8HKUUx/k+idDiQ=.ed25519) put out a call for "sounds and inspiration from all the scuttlebutt community." Building on past successes "This is [an open invite for anyone to contribute sounds](%kIUhQGNLzANFQ12QhwHrbg5ngnGBxlgP1mCRXv6RIn8=.sha256) from their days or creations, and then we can jam to see what we create..."

----
[@Ladislas](@SmLddSPxpYkJ/8HH8qDycMEwus+tyojjH+a60beRMdg=.ed25519) shares [a french typewriter](%Dudnyfb0do+aNicfzEbQPV2m6Wb2ILerNNz70/wYnlw=.sha256)

![closeup of a sharp toothed gear in a french typewriter](&gybXiPGHAMyJJCiFtm2bkoZ0Pse0+JDdwyfHozTtWoA=.sha256)

There's something wonderful about these old mechanisms that we've lost with our sleek glass handheld devices. 

## Solarpunk
[@Jackalope](@EpTy67PmCoiO8RWg83TEG7jK9PsYbN/KIhirnN3Wk6E=.ed25519) wrote about [finding ways to live a solarpunk lifestyle within the constraints of the current social and urban reality](%tjgSefqqrFD1RAAxrecdjesXIZ9UUHj5AtmsxkB+sp0=.sha256), and without having the luxury of buying a place in the country and yet still having an income. 

----
[@lilly](@T+QcTq8t3a+X8kpHXcsUBbbKAgnfNCkRUM2/bOeObmU=.ed25519) took us to a forest a few hours south of Pittsburgh, PA, USA and [harvested Paw Paw fruit](%S3iUEgfnar6eyKx/kK0SYiIfkrNB6dn3jIRQVXZcK+Y=.sha256).

![IMG_3450.JPG](&8STJk/9q3BrGA0ddL+tQFzuLO1vvptOEI5iKqBUPHsA=.sha256)

## Community
[@punkmonk](@EaYYQo5nAQRabB9nxAn5i2uiIZ665b90Qk2U/WHNVE8=.ed25519) says 

> Recently, I started a fellowship for an organization that works with a local school district to build out capacity for the school to create makerspaces within their own schools, and to provide STEM/STEAM related projects tied to core state educational standards...
>
> With that in mind, I‚Äôm very interested in learning more about running the needed p2p infrastructure effectively, reliably and safely. I‚Äôm familiar with running these things for my own use, but not when providing tools for a larger community.

[Click through](%L9X+oakILqFsbDGCHv7mXmf52vzxaTX/iNMA4GTnweQ=.sha256) to hear more and share your thoughts.

----
[@yhancik](@W6gUhDCKoM+qnoY1bm3SYU7QlCyUhOIaDomcRHHYHVg=.ed25519) shared [Kind Words](%kQkX1d7Q5dW9pRUcD/kIVai58DbCLsVTd70mXwsopTI=.sha256)

> ‚ÄúA game about writing nice letters to real people. Write and receive encouraging letters in a cozy room. Trade stickers and listen to chill music. We‚Äôre all in this together. Sometimes all you need are a few kind words.‚Äù

![kind words game screenshot](&YpNjzsX2/aVe9m+m1/Fur9ttQ0GYdII5VoD0Urq1tgg=.sha256)

We need more things in the world like this. It's $4.99 US on Steam.



## Software
[@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) announced that [Manyverse now supports adding pictures](%26IrIsMr9uSZn3Fyh89D1HqsFYrwXJZQExzj2cYUd0s=.sha256) from the galery or camera.

![animated gif of adding pictures in manyverse](&MzBr3Tp2ALaajjzs/gKdHLxQv8/YS+vZKnEJGprkjyI=.sha256)

post 2 of 3?

content.text:
[@SoapDog](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519) notes that [profiles are working again in Patchfox](%af6piQxnnfEKDegzNqb+Ka/q3DmpndZn3sDpWOsq1ug=.sha256). 

![screenshot of profiles in patchfox](&b4/qZqBRt/pryNLcfiE3MaVzb29n3OUJR7aqUKlpIvo=.sha256)

----
[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) and [@SoapDog](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519)  started discussing [the extraction of their identity backup and restoration code](%9bNeNMiK+mUM+wpX5BK54Cn7sE3ee/7Qsxuw8plRGSs=.sha256) in Ticktack into a standalone app for all.

----
[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) also has some grant money for someone to [help build a diagnostic tool](%SIU7qPlHxt2nCa/E/P2PZzTkGJgkcKqpiKh/Y06dlwg=.sha256).

> problem : peoples feeds / indexes get into weird states, and they don‚Äôt know what is wrong, or how to fix them. This results in a bunch of painful debugging work, and we have very little stats or visibility on what problems people are experiencing.

There are more details in the post.


----
[@Ace](@rUntanbH1/pIEpkuTGVokZIl+8u7jBuroTVraNpu1cE=.ed25519) made [a tool called PageSaver](%M32QAT49rBG7oPXD7CUvEuSCsT3N3G10aKTx7qIDgc8=.sha256)

> you can enter any URL and save the whole page as a single file.
> 
> it also uploads the file to ipfs and gives you mirror links to the file, its an easy way to backup a page of the internet.

They then [updated the tool](%DK+s0JtkHJc0TCift5Wg2HHPEQXb4Cctn103jYd/wH0=.sha256) and notes they'll release the source soon. 

Click through to get the link and share your feedback.


## Hardware

[@gmarcos87](@RmClT86x/o66QdW1dqAfj5Jek4qxUf8rtmvAlhZeZFg=.ed25519) notes that 

> ## librerouter was officially [h]omologated in Argentina! ü§©
> 
> In most countries of the world it is necessary to carry out a certification of homologation of the equipment that make use of the radioelectric spectrum. The approval verifies that the equipment complies with the corresponding technical standards.

![homologacion](&a35i4y6lwYr1PPEvA24irBLF0Y+SJu/hwIH4+Xyi/6U=.sha256)

I'd never heard of "homologation" before. Here's the definition: 

> transitive verb: sanction, allow especially : to approve or confirm officially - [Merriam-Webster](https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/homologate)


## Geeky 
 [@matt](@FbGoHeEcePDG3Evemrc+hm+S77cXKf8BRQgkYinJggg=.ed25519) [@mikey](@6ilZq3kN0F+dXFHAPjAwMm87JEb/VdB+LC9eIMW3sa0=.ed25519) [@dominic](@EMovhfIrFk4NihAKnRNhrfRaqIhBv1Wj8pTxJNgvCCY=.ed25519) and [@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) gathered to discuss [authorship and editing](%kAEvUtjLUkk2h2aldHcuatYKe3HQvnAvSF22idufzXs=.sha256). They came up with a shared vocabulary for some of the things at the heart of SSB and agreed on an aspect of edit permissions on documents. 

----
[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) started discussing [a "point-of-identity" spec](%eHfsC6PHIDS1jtMHp/u3qmeCpK0Ejy/MRVUvzV5fs68=.sha256). 

> It‚Äôs a collection point for details about a specific thing / place / person / ancestor / group.

Separately, they note that they're

> ...[building tools which help you build a tangle graph from a collection of messages](%VFDrxfeuyzo3pR26hsKWFIRW2+o+2fHiopn11N+Pmrg=.sha256). Doing this to be able to check for merge conflicts when there‚Äôs a branching in the tangle (a hyrda! :snake:).


------------
### Summary Data 

This week‚Äôs summary was curated from 238 threads by 100 authors by [@masukomi](@LzTjF5eAVC6xprPMGeNzqEP/EEBIGpM6hDaaY10hrz8=.ed25519), **with the support of my lovely patrons**. If you'd like to help continue this creation you can [become a patron on Patreon](https://www.patreon.com/the_weekly).

content.text:
Dear Everyone: 
My apologies for the delay. 

Life has been... busy (personal stuff and a company retreat). I was going to put together an update for you tonight, but unexpected events transpired and that doesn't look like it'll happen. 

I expect to be putting the next update together for you this weekend, and hope you're all doing well. I can't wait to see what you've been up to in my absence. 

\- Kay

![the weekly - curated posts from the scuttleverse](&Q9wEqKM6UtKmMpI+W17MuwTSNTQpEtSnLvTFrgVI5EE=.sha256)

# Recent Days in Scuttlebutt

## A request

As I've been building up the posts for today's summary I'm seeing a lot of images like this:

```
![CAPTIONS FOR THE VISUALLY IMPAIRED](<blob hash>)
```

or more frequently something like this.

```
![12345_DC420.jpg](<blob hash>)
```

I ask you to consider putting even slightly descriptive strings in your image markup (in between the square brackets). We want the Scuttleverse to be an inclusive place. Right now, we've got a lot of interesting posts that discuss, or center around, images, but our blind and visually impaired folks are left going "um... yeah, I wish i had a clue what you're trying to show me" because we've left them in the metaphorical dark. 

I don't know how well the current apps work with screen readers (Patchfox is probably the best option), but even if they aren't good now, they hopefully all will be, and someday, you or someone you care about may need to use them.

Anything helps, even if it's something as simple as "a bridge", or "a cat in a sunbeam".

To those of you who are already doing this, and especially those taking the time to do _really_ descriptive tags (the best I've seen anywhere): Thank you. You rock. 

...

Tech notes: A screen reader will end up reading the stuff you put between the square brackets in a Markdown image link. This means that if you add descriptions outside of the square brackets (usually after the image), they are helpful, but they're prefaced by the reader having to listen to whatever was in the square brackets, which is usually a meaningless string of characters created by your camera or computer. Also, some markdown parsers have trouble with parentheses inside of the square brackets, so it's best to just not use them. It's totally fine to do normal descriptive sentences with spaces inside of those square brackets too. 

## Totally Random

[@Chromodoris](@XY261NcgFjgLXVsnZbeIPGdA8h+6U4VNLErQjvHXDns=.ed25519) [shared some pretty insects](%ClWBrbPsL1xLbbfKq7KQrXo9sWoaWZK7mdg0fJAg7Jc=.sha256).

![a month with sunlight shining through its wings](&phG60upK5rComIXyGKTV/DQn4bPy/p+UOrqzXKvI7G8=.sha256)

----
[@Kaotisk Hund](@n0d6cRhB9TFy7gLhzVxy9/vH6/EuUWlpG33fGox9jCo=.ed25519) shared [this moment](%vKuLfSn3wuXPpeErs+s+wDM0cVwjY8sVmOEUdkC2xIg=.sha256). 

![ŒºŒπŒ± Œ≥Œ¨œÑŒ±](&CJ1MPmySVTDxx5DbEF9fM7R68Cstu0bnuLKgBevShjw=.sha256) ŒúŒπŒ± Œ≥Œ¨œÑŒ±

I like the peace of the moment, and how it took a while for me to even notice the sole occupant of it.

----
[@keyvwordnew](@ORjiaXCGyv5vs4FjBFZOrrsyuSk1Hc++1liyO87jW6g=.ed25519) took a selfie with a llama.  [@Matt Davis](@+DPnYPw1+YBFxf1SqIYkzzxoltp0BUaegv/AnL3fhok=.ed25519) to a picture of them taking a picture with a llama and [shared it with us](%fsGdwpDPnRO+YO9vJYM/McaETDmPFrH7HqsEGZamNUo=.sha256).

[@Gergely Polonkai](@I1JSeKes1DIBawiMok7WZ8w3Auo7CTq/VMRYId22+5A=.ed25519) and family [helped some ants that were gathering for a ritual](%Up/La0GeH9orlPcoAprWHioonO+uUEwp5dg7W2TbYYc=.sha256). I dare not share pictures lest I ruin the ending. 


----
[@dangerousbeans](@TXKFQehlyoSn8UJAIVP/k2BjFINC591MlBC2e2d24mA=.ed25519) Created [a webapp for folks to easily follow all the posts about the Scuttle Flotilla](https://scuttleflotilla.solar/). 

![screenshot of scuttle flotilla web site](&fTi6KfbRWfmePD1RPg9PkUlaQAiWNhjyQTHNsUNHcFc=.sha256)

The [post is here](%jMax2ShYesUtxC3DLgLbv2mOg62vS/pLejBCTHOphCA=.sha256) with more details.

That screenshot is from [this post](%sIJVQDLSGq8uW8AKDwObZZY69M8NT1LDvt+qydfJ6RE=.sha256), and there are [more details about why that starter motor stopped working here](%G429187ZgbvyP13pWn8urBivdN0MGiMQjQBJ8Wo6Cb0=.sha256) as well as lots of pictures of the boat, the humans who visit it, and the progress being made to improve it.

![dangerous beans taking a downward facing selfie from high up a mast on alchemist.](&OcktVTvfCsGKsK0lvOvXMH6kpfle+ycM6d2htHz7kXw=.sha256)



----
[@Daan p20 üìü](@tUMwMvb+roaOJAyohpGUxgqYo4E7HfBlY0NkUzALqjY=.ed25519) shared the [Walk of the Dead at the Climate March](%+ZCmqKOk6Y2+79XlB32PzZL5bFWTVrj/bdH0Pu1LUH0=.sha256)

> After Friday's climate strike, there was another climate march on Saturday here in #Grenoble. And so we accompanied it with a ‚Äúfuneral march‚Äù which was a mixture of theatre and dancing....

![Daan with a scary mask and black clothing. The good of his sweater covers the part the mask left open. ](&qUnOerukdifGiqbizZCKdPBDUoCWN8eiXCsGJB5uvoI=.sha256)

----
[@Dangerousbeansüì±](@yvyyuEd9+GJ5xyrFzMPWONTb8lrL0kULoirD7oejBzk=.ed25519) shared [some](%KkMxyBEb607w5FjIy0xThz91CP87micyg7VIjUJEYvQ=.sha256) [pictures](%o3V8gr97Xsc7f3heSNDrE0sddGPG4MLAok/+rK7RHH0=.sha256) from the Climate Strike in their part of the world. 

![many people sitting in the road during a climate strike in new zealand](&qRPbY27579lGFlUxBW1iboN3df4a8mLpyhDDMgIMXKg=.sha256)

[@Dominic](@EMovhfIrFk4NihAKnRNhrfRaqIhBv1Wj8pTxJNgvCCY=.ed25519) added [some details about the person in this photo](%C7Mtl/4zm2vQUBzIqmyQo2MzBlVttZJrgaCX/HsRZSY=.sha256) who has traveled over 15,000 kilometers through many countries on this creation.

![man on a solar powered tricycle with 6 large solar panels on a trailer behind it](&SO8WF/MrzOnc3vpFwfvJPCkWKv6cb7DEhJpasu4YwXI=.sha256)


----
[@sentamalin üñ•Ô∏è](@ONFJa2sEtv9lHgH9LhwnfAr+JX9nUK0JuIzjnCVFRH0=.ed25519) discusses [a feeling of "weltschmerz"](%Zzh3Ju0LkkHGaGkNuCU2Us8HADZrwNbHOogFf+NbSC8=.sha256)

> Do you have sadness in your heart for the world that can never be and sensible shoes? You've got weltschmerz.

----
[@Cykros(mobile)](@zbvU7hqpea+UEmWuhEWybdk73jwYcasy5BCOcFzzS0o=.ed25519) reminds us to [support our local trail maintainers](%uAZf6RQGskYNtYYuDOxXkD3XK2GhgkodiwbykQBNves=.sha256), because this stuff doesn't build itself.

![a path of stones through the woods](&vyULFRC90+9rglI555iY6923wfapV+MTe8p4p4++iC4=.sha256)

content.text:
[@glyph](@HEqy940T6uB+T+d9Jaa58aNfRzLx9eRWqkZljBmnkmk=.ed25519) [met a tortoise](%yqG55k1rjrE70jjNoxdHED/D4laPddTq6T21gnL+6/4=.sha256).

![Close-up, colour photograph in portrait orientation of a tortoise on a patch of grass. The tortoise is faced towards the camera. It's big black eyes, nostrils and scales are all clearly visible. A wooden gate and milkwood trees are visible in the background.](&9PkMUNDdAVNSRJWKbXZ+17CMVLzOaqtt4LjciGVdrwA=.sha256)

Days later they [came across a baby tortoise](%CSNzGQ2esxh/10qxLDF47NI298mJA7FO5+Lma4L5O5g=.sha256).

![Close-up colour photo of a baby tortoise, taken from near ground-level. The tortoise is surrounded by dry leaves, bark and sticks.](&e6RSY8Bh9LuH0MPgN2BZt/nVY5qfXDxUk3+OL/U0gOA=.sha256)


----
[@Daan](@MRiJ+CvDnD9ZjqunY1oy6tsk0IdbMDC4Q3tTC8riS3s=.ed25519) managed to get [access to a proper lab for their mycology stuff](%255TL2vIOIITnBBw/dfQJpDE9F+A3jNmTFUM+KXQ3SA=.sha256) and will be growing some of these. 

![Stropharia rugosoannulata mushrooms in the forest, one of them tipped over to expose the underside.](&+9M8G3LS3ynkOakAZqKwUOJouCO4386qCZdLrG/zxI8=.sha256)

The post is filled with lots of mushroom geekery.

Later on they shared [a bunch of microscope based photography of their efforts](%obBNRgV9dqgKne0TR9REqgO8XVY1iG1MPEI2k/wP7XE=.sha256).

![moisture on microscopic hairs of a fungus](&c71eBTYNZqhVy4fI/cfLCRVIJJpwXk4yheg02oOf/Qo=.sha256)

They've posted a number of other myco based updates since my last update. Definitely follow them if you're into this sort of thing.

----
[@lucy](@IWEJQ2SPZUnFYHrDBFJmCZlANoyOQfZ9vXimUNbe48M=.ed25519) is working on an audio thing...

![a collection of files hang above a worktable. Two trays contain metal and plastic things of unknown purpose](&kZ3ljQ5b9d6TwN31Fg9yI7KjNVkhl8qViEVBO8MqVeI=.sha256)



----
[@copystar](@OmcQKQBmpGPni4lZbLmZE8In323qiIneo5EF7zejmvA=.ed25519) puts out [a small weekly newsletter](%hCMWZbYZYn/8l4w2ldLxdCs3Rswb6Ej5NuA5tCQJuLs=.sha256) which they've started sharing here. Topics in this one include: a conference on decentralized networks, Extinction Rebellion, Nature Conservancy of Canada, and Northern Soul Dancing. 

And then [another](%5X74tqxuRbzgNbp1NIlhX8mCw1rvopf/KTcwmk1ddvY=.sha256)

----
[@polylith](@0nakXtVIodBfdHwRQLVb64p54jTWS+DFHRqg58ky4CI=.ed25519) released [the latest version of their newsletter](%wSKOgL4M28Ns9ECW5vEDPw213FCoCTAOhJCd2wgn5/o=.sha256) too.

> I woke this morning to find September packing its things. A thin rain was pattering on the roof, and the air in the house was unfamiliarly chill. I lit the first fire of the season in the wood stove, and over a cup of tea did the last bit of editing on this month's letter. I read the letter to September as it warmed its hands over the stove. Would you like to hear it too?


----

[@Alchemist](@na1AJv1iWOflQOwsQ4srJJhYynkYawXiWDwM0ln4DgY=.ed25519) shared [a post about drying themself out](%aIuzDq0WPN1CQjnGtQ59qbLCEabpTaq9fwdtWNuOrNg=.sha256) so the humans can clean off the sea life and have a good look at her underside. This resulted in an interesting discussion about how much force that would put on the wharf. 

![a sunset sky over dark water at a potential wharf to dry Alchemist out on](&m9csvTW4EDsVoySPP7PqK/S/kHLkJueoltSdUcgqbvY=.sha256)


post 3 of 7

content.text:
## Solarpunk
[@Eb4890](@iGLjxMHlCW94tu/lEB8woc7AG2dNCzLY0KsebX+x2Iw=.ed25519) said,

> I am back from sailing and travelling with a crystallization of a plan. I had been thinking about getting a boat for a while, as a thing to travel in and tinker on, but now I think it's primary purpose will be as a sanctuary/refuge.
>
> I've been finding the modern world increasingly bizarre and oppressive. Bizarre in the political machinations going on around Brexit and oppressive in seeing normal life continuing without sufficient reaction to the climate crisis.
> 
> Both these things I find pretty debilitating.
> 
> While I was travelling I spent a lot of time without internet. I'd found it great whilst on the bay of biscay. I wouldn't wake up and check my phone and if there was something that I wanted to find out, I would either use offline wikipedia or note it for later. This allowed me more time to be creative and think of various boat/sea related inventions and contraptions. It gave me a sense of freedom I've not had for a while.

Read more [in their post](%NOOvuA9wtmz6ei51ET1aTyc6JJLyYW+7rql8p3R4P6E=.sha256) about how they're building on that to make their boat a personal sanctuary.

----
[@Jackalope](@EpTy67PmCoiO8RWg83TEG7jK9PsYbN/KIhirnN3Wk6E=.ed25519) shared [some solarpunk halloween projects](%C4NwtY9eyxpgqQhBo0N8wXKEBq6pNpRTib4TNDj6EGc=.sha256): pumpkin batteries, bioluminescent mushrooms for creepy lighting, and more.


## Community
[@glyph](@HEqy940T6uB+T+d9Jaa58aNfRzLx9eRWqkZljBmnkmk=.ed25519) started the discussion of Scuttlecamp 2: Brazil. They're currently aiming for June 2020, which is in the dry season before the peak of tourism.

![A map of South America, with Moinho represented as a red circle in the center of the image, is overlaid with a photo of a gorgeous waterfall in the top-right, a photo of a humyn person working with plants in the bottom right, and a sketch of one of angelica's awesome characters on the left sitting on the ground & tapping away at a laptop while wearing cool goggles.](&5zST4no0zmQHhKu07LUxaKDvrJ0jg8bEpoBruzf75BY=.sha256)

> We see Moinho as an ideal place to come together and cultivate long-term inter-community relationships, to share food and language, to be exposed to other realities, to lean out of our comfort zones, and to practice our solarpunk values and SSB principles.

There are [many more details in the post](%vjl7EZeaVEv4/XRaiOZB/gWDtdSOJBBR64jXb5bCp58=.sha256)

![Colour photo of a garden and house under construction, with banana trees, a hill and lots of open space.](&Sj1mC7U94LFdlK6v7yPggdrg/hfGk/BmY2V8jR3a0oc=.sha256)

----
[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) shares a [post about a future SSB Governance Council](%J6gh6nbCCeMDsvxo4o6kdMonMOSVzCiD0ydOQfPXRT0=.sha256)

> We have some money left in the #maintenance fund, and I think I've sensed a need for some governance work around Scuttlebutt. What I mean by that word is :
> - policy setting - how do we do things, what do we not do?
> - strategy forming - what are we trying to achieve (notice this doesn't specify tactics i.e. how to do it)
> - accountability function - taking on the role of checking that we're acting with integrity, and assessing whether policy / strategy is being followed or not.

Click through to read their thoughts behind it.

[@zelf](@3ZeNUiYQZisGC6PLf3R+u2s5avtxLsXC66xuK41e6Zk=.ed25519) [shared an anime brochure about Verifpal](%z4fLGXvj4l4Wd8TKAzZxQ13tP4pyvXheTkD6uc3dQN8=.sha256). The brochure helps teach people about protocol security and uses Scuttlebutt as one of the examples. 

> I can highly recommend it. Also seems like a good way to teach people about protocol security üå∏ ‚ú®


![anime style person inspecting a "protocol" with a magnifying glass](&lCbLS3luhPbZBP+GctBZES0dSX4JydWseXPEsloZvfY=.sha256)

> Verifpal is new software for verifying the security of cryptographic protocols. Building upon contemporary research in symbolic formal verification, Verifpal's main aim is to appeal more to real-world practitioners, students and engineers without sacrificing comprehensive formal verification features. 


## Software
[@SoapDog](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519)'s making [progress on the identity export / backup tool](%+EMsaRwwkn935JbW0TN8crJ9OYDWZVHdqM1G6IPbUD8=.sha256).

![gif: animation showing identity export process](&RDodRge1aWhLuTbESLiIZK8jonKd5JR5gpOVkqa6Pfk=.sha256)

![Manyverse on a DEX desktop](&+daGozabiWClGdCfbcC93pjD5TwoWPB0tsYQjdWtYtU=.sha256)

----

[@Rabble](@THUzexG1y6kWofwiN8Lix/jNH/P6roYdlCDgpAn2HSc=.ed25519) notes that they've chosen a name for the iOS Scuttlebutt client: "Planetary". [Their post also has updates](%SD3WszbEsswbRHhj6cCffcKD2ZhwF6iJ/OCKwQmLGOY=.sha256) about new decisions and functionality in the app, as well as lots of screenshots of the current UI.

![Screen Shot of planetary app on iOS](&Q9JZ9aJKEnVx/gEodJpXqhsyT5rSwvTGUQuheD1B4NM=.sha256)

There's also an interesting post by [@Rabble](@THUzexG1y6kWofwiN8Lix/jNH/P6roYdlCDgpAn2HSc=.ed25519) responding to questions about [who's behind Planetary and how the company is run](%DbzpPudWcQdK670jzOsrc1i9EPFTrqyIi/hwQeUDJKU=.sha256). 


----

[@arj](@6CAxOI3f+LUOVrbAl0IemqiS7ATpQvr9Mdw9LC4+Uv0=.ed25519) shared an [update on their ssb browser / partial replication experiment](%xmAXrk4iqbHifKTTQ9/Nx2zt7HzXREymRphlXyMV4P8=.sha256) and linked to a public site where you can check it out.

![ssb-browser-screenshot.jpg](&9f8jx9zXfmnUQAWQEG/YRUgPhVH4WYgf7cZirBF4sU0=.sha256)

----
[@Michael Mur√©](@GecdVOqEhzUIpNuxj6WveQR31fXTxP3BqCQWUHWY9eY=.ed25519)
 shared [some feedback about onboarding](%amKWUDP1waOljqmNZG6agdG73dfm2aMP8QwgqVPdZtg=.sha256) and some "long hanging fruits" that some developers could address to help improve the experience for new folks.

----
[@Ace](@rUntanbH1/pIEpkuTGVokZIl+8u7jBuroTVraNpu1cE=.ed25519) has [updated their IPFS Page Saver app](%iW9RMqksoWoJ7MrW++9FxFtCPLVF9cUyrcfR5K9fyXE=.sha256) and made a docker compose file if you're interested in running it locally or hosting it.

content.text:
### Summary Data 
This week's summary was curated from 660 threads by 188 authors by [@masukomi](@LzTjF5eAVC6xprPMGeNzqEP/EEBIGpM6hDaaY10hrz8=.ed25519), **with the support of my lovely patrons**. If you'd like to help continue this creation you can [become a patron on Patreon](https://www.patreon.com/the_weekly).

There... may have been an atypically high amount of skimming this time, which means there's lots left for you to discover on your own. ;)




post 7 of 7

Scuttlefriends: 

I wanted to give you a heads-up that summaries over the next two months will be on a somewhat erratic schedule.  My wife has a medical issue that will hopefully be resolved by an impending surgery, but between taking care of her and the many tasks life demands, it's been difficult to find the hours to work on this. I look forward to reading all your lovely posts, and summarizing them, it'll just be a little more unpredictable when they'll emerge. 

Thanks in advance for your understanding. 

-Kay
Thanks so much [@mixmix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519)  :)

[@IBob](@vkdMlsuBgzzo5eLS3LZLdqnBpZ26OauJOMIq9gQ2E7E=.ed25519) shares that [data sniffing dogs are a thing now](%Ju1vbRTzqbNw6aCKvtfTqGDHa6d3MvF9KYv8H4Wm6AA=.sha256)

![a dog demonstrating their ability to sniff out data storage devices](&yV6/kyTChsA7ECjSt74dgt9EbRb4eyKueCk6YRKbMOg=.sha256)


I tracked down [a related web article](https://www.nextgov.com/cybersecurity/2018/06/these-police-dogs-sniff-out-electronic-devices/149045/) with this bit of info:

>All electronic devices that have memory storage have a coating of a chemical called triphenylphosphine oxide, or TPPO. This is what the dogs are sniffing out.


----
[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) shares a story about childhood, grenades, paint, and gifts.

![WWII russian grenade](&ROZwQ9MAeRiFVOhtWL60eVJ4hFEpuSG3xgnHXzaoCmw=.sha256)

----
[@Norddeutscher Honigdachs](@RAserlXFEyOZko7/wNxtSHbdrynNdpMhSMzWLyPFCLQ=.ed25519) shared this adorable video of a small child discovering a very tasty drink.

![video:schokolade.mp4](&hK2uXfOWU6uwVpAK8IrlsyuW/ADOmiMJDFp76vKsG7I=.sha256)


## Solarpunk

[@Luandro](@2RNGJafZtMHzd76gyvqH6EJiK7kBnXeak5mBWzoO/iU=.ed25519) shared a story about trying to get his community to [start monitoring and managing their watershed](%4nAEeofS6zbeuaoxZAQksTw6F7NUL6tIccDIRLrtfUw=.sha256) before the water company moves in and makes life worse for everyone.

Along those lines, they're thinking of having a project for Scuttlecamp be to help empower the Mohino community to save their watershed.

## Community

[@zelf](@3ZeNUiYQZisGC6PLf3R+u2s5avtxLsXC66xuK41e6Zk=.ed25519) shared [this picture](%4P4WgyAYJywk+AfFxqbOo9jYyZvv5ERGCStC4Qc11f8=.sha256) of a little slice of our community.


![all hail SoapDog. Center of a group of people, and the only one to wear their scuttlebutt shirt to a crab-meet](&Qi1ZSLDe9LQrVBJ86eRiRdJRbCX1F504PEKhGOLCFc4=.sha256)

[@glyph](@HEqy940T6uB+T+d9Jaa58aNfRzLx9eRWqkZljBmnkmk=.ed25519) notes that they are "...[seeking sponsorship, support, and connections](%E/y4S0/6vET6laNlGOL2xm8voScA0ew9L8Ttr3ZDF7g=.sha256) in order to make Scuttlecamp 2 truly lush, symbiotic and polyphonic."

Click through to see how you can help, even if you can't make it to Brazil in June.

[@Richard D. Bartlett](@3r4+IyB5NVl2in6QOZHIu9oSrZud+NuVgl2GX3x2WG8=.ed25519) let us know that The Local Gossip is now available in your favorite podcast apps. [More details in the post](%lfxL2JPGnKztdhuKGPpPecsgaFUZzP1HwaYEEehZMWU=.sha256)

content.text:
[@SoapDog](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519) pondered [if people were posting less](%XTLqUY8TnmBJxJX5MNJL6TQErNbuvyXG0nVnsA+mKys=.sha256) and Glyph shared this nice observational metaphor.

> I get the feeling we‚Äôre all super busy building and growing things, resulting in less time for sharing.
>
> I once described an NGO I used to work at as being like a beehive (the question was: what animal do you think best represents this organisation?). When you stand in front of a beehive you see a lot of activity but it‚Äôs hard to grasp what‚Äôs going inside the hive and what all of those in-transit bees are up to. I think the Scuttleverse has reached the beehive stage now, and meta communication is going to become increasingly important. - [@glyph](@HEqy940T6uB+T+d9Jaa58aNfRzLx9eRWqkZljBmnkmk=.ed25519)

----

[@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) shared some thoughts on traditional [centralized governance vs "disgovernance"](%jGfKOSgs+R3AM2M1c41Z9EHCrz9YEu0dwU0sPnkOOm4=.sha256) and why they feel that the "disgovernance" model is better suited for the scuttleverse.

> ... you can think of the entire scientific community as a decentralized consortium to ‚Äúapprove‚Äù some scientific hypothesis (‚Äúproposals‚Äù) in a decentralized manner via ‚Äúpeer reviews‚Äù. Contrast that with an imaginary centralized ‚ÄúGlobal Scientific Community (GSC)‚Äù consortium with formal processes for proposing and approving all science papers in a pipeline...

I'd share the pictoral descriptions, but they wouldn't make much sense without the context. You should go [read the thread](%jGfKOSgs+R3AM2M1c41Z9EHCrz9YEu0dwU0sPnkOOm4=.sha256) though. Hear what they're thinking, and why others agree and disagree with it.

----
[@Aljoscha](@zurF8X68ArfRM71dF3mKh36W0xDM8QmOnAS5bYOq8hA=.ed25519) is starting to put together [an SSB event in Bazel Switzerland](%Xzrcj8ncjwt86Q6NngySzp3JRz25RW//yzt0bYJ1/PI=.sha256).

![old houses line a river in Bazel Switzerland](&5evqucVacroZrEmiNMRg4BTyuZosJO0kEgXv+REfNKc=.sha256)


## Software 

Guess which client got [a cute timeline view of future events](%SwxRsPWWDj7zMjEDvt7HTmTxIBWYI/s738ycHSwRs+M=.sha256)? Patchfox!

----


[@arj](@6CAxOI3f+LUOVrbAl0IemqiS7ATpQvr9Mdw9LC4+Uv0=.ed25519) shared a [demo of peer invites](%Mc/IdsRtrUtvqJJA9nHtW2A42jSax4HexeTEbAlDVIQ=.sha256) with a bunch of photos showing how the process works.

![create-invite‚Äì1.jpg](&+PiW1PgLSDszXol8sG+OU/OHBZCr5JaqKPETCg5iBVQ=.sha256)

> And once the invite is accepted the feeds or those people included in the invite will be fetched so the user can start exploring the butt‚Äôverse :confetti_ball:


----
[@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) shared that Manyverse was temporarily taken down from the Google Play store [because Andr√© dared to thank people](%L6NED6FPcggF0/I4dCGdDda2ELzbRCdb6rs4juRl2jI=.sha256).

----

content.text:
[@Maleficient](@KpPLISvjzw8CkoWOJ3zKXBgPtNDuzUgfyGbJEfbJ4H8=.ed25519) shared [a look at how Tsunami Democratic hadles their extra difficult problem of making onboarding easy](%0sTRZFT4orM9iD8E+noH6Zmbe4++eXeqk7i5feGKTWg=.sha256) and yet limited. In the end they wonder how we could apply their lessons to SSB onboarding.

----
[@Powersource](@Vz6v3xKpzViiTM/GAe+hKkACZSqrErQQZgv4iqQxEn8=.ed25519) shared [a rough sketch of a SSB First-Aid Client](%mKCauFJbUvrP4nzJ+yyiTTkZxAkQLazXoDg5Wn9/ceU=.sha256). 

![a sketch (pencil on paper) of a proposed UI for a SSB first-aid client](&PC7OUvRo7Ig/Q/pLjNnGJ+BAf5+9kwbQ3KbJ3VQX4lY=.sha256)



I love how often SSB developers start out with paper. Geeks so often reach for code first, and plan later. SSB Geeks, seem to do the opposite. We have good geeks. ;) 


## Geeky

[@SoapDog](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519) suggests that...

> [It would be beneficial to the scuttleverse if we could agree on a custom URL scheme](%Epck+Xt399/tyc7HzIK38WH4QHu9ilEvd3gBVwxFR3g=.sha256). There have been different approach to this issue and everyone is basically doing their own thing in an incompatible way.


----
[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) has [released ssb-schema-definitions v2.0.0](%0o2zFUP5C0PaYJV3ZnTVaFQafn3QOLNVB54SKBaWUiM=.sha256)

> this is a module of JSON schema definitions to make writing your own validators easier. This has existed for a while but I‚Äôve changed a couple of things recently...

They [released ssb-profile v0.1.0](%PjyuHJN7raVxxIcItNMp++NxxFN1oo5vkUhN0quEWh8=.sha256)

> It‚Äôs a new module which lets you manage creating, updating, and getting ‚Äúprofile‚Äù records.

They [released ssb-tangle v2.0.0](%MySpH3rUQNSEtV2eibFwRX8zjx16A+97KwAkL12CueE=.sha256)

> This is a module for creating, manipulating, and reducing tangle-threads. It‚Äôs ‚Ä¶. kinda a beast, but I‚Äôm incredibly happy with it. It‚Äôs a bunch of the power under the new ssb-profile


And, because that wasn't enough, they also posted about [Naming thread-tangle attributes](%xrIrNSlZo3/K+MQEN+jDftQtofNXxfd5WLFNvChwMuM=.sha256).

------------
### Summary Data

[@hoodownr](@YND2Cb9uk3ZdFyzXpaXDH5HZ9udu+qjg4MhNcynK2RE=.ed25519) shared this nice minimal line drawing from their Inktober. 


![line drawing of a person laying on a table in a hospital room](&3gnRsmGFp2l9egB5yZNBTe+QPSDrEE/qFKiWFG9QoOE=.sha256)

October provided us with a lot of great Inktober submissions. I'd especially recommend you check out what [@Gaffen](@zdpL3pz44do6ZK5V9wzuzrponmGlgcVyY7TEYVvkVeE=.ed25519) has been uploading. Lots of great little pieces like this one:

![Inktober Day 24: Dizzy. An improvised temple sculpture based loosely on Aztec portrayals of Quetzalcoatl with spirals in its‚Äô eyes](&DSLPH0kXYlzmhoH8yYfJ4MH4VQI8nmGJ41EIuiOsbtc=.sha256)


They put together a collage of the full set [here](%7FCJhR0Kk6IzOnbjww3JHqi787hgduLz0fVPnv8KCuM=.sha256), but As you can see from the one above, there's a lot of detail lost when they're shrunk down. Go find the "originals". 

![A collage of all Gaffen's inktober entries for 2019](&5ZMygBjGc6bWtklbfhu1q8l6eE+5UnTW6YdauHWOi7g=.sha256)


----

[@Aadil Ayub](@y0P7anmcS+TqwiFGlONhFNadXNb9agEAWVRPRk9ed+0=.ed25519) shared this quote from _Permanent Record_ by Edward Snowden:

> How can I explain it, to someone who wasn‚Äôt there? My younger readers, with their younger standards, might think of the nascent Internet as way too slow, the nascent Web as too ugly and un-entertaining. But that would be wrong. Back then, being online was another life, considered by most to be separate and distinct from Real Life. The virtual and the actual had not yet merged. And it was up to each individual user to determine for themselves where one ended and the other began. 

> It was precisely this that was so inspiring: the freedom to imagine something entirely new, the freedom to start over. Whatever Web 1.0 might‚Äôve lacked in user-friendliness and design sensibility, it more than made up for by its fostering of experimentation and originality of expression.

[and commented](%Q7GBYuLBoFeloX5JN6FlDmRUXOkbeGluBKvou+9FMkQ=.sha256)

> I think this explains what it is that I love so much about #scuttlebutt, the #fediverse, and #dweb in general.

I couldn't agree more. I was doing web dev for people back in 1995. The distributed web and Fediverse are _very_ reminiscent of what the internet looked like without corporate overlords shoving everything into walled gardens. The tooling is just more mature and less DIY. 

I can't wait for the eventual implosion of Facebook and Twitter. I'm just hoping that the Distributed Web and Fediverse is ready to fill the void when that happens.

We're getting there with great tools like [Mastodon](https://mastodon.social/about) & [Pleroma](https://pleroma.social/) and [Pixelfed](https://pixelfed.org/). The distributed web feels, to me, like we're getting close. I love SSB (obviously) but onboarding is still a pain, and while we've talked a lot about how to handle potential abuse, we've still got a lot of code to implement before. we can actually do it. We _could_ be the replacement for Facebook, but right now none of the distributed offerings feel mature enough. 

----

[@Matt McKegg](@FbGoHeEcePDG3Evemrc+hm+S77cXKf8BRQgkYinJggg=.ed25519) started [vlogging about their music rig](%RJn+WJB4faSmIhF7xESsfKEqHEQLuuv7SBTWqOG4i5M=.sha256). 

![matt looks into the camera while sitting at a desk covered with digital music equipment](&7Vc6imrzz12sNkSA3zcl2RkzQGc0G/jl71SfTlsGEtI=.sha256)

## Solarpunk

content.text:
## Software 

[@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) has [released a new version of Manyverse](%TDhAyEHAz4AxabiRl9oxJ8JR6LiWKrYvQNvL8NGbrvQ=.sha256) with Backup and Restore! ... and other improvements. ;)

![manyverse screenshot with a dialog indicating that an identity has been restored](&8wynlI9ed5KUm4kRevvbWe9G8R5NyhkjZUxkxXEwmHg=.sha256)

They also [discussed Resisting recency, and zoomable UIs](%UgxCCh+wKDENFVXWuvMJrh81AtFHyawEb998Ca9HtNU=.sha256)

> I think one of the drivers of burnout within SSB and other social spaces is the focus that the ‚ÄúFeed‚Äù puts on a linear timeline where recent content is king. Sorting a timeline of content by recency, and recency only, is useful but it puts emphasis on ‚Äî well ‚Äî recency! It makes a lot of sense for Twitter which is a space you enter to take a sample of ‚Äúwhat‚Äôs going on‚Äù at the moment. It makes less sense for social circles like Facebook and Instagram, except if you‚Äôre gossip/rumor oriented, which is/was Facebook‚Äôs emphasis. Overall lists of posts are attractive because scrolling is a simple mindless activity that even monkeys and babies can perform. SSB apps, Manyverse included, follow the recency tradition because it‚Äôs familiar and the ‚Äúdefault‚Äù.

Much more in the post. I think he's on to something important. Displaying content has just been "the way" for so many years that we take it for granted that it is the "right" way. Personally I think it's an interaction mechanism from a time with less data. You went to someone's blog and it was just _their_ posts you saw sorted recently. You weren't looking at the feed of recent posts from _everyone_ you found interesting on a particular platform. Despite multiple prunings, I still follow _hundreds_ of people on Twitter. Because of the way data is presented I am regularly forced to skip large swaths of it because I simply can't read it all. 

----
Speaking of backups, [@SoapDog](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519) released an early beta of [ssb-backup-tool](%8uA4R1XBJCw7hVQ+Nd21p5wfWLrDw2ZFP/1oYUWP0Yg=.sha256).

----
[@Rabble](@THUzexG1y6kWofwiN8Lix/jNH/P6roYdlCDgpAn2HSc=.ed25519) noted that Planetary (the iOS SSB client) has moved to TestFlight distribution. Speaking as a beta tester that's a huge step forward. They're also working on displaying local and remote peers in the UI. 

In other words, [gradual progress continues to be made](%I/I5GcW48qtCYCdF8tViB2kT3DXzvGBISh8mAdaDRFY=.sha256).

![screenshot of planetary showing connected peers](&yCuYRN5wcex4utDc8nyYKuoRdP9hvfHv33Y42nnNkEI=.sha256)



----
[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) shared a post (and PDF) discussing some recent work about [trying to figure out who gets to see what information in a tree of human connections and relationships](%vnDRm8VqPIU4iWM2L35i3B4GwWZdSHc5AQ/G/cyNpGo=.sha256).

![example of a whakapapa tree](&L9T8Cdsp1d1zicXjRMKEm0Q+ZJrOSfHoEtjDuz6QFNg=.sha256)



----

[@duncan](@Wbmkx0zKN/zFC1Li7Mz3IEQlcnHT7gAQ38i3hRCqyp4=.ed25519) says 

> I‚Äôm starting work on a new project. The goal is to improve Scuttlebutt‚Äôs documentation for people who wish to build things upon Scuttlebutt. [I want to make these situations better](%z4bA3ix77rovI+FZOjMG8j1bgpGdJQ1lLabMjmcPTgU=.sha256):

> * ‚ÄúI have an idea for something I want to build with Scuttlebutt but no idea where to begin‚Äù
> * ‚ÄúIs this code I found currently being used, experimental or old and not used anymore?‚Äù
> * ‚ÄúWhere on earth is the code responsible for this part of Scuttlebutt?‚Äù
> * ‚ÄúHow do I change this existing Scuttlebutt client to do what I want?‚Äù

Click through to learn more.


----
[@Daan](@MRiJ+CvDnD9ZjqunY1oy6tsk0IdbMDC4Q3tTC8riS3s=.ed25519) shared [a quick anecdote](%GONsWGXmUxtTpo/JQbFyuGHiUOlo12ngj266a40fyGA=.sha256) about why offline-first software design is so important. 

----
[@switch](@9OFBA15mnlpqRfjzL8idyOvKj3UbQCA96GOLk4AjmxE=.ed25519) shares a twitter thread and some comments about how [Apple's new "notarization" policy screws indie, and poor, developers](%PBYdGLMriWWO1/xk97cI0MPsQkFzNCpIT89X+AYTFjM=.sha256) by forcing them to pay to make their software to run on macOS without additional steps on macOS. 

## Geeky
[@keks](@YXkE3TikkY4GFMX3lzXUllRkNTbj5E+604AkaO1xbz8=.ed25519) shared a use case for potentially making a new SSB message type: sharing your public key. [Click through](%Iy3qGmRgGVdoHtc6PmHgtWWdr6/w8Y2AZ5IH8C75bb8=.sha256) to hear their thinking and leave some feedback.


----
[@cft](@AiBJDta+4boyh2USNGwIagH/wKjeruTcDX2Aj1r/haM=.ed25519) shared some [research they'd done](%XNMwjzb/tKiTDyfeDDDNOAV9UQpNxm+f/ZwYO9qonN0=.sha256) about tangles and extending the pub/sub concept throughout the software stack. 

![pub / sub structured software stack](&1ZrChMe8zWibkdXpm5z0CW1d/zTQ6Oc1LDh0U6F2qgk=.sha256)

There's much more in the post including a chess, and chat proof of concept.

![video:demo-chat.mp4](&bPVbCyCOHXa1rWmhbV6bZl31+rnBvB2nwS4HzC1TwvQ=.sha256)




------------
### Summary Data

This summary was curated from 428 threads by 161 authors by [@masukomi](@LzTjF5eAVC6xprPMGeNzqEP/EEBIGpM6hDaaY10hrz8=.ed25519), **with the support of my lovely patrons**. If you'd like to help continue this creation you can [become a patron on Patreon](https://www.patreon.com/the_weekly).

And, as noted before. Thank you for your patience over the upcoming weeks while I take care of my wife. Posts will continue, they'll just be somewhat erratic in their scheduling.

content.text:
## Community
[@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) notes that [SSB has a Wikipedia page now](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Secure_Scuttlebutt) :link:

Their [post is here](%0sGApWhdDK/9NsLkQKG9M4zawZRuiH9zeGSdWUtv7WQ=.sha256).

----
[@hng](@ySXxRNhuEQj8oUNqDuUNF2stKE4t0BwnWPOjnPGm6ck=.ed25519) notes that [ssb is about to be featured on the Apen√£ podcast](https://medium.com/apen%C3%A3) (Portugese language).

## Software
[@mnin](@SXVoA/7CuMRS5IDTNsO8HU2PvCIVq8HKUUx/k+idDiQ=.ed25519)'s work has come to fruition and the new Scuttlebutt web site is live. [Check out their post](%ATssjMsgJeymt91dHJZ7gypdlCiCh9IIxZGa9F3J0O0=.sha256) for lots of details.

![screenshot of scuttlebutt.nz](&61H0VtbG4O+AO639E0PgLjOvrjLn2CsG9ysEoUvGYQw=.sha256)

----
[@Christian Bundy](@+oaWWDs8g73EZFUMfW37R/ULtFEjwKN/DczvdYihjbU=.ed25519) made [a CLI client for Scuttlebutt](%7p73Zaxq/UnCbqVsIgTNPBhpWD4pUYPLe8rnprfkJUo=.sha256).

> It‚Äôs still under development (and it‚Äôs unearthed a handful of problems in the stack) but I‚Äôd love thoughts and feedback.


----
[@„ÄêÔªøÔºÆÔΩÖÔΩîÔΩìÔΩÉÔΩÅÔΩêÔΩÖ Navigator‚Ñ¢„Äë](@z2M8msI2EUubNHnrEJncglDIy2/SUd+36jCyJnfeiHk=.ed25519) has [figured out how to blog on the web via SSB](%1fVaxOurkNIGrphWeXM0h7EYxD6dmvYgxNYbf1+Kci8=.sha256).

The tldr; seem to be it reads your feed, copies images to a local folder, and runs it thrnough a static site generator. They've shared the ruby script that does it too. Cool. 

----
[@Christian Bundy](@+oaWWDs8g73EZFUMfW37R/ULtFEjwKN/DczvdYihjbU=.ed25519) has released v2.7.0 of Oasis a "Friendly Scuttlebutt interface designed for simplicity and accessibility." Details [in their post](%kb/f/i0pKWlqeQH6uFfOqGAhIaHfusrLFcZWtpBTHCg=.sha256)

----
[@SoapDog](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519) demonstrated how [Patchfox's sidebar can let you reference other posts](%w5brS4h+1x5OFw7nsrDmD6zXiyWn93F99ND9hPXUh68=.sha256) while creating a new one.

![video:quotes.mp4](&4lS1hQs6SOM86j5q30aQpJhhzV2dB4GQ7YnG1E88vRg=.sha256)

## Geeky

[@keks](@YXkE3TikkY4GFMX3lzXUllRkNTbj5E+604AkaO1xbz8=.ed25519) shared [the minutes from a call](%ho/e1MyrtwpfJiYm5DmlkGiAxe7rOAk5tr2MYC5oYR8=.sha256) with [@Dominic](@EMovhfIrFk4NihAKnRNhrfRaqIhBv1Wj8pTxJNgvCCY=.ed25519) and [@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) about the new private groups feature.

[This later post](%1qQJ2szfWa/PerVSVPLlwpl8SlyhGsorrwp6jLW+zfA=.sha256) discusses "...use cases where we need to reference a group in a public message, but don‚Äôt want to leak who created the message." and shares a couple thoughts on that matter

They "... also we realized that [it would be helpful if a message could be referencing itself](%CD1C8SgKYmghPOpq5tI3nQmGKTewxqBXJCG0bxZyA8A=.sha256)."

content.text:
[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) realized they didn't know [how to decript a private message on SSB](%RouG6IVwpEQhfYLpyFkjyJrj9uhR6GlQDH+4Ngt/6Bg=.sha2569), and then spent some time figuring it out and writing down the details for us.

----
[@adria0](@ZFWw+UclcUgYi081/C8lhgH+KQ9s7YJRoOYGnzxW/JQ=.ed25519) got ssb `whoami` [working in Rust](%mcs2pQ+uDph77Qsn2O/lTvNeqFAnZfsuYZXX8mmKnRk=.sha256) and shared the source code.

----
[@corlock](@sHFNLAao6phQ5AN17ecYNUbszDa4Qf6DhyQsjtQfdmY=.ed25519) discovered that there's no verification of "local" SSB users and thus [you can fake them](%itxbdOh3sCW1YLIDCWzA7UlssaAWXNRi9Jf8ZxebTXY=.sha256).

> Today I made a quick program that simulates the peer-discovery component of the SSB protcol.. and I realized that there‚Äôs actually no verification that happens before showing users in ‚ÄúLocal‚Äù section of your sidebar. This means, it‚Äôs pretty trivial to send a message that makes all SSB users on the local network think that ‚Äúdominic is in the building‚Äù.

I'm not sure what nefarious purposes you could put this to but I'm pretty sure there are some. 


----
[@micro](@wsoeSOhEE3yAIEF1gTVMeStUWnoejIz1P6a3lnvjaOM=.ed25519) shared their [Lua Wireshark scuttlebutt discovery packet dissector](%W4cHMXizTTN/9M9kVcI4/jKhNTV3eitpIl5fCpoGcE4=.sha256).

![screenshot of wireshark ssb packet disection](&2YDIhBDaUoSXpWjI/DOoI+LyW7CXjF6q5yHKUagOal0=.sha256)


------------
### Summary Data 

This week‚Äôs summary was curated from 506 threads by 182 authors by [@masukomi](@LzTjF5eAVC6xprPMGeNzqEP/EEBIGpM6hDaaY10hrz8=.ed25519), **with the support of my lovely patrons**. If you'd like to help continue this creation you can [become a patron on Patreon](https://www.patreon.com/the_weekly).

## A note from your curator
Thank you all for your patience and understanding. I think I'm finally able to pick this work back up on a regular basis. This post is going to include a number of "old" posts, because there's almost a month of stuff to catch everyone up on. 

I look forward to joining you more regularly. :) I was a way too long.

# Recent Days in Scuttlebutt

## Totally Random

[@platteneule](@2knKcpGIimcEYkK4OdzOX3wGImtRbDsQl9U2uitCm50=.ed25519) [shared a "mix tape"](%ya48fuYN+COZhlreKJe02V3zdFU2WHcAJGS4lJN2O1I=.sha256) that encodes "...the heat of the japanese mid-summer until the golden autumn hits the greater area of Mount Fuji..."

> A bunch of us butts got together to reflect on a call on the whole process of building the scuttlebutt website thus so far. It was really nice to reconnect after some weeks and months between some of us chatting, and it was reaffirming to hear the lessons learnt and the challenges felt between us all.

[@Luandro](@2RNGJafZtMHzd76gyvqH6EJiK7kBnXeak5mBWzoO/iU=.ed25519) shared some gorgeous [pictures of Moinho](%9sXdlzAyjMPeUic/jmnr8RDM9735Yi+tgAxwC4RPn94=.sha256) where scuttlecamp 2 will be. 

![entrance to moinho](&f1fWSyO00hoPAt/31Z10/XhsXHvdky/7p7u646tLiYc=.sha256)


On a related note [@glyph](@HEqy940T6uB+T+d9Jaa58aNfRzLx9eRWqkZljBmnkmk=.ed25519) announced that [the Scuttlecamp 2 Web site is live](%kmedw9jxJy1IdGl6551DXOnQWuIAFD2yRm70PmUXmXM=.sha256). 

![Screenshot of the background of the Scuttlecamp 2 website. The image depicts a verdant landscape, with grass in the foreground, a mangaba tree (like a mix between an apple and mango) on the left and rolling green hills in the background. Three mangaba fruits can be seen laying in the grass beneath the tree. A robot traveller with backpack is walking away from the tree and appears on the far-right of the image. A blue sky and wispy white clouds complete the scene. White font, centred at the top of the image, reads ‚ÄúScuttlecamp 2‚Äù. All artwork composing this image was created by the stupendously-delightful @angelica!](&dN1Od5aQ6C4JC7f6hrhsHOmJJLFK4ttlTSacg4vq9yc=.sha256)



## Software
[@Christian Bundy](@+oaWWDs8g73EZFUMfW37R/ULtFEjwKN/DczvdYihjbU=.ed25519) has [released Oasis 2.8.0](%r9nMaZHNBQ5ysnIU5m/N3oUk37MLz+EFjnqKZW0EiEw=.sha256).

> I‚Äôm happy to announce the latest release of Oasis, the friendly scuttlebutt interface that works in your favorite web browser. There are a handful of small changes and fixes and such, but there‚Äôs one change I‚Äôm very excited about: popular posts.

[Check out the web demo](https://oasis-demo.fraction.io/) to see what it's like.


They also [asked for feedback on how posts should be shown by default](%8r9O7185djNXP2XHn2Rv6l9krmxos8iQu9IavDBA0UE=.sha256). 

----

[@corlock](@sHFNLAao6phQ5AN17ecYNUbszDa4Qf6DhyQsjtQfdmY=.ed25519) shared a screenshot from [the project they've been working on](%F8Vyn73wTxdOM/xVn+9xa6r4ivR3+UzFu/szLeZ2Jrs=.sha256): scuttle-chat terminal based "Ephemeral chats over encrypted TCP streams for the Scuttleverse"


![Screen Shot 2019‚Äì12‚Äì09 at 1.50.12 PM.png](&QQfknolADwg2FafBRXEwvGhaDw2d1moU9U+TKaMQ36s=.sha256)

It's written in rust. 


----

[@mixmix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) [released whakapapa ora](%73IEAkfBlClyHZUx7LZiiRaGxcbEGPMBhefnQYzL2ao=.sha256) a couple months ago, and has been [iterating on it](%C9KCJDMcusW3WjlFsnXQtuzORALg2b/5v1oO/OKoJGk=.sha256) ever since.

It's still early stages, and the documentation is limited, but you can use it to keep track of communities, 

![whakapapa ora - communities page](&OgJxwcP7fAGKrHkH8VZ6TBX6xtTGFN2Y8eK+2enL/e8=.sha256)

people

![whakapapa ora - profile page](&Mkz62JFY62MjBOVANnFRU7aMYFny6xlvNrx9VvgQeaE=.sha256)

and family trees

![ahau mix whakapapa](&WpM49KwLhpg8MP0C2QQQFBR4QkseERWuT5l5jsqWzjw=.sha256)

Of course, it all runs over SSB. 

The [source code is here](https://gitlab.com/ahau/whakapapa-ora/) but requires a little familiarity with NPM and the command line to build and run. There are no packaged releases...yet.

[@SoapDog](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519) released [a Firefox plugin to remind you to come back to a web page](%AOOjNVXDRxTzO/INAK2JdyuUrVeS6QzgqyT219jXzdo=.sha256) at some date in the future. 

![remind me of the page firefox plugin animated screenshot](&TYqxmqrREAgwq7HwK+Ch2DW/6beoppr/6GKsUsBr0So=.sha256)

Click through for details. 


## Geeky
[@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) shared [some sequence diagrams of how SSB "Rooms" work](%cqDk0dbcYc/n+zugT15qVUvnEkwXz+dkfjH/uZxVCWs=.sha256). 


----
[@micro](@wsoeSOhEE3yAIEF1gTVMeStUWnoejIz1P6a3lnvjaOM=.ed25519) is 

> [Playing around with an idea to create scuttlebutt "gardens"](%Jm+/spO8D/08Uz18HwKb+p/mpkCZ3lTgOWpAgryO10c=.sha256) - an easier way to create and join networks by name. Trying to find ways to make it less intimidating for spawning communities that are not dev firehose content.

![table of 3 name of scuttlebutt networks, and long string of random encoded ‚Äòkeys‚Äô to access those names](&vXp5lhbJRAk12QdmmFTDYzCZ7519IpGQ9PArGv84VHI=.sha256)

# Recent Days in Scuttlebutt

Note: I'm still catching up from my time away. This post has some temporal overlap with the last one. I still have a bit to go to catch up to the present day, but you just write so much good content...


## Totally Random

[@Chromodoris](@XY261NcgFjgLXVsnZbeIPGdA8h+6U4VNLErQjvHXDns=.ed25519) shared [some lovely pictures of the outside world](%fY0hzpu5BBnxfc8xTnIk09cktj/uixTLyC7NNHGA6Rw=.sha256).


![a close-up of a tree with mushrooms growing on it](&tDDBC/d8gvLT6v2TtrFK/TAg5e3RvfrSDFbHTHEDJHE=.sha256)


----
[@Daan p20 üìü](@tUMwMvb+roaOJAyohpGUxgqYo4E7HfBlY0NkUzALqjY=.ed25519) shared [a couple outdoors shots and a book](%gwHC5k09PHLUKPPHsJPcd/tVyrjyEXKVc/7yx7CHqDs=.sha256). 

![the sun shining through a high layer of fog over a north hessian landscape](&dNb39aC6SqhuUHnxBa9RINa/dutGwQ3lzAYKn3DW9TE=.sha256)

----

[@emile](@2YVYXQclEJHVzCON5dsLRwf65b2S6HnvxpGS8/LwjwY=.ed25519)'s cat [helped with some Ham Radio contacts](%3rK6epGpy5/dEh0wvpWBK4vz/35AhuD/R+YGETVfel4=.sha256).


![cat behind iMac and near a ham radio antenna](&n+OlkmGzVsHV/LrgYOggiLzIszEJv1l3q+XzE46YNVM=.sha256)

They also [shared a link](%QaX0gB1WsJ3caPoGpi78GfwJjNy2vOBhKWV8bmnWIbA=.sha256) to

"[Mina and me - Toddling across the Norwegian mountains](https://youtu.be/6BEwdDgdOSU)"

A ski tour of Alexander and Mina (age 4!) though the Norwegian snowfields.It's an interesting looking 26 minute documentary. 


----

[@Angelica](@eANNuLfzX/9rlGODXHYV8WJb+zw2h+d7YsT4vpYPvD0=.ed25519) found large versions of the Cynthia, Jackie, and Martin characters from the SSB Intro video [and shared them with us](%GNZ4bFJD6LHuGUYLa3eNhw7NulGczsKsvOomdmSgWCc=.sha256).

![cynthia ssb user pic](&6z+EP6Esy8Ft6FsxViBmyUs4986J8oD8oxCoc44TCYI=.sha256)

----

[@sl007](@jX1pC2ZWcoOd0z8IrVxpBX7bpcPfV438t6jsvp3d9Po=.ed25519) joined us and [shared this photo](%y9wrM2McWsNB3T+v41Q8IQgz+6xSNQV9+OseDQpxfwY=.sha256), along with links to many more amazing ones from their time as a photojournalist. Hopefully more will be shared with us. 

![hands holding an ak47 machine gun overlooking a mountanous road](&QhEpwwB0e57mgbf/zhBL+DsNP/JwRD92jMnIdaieQHA=.sha256)

[This batch](https://pluspora.com/posts/8f7603c03817013703de005056264835) and story that they linked to are from the Carteret islands which are [nearly lost to climate change](https://www.abc.net.au/news/2018-08-04/the-race-against-time-to-save-the-carteret-islanders/10066958).

----
[@Agustin Haro](@JMIbfsr2i/DRm+esw+bv0MkxsKuaXgc3rMAje4bhwwk=.ed25519) has a [new family member](%2MajD+/vTLR1I2COXcONuYOGnV19OXk2hD9YryOEh7U=.sha256)


![oso the dog looks up](&kb3Vxp8oA2Xj2bt2VnbFnXVGK45UiIWLlKiyHNe6p+E=.sha256)

They also [shared links to the music they've created](%FHCMKNroU0QDjPQNce+tQTzsuIQ4CEtYhCrkETzZcZw=.sha256)

----
[@Ryan](@YcULoiCt35mq9njrahmXFONqX/gGEVN1ffdMt20pzgE=.ed25519) also [got a new family member](%N0mZTPoiCrhKlBtBV7MiaQ4XZtLdQzZU8MB5+h/cHxs=.sha256)

[@Aadil Ayub](@y0P7anmcS+TqwiFGlONhFNadXNb9agEAWVRPRk9ed+0=.ed25519) shared [a "p2p Mixtape" on DAT](%i3GFUiACyj7qWHHQxsZ/JFtNBTppyhhfbNDRoBZ0Yfo=.sha256) entitled "Ambient Flow". 


----
[@polylith](@0nakXtVIodBfdHwRQLVb64p54jTWS+DFHRqg58ky4CI=.ed25519) released [their December newsletter](%ODx5+mHZdO3W7xoUl45t5zHMbdpEFzpkmYai+Tfxi8c=.sha256).

(I told you I was still catching up. ;) )

> December tends to hang around till the last minute each year. It joins us for a sauna after sunset, packs its things in secret and stashes them in a snowbank. December only leaves after we‚Äôve counted down from ten, dropped the lantern from the tree, and toasted with kombucha and tea and the odd glass of cider. While we‚Äôre hugging and singing, it slips off down the street in the shadow of the maples. Goodbyes can feel awkward for me too, so I get it. Safe travels friend.

----

content.text:
[@SoapDog (SPX)](@0xkjAty6RSr5uhbAvi0rbVR2g9Bz+89qiKth48ECQBE=.ed25519)
released v0.0.5 released (beta) of the [SSB Backup Tool](%tmQjDsWri6a2kLrFNDnezwfp5sQ+kloDmPVI39fBtIs=.sha256). It's still early stages, but this is good progress. :) 

![backup tool](&16rYIY9Wa3dfs41IbNXmlizTrpTJEQKbgqLhM309yK0=.sha256)
(Give it a minute and you'll see more than just a progress spinner)

> This version is a milestone for SSB Backup Tool because it is the first version that is able to start an SSB server on demand. This means that I can now start working on the restore account part of the app. 

----
[@Luandro](@2RNGJafZtMHzd76gyvqH6EJiK7kBnXeak5mBWzoO/iU=.ed25519) shared [a demo](%+Hz7yBq533jDWNzWfflyhWIdfEI79qbCm2aIRwIEsW0=.sha256) of "...Pirania, the mesh captive-portal solution, integrating it with LiMe App and LiMe Packages with tests."

![video:Pirania_demo.webm](&w0jWgEHZfsMthN7tCddRMpO2ZGZX8mfHqvu+lZzv/Fs=.sha256)


----

[@Stephen](@YRtB3WcY1zqGAeUx4OWv+p3+hvS7IvrDdUnmlkrz6ZM=.ed25519) [released their side project](%42tChB2BTv77L0ljd1486gEWX4kw1oOd3tVOtWFjgX4=.sha256) called [Fediverse Explorer](https://fediverse.0qz.fun/)

> Every hour its aggregating trending content from 3000 mastodon pixelfed and pleroma servers to produce a trending tag report.

Find a tag that interests you, click it, and see the recent posts with it.

----
[@ahaproudowl](@cP1iqUv8WYGL0s/5S8Rgx4gaJYxDErKIHVqw4/aB0K4=.ed25519) shared what Patchwork would look like with the Meriweather Open Font. 

[More examples in the post](%cZ4txv4Ti67oAxaUX+StWUL+IUKCF/5ZOhzoU46R+mw=.sha256)

![Patchwork with the Merriweather Open Font](&vAMS93+/Rlk+ToD3lKX8RGdtzdDjcSu9uFXrnt+W+aM=.sha256)

I don't know about you, but this and the other examples make me _really_ want a real Font picker.


## Geeky
[@SoapDog (SPX)](@0xkjAty6RSr5uhbAvi0rbVR2g9Bz+89qiKth48ECQBE=.ed25519) shared the [roadblocks they've been encountering with Svelte](%PY7CeNmH190OvwjPoMHvG4mRkHbxU01WbrgebDdelko=.sha256) and their effects on Patchfox work. 

----
[@Offray](@QRttJgVouWhDWpnZHo2BoT5LkGA1irFA+fY+HkGSksc=.ed25519) has been sharing some visualizations of their Scuttlebutt stuff, [like this visualization of Scuttlebtut folder sizes](%SS8MrGU2lEi+YMKU5+KiJt8e0oj1PKVshbb81XJqFZ0=.sha256):

![SSB Folder Sizes visualized](&JA7Tx5BcIV4A22gAcaGsAfTsi38QvMtH4vFyXMLbMx8=.sha256)


> For the moment, this and others are just starting explorations. My idea is to build a Pharo + Roassal Domain Specific Language to explore and visualize the #scuttleverse and to live code it.


----
[@masukomi](@LzTjF5eAVC6xprPMGeNzqEP/EEBIGpM6hDaaY10hrz8=.ed25519) (me) shared a [personal journey through 30+ years of programming](%wHlaRYCo3jnzKWqqz57EVHyHf/gnzU/9FMZjc2Xsn6I=.sha256). 

![a graph of masukomi‚Äôs journey through programming languages](&Nr054t0vTbGe3OUOKJMiF6GBhnBaLOd8NFR5vxrzDE0=.sha256)

I still don't really know what it means. I'm just reflecting on languages I've known, how they've affected me, and what I took away from it.

------------
### Summary Data

This week‚Äôs summary was curated from ~373 threads (that I'm still working through) by 154 authors by [@masukomi](@LzTjF5eAVC6xprPMGeNzqEP/EEBIGpM6hDaaY10hrz8=.ed25519), **with the support of my lovely patrons**. If you'd like to help continue this creation you can [become a patron on Patreon](https://www.patreon.com/the_weekly).
