content.text:
## Solarpunk 
[@Luandro](@2RNGJafZtMHzd76gyvqH6EJiK7kBnXeak5mBWzoO/iU=.ed25519) shares they've been making towards managing their community watershed and asked for a little money to help build the prototype. You beautiful people stepped up and helped out. 

![comurede_modulos.jpg](&RyaXnu/DFdv/Oi5Rj3TZpHViZ+XI0PNOfELHl3+ioIs=.sha256)


As an aside, it's saddening how much of the $$ got eaten by crypto fees.  The idea of cryptocurrency is great, but I feel like we just haven't found an implementation that actually works better than "real" money for most applications. :(

## Community
[@haileycoop](@QdKPBH4vZne0DqD+v1mVJgeeOg8y3RxWuomT7pvIfEA=.ed25519) says 

> After I mentioned to a US friend about our air quality situation here in Australia, she came back with a ton of ideas about what people could do within limited means to protect their lungs and their overall health.
> 
> I‚Äôve also started pulling in other stuff I‚Äôm seeing, including stuff that some other folks have been sharing about air purifiers and the right app to use.

[Click through](@QdKPBH4vZne0DqD+v1mVJgeeOg8y3RxWuomT7pvIfEA=.ed25519) to their thread for a link to the Google Doc.

----

[@martin ‚û¨](@pJsYrTaEjm5XW5Qe0W9JW2c+RpYNqJHPMZ0qGFFYXfI=.ed25519) says 

> Yesterday at #lca2020, [I spoke about what makes decentralisation hard, what we can do about that](%9yVpmGY6d5zqcuGiWI2mFuM45BnQX7s/LsC/6jLKSTI=.sha256), and a plan to save the Web, which has stark similarities with what @andrestaltz has been writing about (although I came up with it all by myself).

The video is up if you're interested. 

----
[@Richard D. Bartlett](@3r4+IyB5NVl2in6QOZHIu9oSrZud+NuVgl2GX3x2WG8=.ed25519) says 


> We just wrapped up the filming work for our new online course ü•≥

It's called [Patterns for Decentralised Organisation](%HvDkaIecJG941oON6Ju1ftH3nDxRz4r0+StyS9URy0Q=.sha256)


![richard d bartlett being filmed for their new online course](&ojTKlSc4qV02GC0WjT9psuyNxctRmKGu3Nr0WhkLMR8=.sha256)



----
[@mnin](@SXVoA/7CuMRS5IDTNsO8HU2PvCIVq8HKUUx/k+idDiQ=.ed25519) shared [an image](%XvyMQXz2LjUmJtc6crjP9GrAEofjXVRHoLRBEqEy46g=.sha256) showing the scale of the Australian bushfires relative to recent large fires.

![bar graph showing the relative size of the 2019 amazon fires, the 2018 California fires, and the 2019-220 Australian bush fire](&O7hjdV1339I10LUO9JnXnfB+SQQNL2DBzOmhFnCmi8Y=.sha256).

content.text:
[@KawaiiPunk](@LVL4qjvmws3Cxavfi4iCQI6dSOqWqOyq5/5CHImILA8=.ed25519) shared a post about [Growth at the rate of trust](%96fE4lECuncfo8cMQHBWU0WpAx+cIq7A8NHFSzbxLTM=.sha256)

> I am a little worried about our network getting too large...
> I think private groups may be the single most important feature that is coming down the line. I am basically connecting and replicating with a lot of peers that I don‚Äôt know or trust. I‚Äôm not actually so up for that. It adds a constant low level of stress that someone may share something bad or they may be a malicious actor on the network...
> I really want to share more personal stuff on here about stuff like mental health, gender and ADHD but the current model doesn‚Äôt seem safe...

They go on to talk about Google+ style circles and provide a rough sketch of how that could fit in to SSB.

----
[@andrestaltz_phone](@+UMKhpbzXAII+2/7ZlsgkJwIsxdfeFi36Z5Rk1gCfY0=.ed25519) shared "[The many stages of climate anxiety](%j6pU2gUwhJ82HylvtoBKKckVYqMY86CRtRbnQ4OtJbc=.sha256)" 

----

[@mnin](@SXVoA/7CuMRS5IDTNsO8HU2PvCIVq8HKUUx/k+idDiQ=.ed25519) shares that 

> In preparation for #scuttlecamp2 a bunch of us are really keen to start picking up some Portuguese! :)
> 
> I‚Äôd thought I‚Äôd [use this thread to begin](%eQP5HHrbULlv0v3Xq2PY6QJBwoGA1ixaQkWXPsQM3Mo=.sha256) some basic introductions of ourselves in Portuguese and share resources. No pressure or fancy pants needed, but also go ahead if you want to show us what you‚Äôve got :) Just reply in text and/or audio-files of you speaking to join in the fun.



## Software

[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) announced [a really nice upgrade to the Profile Overview page](%2okHT7oIb3f3AWTUGVkwTL6enG7/s75k8iZ0PfU1ugw=.sha256) in ƒÄhau.

![profile overview page in ahua](&VBqr/5tEm69dgWIVeXkjBsvpGGs1BLoA/DuEoPaHyJQ=.sha256)

You can learn more about [ƒÄhau here](https://ahau.io/)

----
[@Powersource](@Vz6v3xKpzViiTM/GAe+hKkACZSqrErQQZgv4iqQxEn8=.ed25519) has [released SSB First Aid Kit 1.3](%ftHCQ/2PvWjys7KKH2oO7PwMMj+aAXFXn7/pryultJI=.sha256)

> A user-friendly app for diagnosing and fixing problems with your Scuttlebutt installation


![SSB First Aid Kit v1.3](&MdDNTMvdoWL7gkZpjK5zzNVdUt/pr3/UPXOcTsWybvg=.sha256)

> Pretty happy where the app is at now. No major missing stuff. Which is nice since the second funding block is just about to end. There are some features I can think of to add but this might be a good point to let people play with it and see where it‚Äôs lacking and could help more, rather than just to put random new features into it.

----
On a related note [@SoapDog (SPX)](@0xkjAty6RSr5uhbAvi0rbVR2g9Bz+89qiKth48ECQBE=.ed25519) has begun working on [the restore identity process](%IlbaHuKDPXFQjtDUzl8BKkiPZeEruQB/UdbkKlL8iUk=.sha256) in the SSB Backup utility.

![restore identity screenshot](&FRdWnF/4NEr/MJt3ZvyPWQMwgQ2yvne1CM7rgYAuK7c=.sha256)


----
[@cblgh](@C6fAmdXgqTDbmZGAohUaYuyKdz3m6GBoLLtml3fUn+o=.ed25519) has "... created an open collective to help fund at least recurring costs [of Cabal development]" 

There [post is here](%QKG/1CVxb5XnW/a4Lr50J+/4rWMP553WlPvSCDG0QTA=.sha256) and If you like the idea of an easy to use, free, decentraliced chat system that can eventually replace Slack you should consider going to [their open collective page](https://opencollective.com/cabal-club) and sponsoring them.

Right now I think [Cabal](https://cabal.chat/) is our best chance at a chatty future not controled by big corporations. 

I love that the GUI client is already very user friendly. It's not perfect, and needs some more moderation features before most folks could use it at work, BUT I'd love to see this get funded enough to support real development progress.

content.text:
[@Offray](@QRttJgVouWhDWpnZHo2BoT5LkGA1irFA+fY+HkGSksc=.ed25519) has [launched "Minipedia"](%b6MZa9l43LKq4xNstnUxuDzqUYfVxqYtt/w7HYRz9OI=.sha256)

>Minipedia is a project that follows the Grafoscopio Community principle of "simplifying infrastructure to amplify participation", reimagining Wikipedia as an enabler of Solarpunk futures where the Global South people are equals in building the Knowledge Commons by helping to blur the distintion between (de)constructing contents and (de)constructing inclusive empowering interactive infrastructures, easier to use, extend, modify and understand. Our working hypothesis is that will change the way we build Knowledge Commons contents together, when we change the way we build together enabling infrastructures for those contents and the people behind.  - the Minipedia web site

![minipedia interactive notebook showing all the revisions of an article](&oldiMDA/AkAbqLdgY+AmYI0LkhHsQdtxKzwWe4KmZ/Y=.sha256)




----

Some good advice from [@tao](@AhJXTf14MF4XECpBp/dOLWPVSc5mWx6xpQs19IV13nI=.ed25519): 

> since another of these proprietary, buzzword-y security things seems to be going around:
> 
> friendly reminder that you should absolutely not trust any proprietary security product that does not have clear, precise details on the technologies behind it. protocols cannot be considered secure unless they are open to scrutiny by the security field. stick to battle-tested standards.

----
[@gmarcos87](@RmClT86x/o66QdW1dqAfj5Jek4qxUf8rtmvAlhZeZFg=.ed25519) is [improving the documentation on some SSB packages](%dka5LyifpeWotdE1LxNGmbk1Jtwme0RUlA0LhfM0blQ=.sha256) as part of a maintenance grant. Click through to see which packages they'll be working on.


## Geeky

[@Piet](@U5GvOKP/YUza9k53DSXxT0mk3PIrnyAmessvNfZl5E0=.ed25519) says

> I just made [a super hacky REST API for bamboo messages](%BX6n3h3YW26k1BgUoL7ZXYvJ4YWzmLFxujlVVsJ1kw8=.sha256).

and gives you a place to try it out, and get the source code. 

----
[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) started a [thread about using Buffers in JavaScript](%bG+8+5ex6xT1LKvpG0W7ghX3cUinInNm0CRLeFLqd+8=.sha256)

> I‚Äôve been learning how to work with Buffers as they‚Äôre primitives commonly used in cryptography, and I‚Äôm writing tests + code around private groups. This thread is about gathering hints + tips for my own and others refernce.


------------
### Summary Data

This week‚Äôs summary was curated from many threads by many authors (accurate stats next week ;) ) by [@masukomi](@LzTjF5eAVC6xprPMGeNzqEP/EEBIGpM6hDaaY10hrz8=.ed25519), **with the support of my lovely patrons**. [@Beni Grind](@i/gfWqlqxBq9JkYhWIT0whiczxDTySFr9KXVwZgVavw=.ed25519) [went for a ride](%GWhhx0Ixb5dZJtTnWnEUxaMtd9MYZemO8CDxrPbFCbA=.sha256) and shared a lovely picture.

[@gmarcos87](@RmClT86x/o66QdW1dqAfj5Jek4qxUf8rtmvAlhZeZFg=.ed25519) went for [an aftenoon walk on the lake](%EcFpsRDsDKxL/IHdvtEnIJckXjBEUIrb/SAMyVGYHpY=.sha256).

content.text:
[@scott](@0nakXtVIodBfdHwRQLVb64p54jTWS+DFHRqg58ky4CI=.ed25519) has released [another Polylith newsletter](%oY1qkc6IW3war9zneziHTfkJXR3+fe6v1yCaQavX4rE=.sha256). 

> Hello friends. Here we are at the end of this inaugural twelve-month cycle of letters. We arrive, as ever and by puzzling graces, where we began: under countless strata of snow by turns waning and waxing, pleasantly lost amid a kaleidoscope of tracks, standing atop the great mineral body.

## Community

[@Aljoscha](@zurF8X68ArfRM71dF3mKh36W0xDM8QmOnAS5bYOq8hA=.ed25519) created [SSB Event in Basel - The Official Infothread](%fc9bcQHZiiyntJC6G9IPkI6LHUytEmQeQZvGm9mgyis=.sha256)


> In this post, you will find all the information you might need regarding the Basel SSB event in one place. Also check out the event website or the handy flyer.

![P2P SSB Event in Basel Header](&ByyZhYA0u5JQa/1fTezb4XJTL4HBmsGE47zGLnartFM=.sha256)


----

[@Richard D. Bartlett](@3r4+IyB5NVl2in6QOZHIu9oSrZud+NuVgl2GX3x2WG8=.ed25519)

> I published the latest story in my Microsolidarity series, explaining how to start a new mutual aid community (a ‚ÄúCongregation‚Äù). That chapter was exclusively focussed on the initiation process: where do you start?

![Scaffolding for a new congregation](&+0RNgrTZi80qQXzDfAcVTXRMKy5jKypRj3dUzo7tyZI=.sha256)

[Details in their post](%TTnDBeIzGU6j69mnUs2Z24cJkp/ojoRJSCRwOIi8t2A=.sha256)


## Community & Software Intersection
[@Luandro](@2RNGJafZtMHzd76gyvqH6EJiK7kBnXeak5mBWzoO/iU=.ed25519) shared a story of [how a handful of Scuttlebutt people got together and used SSB to connect remote villages in hash desert conditions](%Uh6Qk/9ncyKFJWJXDOeLSU1CLIagXc+ANyT999Ol5dw=.sha256). It didn't work as intended, but there's hope for it still.

![san women app cropped](&tWh14aRBmwiz0aHUtW6NOvtomsZyU3n3S6O/jTL85LQ=.sha256)

In a related followup post they [wonder aloud what we can do](%ysNpZQb8WlraaTJYwRGIdwQUTSgWQ6fUETFDzPB2Eo0=.sha256) to make SSB usable on low-end Android devices. 


----

[@Hamiller](@LZSw/izhW0O1VA1ptApOEQovM2U1//8ThdJNsfDqePQ=.ed25519) [shares](%clRWH7oUl6uNNcmQrL4kqfr7fHW63cofAzcOwE1iuk4=.sha256) a [Wired article](https://www.wired.com/story/phone-addiction-formula/)

> Push messages, manipulative menu navigation, red bubbles that scream: There are new messages! - who came up with all this? The historical view is often missing in the heated debate about the permanent distraction caused by our smartphones. Wired set out in 2018 to find the trail, and the trail leads to Stanford University.

----
[@Hamiller](@LZSw/izhW0O1VA1ptApOEQovM2U1//8ThdJNsfDqePQ=.ed25519) shares [some thoughts from Cory Doctorow](%dw15U8YH33Jq2enpPs+Zmr92pPUS7gvREo1dQp2/E8Q=.sha256) about a future where the technology we carry is used to help sense and share information on the world around us, not intstead of just sharing information about _us_. 

----

content.text:
[@Emmi Bevensee](@5fX6QTmue/udf7tLwW25vQ63wZSENrksghBt6vfL4/I=.ed25519) helped create [The Social Media Analysis Toolkit](%0bgCPWPsfIC+lrL8kt5WYreDjBtFA17uDO016dOcPTA=.sha256)

> The Social Media Analysis Toolkit (SMAT) was designed to help activists, journalists, researchers, and other social good orgs to analyze and visualize larger trends on a variety of social platforms. Our intention is to provide quick and easy tools that help you tell a story about something like hate or disinformation happening at a large scale and rapidly online. But they‚Äôre also rigorous enough for academia. This is our crew doing some research with similar tools.

Click through to learn more and checkout the graphs. 


## Software

[@Rabble](@THUzexG1y6kWofwiN8Lix/jNH/P6roYdlCDgpAn2HSc=.ed25519) shared [some updates on the Planetary iOS Scuttlebutt Client](%T9rxQjww7cu4h4KeqvwDwKJamgS4v2f3jCMnbda854s=.sha256) and the company they're building to create it.

----
[@arj](@6CAxOI3f+LUOVrbAl0IemqiS7ATpQvr9Mdw9LC4+Uv0=.ed25519) says 
[Its time for another update on the ssb-browser front](%pc3IVvokQreZF1a0q448THRccPcuBv5PHhuO6sBUTIA=.sha256) and then [proceeds to give us one](%pc3IVvokQreZF1a0q448THRccPcuBv5PHhuO6sBUTIA=.sha256). 

![ssb-browser screenshot](&PbryfIEh5YsKjut3Qse7GLShTecBtoHADLk99X59SBc=.sha256)

----
[@KawaiiPunk](@LVL4qjvmws3Cxavfi4iCQI6dSOqWqOyq5/5CHImILA8=.ed25519), and others, have posted about how Oasis is the next generation of SSB client, the successor to Patchwork.

Christian Bundy has made spectacular progress on this, but there's still a ways to go, and our future shouldn't be resting in the hands of one person. If you're a JavaScript developer, looking to help with the future of Scuttlebutt I'd strongly recommend you check out the [Oasis Repository](https://github.com/fraction/oasis) and help out in whatever way you can. Maybe take on one of the existing tickets, or write a little documentation for it. 


![Oasis screenshot](&XVXSIrw9GpmbPJZbErRlAvZhCEnZ+myh63yHKA56xfQ=.sha256)

Please know that I'm not saying this to diminish any of the great work on Patchbay, Patchfox or any of the other clients, or suggest that they're not worth pitching in on if they excite you.

----
[@SoapDog (SPX)](@0xkjAty6RSr5uhbAvi0rbVR2g9Bz+89qiKth48ECQBE=.ed25519) shared [some eight ideas for future SSB software](%nbCypNv4VBvSyFCFjLCSez2H0xHf3YLuT1/CWhhX2b4=.sha256) that some of you might find interesting enough to take a crack at. 


----

[@m455](@uysyXWRXsRD8N13ux57niW/CjZRoDVlilFRi9wpI6BQ=.ed25519) [shared a quick link](%W8mUaCX5iLzLjTm3Eq+pCRqvgokFA4POMx9P/eZ1f3k=.sha256) to a Federated Chat app called [Delta Chat](https://delta.chat/en/) that is built on top of email. If you know someone's email address you can chat with them, even if they don't have the client installed. 


## Geeky
[@zyk.ratbox](@+Ld8QDcDS4Jnezi48yrpZvwC1tDBiCGpxTfyp6rw920=.ed25519) shared their ["mighty and terrible" "ratbox"](*%Bej9aKn7YDMoMBT953s+ucybEWzp3wgDNJl9KJmak/s=.sha256)

![a laptop(ish) computer with too many wires a couple exposed circuit boards](&cA42siEDagVsDBhW60AQcUPoCUU51Nev5g+wbDGj4jg=.sha256)


### Summary Data
This week‚Äôs summary was curated from ~646 threads by ~225 authors (a little overlap with stuff before the last issue) by [@masukomi](@LzTjF5eAVC6xprPMGeNzqEP/EEBIGpM6hDaaY10hrz8=.ed25519), **with the support of my lovely patrons**. If you'd like to help continue this creation you can [become a patron on Patreon](https://www.patreon.com/the_weekly).

content.text:
## Community Software Intersection
[@elavoie](@IgYpd+tCtXnlE2tYX/8rR2AGt+P8svC98WH3MdYAa8Y=.ed25519) shared some [more thoughts about the proposed SSB-Coin](%6mByr6BrJflzFM5gCQj5tAwDcYNgiFeZMR41LGj4PzE=.sha256), including a number of practical ways it could be used.
I'm really torn about this. On the one hand what they're proposing is _very_ different from all the cryptocurrency BS out there. On the other hand cryptocurrency has become _seriously_ tainted by scams, unregulated market manipulation, and all sorts of other BS. 

So, I _love_ the community aspect and just basic idea of tokens that, ath their heart are just representations of favors. I also fear that having _any_ "coin" associated with SSB will affect the future prospects of SSB as a social network by proxy.

----
[@cinnamon](@fBS90Djngwl/SlCh/20G7piSC064Qz2hBBxbfnbyM+Y=.ed25519) mentioned the [social problems with the word "block" in SSB](%RhRAuS9kkBhJeaUoKlGGoD6yimM4KY3zm0MJAGylTnI=.sha256) and a small discussion emerged on how to improve it. I believe the general consensus is "yeah, Cinnamon's right, there's a problem" but it's not clear what the best solution is.

----
[@gwil](@PEqxT8YRvrkf2fyjAgTl8pmdo8aR4KVsKLyh0b5JyOE=.ed25519) posted about how "[Timelines Are Awful, Even If They‚Äôre Decentralised](%4UHRF/xbCaeyk/Jgw92LBWXrfGm9SCo3YIfAVXwtNzw=.sha256)" 

> Social networks are made of posts, and users need a way to read them. But the popular ‚Äòtimeline‚Äô interface is designed to benefit the organisation that serves it, not the user who reads it.

They break down why, and suggest a couple improvements.


## Software 
[@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) released [the 0.20002.4 version of Manyverse](%Sptmraltrgkcq/WP72LGb8gHltncs17taPds254YUBc=.sha256) for Android and iOS. It's got a bunch of bug fixes and general improvements, but the more notable things are that it now supports private messaging, and has a new layout.

![animated gif of manyverse private messages](&8B5KwCaFThwgFhKADRC08KVqAMpfAcitykn34+jn/VU=.sha256)

They also shared [a fun little SSB tip](%BupswexGU5BogqOYr05RbRFR9PWjZnT8EsgWSeYzJ28=.sha256). 

> if you assign a name that starts with "dead" or "deprecated", they will be ignored in the suggestions dropdown.
----

[@Christian Bundy](@+oaWWDs8g73EZFUMfW37R/ULtFEjwKN/DczvdYihjbU=.ed25519) [notes that](%P/Fb+aHzqEASsFMV0fkJohNfVUTqkLFnXVISbimOfaY=.sha256)

> ...if anyone wants to dip their toes into SSB development, Oasis has lots of [good first issues](https://github.com/fraction/oasis/issues) that only require that you know the basics of GitHub. Some require basic HTML, CSS, or JS knowledge, but all of them are easy and bite-sized and I‚Äôd love to support anyone working on them.

----
[@KemoNine](@2JMza/WpInn3c0N2bw4QfRRLhrb2h17eNBKpDshBk1o=.ed25519) has shared [instructions on how to install patchfoo as a Docker container](%ELS+7x5JjDJTT+8YN4YcesmEN2BzNHB44JzI7fXJlR8=.sha256). Patchfoo is a...

> Plain SSB web UI. Uses HTML forms instead of client-side JS. Designed for use on low-power and low-resource computers.

----
[@adz](@3u2quSQ8qX1fTx4HQKthYPDavQI4Wm88kThExFXemYo=.ed25519) has created "Beep beep!" 

> ...a naive [p2p proof-of-concept system which can be both federated or fully decentralized](%3cZzSLQBeF97sYIkPjFMqhE7sSLF5cy5KyKW3THtX+o=.sha256), something in-between #ssb and maybe #activitypub.

![Beep beep network](&GdAgrRVAC2AmQRvUUfPJMQtWZrgIFk4WEdJUC0TfYU8=.sha256)

Check out their post for more details.

[@nichoth](@RPFLJtoWjcQyYC51lEUxm4brAyE6Okln8LGeh4Z7sVw=.ed25519) has been continuing their work on "eventual gram" an ssb-based photo sharing. They're updating us with development diary posts [like this one](%/PKLgEKQqNi1S3XIw3JagcdsgKOR9wRb9j2RXNzj1bg=.sha256).

## Geeky
[@mixmix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) has created [is-my-ssb-valid](%cOBKIX7oyDF4x9yMFDNWcUjV0hGvJrEiRisA54//vAI=.sha256) which can "Build message validators for scuttlebut using JSON schema."

----
[@punkmonk](@EaYYQo5nAQRabB9nxAn5i2uiIZ665b90Qk2U/WHNVE8=.ed25519) has been [exploring the nodejs cluster module](%4S5TVYfrx4GAqeGpYYWc1fvSoEO9UyS/7UfI17kw8v0=.sha256) and shared  their results.

------------
### Summary Data

This week‚Äôs summary was curated from 387 threads by 148 authors by [@masukomi](@LzTjF5eAVC6xprPMGeNzqEP/EEBIGpM6hDaaY10hrz8=.ed25519), **with the support of my lovely patrons**. If you'd like to help continue this creation you can [become a patron on Patreon](https://www.patreon.com/the_weekly).



post 3 of 3

I keep thinking about wanting to do more with SSB. About the great community here, and the future we can build. About how it allows us to do great things like [blog from the middle of the ocean](%RbzGUXS4jiZHToZN9xPHBRAOs08VZjLgfyoz1KklmvQ=.sha256) and one thing really struck me tonight.

It doesn't matter if SSB becomes "popular". We never have to worry about some company making enough off of it to keep the infrastructure alive. All we have to do is believe in it, and have some developers willing to maintain the tools to use it. 

We do need some folks generous enough to run pubs for us, but that's not too much to ask especially from a community of devoted users, and it's just going to get cheaper and easier as time goes by.

That's pretty awesome. 

There are _very_ few places online that can say that.

mentions.name: blog from the middle of the ocean

content.text:
## Software
[@Christian Bundy](@+oaWWDs8g73EZFUMfW37R/ULtFEjwKN/DczvdYihjbU=.ed25519) released Oasis 2.13.1. 

* Follow, unfollow, block, unblock
* More networking info and actions (including offline mode)
* Way faster private message rendering
* Works with Patchwork running in background (!)
* Sidebar navigation with cute emoji
* Very very basic internationalization (need help translating!)
* Removed strangers from main feed
* Add Extended and Topics views
* Add public viewer mode
* Fix 8 trillion bugs

If you're familiar with running `npm` commands I _highly_ recommend you check it out. It is _very_ usable, and very nice looking. It doesn't have _all_ the features yet, but the ones it has are :thumbsup:

[@cinnamon](@fBS90Djngwl/SlCh/20G7piSC064Qz2hBBxbfnbyM+Y=.ed25519) shared [a screenshot](%u+Mnq1AFB2w7BV3F27jfi2EcZiyPc7YCnK1mEf+9Z9U=.sha256), and noted that the background color was the result of the color palette they'd chosen. 

![oasis.jpg](&OVCfC6AhysTM+1DFuaWPZoCK6DIYKlqTkndCu3SvVcY=.sha256)

I'm really enjoying the built-in color choices. :) 



Then [@josh](@HaYp1REDTDv9Su7XIz8WNDyCIbv5/TkbUJpTdJuQuwI=.ed25519) [shoved it in an Electron wrapper](%1pDgo29fURD+lY/WxbKPdQZG0oHwD0Hao8xV4T222M8=.sha256) to make it a desktop app.

----

[@graham](@LEkAGbzqsXLzBxLEPhkNluDHbPnkU6PXGyqwjqY10Tk=.ed25519) [shared a link and info](%j0DiHbHkdlm3gtn1xmf+ipJ3m4XpYXAiPSz/mbiUh0s=.sha256) about [Anytype](https://anytype.io/)

> Anytype is a next generation software that breaks
down barriers between applications, gives back
privacy and data ownership to users.

It appears to be a collection of locally managed apps that share data with peers over IPFS. Apps manage "Pages", Tasks, Files, Contacts, Bookmarks, and Music. It's still pre-release though so, there's not much that can be said about it.

## Geeky Software

I [announced private comments](%eY5MWy7c8Ocj5k5Rt5RwxrEVbxFU7QppAUhqwJ33UFQ=.sha256). It allows you to leave ‚Äúprivate comments‚Äù on specific lines of a codebase that are not stored _in the codebase_, and disappear when they become obsolete.

There's a vim plugin for it, and instructions on how to create one for your favorite editor.

## Geeky
[@SoapDog (SPX)](@0xkjAty6RSr5uhbAvi0rbVR2g9Bz+89qiKth48ECQBE=.ed25519) shares [some of their thoughts on the current version of Patchwork](%wq4Wxx8fbhCiStU9WQ1Wzf3s9qLAs5Xc0hNZW4ioezk=.sha256) as they move from Svelte to Mithril. Separately they discussed the [new build system and scaffold](%o5YA89gWtZaUx9ijo2kHVF25zJL9AmSqMMXiBEJH+Bo=.sha256)

Also, [an interesting observation about Patchwork as compared to Oasis](%/P3lphrjBvhUy68HOjLnP7g7RZqjatgHZp5nLKS7BtQ=.sha256).

> Oasis is what if the JS was all in the backend.
> Patchfox is what if the JS was all in the frontend.

----
[@gwil](@PEqxT8YRvrkf2fyjAgTl8pmdo8aR4KVsKLyh0b5JyOE=.ed25519) is continuing to put out "draft UI Patterns" for social networks. [This one](%GuXX6CGk4sFR/ndczoeM+APoVufOOA4KRq7oG9lQv+A=.sha256) describes "organisational primitives for message-based social networks" including "Pins" and "A place for posts to retire"

----
[@scott](@0nakXtVIodBfdHwRQLVb64p54jTWS+DFHRqg58ky4CI=.ed25519) has been talking about their work on [creating a DAT version of scuttlebutt.nz](%OR2THatxlW+ZYTXU5DDGoinkT8D8MUpEA4iFJo9lHAY=.sha256)

[@cinnamon](@fBS90Djngwl/SlCh/20G7piSC064Qz2hBBxbfnbyM+Y=.ed25519) released [Buntimer](%6Kk4ezDdOlO6+F7V0Rp8iAIjlupzxbEyrPdZ2MnajRs=.sha256) 

> I have trouble doing things on time. I‚Äôll get deeply engrossed in projects and forget to eat or take medicine. So, I built a little timer app to help myself. Maybe it‚Äôs useful to you too.

![buntimer screenshot](&gxLMJoc2AowrLLnXFnvU51V9tyzaR5JgS1RIjTqhy1E=.sha256)


Later in the thread SoapDog took it and made it into a Firefox Extension.

----
I talked about [Software That Lasts](%Gc9o9vg7FlPPeC3x7K5HbGz4BLlE+qr/R20s32OM55M=.sha256); the problem with the recent trend towards cloud-based software, and some thoughts for your future software choices.

> When your data only exists in software that you don‚Äôt host yourself it is no longer yours. It can disappear at any moment. Your data‚Äôs future is dependent upon a company‚Äôs continued profits and interests.


## Geeky
[@mixmix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) "...[improved the at-mentions suggestions algorithm of [the ssb-suggest library]](%YkZcQeOTxmVjNtYgR6dEdS2nGMCheEOCpPYr2Em8iso=.sha256)" and added it to the master branch of Patchbay.

[@SoapDog (SPX)](@0xkjAty6RSr5uhbAvi0rbVR2g9Bz+89qiKth48ECQBE=.ed25519) shared [a bunch of photos from the event itself](%zKGFjlHn+j42CObalWCfERDtczUxwSzSEIAt5g7aWa8=.sha2569).

![a talk at P2P Basel](&XiOtjswL8VCAGUA4IC0b9Rfag1lMV0sGR5FWU7ehCcc=.sha256)




## Software Community Intersection
[@zelf](@3ZeNUiYQZisGC6PLf3R+u2s5avtxLsXC66xuK41e6Zk=.ed25519) posted some high-level [information/thoughts about privacy](%gNJjsZb+jxc032+uZunkj8HyGDO7LFQXHpD+rndvN0s=.sha256) that came out of the brainpower that came together at P2P Basel.

This is definitely worth a read if you're interested in how privacy can / will play out in the future of SSB. It is _not_ a geeky post.


----

[@Daan](@MRiJ+CvDnD9ZjqunY1oy6tsk0IdbMDC4Q3tTC8riS3s=.ed25519) talked about [the idea of "Passes"](%bYZx4SpKerJGtg3bI5u+pbk+sZZfXG+WxxPxkjRvnro=.sha256) to allow specific posts to be viewable on the web.

> Currently, the ssb-viewer instances and publicly hosted oasis installations are not very useful for bridging people into the scuttleverse because many messages will simply not be displayed. This is for good reasons: many people don‚Äôt want their ssb content to be indexed and searchable by google and the others, so we switched to an opt-in system some time ago. Anyone who does not explicitly set `publicWebHosting` to `true` in their profile will simply not show up on these viewers. But currently it‚Äôs not easy to opt in, and even if it were, many people probably wouldn‚Äôt. But we would like to be able to show some content to people we know, wich is very different from making everything public.

It's a great proposal. I'd love to see it implemented. It would provide tremendous value. However, I can't help but think that it's been over a year since web hosting became opt-in and only Patchbay has an easy "opt-in" mechanism. As far as I know, no other client gives you an easy way to do this, and very few SSB people even understand that it's an option.


----
[@keks](@YXkE3TikkY4GFMX3lzXUllRkNTbj5E+604AkaO1xbz8=.ed25519) wrote about [Making it Easier to Join Scuttlebutt](%y/4kpkhnsdVJddS0+mgSR+MLEGxnMz7p3+p/pILrg2g=.sha256)

![new message format in patchfox](&V884FhkI2rzPU2k5T27xrsGIV5aP13lXmjB4tj2oNzg=.sha256)

which includes the new "Zine" app. 

![screenshot of the zine app within Patchfox showing a panel](&RMUmQ/Wp0dVD2wySEgTBlJ+A2yWdMd1w8d9FXz8BFKw=.sha256)

You can find the Zine App if you click on Launcher in the Patchfox menu.

----
[@mixmix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) shared [a screenshot from Ahua Mobile](%KE6AisR4a6nhN4TVTLJGv2yDKmyBfT9kkBnVRSiuvCM=.sha256).

[@F√°bio Emilio Costa üáßüá∑üêáüïêüé©‚òï‚úÖ (Patchwork-Requeriment Room)](@UaDd69LROKdpgNokDjdyxgxmXH0J/HD1eK7KEb98/+g=.ed25519)
shares some insight into the thinking of British expats living in Spain, as the come to understand the reality of their Post-Brexit world. It's an Aljazeera article, but the original is no longer available. :/



## Solarpunk

[@KawaiiPunk](@LVL4qjvmws3Cxavfi4iCQI6dSOqWqOyq5/5CHImILA8=.ed25519) shares a tale of drama in Sunbeam.city.

> Essentially, the Sunbeam City co-op has been in a difficult spot for a long time, with original founder of the project leaving, we had difficulties assembling a team of volunteers in order to carry out moderation and admin duties. Nevertheless the instance kept on growing and eventually a new team was formed by trusted members of the community.
> 
> After several incidents where moderation processes were lacking and after receiving critique from comrades in our surrounding communities, we decided to enter into a process of reform surrounding our structure and purpose.

It didn't go very well and many users are abandoning ship, and trying to find homes on alternate Fediverse Servers.

----
Separately [@KawaiiPunk](%MHi8MeDLOTlpQ4OvA9YnSn7HL3MGfpAKKo4NnI6VDRo=.sha256) shared a post entitled "[Solarpunk: To walkaway or to stay and fight?](%MHi8MeDLOTlpQ4OvA9YnSn7HL3MGfpAKKo4NnI6VDRo=.sha256)"

----

![luandro is solarpunk](&+YjoM64mkB5X1MDM/NqIDHUq5EDiV9D3Kah/BftDxQk=.sha256)

## Community

[@cel](@f/6sQ6d2CMxRUhLpspgGIulDxDCwYD7DzFzPNr7u5AU=.ed25519) has [SSB stickers for you.](%5boB1JPEk6JX27eL3a00D8PCzNHrJFGY9HocCQKPWlE=.sha256)

![ssb stickers](&A9se6F6XJl8W7afqNPTpsmlzRMlGUoJmQhgD2I1O0yY=.sha256)



## Software
[@Rabble](@THUzexG1y6kWofwiN8Lix/jNH/P6roYdlCDgpAn2HSc=.ed25519) announced that [Planetary has switched to the main Scuttlebutt network](%BJEGR8gr3RGcVbyV62dtRsMUHQ8KPjmyR4bQsfzCiT8=.sha256)

Previously it was just a bunch of us testing it on a private network.

![planetary screenshot](&BRFZxkoJbZYqCATGotptvEXsCAYx4BnuqFngkHtA5m0=.sha256)

iOS users can [sign up for the test-flight beta](https://testflight.apple.com/join/M9hPo1gA). From personal experience I'd suggest you _only_ do this if you're OK with beta software and willing to file bug reports. I don't think it's quite ready for general use. I've yet to get a single post to download since the switch, but I assume it's working for others.

[@SoapDog (SPX)](@0xkjAty6RSr5uhbAvi0rbVR2g9Bz+89qiKth48ECQBE=.ed25519) has [managed to get Mentions working well in Patchfox](%wfaROeKo9lyZ9yLQOyAMT32XcLdsnpisoa0ptQpKJKs=.sha256) using  [zurb/tribute: ES6 Native @mentions](https://github.com/zurb/tributez)

[as well as custom urls](%fe7x7HZOiL/GcUptdPs84LH7PGmL3n3NPr6y0eNKVY4=.sha256)

# Recent Days in Scuttlebutt

## Totally Random
[@Riley](@MGtu3A8ogT0HmD55UyYgb47UAu4h8H+w/XxPDg2NWfg=.ed25519) caught [a beautiful sunset](%sFU5qSHCsTdjwxYwTY6KU1P9KhgUGX7kHs3jr0IBFng=.sha256) while walking their dogs. 

![a sunset in Melbourne with smooth gradient skies behind a couple skylights and reflective brick covered ground](&jLzU+rxKbsuPdPklY6oElKo3TbONsfEzsxfj0hNmklA=.sha256)

----
[@Daan](@MRiJ+CvDnD9ZjqunY1oy6tsk0IdbMDC4Q3tTC8riS3s=.ed25519) shares some pictures from a deserted [St Laurent of Grenoble](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grenoble_Archaeological_Museum)üîó

![a young woman running over a near-deserted bridge. in the background, quartier St Laurent of Grenoble, with the notable ‚ÄúMus√©e Dauphinois‚Äù letters at the top of the frame.](&WWCZRbUahqI3Wh1JkxMGSTJp1dfZoKGd3yyxRmkOAV0=.sha256)

They also reminded us of the value of ["Faerie Rings"](%F005mHU21JN3l5w2uEUWd421lAjBZn7pM8B6q5ZulUI=.sha256) during these times of isolation. 

----
[@Rabble](@THUzexG1y6kWofwiN8Lix/jNH/P6roYdlCDgpAn2HSc=.ed25519) watched folks in their neighborhood driving by, filling bars, and restaurants, and [made them a reminder](%haMWixI8E1//BGYdP1d23qm7nHOyXKQTorHl1xa7L6w=.sha256). 

![stay at home sign on a corner lawn in Portland Oregon USA](&2lUcCCmWE450lC34cNwsWD0cMmYIG7sy3XVbfcAzVh0=.sha256)

Meanwhile, they started to connect up all their neighbors so that they could help each other out. 

----
[@Rick](@JfQJYnT2o6lbwIfzNcH4GaR+fymvtXSjdfxrKwrc8SY=.ed25519) shares this picture. 

![many people pose for a picture at a party with balloons and music](&tKG8pvzN/SQv1qlRtABlbj4uJDlbhWeZ0RrbAIM4omI=.sha256)

A lot of people are having a hard time, suddenly isolated from all their contacts. It's good to be reminded that they're all still there. That we'll see them again.

If you're feeling disconnected, maybe print out a picture of your friends and / or family. Maybe make one a background on your computer.

----
While the world fights a virus [@dangerousbeans](@TXKFQehlyoSn8UJAIVP/k2BjFINC591MlBC2e2d24mA=.ed25519) has been fighting bacteria. 

> [@Alchemist](@na1AJv1iWOflQOwsQ4srJJhYynkYawXiWDwM0ln4DgY=.ed25519) began to harbor new, angry life deep in the salty, oily depths of it‚Äôs bilge

They attacked it with Green Tea and Turmeric. 


![green tea bags and turmeric cover mechanical devices in a ship's bilge](&Sml8tOiy9Im+liQsJ+nKoACVaIqMmShp6g+Eu7GWOhY=.sha256)

content.text: I'm noticing some delays in getting these posts out into the world. If you run a stable pub and wouldn't mind another user (this one), then please DM me an invite. I want to make [@The Weekly](@iVPi/B73hJSpsUB8XbSnlxe3NembPXLjOfIexlYdgJA=.ed25519) easier to obtain.

![the weekly - curated posts from the scuttleverse](&Q9wEqKM6UtKmMpI+W17MuwTSNTQpEtSnLvTFrgVI5EE=.sha256)

# Recent Days in Scuttlebutt

## Totally Random
[@Richard D. Bartlett](@3r4+IyB5NVl2in6QOZHIu9oSrZud+NuVgl2GX3x2WG8=.ed25519) is []looking stylish in their new mask](%1MyUI2VzHOeFXd6xXXOLkwSGossmjNnrs1bo9uwMCC4=.sha256). I just posted about these.  There's a lot of misinformation out there saying they're not effective. On average masks like this will get you a six fold reduction in infection. They'll also protect the people around you in case you are a carrier and don't know it. [In my post](%1MyUI2VzHOeFXd6xXXOLkwSGossmjNnrs1bo9uwMCC4=.sha256) I share links to articles covering the history of the mask in 1910 through to present day including links to reliable sources and studies of their efficacy. Even one from the CDC from long before Covid-19 talking about how you can use t-shirt material if you have nothing else. 


![rich with face mask](&SGdhlfY1HDS70HjXOWo+d2D3ZNPKYaBBbaEkiPcKtyQ=.sha256)

Wear your masks outside folks. They're good for you, and good for everyone around you. Make them if you don't have them.

----
[@Verdeoliva](@BAqkyL7wJIavl2p6g1yQ9TYYy/1pKM6vSUyDOzZSJ18=.ed25519) shares [some pictures from Spain](%CmFx6RqoRvCODJFdYkUPJ4WNknjpAguGupA7pfSgCwM=.sha256). The post is in Spanish.

[@Daan](@MRiJ+CvDnD9ZjqunY1oy6tsk0IdbMDC4Q3tTC8riS3s=.ed25519) [shares this foffee](%WaOh+W697bMlcKe+jMP7nvZ/CHoVM3c58COHwN7ciO8=.sha256)

content.text:
[@mnin](@SXVoA/7CuMRS5IDTNsO8HU2PvCIVq8HKUUx/k+idDiQ=.ed25519) says 

> These times can be triggering or scary, especially for those with traumas/ptsd/depression/chronic conditions. [I‚Äôm keen to hear what are routines or things that help you keep grounded, not too overloaded](%NcsK5+/v07m1FE7yJnzcC11yoLV7DRxqf5B64DqQOv8=.sha256), and/or just generally how people are doing in these times. I‚Äôm learning about Polyvagal theory too which is helpful for me...

Some folks have responded with their thoughts, maybe you have some to share, or maybe you'll find something that helps you. 

## Software 

[@SoapDog (SPX)](@0xkjAty6RSr5uhbAvi0rbVR2g9Bz+89qiKth48ECQBE=.ed25519) is [working on the ability to import an RSS/Atom feed into SSB](%AD18JKTigPcmM4wAKT1BPPRxMJ6Vnr6blgJMM0n1jT8=.sha256).

> Importing a feed is the first feature implemented and is shipping on the next version. It is not a bulk import, I‚Äôm not interested in doing that as it would spam SSB. What it does is fetch an RSS/Atom and list all the entries in it for you. From that list you can choose a specific post and click the compose new blog post using this content button and you‚Äôll be moved into the blog compose view with the content from the chosen post converted from HTML into Markdown and placed in the appropriated fields.

![blog import animated gif](&JsyvvENaAtdY52H6ykwNDD/jaDTlc4goCuiooKGvGGA=.sha256)


----
[@cel-desktop](@lOUVT+Phkvai9a/cCS/RKo+S9hnPAQdVixms/7ldpPA=.ed25519) [shared their progress](%aED9KQVEHHLJUTG6f171ZkYBZ/2wvM92UXX2kncehWs=.sha256) on adding a "public web hosting" checkbox to Patchwork.

![patchwork public Web Hosting](&7R2R/vd5eLTybBE6objBO5qvu7r3kAziqtGvrVyTOzk=.sha256)

----

[@Joey Hess](@BCM6DHYJvWzwWi1lFl2tjDXjaqyZAEmJH5ZONSpXhtc=.ed25519) is [working on a "quarantine timer"](%yYMgbDAU2PDd3cZnaI7GuqD48QaXSMu35Dl9n1fuiOo=.sha256) for timing when the things you've brought into your house are safe to touch. Go to the web page. Take a picture. Tell it what material, and it'll start a countdown until that item is safe to touch. 

[Webapp here](https://quarantimer.app/). Check out the thread if you're interested in helping improve it.


----
[@Ladislas](@SmLddSPxpYkJ/8HH8qDycMEwus+tyojjH+a60beRMdg=.ed25519) shares [a post about how to make a blog with Publii and share it on Dat](%JSkpAHXFJ5rRBcWFZlPGyAfzXFTUQQqjOzG28Qa3bRo=.sha256).


### Geeky

[@devNull](@FJxH29WOcGbN0SuoasQo/mAXybo0lrMKbZDjpFlSrYs=.ed25519) has been giving [an SSB workshop in spanish](%uykw1pUbnhMlEEYG4ij4Gg4PumvTkU7XissSvVUlhrA=.sha256)

> So, taking advantage of the social isolation that‚Äôs happening ... I decided to start an ssb workshop aimed at students that go to my university and my career...
> The idea is to explore ssb tools from a kinda low level approach, trying to grasp some fundamental concepts as I‚Äôm also making sense of them.
>Last friday I streamed an intro/first talk where I introduce the ssb protocol and layout my intentions for the workshop.

----
[@Fred](@9BbJwPDjcyIqrOUPNn0nJZBduWdIrpMk3Cjz5MP361s=.ed25519) shares "[How to use ScuttleButt as messaging layer between ipfs Nodes](%hGZRh3lYDBgaA3RM2gbrppbBgxgWFlnZaxAic0SZAtY=.sha256)"


------------
### Summary Data
This week‚Äôs summary was curated from 356 threads by 125 authors by [@masukomi](@LzTjF5eAVC6xprPMGeNzqEP/EEBIGpM6hDaaY10hrz8=.ed25519), **with the support of my lovely patrons**. If you'd like to help continue this creation you can [become a patron on Patreon](https://www.patreon.com/the_weekly).

# Recent Days in Scuttlebutt

## Totally Random

[@Dan Hassan](@NeB4q4Hy9IiMxs5L08oevEhivxW+/aDu/s/0SkNayi0=.ed25519) shares 15 days of progress learning to braid (plait) their little one's hair. 

![day two of learning to braid sprout's hair](&s7wKVmvNRtrcW0ccRxFxRKWFjbNBQ+EXCyr3apKYvyA=.sha256)

that comes _after_ they've [creeped downstairs to have some quiet me time in the early morning](%uZeG0q8qB+0fnOPVs0JtJW5rJ0AxpwruK1J+wGY2CjA=.sha256)

![image of coffee in a glass plunger with a copper lid and legs. the plunger is about a quarter full. there is a stoneware hasami mug to the left of the plunger and behind there are some plants and a crystal backset by a window. it is dark outside. in the window you see a reflection of the person taking the photo, me. ](&retu4VZWCqa5/wxarSi11pBv4mdOQSsHJwxhgM3G/nk=.sha256)

-----
[@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) has started learning how to [_make_ their own food](%AnKHagTxpuzSIhvRbotswGmFfCKrrEmx9slS3MnQJ5U=.sha256) from scratch.

![sources of nutrients for plants in soil versus hydroponics displayed in e-ink on an angled surface](&DLIcrlSfk2J566MzQA68NIeaC7QCxb7hSkcpAMxuNL4=.sha256)

----
[@Rabble](@0uOwBrHIeiRK7lcvpLwjSFkcS3UHSQb/jyN52zf+J6Y=.ed25519) shares [some photos of the many flowers blooming](%n2qY+ybJuH+NHdxmp+0W6EXv7LeM/jmnd4d2PSvVppo=.sha256) around them.

![purple flowers blooming](&amrG00MKwtfR5+LtF+smKzLRFzKhd11ReOPB4IuVsU4=.sha256)

they also [roasted peeps](%+deUGSOaq6dN4448yAl6Gpi+tuZoGXqOqTqbIVjWcT8=.sha256) when the store ran out of marshmallows.

![two kids sit outdoors under a blanket with a black dog in their lap. a fire burns in a ring before them](&6hOZni2g6SX8BcxJDTQ9piRRIj3/x6bSfCVKTsrYlYY=.sha256)

## Community
[@hoz](@RtsOc2h1gqh0fRrjrUTHAkRBu9YyDgsD+EWsfLpykrc=.ed25519) shares just [a look at how seriously Puerto Rico's governor is taking quarantine](%4mDfPddrzD7mwt7N17nei4ys4s8f+cHOWMwyLnZNpyQ=.sha256). Some would definitely call it "excessive". Speaking as an outsider I can't help but wonder if draconian measures aren't _precisely_ the correct move for Puerto Rico. I fear if they had an outbreak they would get _zero_ help from the US government. That being said, it seems very hard on the residents. 

It's a quick post and definitely worth the read if you, like me, haven't heard about what's happening there. 

## Software
[@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) announced [the release of Manyverse 0.2004.4](%jsIQ9KqvQe/R8YtmVzTK/tbghAJNaPrXgMNRfwIdJhQ=.sha256) 

in addition to various fixes and improvements it now offers "emoji reactions instead of likes" which sounds interesting.

![screenshot of emoji reactions in manyverse](&regE9xl9BNil6+4vb3jVWRZsSJyrefQzTNrAn0crbDA=.sha256)

content.text:
[@Christian Bundy](@+oaWWDs8g73EZFUMfW37R/ULtFEjwKN/DczvdYihjbU=.ed25519) 
has [released Oasis 2.15.0](%1249ZIXMBdHh2xVE3NuD2cJBgr2utlwg/B6wttfNmb4=.sha256) which includes [Oasis desktop](https://github.com/fraction/oasis-desktop/releases/tag/v1.1.0) :link: and a "threads view" which should be great for long discussions.

More importantly you should _upgrade immediately_ as there was a security vulnerability in the prior versions.

> We don‚Äôt have any reason to believe that this flaw was exploited in the wild, but we need to get everyone upgraded out of an abundance of caution.

Also, you'll get a bunch of new features and bug fixes if you upgrade, and that's always nice.

If any of you are graphics folks with a little time on your hand, maybe you'd like to help work on an icon for the new desktop client. hint. hint.

----
[@Daan](@MRiJ+CvDnD9ZjqunY1oy6tsk0IdbMDC4Q3tTC8riS3s=.ed25519) shares [their thoughts on Jitsi](%JyEuDV4brvYX8SEcIHts0zhgUjkyWV+ub+99vco2Zv0=.sha256) and getting their family set up with it.

> Overall, I feel like [Jitsi](https://jitsi.org/) is very quickly becoming my favourite videoconferencing solution, and I‚Äôve been using quite a few of those recently, as everyone.

Considering all the recent problems with Zoom, and the poor quality of Google Hangouts, Jitsi is worth considering. It appears to be relatively easy for someone with basic server experience to install, and Digital Ocean has a [one click installer for Jitsi](https://marketplace.digitalocean.com/apps/jitsi-server). You can ignore the version number it claims to install. The [installation script](https://github.com/pachamaltese/jitsi-droplet/blob/master/scripts/01-packages.sh) :link: will always install the _latest_ stable version, whatever that is.

content.text:
![the weekly - curated posts from the scuttleverse](&Q9wEqKM6UtKmMpI+W17MuwTSNTQpEtSnLvTFrgVI5EE=.sha256)

Hello lovely people. 

The time has come for me to step away from my summarizing. I have loved reading your posts, and helping to surface the gems I found there. Unfortunately, summarizing them all has been a surprising amount of work. It was enjoyable work, but work none-the-less. I'd like to reclaim those future weekend and evening hours for other smiley tasks.

To my wonderful supporters on Patreon, I can not thank you enough. It's amazing to know that your work is appreciated enough for someone to actually offer you money for it. If it were not for you, this work would not have continued for as long as it did. There was no charge for this month, and I'll be taking down the page shortly, so there will be no future charge. I hope your generous donations find their way to another creator. 

Thank you for allowing me to do this work, and the many kindnesses you have shown me. I can't wait to find out where your stories lead.

Your thankful summarizer, 
[@masukomi](@LzTjF5eAVC6xprPMGeNzqEP/EEBIGpM6hDaaY10hrz8=.ed25519)
